Responsible for weapons, weapon systems and associated test equipment. Sign off on the integrity of a system or piece of equipment to ensure safety.

fields.name: Armament Engineering Technologist (Defence Industry)
fields.description: An Armament Engineering Technologist (Defence Industry) forms part of the larger Mechanical Engineering group. An Armament Engineering Technologist (Defence Industry) analyses and modifies new and existing engineering technologies relating to the design and construction of defence force's technical equipment.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing machinery and tools for manufacturing purposes. Advising on and designing parts of apparatus or products such as precision instruments. Ensuring that equipment, operation and maintenance comply with design specifications and safety standards. Establishing control standards and procedures to ensure efficient functioning and safety of machines or equipment. Making technical decisions on engineering changes such as upgrades and modifications to equipment, system safety, and the approval of structural repairs. Responsible for weapons, weapon systems and associated test equipment Sign off on the integrity of a system or piece of equipment to ensure safety.

fields.name: Armature Winder
fields.description: Locate the broken part of electric motors, of which the coils are burnt out or damaged, and repair or replace it with new ones, or completely rewind all the coils.
fields.tasks: Using various kinds of testing instruments to locate damaged coils. Making a decision whether to repair a damaged coil or to completely rewind the machine. Dismantling a machine, cleaning and removing all dirt. Working from diagrams that give details of the arrangement of coils. Drawing  diagrams.

fields.name: Armour Soldier
fields.description: Practises, exercises and employs armour tactics, techniques and procedures during military war and peace operations.
fields.tasks: Coordinating armour, artillery, and air support units.      Directing deployment of land defence weapons, vehicles, and equipment. Directing location, construction, and camouflage of landward defence positions and equipment.      Managing field communications.      Driving and operating specialised military vehicles designed for combat operations.      Performing strategic and tactical planning, including battle plan development and reconnaissance operations.

fields.name: Armoured Car Escort
fields.description: Provides armed escort services for transportation and delivery of cash and other valuables.
fields.tasks: Loading bags of cash and valuables into armoured-cars at banks and other relevant premises. Issuing receipts. Standing at the ready while valuables are loaded and unloaded at predetermined destinations. Guard cash and valuables while they are in transit. Assisting the drivers of armoured-cars.

fields.name: Armoured Personnel Carrier Operator
fields.description: Drives vehicle to transport personnel in regions with weak or no road infrastructure.
fields.tasks: Driving a heavy motor vehicle or armoured vehicle to transport persons and their goods or luggage over short or long distances. Determining the most appropriate routes for travel in areas with weak or no road infrastructure. Reading maps and geographic position systems (GPS’s). Assisting with or carrying out loading and unloading operations.      Ensuring that goods and luggage are stowed and securely covered to prevent loss and damage during transport. Carrying out minor maintenance to vehicles, and making arrangements for major maintenance and repairs.

fields.name: Art Teacher (Private Tuition)
fields.description: Teaches students in the practice and theory of art in private training establishments.
fields.tasks: Assessing the students’ level of ability and determining learning needs. Planning, preparing and delivering programs of study, lessons and workshops for individual students and /groups. Preparing and presenting material on the theory of the subject area being studied. Instructing and demonstrating practical aspects of drama, dance, visual or other arts. Assigning exercises and work relevant to students’ level of ability, interests and talents. Assessing students and offering advice, criticism and encouragement. Revising curricula, course content, course materials and methods of instruction. Preparing students for examinations, performance and assessments. Arranging visits and tours to exhibitions and performances. Organising and assisting in performances or exhibitions of students' work.

fields.name: Artillery Soldier
fields.description: Practise, exercise and employ artillery tactics, techniques and procedures during military war and peace operations.
fields.tasks: Coordinating armour, artillery, and air support units.      Directing deployment of land defence weapons, vehicles, and equipment. Directing location, construction, and camouflage of landward defence positions and equipment.      Managing field communications.      Driving and operating specialised military vehicles designed for combat operations.      Performing strategic and tactical planning, including battle plan development and reconnaissance operations.

fields.name: Arts / Culture Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls, coordinates and promotes artistic and cultural policies, programs, projects and services.
fields.tasks: Advising on the facilities available and promoting publicity in relation to events, shows and activities.      Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of staff.      Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Keeping abreast of new trends and developments in the creative arts and arranging theatrical productions and performances by bands and orchestras.      Planning and directing daily operations.      Planning and organising the range and mix of entertainment, attractions, cultural activities offered.

fields.name: Arts and Culture (Grades 4 - 9)
fields.description: Teaches arts and culture within a prescribed curriculum from grades 4 - 9 school students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Arts Therapist
fields.description: Diagnoses, assesses and treats patients by using art and creative processes as a medium to enable patients express and understand emotions.
fields.tasks: Assessing clients’ therapeutic needs by listening, observing and understanding their temperaments and feelings.   Using visual art, media or music to help persons with communication challenges to express their feelings.   Providing a mode of psychotherapy with the creative use of painting, drawing, visual images and music.   Manipulating visual images, objects, materials and music to help people to face difficult emotions and to develop self-awareness.   Challenging the behaviour and attitude of clients with the use of physical materials, objects, music and art.   Providing a safe and secure setting for clients to participate in therapeutic processes.   Working creatively with individuals and groups in therapeutic settings, often as part of a multidisciplinary team of professionals.   Planning, designing and facilitating a schedule of art (including dance, drama and music) activities with individuals and groups.   Adapting ways of working with clients with a range of needs such as special education; support to recover from substance abuse; rehabilitation following strokes or traumatic head injury; and palliative care.

fields.name: Assessment Practitioner
fields.description: Conducts external assessments to determine competence.
fields.tasks: Gathering, analysing, interpreting, and using information about learners’ progress and achievement in order to improve teaching and learning. Documenting (in measurable terms), knowledge, skills, attitudes, and beliefs of the individual learner, the learning community (class, workshop, or other organised group of learners), the company, institution or the educational system.

fields.name: Asset Swap Administrator
fields.description: Administers the exchange of fixed or tangible assets for floating or intangible assets or vice versa.
fields.tasks: Providing post-trading services in the trade of securities in the financial market including bonds, equity and money market. Undertaking various administrative functions in the provision of clearing, settlement and depository services for clients. Keeping records of services provided. Compiling reports for clients. Keeping up to date with and adhering to all relevant legislation.

fields.name: Assistant Midwife
fields.description: Provides basic health care and advice before, during and after pregnancy and childbirth. They implement care, treatment and referral plans usually established by medical, midwifery and other health professionals.
fields.tasks: Assessing progress during pregnancy and childbirth, and recognizing signs and symptoms requiring referral to a health professional. Providing advice to women, families and communities on health, nutrition, hygiene, exercise, birth and emergency plans, breastfeeding, infant care, family planning and contraception, lifestyle and other topics related to pregnancy and childbirth. Providing care and support to women and newborns following childbirth, monitoring their health status, and identifying signs and symptoms requiring referral to a health professional. Providing delivery care, usually only in the absence of identified potential complications, or assisting Midwives with delivery care.

fields.name: Associate Legal Professional
fields.description: Works within a legal environment, usually directly supporting one or more solicitors or legal executive by sharing caseload and providing legal advice and customer care within a law firm, a commercial company or in the public sector. Alternate Occupation Names Judges Associate Legal Advisor Legal Analyst Legal Coordinator Legal Officer Revenue Fraud & Prosecutions Practitioner State Legal Advisor

fields.name: Astrologer
fields.description: Studies the positions and aspects of celestial bodies in the belief that they have an influence on the course of natural earthly occurrences and human affairs.
fields.tasks: Preparing personalised horoscopes based on factors such as time and place of birth by calculating the position of planets, their relationship to each other and to zodiacal bodies. Forecasting and advising on issues regarding future trends and events based on astral movement. Interpreting horoscope charts, forecasting conditions which lie ahead, the best course of action, and the probability of success or failure. Providing client consultations either face-to-face, telephonically or via Skype. Writing horoscope pages for newspapers or magazines predicting future events based on the position of the sun relative to a person's birth date or zodiac sign.

fields.name: Athlete
fields.description: Competing professionally in athletics such as running, throwing and jumping. This occupation requires high levels of physical fitness, sporting ability and personal commitment as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications or experience.
fields.tasks: Adhering to the rules and regulations associated with athletics. Participating in regular practice and training sessions and undertaking training to maintain the required standard of fitness and skill. Maintaining a high degree of expertise in athletics. Assessing other competitors and conditions at venues. Deciding on strategies in consultation with coaches. Competing in athletics events. Undertaking athletics promotional activities and media interviews.

fields.name: Attorney
fields.description: Provides legal advice, prepares and drafts legal documents and conducts negotiations on behalf of clients on matters associated with the law.
fields.tasks: Drawing up legal documents such as contracts, real estate transactions and wills and preparing statements of legal opinions. Gathering evidence to initiate legal actions by means such as interviewing clients and witnesses to ascertain the facts of a case. Giving clients (including individuals, companies, associations or government departments) legal advice on a wide variety of subjects and undertaking legal business on these clients’ behalf. Negotiating settlements in matters which involve legal disputes. Pleading clients’ cases before courts of law, tribunals and administrative boards or instructing advocates to plead in higher courts of justice. Researching legal principles, statutes and previous court decisions related to specific cases.

fields.name: Auctioneer
fields.description: Conducts sales of real estate, goods and livestock by taking offers from buyers and accepting the highest purchase price.
fields.tasks: Gathering items for sale and sorting them into lots. Assisting in the valuation of items and helping owners to get the most money from their sale. Preparing a sale bill to advertise the date and location of the auction. Organising and running auctions at indoor and outdoor venues, including the organisation of portable meal and ablution facilities for informal outdoor venues. Setting up and testing the auction sound system. Selling a variety of general or speciality items to the highest bidder through public speaking and using the auctioneers ‘chant’. Collecting the winning bids, and handing over money to sellers and items to buyers. Cleaning up the sale site after the auction. Participating in auction clerk and record-keeping functions.

fields.name: Audiologist
fields.description: Provides diagnostic assessment and rehabilitative services related to human hearing defects.
fields.tasks: Evaluating hearing and speech performance in patients to determine the nature of disorders. Administering hearing or speech/language tests using specialised equipment and instuments and interpreting results alongside other medical and behavioural data. Planning and participating in counselling, screening and speech rehabilitation programmes. Prescribing hearing aids and other assistive devices according to patients' needs and instructing them in their use. Counselling and guiding hearing- or language-impaired individuals and their families and wok colleagues.

fields.name: Audiometrist
fields.description: Administers audiometric screening and threshold tests under supervision of audiologist or otolaryngologist and refer individual to audiologist or other health professional for test interpretation or further examination.
fields.tasks: Conducting audiometric screening tests for hearing impairments induced in occupational settings such as factories, mines, construction sites or industrial workplaces.   Carrying out pre-tests on audiometric equipment to ensure that it is functional and recording the baseline calibrations to ensure reliable results.   Taking the acoustic health history of the patient.   Conducting an otoscopic examination where it is indicated to rule out another explanation for an adverse hearing screening such as an ear infection.   Providing information on the patient’s rights and responsibilities in respect of exposure to noise in the workplace.   Interpreting, evaluating and reporting on audiometric screening in accordance with current occupational health legislation and established standards.   Referring patients to health care professionals who work in the field of hearing health care where this may be required.

fields.name: Author
fields.description: Produces literary or other written work for publication or performance. This occupation requires high levels of creative talent or personal commitment and interest as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications and experience.
fields.tasks: Conceiving, writing and editing novels, plays, scripts, poetry and other material for publication or presentation.      Conducting research to establish factual content and to obtain other necessary information.      Selecting material for publication, checking style, grammar and accuracy of content, arranging for any necessary revisions.      Writing for the purpose of publication.

fields.name: Automotive Engine Mechanic
fields.description: Diagnoses, adjusts, repairs, or overhauls automotive engines.
fields.tasks: Detecting and diagnosing faults in engines and parts. Fitting, examining, testing and servicing motor vehicle engines. Fitting, examining, adjusting, dismantling, rebuilding and replacing defective parts of motor vehicles Installing or adjusting motors and brakes, and adjusting steering or other parts of motor vehicles. Installing, adjusting, servicing and replacing mechatronics components of motor vehicles. Performing scheduled maintenance services, such as oil changes, lubrications and engine tune-ups, to achieve smoother running of motor vehicles and ensure compliance with pollution regulations. Reassembling engines and parts after being repaired.

fields.name: Automotive Motor Mechanic
fields.description: Maintains, tests and repairs diesel and petrol road vehicles (less than 8 tons) and the mechanical parts thereof including transmissions, suspension, steering and brakes.
fields.tasks: Detecting and diagnosing faults in engines and parts. Fitting, examining, testing and servicing motor vehicle and motorcycle engines. Fitting, examining, adjusting, dismantling, rebuilding and replacing defective parts of motor vehicles. Installing or adjusting motors and brakes, and adjusting steering or other parts of motor vehicles. Installing, adjusting, servicing and replacing mechatronic components of motor vehicles. Performing scheduled maintenance services, such as oil changes, lubrications and engine tune-ups in order to achieve smoother running of vehicles and ensure compliance with pollution regulations. Reassembling engines and parts after being repaired.

fields.name: Automotive Parts Salesperson
fields.description: Sells motor vehicle accessories and spare parts in a retail or wholesale establishment.
fields.tasks: Selling vehicle products such as parts, tyres, lubricating oils, batteries, car stereos and alarms.  Searching catalogues or databases of parts to identify part numbers, prices and availability. Determining the replacement parts required by inspecting part sizes and details such as vehicle make, model, manufacturer and year. Advising customers on substitution or modification of parts when required replacements are not available. Measuring parts, using precision measuring instruments, in order to determine whether similar parts may be machined to required sizes. Explaining how a part functions, and demonstrating its proper use and installation to customers. Examining returns for defects, and exchanging defective parts or refunding money. Receiving and filling telephone orders for parts. Preparing sales slips and receiving payment or obtaining credit authorisation. Filling customer orders from stock and assisting in stocktaking operations.

fields.name: Auxiliary Child and Youth Care Worker
fields.description: Assists young people as individuals or groups to solve social, emotional, developmental, behavioural and financial problems in an agency framework.
fields.tasks: Collecting information relevant to clients’ needs and assessing their relevant skills, strengths and deficits. Assisting clients to identify options and develop plans of action while providing necessary support and assistance. Participating in the selection and admission of clients to appropriate programs. Providing crisis intervention and emergency shelter services Implementing life skills workshops, substance abuse treatment programs, behaviour management programs, youth services programs and other community and social service programs under the supervision of social work or health care professionals. Assisting in evaluating the effectiveness of interventions and programs by monitoring and reporting on clients' progress. Maintaining contact with other social service agencies, schools and health care providers involved with clients to provide information and obtain feedback on clients' overall situation and progress.

fields.name: Avian Farmer
fields.description: Plans, organises and performs farming operations to breed and raise small birds.
fields.tasks: Monitoring and examining birds to detect illness, injury, or disease.   Performing duties related to bird reproduction, such as placing eggs in incubators.   Promoting and marketing birds for sale.   Arranging purchase and transportation of stock.   Raising, feeding and tending birds.   Maintaining and cleaning buildings and aviaries.

fields.name: Avionics Mechanician
fields.description: Inspects, tests, aligns, repairs and installs aircraft electrical and avionic system components. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Examining and testing machines, instruments, components, other equipment, instruments and control systems to identify faults. Adjusting, repairing, and replacing worn and defective parts and wiring, and maintaining machines, equipment and instruments. Reassembling, test operating and adjusting equipment. Installing electronic instruments and control systems. Coordinating work with that of engineers, technicians, and other maintenance personnel. Interpreting test data to diagnose malfunctions and systemic performance problems.

fields.name: Ayurvedic Practitioner
fields.description: Provides a whole-body approach to health serves to promote spiritual, physical and mental well-being.
fields.tasks: Diagnosing people through visual and tactile observations and analysis of patients' medical histories and lifestyles.   Assessing the patient’s well-being by observing the interconnectedness between body, mind and spirit.   Using compounds made of herbs, oils, minerals and metals to mix into medicine to treat ailments and to reduce impurities in the body.   Applying a range of remedies including special diets, detoxification and rejuvenation techniques to restore balance and fight disease.   Providing counselling on lifestyle, spirituality and meditation and using various techniques such as yoga, sound therapy, and aromatherapy to promote overall health.

fields.name: Back Office Process Consultant
fields.description: Processes back office transactions in order to fulfil business and client and/or customer requirements.
fields.tasks: Collecting, counting and disbursing money received from sales made by sales staff. Undertaking basic bookkeeping and completing banking transactions. Dealing with sales invoices, receipts and payments. Arranging  and checking purchase orders. Communicating  with staff, clients and customers by answering questions, communicating information, taking orders and addressing complaints. Compiling, copying, sorting and filing records of office activities and business transactions. Completing and mailing accounts, contracts, policies and invoices.

fields.name: Backhoe Operator
fields.description: Operates a backhoe and attachments to excavate, break, drill, level and compact earth, rock and other material.
fields.tasks: Performing pre-operational checks of equipment as well as basic maintenance on track or rubber tire undercarriage, buckets and attachments.   Moving levers, depressing foot pedals and turning dials to operate the backhoe.   Becoming familiar with digging plans, machine capabilities and limitations and with efficient and safe digging procedures in a given application.   Observing hand signals, grade stakes or other markings when operating machines so that work can be performed to specifications.   Operating machinery to perform activities such as backfilling excavations, vibrating or breaking rock or concrete.   Receiving written or oral instructions regarding material movement or excavation.   Moving materials over short distances, such as around an excavation or construction site.   Lubricating, adjusting or repairing machinery and replacing parts such as gears, bearings or bucket teeth.   Acquiring and using a knowledge of earthmoving fundamentals such as soil characteristics, ground conditions and map reading as well as relevant Mine Health and Safety Act and Regulations if applicable.

fields.name: Bakery and Confectionary Products Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets operates and attends machinery used to mix, blend and otherwise process bread and confectionary.
fields.tasks: Attending equipment to make jam, toffee, cheese, processed cheese, margarine, syrup, ice, pasta, ice-cream, sausages, chocolate, maize starch, edible fats and dextrin. Setting, operating and attending machinery and ovens to mix, bake and otherwise prepare bread and flour confectionery products.

fields.name: Balloonist
fields.description: Navigates and controls the safe operation of an air balloon.
fields.tasks: Applying knowledge of principles and practices of flying in order to identify and solve problems arising in the course of work.      Controlling the operation of equipment and ensuring that all instruments and controls work properly.      Examining maintenance records and conducting inspections to ensure that aircraft are sound, maintenance has been performed and that all equipment is operational.      Flying and navigating aircraft in accordance with established control and operating procedures.      Obtaining briefings and clearances before flights and maintaining contact with air traffic or flight control during flight.      Signing necessary certificates and maintaining official records of flight.

fields.name: Bank Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the general operational activities of a branch of a bank or similar financial institution.
fields.tasks: Examining, evaluating and processing credit, commercial, real estate and personal loan, and insurance applications. Conducting financial investigations. Approving or rejecting, and coordinating the approval or rejection of, applications. Coordinating cooperation with other branches of the bank. Establishing and maintaining relationships with individual and business customers. Providing advice and assistance to customers on their financial and insurance needs and with matters such as changes in law that may affect them. Managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources. Monitoring credit extension decisions, overseeing the flow of cash and financial instruments and the preparation of financial and regulatory reports. Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff. Planning, directing and coordinating the activities of staff in the branch.

fields.name: Bank Notes Processor
fields.description: Sorts used notes and processes the disposal of damaged and the issuing of new ones to maintain quality of notes in circulation.
fields.tasks: Preparing bank notes received from financial institutions for recirculation. Checking and sorting re-issuable bank notes manually and by machine.   Preparing bank note bundles for processing on the note-processing machine. Using the note-processing machine to run quality checks on bank notes. Identifying and shredding unusable bank notes. Bundling bank notes according to the requirements of banking standards. Checking for counterfeit bank notes. Carrying out of other administrative duties for bank notes as per the South African Reserve Bank requirements.

fields.name: Bank Teller
fields.description: Process customer cash deposits and withdrawals, cheques, transfers, bills, credit card payments, money orders, certified cheques and other related banking transactions.
fields.tasks: Receiving cash and cheques, and processing deposits and withdrawals. Preventing fraud by verifying the validity of cheques and cross-checking amounts. Cashing cheques after verifying signatures and customer balances. Processing transactions electronically. Processing credit card payments. Issuing foreign exchange and traveller's cheques. Looking out for counterfeit coins and notes. Ensuring that the cash drawer is balanced and maintained at all times.

fields.name: Bank Worker
fields.description: Making records of all transactions and reconciling them with cash balance.
fields.tasks: Carrying out general administrative tasks within the bank. Recording all transactions made to and from accounts and balance end-of-day banking records. Recording and organising loan information. Preparing the monthly balance sheets of account customers. Carrying out administrative tasks in various banking departments such as new accounts, credit, loans and mortgages. Specialising in the administrative tasks of one banking department.

fields.name: Bar Attendant
fields.description: Prepares, mixes and serves alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks to patrons in a bar in a licensed establishment.
fields.tasks: Taking customer orders for alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Preparing and mixing cocktails by following standard recipes. Serving prepared drinks, as well as drinks from bottles and from tap.   Slicing and pitting fruit for garnishing drinks. Collecting money for drinks served. Preparing appetisers, such as pickles, cheese and cold meats. Ordering or requisitioning liquors and supplies to replenish stock.   Arranging bottles and glasses to make attractive displays.

fields.name: Barista
fields.description: Prepares and serves espresso coffee and other hot beverages to patrons in a cafe, coffee shop, restaurant or dining establishment.
fields.tasks: Making espressos and a wide range of espresso-based drinks. Making coffees and other hot beverages by following standard recipes. Preparing orders by making several drinks at the same time. Operating commercial espresso machines, and steam-frothing and steaming machines. Working under pressure in a fast-paced environment

fields.name: Basket, Cane and Wicker Worker
fields.description: Apply traditional techniques to weave baskets and other products from straw, rattan, reeds and cane and wicker.
fields.tasks: Preparing wood, straw, rattan, reeds, willow branches or similar materials to make products. Applying traditional techniques to weave baskets and other products. Forming bottom of basket by interlacing strips of rattan, wood veneer or other material. Inserting rods around edge of bottom between woven sections of bottom and bending them upright to serve as framework for sides. Carving floral and artistic designs on surfaces for decorative purposes.

fields.name: Bed Maker
fields.description: Makes, rebuilds and repairs beds, bases and mattresses.
fields.tasks: Reading and understanding schematics and blueprints. Determining how parts should connect and fitting components together by using hand or power tools. Connecting parts with bolts and screws, or welding and soldering pieces together once the parts are properly aligned. Conducting quality control checks and looking for faulty components and mistakes. Installing and securing springs and covering material to bed frames. Making mattresses according to specifications. Discussing upholstery fabric and providing cost estimate for upholstering of items. Tacking, gluing or sewing accessories to covers or frames on upholstered items. Working closely with designers and engineers in building prototypes or test products in some manufacturing environments. Working with computer or programmable motion-control devices and sensing technologies in some advanced manufacturing environments.

fields.name: Betting Agency Counter Clerk
fields.description: Records and processes customer bets, payments and payouts over the counter at betting agencies for horse and dog racing, and other sports and events.
fields.tasks: Taking bets from customers over the counter for horse racing and other competitive sporting or recreational events. Receiving cash or recording bets electronically. Issuing tickets and preparing summaries of transactions. Checking the amounts of money placed on race entrants and updating bookmakers accordingly. Giving copies of betting records to bookmakers after the closing of bets for each race. Verifying the identity and account balances of betting agency customers. Checking the details of winning betting tickets against the betting records, and paying out on winning tickets.

fields.name: Betting Agency Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of a betting agency.
fields.tasks: Planning and directing the daily operations of a betting agency. Planning and organising the range and mix of betting activities or options offered. Keeping abreast of new trends and developments in the betting arena. Checking and keeping custody of all cash receipts and making regular stock checks. Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources. Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of betting agency staff. Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations. Ensuring that facilities are kept clean and in good condition.

fields.name: Bicycle Mechanic
fields.description: Fits, maintains, services and repairs the mechanical and related equipment of bicycles.
fields.tasks: Assembling new bicycles. Changing bicycle tyres and controlling air pressure. Cleaning and lubricating bearings and other moving parts. Examining, servicing and repairing bicycles. Replacing and repairing components and accessories, such as brakes, driving chain mechanism, wheels, handle bars etc. Spray painting frames.

fields.name: Bid Assistant
fields.description: Clarifies bidding technicalities, spots and relays bids to an auctioneer.
fields.tasks: Observing the crowd at an auction, spotting and working with bidders and potential bidders, and passing on information to the auctioneer through designated voice or hand signals. Having knowledge of the items for sale, as well as their value, and answering questions of potential bidders. Assisting the auctioneer in keeping the pace of the auction fast and exciting. Assisting the auctioneer in all tasks related to setting up and running an auction: keeping records of sales, handing over money to sellers and items to buyers, and clearing up the auction site after the auction.

fields.name: Bingo Caller
fields.description: Operates the equipment used for the random selection of bingo numbers and to call the numbers at the bingo event.
fields.tasks: Running bingo games by calling the numbers generated randomly by a computer. Calling an average 15 to 20 games during a one-hour slot and ensuring that each game runs smoothly. Building rapport with the audience, providing entertaining commentary and creating a lively, sociable atmosphere. Providing social banter and amusing players between games. Handling any winning claims. Carrying out related administrative tasks during non-game times.

fields.name: Biochemist
fields.description: Studies the biochemistry of living organisms and the molecular structure and function of related components.
fields.tasks: Planning and organising work in biochemistry laboratories. Performing clinical validation: checking abnormal results identified by automated analysers and deciding if further tests are necessary. Carrying out complex biochemical analyses on specimens of body fluids and tissues. Auditing the use and diagnostic performance of tests as part of national and international quality assurance programmes. Identifying the cause of and resolving any poor analytical performance problems. Searching scientific literature for evidence of specificity and sensitivity of a diagnostic test. Devising and conducting basic or applied research. Writing reports, submitting funding bids and conducting research. Attending and contributing to local and national scientific meetings and conferences. Managing a biochemical laboratory.

fields.name: Biokineticist
fields.description: Assesses, diagnoses and treats illnesses and disabilities and prescribe individual healthy exercise habits or programmes to improve individual people's physical conditions and quality of life.
fields.tasks: Improving a person’s physical condition and quality of life by means of physical assessment and prescribing of healthy exercise habits.   Evaluating and measuring body posture, body composition, blood pressure, glucose levels, lung function, heart rate, fitness, muscle strength, endurance, power, flexibility and other health screenings to determine the patient’s capacity to work and exercise.   Prescribing exercise routines either as preventative health measures or to correct health problems, such as sport injuries or recovery from diseases or illnesses in close co-operation doctors and other medical practitioners.   Identifying exercise risks in a person and assessing the different basic components of fitness, namely the heart and respiratory systems, muscle strength, muscle and joint flexibility, speed of movement, skill, coordination and posture.

fields.name: Biologist (General)
fields.description: Studies the origin, anatomy, physiology, reproduction and behaviour of living organisms and the ways in which they interact with the environment in which they live.
fields.tasks: Studying animal and plant life in terms of origin, structure, function and development. Collecting and analysing biological data related to the interrelationships between organisms and the environment. Researching the distribution of animals and plants in the environment, their identification, anatomical study and classification. Studying the effects of pollution and radioactivity on animals and plants. Conducting research projects for government and organisations in different sectors, and preparing related reports including environmental impact reports. Reviewing reports that are related to aspects such as land use classifications and recreational development for adequacy and accuracy. Controlling and managing pests. Teaching university students and performing and supervising research. Attending conferences on behalf of employers to present technical information and meet fellow scientists.

fields.name: Biomedical Engineer
fields.description: Combines biology, engineering and medicine to help solve medical and scientific health problems.
fields.tasks: Applying knowledge of engineering to the design, development, and evaluation of biological and health systems and products, such as artificial organs, prostheses, and instrumentation. Designing devices used in various medical procedures, imaging systems such as magnetic resonance imaging and devices for automating insulin injections or controlling body functions. Designing components of optical instruments such as lenses, microscopes, telescopes, lasers, optical disc systems and other equipment that utilize the properties of light. Designing, testing, and coordinating the development of explosive ordnance material to meet military procurement specifications. Designing and overseeing construction and operation of nuclear reactors and power plants and nuclear fuels reprocessing and reclamation systems. Designing and developing nuclear equipment such as reactor cores, radiation shielding, and associated instrumentation and control mechanisms. Assessing damage and providing calculations for marine salvage operations. Studying and advising on engineering aspects of particular manufacturing processes, such as those related to glass, ceramics, textiles, leather products, wood, and printing. Identifying potential hazards and introducing safety procedures and devices.

fields.name: Biotechnologist
fields.description: Studies the anatomy, physiology and characteristics of living organisms and isolated biological molecules, and develops new materials for applying to a range of purposes.
fields.tasks: Using biological processes such as fermentation and harnessing biocatalysts such as enzymes, yeast, and other microbes to become microscopic manufacturing plants. Using engineering and science to create new products from biologically based raw materials such as vaccines or pharmaceuticals, while monitoring production trends and data and working out budgets and production costs. Developing factory processes that reduce pollution or treat waste products. Studying and examining micro-organisms such as bacteria, fungi, yeast, and their enzymes. Operating and maintaining equipment used to process biological materials such as whey, foods and pharmaceuticals. Keeping up to date with environmental matters, technology and computer applications used in their industry by, for example, attending conferences and meeting other scientists or clients.

fields.name: Blacksmith
fields.description: Shapes bars, rods and blocks of metal by heating and hammering to produce or repair metal articles. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Heating metal in forge furnace and manufacturing and repairing articles by drawing, bending, cutting, hammering metal on an anvil, punching, shearing, joining and hardening or tempering. Shaping heated metal into forgings on power hammer equipped with open dies. Operating closed-die drop hammer to forge metal articles. Operating a power-press machine equipped with closed dies to forge metal articles. Drawing wire Reading work orders or blueprints to determine specified tolerances and sequences of operations for machine setup. Measuring and inspecting machine parts to ensure conformance to product specifications.

fields.name: Blaster
fields.description: Fill blast holes with explosives and detonate explosives to dislodge coal, ore and rock or to demolish structures.
fields.tasks: Ensuring workplace safety and explosives handling, storage and transport procedures and regulations are followed. Planning and giving instructions for the lay out, depth and diameter of blast holes. Checking depth and cleanliness of blast holes. Determining quantity and type of explosives to be used. Loading explosives into blast holes. Assembling, or directing other workers to assemble, primer charges using detonators and explosive cartridges, and attaching electrical wires, fuses and detonating cords to primers. Connecting wires, fuses and detonator cords into series, testing electrical circuits and repairing malfunctions, and connecting series to blasting machines. Covering charges, filling blast holes with rock dust, sand and other materials, and tamping material to compact charges. Ensuring all explosives are detonated, and reporting and attending to misfires. Declaring blast areas safe before and after detonation of explosives. Compiling and maintaining records about usage of explosives in compliance with laws and regulations.

fields.name: Boarding Kennel or Cattery Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of an establishment which offers temporary boarding for dogs and cats.
fields.tasks: Attending to customers who are dropping off dogs and cats for boarding, or collecting their animals after boarding.   Answering customer queries with regards to boarding facilities, cost and availability of services.   Supervising staff who care for the animals and clean the facilities.   Ensuring that boarding dogs and cats are fed, have fresh water and get daily exercise.   Keeping record and control of business finances. Training, grooming, and nursing dogs and cats as necessary.   Ensuring that the cleanliness of the kennel and boarding facilities is maintained.

fields.name: Boat Driver / Coxswain
fields.description: Controls and manages the operations of a small boat / vessel.
fields.tasks: Commanding and navigating ship or similar vessel at sea or on inland waterways. Controlling and participating in deck and bridge-watch activities. Navigating vessels into and out of ports and through channels, straits and other waters where special knowledge is required. Ensuring safe loading and unloading of cargo and observance of safety regulations and procedures by crew and passengers. Applying knowledge of principles and practices relating to ship’s operation and navigation in order to identify and solve problems arising in the course of their work. Ordering ship’s stores and recruiting crew as required and maintaining record of operations. Transmitting and receiving routine and emergency information with shore stations and other ships.

fields.name: Boatbuilder and Repairer
fields.description: Builds, repairs and modifies boats.
fields.tasks: Examining drawings and constructing templates from full- scale outlines. Scribing lines from templates and cutting and forming parts such as keels, stern posts, ribs and sidings. Assembling boat shells, fastening sidings or ribs to keels and covers with planking. Building and installing structures such as cabins, machinery mountings, propeller supports and rudders. Installing decking, masts, booms and ladders. Determining repair requirements and procedures. Making hull moulds and fabricating or repairing vessels using materials such as aluminium, wood, glass reinforced plastics, carbon fibre, kevlar, fibreglass or concrete. Ordering materials, preparing cost estimates and quotations.

fields.name: Body Therapist
fields.description: Provides body therapy treatment services for health, relaxation and remedial purposes.
fields.tasks: Providing professional spa massages and body treatments to clients. Massaging different soft tissues of the body such as muscles, tendons and ligaments. Providing different types of massage techniques according to clients’ requests, such as those for stimulating circulation, for relaxing muscles, or for facilitating a general body detoxification. Performing preparation work prior to treatments, and correctly cleaning and restocking therapy rooms after treatments. Recommending and selling body conditioning treatments and products to client for home use. Maintaining and updating client records.

fields.name: Boiler or Engine Operator
fields.description: Operates and maintains stationary engines, boilers, refrigeration and air-conditioning systems, and associated mechanical plant.
fields.tasks: Operating, cleaning, lubricating and monitoring steam engines, boilers and auxiliary equipment such as pumps, compressors and air-conditioning equipment to supply and maintain steam and power for buildings, marine vessels or pneumatic tools. Firing coal furnaces by hand or with stokers and gas- or oil-fed boilers using automatic gas feeds or oil pumps. Monitoring and inspecting performance of equipment for efficient operation and ensuring boiler water, chemical and fuel are maintained at required levels. Analysing and recording instrument readings, troubleshooting and performing maintenance and minor repairs to prevent equipment or system failure. Monitoring ship’s engines, machinery and equipment indicators, recording variables and reporting abnormalities to the ship engineer officer on watch. Operating and maintaining off-loading liquid pumps and valves. Testing boiler water quality or arranging for testing, and adjusting and taking necessary corrective action such as adding chemicals to prevent corrosion and harmful deposits. Checking safety devices and performing environmental checks on a routine basis.

fields.name: Boilermaker
fields.description: Makes and repairs boilers pressure vessels.
fields.tasks: Marking sheet metal for cutting and shaping. Making and repairing household utensils and other articles in tin, copper and light alloys, or ornamental articles and fittings. Making and repairing boilers, tanks, vats and similar containers. Installing and repairing sheet-metal parts of vehicles and aircraft. Converting blueprints into shop drawings to be followed in the construction and assembly of sheet metal products. Determining project requirements, including scope, assembly sequences, and required methods and materials, according to blueprints, drawings, and written or verbal instructions. Inspecting product quality and installation to ensure conformance to specifications.

fields.name: Book or Script Editor
fields.description: Evaluates manuscripts of books or scripts to determine suitability for publication or production, and edits and supervises material in preparation for publication or for production on film, television, radio or stage.
fields.tasks: Editing novels, plays, scripts, poetry and other material for publication or presentation.      Conducting research to establish factual content and to obtain other necessary information.      Selecting material for publication, checking style, grammar and accuracy of content, arranging for any necessary revisions.

fields.name: Book Sewing Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, maintains and operates a book sewing machine to produce book blocks.
fields.tasks: Examining job orders to determine the quantities, stock specifications and any special instructions. Setting up and operating machines to achieve product specifications. Conducting regular inspections and maintenance of machines. Checking the quality and conformance to specifications of products. Keeping records of products produced.

fields.name: Bookkeeper
fields.description: Maintains and evaluates records of financial transactions in account books and computerised accounting systems.
fields.tasks: Maintaining complete records of all financial transactions of an undertaking according to general bookkeeping principles, with guidance from Accountants. Verifying accuracy of documents and records relating to payments, receipts and other financial transactions. Preparing financial statements and reports for specified periods. Applying knowledge of bookkeeping principles and practices in order to identify and solve problems arising in the course of their work. Maintaining complete records of all financial transactions of an undertaking according to general bookkeeping principles, with guidance from Accountants. Verifying accuracy of documents and records relating to payments, receipts and other financial transactions. Preparing financial statements and reports for specified periods. Applying knowledge of bookkeeping principles and practices in order to identify and solve problems arising in the course of their work. Maintaining complete records of all financial transactions of an undertaking according to general bookkeeping principles, with guidance from Accountants. Verifying accuracy of documents and records relating to payments, receipts and other financial transactions. Preparing financial statements and reports for specified periods. Applying knowledge of bookkeeping principles and practices in order to identify and solve problems arising in the course of their work.

fields.name: Bookmaker
fields.description: Determines risk, offers odds and accepts bets on the outcome of racing and other events.
fields.tasks: Accepting bets on a variety of different competitions or events with unpredictable outcomes, usually horse-racing or other sporting events. Setting the odds or rates for how a bet will pay out if successful. Establishing a margin by which a win must occur in order to pay out, by using the Points Spreads System. Using the Points Spreads System in an effort to offset the potential losses incurred from winning bets made. Having a deep level of understanding of the factors influencing the outcomes of sporting events. Taking money, placing bets and paying out winnings during busy periods. Balancing accounts at the end of the day. Recruiting and training new staff, and developing a reliable team of cashiers and bookmaker’s clerks. Implementing a high level of customer service throughout the team.

fields.name: Bookmaker's Clerk
fields.description: Assists bookmakers to provide on course betting services at race meetings.
fields.tasks: Assisting bookmakers to provide betting services.   Taking bets from customers over the telephone or over the counter.   Receiving cash or recording bets electronically.   Checking on the amounts of money placed on race entrants or games, updating the betting ledger, and advising bookmakers accordingly.   Checking the details on winning tickets against the betting ledger, and paying out on winning tickets.

fields.name: Botanist
fields.description: Studies the anatomy, physiology, biochemistry and ecology of plants.
fields.tasks: Studying the development of the life processes of plants, their physiology, heredity, environment, distribution, anatomy, morphology and their economic value to apply in such fields as agronomy, forestry, horticulture and pharmacology. Studying the behaviour of chromosomes and reproduction, internal and external structures and examining the mechanics and biochemistry of plant cells by using microscopes, staining techniques and other scientific equipment. Investigating the effect of aspects such as rainfall, temperature, climate and soil on plant growth, from seed to mature plants. Identifying, classifying, recording and monitoring plants and maintaining databases. Conducting environmental studies and preparing reports.

fields.name: Boxer
fields.description: Boxes professionally in boxing matches. This occupation requires high levels of physical fitness, sporting ability and personal commitment as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications or experience.
fields.tasks: Adhering to the rules and regulations associated with boxing. Participating in regular practice and training sessions and undertaking training to maintain the required standard of fitness and skill. Maintaining a high degree of expertise in boxing. Assessing other competitors and conditions at venues. Deciding on strategies in consultation with coaches. Competing in boxing events. Undertaking boxing promotional activities and media interviews.

fields.name: Braiding Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, loads, operates and monitors weaving machinery and equipment to produce woven products.
fields.tasks: Mounting attachments such as needles or pattern plates, and adjusting machine guides according to specifications. Placing bobbins of insulating material on machine spindles and threading strands through braiding heads according to pattern drafts which specifies lay and sequence of braiding. Threading yarn or thread through guides, needles and rollers of machines. Turning knobs, screws and dials to adjust settings of machines. Starting and monitoring machine operation to detect problems such as defective stitching, breaks in thread or machine malfunctions. Performing equipment maintenance tasks such as replacing needles and sanding rough areas of needles. Cleaning, oiling and lubricating machines, using air hoses, cleaning solutions, oil cans and/or grease guns.

fields.name: Brake Lining Maker
fields.description: Operates machines to manufacture moulded brake linings.
fields.tasks: Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of raw materials and processing agents into the manufacturing machines. Controlling process start-up and shut-down, troubleshooting and monitoring outside process equipment. Setting up, preparing and adjusting manufacturing machines. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of machines and to verify specified processing conditions. Adjusting equipment, valves, pumps, controls and process equipment. Analysing sample products, performing tests, recording data and writing production logs. Verifying equipment for malfunctions, carrying out routine operating tests and arranging for maintenance.

fields.name: Bricklayer
fields.description: Lays bricks, pre-cut stone and other types of building blocks in mortar to construct and repair walls, partitions, arches and other structures.
fields.tasks: Laying stone, brick and similar building blocks to construct or repair walls, partitions, fireplaces and other structures such as smokestacks, furnaces, converters, kilns and ovens, piers and abutments. Laying footpaths, kerbs and pavements. Laying bricks or other masonry to build patios, garden walls and other decorative installations.

fields.name: Broadcast Transmitter Operator
fields.description: Operates consoles to control radio or television broadcast transmitters.
fields.tasks: Monitoring strength, clarity and reliability of incoming and outgoing transmission signals. Adjusting equipment as required to sustain quality broadcasts. Monitoring and logging transmitter readings. Reporting equipment glitches, ensuring repairs are made. Playing and recording broadcast programmes using automation systems. Controlling audio equipment, regulating volume and sound quality during radio and television broadcasts. Aligning antennae with satellite dishes, finding clearest signal for transmission of broadcasts from field locations.

fields.name: Brownfield Redevelopment Specialist
fields.description: Plans and develops strategies for the sustainable regeneration of Brownfield sites and directs cleanup and redevelopment of contaminated properties for reuse.

fields.name: Builder's Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in erecting and repairing structures and facilities on building and construction sites and in factories producing prefabricated building components.
fields.tasks: Unloading, carrying and stacking building materials such as bricks, pipes and plumbing materials. Unloading and placing tools and equipment in position. Digging trenches using hand tools or jackhammers to break up rock and concrete. Placing and compacting filling and quarry materials. Erecting and dismantling scaffolding, ramps, catwalks, barricades and warning lights. Laying building materials such as brick, structural tile and concrete cinder, glass, gypsum and terra cotta block to construct or repair walls, partitions, arches, sewers and other structures. Applying plaster to walls and ceilings using a trowel as part of repair work. Mixing, pouring and spreading concrete under supervision. Using wheelbarrows to remove rubble and rubbish from building sites. Dismantling small structures and stripping materials in preparation for new construction.

fields.name: Building Associate
fields.description: Supervises construction sites, and organises and coordinates the material and human resources required.
fields.tasks: Reading specifications to determine construction requirements and planning procedures. Organizing and coordinating the material and human resources required to complete jobs. Examining and inspecting work progress. Examining equipment and construction sites to ensure that heath and safety requirements are met. Supervising construction sites and coordinating work with other construction projects. Supervising the activities of building trades workers, labourers and other construction workers.

fields.name: Building Inspector
fields.description: Inspects buildings to ensure compliance with laws and regulations and advises on building requirements.
fields.tasks: Ensuring that building projects meets the structural, safety, fire protection, energy saving and accessibility requirements of the National Building Regulations by conducting site inspections. Co-ordinating site inspections with other departments i.e. Fire, Health, Sewerage etc. Advising on building related issues specifically with regard to approved building plans, to reduce technical risks and prevent construction errors. Assuring that building projects achieve legal building certification and issuing Certificates of Occupancy. Preparing site inspection reports and legal notices in cases of unauthorised building work or building regulation contraventions, and serving legal notices in the correct manner. Attending court hearings as necessary. Addressing complaints and responding to building development related correspondence in an effective and efficient manner. Undertaking site inspections relating to Hoarding and demolition permit applications.

fields.name: Building Insulation Installer
fields.description: Installs and applies insulating material such as foam, granules, foil, solar film, baths and blankets to walls, floors, windows and ceilings of buildings to insulate against heat, cold, air, sound and moisture.
fields.tasks: Examining plans, specifications and work sites to determine the type, quality and quantity of insulation material required. Blowing and packing insulating or sound-absorbing materials into cavities between walls, floors and ceilings of buildings with power-driven machines. Installing insulating material such as foam, granules, foil, or solar film to insulate against heat, cold, air, sound or moisture. Applying insulating materials to exposed surfaces of equipment such as boilers, pipes and tanks. Repairing insulating materials to buildings, boilers, or refrigeration and air-conditioning equipment.

fields.name: Bulk Materials Handling Plant Operator
fields.description: Operates plant to load, unload, move, store and stack bulk materials.
fields.tasks: Transferring bulk products between storage, tanks, vessels, trucks or rail cars using bulk handling equipment and procedures. Operating consoles that control automatic equipment to sort, transfer, and stack on pallets of finished products. Reading production and delivery schedules and stacking patterns to determine sorting and transfer procedures, arrangement of packages on pallets and the destination of loaded pallets. Turning selector switches on the machine to control stacking arrangement of packages on pallets and to transfer loaded pallets to storage or delivery platforms. Supplying loading equipment with empty pallets. Controlling or tending to conveyors or conveyor systems that move materials or products, and controlling the speed and routing of materials.  Observing packages moving along conveyor belts to identify packages and to detect defective packaging, and presses console buttons to deflect packages to predetermined accumulator or reject lines. Stopping equipment to clear jams and informing supervisor of equipment malfunction. Keeping records of product movement and equipment performance and maintenance. Conducting all work according to safety procedures and regulations.

fields.name: Bulldozer Operator
fields.description: Operates a bulldozer using blades and other attachments to gouge out, level and move materials in construction, forestry, mining and other projects.
fields.tasks: Pushing large quantities of dirt, rock, clay, sand, rubble, vegetation or other material in a wide variety of settings such as mines, quarries, road construction, agricultural operations and building sites.   Connecting hydraulic hoses, belts, mechanical linkage or power take off shaft to bulldozer to provide power to raise, lower or tilt attachment.   Moving levers to control tool bars, carriers and disks.   Moving levers and depressing pedals to manoeuvre tractor and raise, lower and tilt attachment to clear right-of-way.   Feeling lever and listening for stalling action of engine to estimate depth of cut.   Driving bulldozer in successive passes over terrain to raise or lower terrain to specified grade following markings on grade stakes or hand signals.   Greasing, oiling and performing minor repairs on the bulldozer, using grease gun, oilcans and hand tools.   Acquiring and using knowledge of earthmoving fundamentals such as soil characteristics, ground conditions and map reading as well as relevant Mine Health and Safety Act and Regulations if applicable.

fields.name: Bus Driver
fields.description: Drives a bus to transport passengers short distances on scheduled intercity services over established routes.
fields.tasks: Driving a bus on specified routes or to specified destinations according to time schedules.   Assisting physically challenged passengers to board the bus.   Loading and unloading baggage into and out of baggage compartments.   Collecting tickets or cash fares from passengers.   Complying with traffic regulations to ensure that passengers have a smooth and safe ride.   Handling passenger emergencies and advising passengers to be seated and orderly while traveling on the bus.   Regulating the heating, lighting and ventilating systems for passenger comfort.   Performing routine vehicle maintenance such as regulating tyre pressure and adding petrol, oil and water.   Reporting delays or accidents and keeping a log book.   Maintaining the cleanliness of the bus.

fields.name: Bus Hostess
fields.description: Provides services for the safety and comfort of passengers travelling by bus.
fields.tasks: Answering questions about bus schedules, travel routes and bus services. Checking the names of passengers on booking list against those on their bus tickets. Welcoming passengers boarding long-distance busses. Adjusting seating arrangement to accommodate passengers. Distributing pillows and blankets on overnight trips.   Tending to on-board music and video entertainment centres.   Selling refreshments to passengers.   Maintaining an inventory to account for refreshments served or sold during trips.

fields.name: Business Administrator
fields.description: Provides administrative and secretarial support to company directors.
fields.tasks: Facilitating efficient organisational operations by executing departmental or company goals, policies and procedures. Directing and administering a company’s financial and budgetary activities. Managing general administration activities related to making products and providing services. Applying new technologies in the workplace. Consulting with management, staff and board members about operations. Negotiating or approving company contracts and agreements. Appointing department heads and managers. Analysing  financial statements, sales reports and other performance indicators. Identifying places to cut costs and to improve performance, policies and programmes.

fields.name: Business Broker
fields.description: Operates as an independent agent in the buying and selling of businesses.
fields.tasks: Assisting buyers and sellers of small, privately owned businesses in all stages of the buying and selling process. Estimating the value of businesses by assisting owners to establish a Most Probably Selling Price (MPSP) value. Developing comprehensive Information Memorandums and pre-screening businesses for potential buyers. Assisting buyers to pinpoint their business interests and thus suitable businesses. Facilitating the progress of due diligence investigations. Advertising and marketing businesses for sale. Screening potential buyers for suitability and handling initial potential buyer interviews. Coordinating negotiations with prospective buyers and providing advice on deal structuring. Assisting with the legal documentation and administration related to business sales, and coordinating the efforts of lawyers, bankers, insurance agents etc. who are involved in the transaction. Helping to maintain confidentiality of the details of business sales.

fields.name: Business Machine Mechanic
fields.description: Maintains, adjusts and repairs computers, photocopiers, fax machines, cash registers and other electronic commercial and office machines. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Examining and testing machines, instruments, components, other equipment, instruments and control systems to identify faults. Adjusting, repairing, and replacing worn and defective parts and wiring, and maintaining machines, equipment and instruments. Reassembling, test operating and adjusting equipment. Installing electronic instruments and control systems. Coordinating work with that of engineers, technicians, and other maintenance personnel. Interpreting test data to diagnose malfunctions and systemic performance problems. Installing, adjusting, repairing or replacing electrical and electronic components, assemblies, and systems using hand tools, power tools, or soldering irons. Connecting components to assemblies such as radio systems, instruments, magnetos, inverters, and in-flight refuelling systems.

fields.name: Business Studies Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches business studies (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Business Support Coordinator
fields.description: Implements non-financial business support strategies and policies, quality controls service providers and supports interventions. Controls expenditure within agreed budgets.
fields.tasks: Supporting a business, a department and/or its functions by following-up on action items and activities. Assisting in the arrangement and execution of events, programs and meetings by obtaining the necessary resources and organising logistics such as travel and venues. Assisting in calendar management, file and document management, administrative support, and other routine office duties as needed. Performing basic analysis based on identified needs and with direction provided. Gathering, entering, compiling, and verifying information from multiple sources as directed. Reviewing, updating, and uploading information to relevant systems utilising software and/or systems specific to the functional area, and using this information to generate basic reports, timelines, tables, graphs, correspondence, and presentations. Working on basic departmental projects, providing support for budgets, and updating stakeholders according to plans and progress. Building and maintaining relationships with internal and external clients and communicating with them as necessary.

fields.name: Business Training Manager
fields.description: Plans, directs, organises, controls and coordinates training policy, provides advice, training and administrative support to trainers and learners.

fields.name: Busser
fields.description: Cleans and maintains public areas in a bar, club or dining establishment by collecting and returning dishes, cutlery and glasses to the kitchen or bar, wiping tables and bars, mopping spillages, and emptying bins and ashtrays.
fields.tasks: Cleaning bars and equipment and replenishing bar supplies.  Stocking refrigerating units with wines and bottled beer. Slicing and pitting fruit for garnishing drinks. Washing glasses, bar counter tops and equipment, and polishing bar fixtures. Assisting with mixing and preparing cordials for mixed or carbonated drinks. Assisting waitrons and bartenders at restaurants and other places that serve food. Cleaning tables, taking plates, utensils and drink ware to the kitchen to be washed. Resetting tables for the next service. Assisting waitrons with carrying food to tables, restocking utensils, serviettes and other dining room requirements. Mopping floors and removing empty bottles and rubbish.

fields.name: Butcher
fields.description: Selects, cuts, trims, prepares and arranges fresh meat for sale or supply; or manages the processes in the production of fresh meat products. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Flaying and trimming carcasses. Boning, cutting and dressing meat and fish for sale or further processing. Preparing ingredients and making sausages and similar products using chopping, mixing and shaping machines. Curing meat, fish and other foods. Operating smokehouses or ovens to smoke meat, fish and other foodstuffs. Cooking or in other ways preparing meat, fish and related food items for sale. Selling meat or fish to customers, including wrapping, weighing and labelling products, and receiving payment.

fields.name: Butler
fields.description: Supervises and coordinates activities of household employees engaged in cooking, cleaning, and related domestic duties.
fields.tasks: Supervising and coordinating the activities and duties of household staff, and assisting with staff training. Assisting with managing the household budget and inventory supplies. Overseeing the serving of meals and drinks by directing staff or serving them personally. Assisting with planning and organising parties and events at the home. Overseeing the wine cellar and the liqueur inventory.  Overseeing family packing and travel preparations. Serving as a personal valet to the household and/or a particular member of the house. Answering residence telephones, receiving guests at the door and supervising the reception of visitors. Scheduling and overseeing vendors of contracted services. Assisting with household and family security measures.

fields.name: Cabinetmaker
fields.description: Fabricates or repairs wooden furniture, and fits and assembles prepared parts to make or repair furniture.
fields.tasks: Using hand tools and operating woodworking machines, such as power saws, jointers and shapers to cut, shape and form parts and components. Studying plans, verifying dimensions of articles to be made, or preparing specifications and checking the quality and fit of pieces in order to ensure adherence to specifications. Trimming joints and fitting parts and subassemblies together to form complete units using glue and clamps, and reinforcing joints using nails, screws or other fasteners. Making, restyling and repairing various wooden articles, such as cabinets, furniture, vehicles, scale models, sports equipment and other parts or products. Decorating furniture and fixtures by inlaying wood, applying veneer and carving designs. Finishing surfaces of wooden articles or furniture.

fields.name: Cable and Rope Splicer
fields.description: Maintain cables, ropes and wires on construction sites, buildings or other structures.
fields.tasks: Inspecting cables, ropes, wires, pulleys and other tackle for defects and damage and determining the necessity for repair or replacement. Adjusting and maintaining cable tension carriages in proper alignment. Installing, repairing, lubricating cables and ropes and fitting attachments to cables and ropes. Splicing fibre and wire rope slings necessary for the movement and placement of heavy equipment. Supervising the activities of work crews assigned to making emergency repairs to cables. Operating overhead cranes in connection with cable maintenance and repair work as necessary. Working as part of a team with other artisans including especially Riggers.

fields.name: Cable and Rope Splicing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines which splice cables and ropes.
fields.tasks: Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of raw materials and in-process products into the machine. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of the machine and to verify specified processing conditions. Analysing sample products, performing tests, recording data and writing production logs. Informing supervisors if machine requires adjustment, maintenance or repair.

fields.name: Cable Ferry Operator
fields.description: Pulls a ferryboat transporting passengers through guided overhead cables.
fields.tasks: Signalling passengers and motor vehicles to embark and disembark.   Directing workers engaged in loading of freight.   Twirling a chain around the cable that is suspended across the water and fixing it to a body harness.   Walking the length of the deck pulling the ferry along the cable, slowly moving forward to cross the river.   Inspecting equipment such as cables, ropes, pontoons and railings and repairs or replaces defective equipment.

fields.name: Cable Jointer
fields.description: Joins insulated electric power cables installed in underground conduits and trenches and prepares cable terminations for connection to electrical equipment and overhead lines. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Identifying defective sectionalizing devices, circuit breakers, fuses, voltage regulators, transformers, switches, relays, or wiring, using wiring diagrams and electrical-testing instruments. Climbing poles or using truck-mounted buckets to access equipment. Creating splices, or joints, in runs of cable by connecting two or more cables together. Connecting the insulation and/or sheathing that surrounds a cable. Maintaining and repairing existing runs of cable. Performing tests and checks of conductors and insulators, locating and repairing faults. Assisting in digging trenches and ditches for runs of underground cable.

fields.name: Cable Manufacturing Machine Minder
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and runs and monitors cable manufacturing machinery and equipment to produce cables.
fields.tasks: Operating or minding semi-automatic cable manufacturing machines. Watching gauges, dials or other indicators that provide information on raw material input and product output flows to make sure machines are working properly and taking necessary corrective action. Conducting routine quality checks to monitor component or product quality during machine running cycle. Inspecting products to verify that they meet specifications and determining whether machine adjustment is needed. Operating machines for test runs to verify adjustments and to obtain product samples. Recording data and writing production logs. Informing supervisors if a machine requires maintenance or repair.

fields.name: Caddie
fields.description: Assists a golfer by carrying his golf bag on the golf coarse.
fields.tasks: Carrying the golfer’s club bag for the duration of the game and handing the golfer the required or requested club. Cleaning the clubs and balls during the course of the game. Knowing and advising the golfer of the distances (yardages) between the ball and the flag (pin). Knowing where all the hazards are along the course and the best approach to avoiding these hazards. Raking the bunkers and sand-traps after the golfer has used them. Replacing divots (chunks of grass) if the golfer has cut them. Holding the flag (pin) on the green while the golfer is putting.
