Offering assistance or giving advice if asked. Knowing the rules and keeping up-to-date with relevant golfing and golf course related information.

fields.name: Café (Licensed) or Restaurant Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of establishments involved in catering and dining services.
fields.tasks: Taking reservations, greeting guests and assisting in taking orders. Arranging the purchasing and pricing of goods according to budget and maintaining records of stock levels and financial transactions. Conferring with customers to assess their satisfaction with meals and service. Ensuring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations. Planning and organising special functions and planning menus in consultation with chefs and cooks. Selecting, set staff work schedules, training and supervising waiting and kitchen staff. Negotiating arrangements with clients and suppliers.

fields.name: Cafe Worker
fields.description: Sells and serves food and beverages for consumption on premises in a cafe or similar establishment.
fields.tasks: Preparing and serving food and beverages for consumption on the premises. Taking customers' food and beverage orders. Operating cash registers, accepting payments and preparing sales invoices. Cleaning and setting tables for prospective customers. Clearing away used dishes and cutlery from tables when customers are finished. Washing dishes, cutlery and cooking utensils. Cleaning cafe equipment such as coffee grinders, espresso machines and ice makers. Participating in stocktakes and assisting in putting away new stock. Providing backup to other cafe employees

fields.name: Call Centre Salesperson
fields.description: Contact existing and prospective customers, using the telephone or other electronic communications media, to promote goods and services, obtain sales and arrange sales visits.
fields.tasks: Working from scripts and lists of contacts to promote goods and services by telephone in order to persuade potential customers to purchase products or services or to make donations to charitable causes. Obtaining customer information such as name, address and payment method, and entering orders or commitments into computers. Creating interest in goods and services, and seeking a sale or an agreement by the potential customer to meet with a sales representatives. Arranging appointments for sales representatives to meet with potential customers. Arranging the processing and despatch of purchased goods and services, information kits and brochures to customers. Maintaining statistics of calls made and successes achieved and submitting periodic reports on telemarketing activities and results.

fields.name: Call or Contact Centre Agent
fields.description: Conducts inbound and/or outbound calls, responds to, or communicates with customers on a variety of products or services.
fields.tasks: Advising clients of additional products or services. Dealing with incoming calls and messages from clients, whether to answer queries, handle calls for service or sort out complaints. Identifying requirements and entering events into a computer system.

fields.name: Call or Contact Centre Manager
fields.description: Manages the performance of call centre workers, processes and technology against financial and non financial operational targets.
fields.tasks: Managing the team of call center representatives directing their activities for the achievement of call center targets and goals. Developing and supervising a team of representatives, conducting performance evaluations and writing performance reports. Identifying requirements which includes targets, specific data, and anticipated outcomes. Managing the overall performance analysis of existing lists and programs. Developing new lead targeting schemes and scripting for the optimization of existing programs. Promoting sales culture that encourages and ensures staff satisfaction.

fields.name: Camera Operator (Film, Television or Video)
fields.description: Operates consoles to control radio or television broadcast transmitters.
fields.tasks: Discussing with director the types of film and  video techniques to be used, as well as focus and distance settings and camera angles.   Following directives from Director during filming over headset.    Moving cameras and adjusting controls to follow action scenes being photographed / filmed.   Selecting and setting up relevant equipment and accessories.   Checking  lighting has been set up as required.   Viewing scenes through viewfinder, making final adjustments and photographing / filming scenes.   Monitoring equipment during filming operation.   Moving cameras and adjusting controls to follow action scenes being photographed / filmed.

fields.name: Cane Furniture Maker
fields.description: Designs and makes furniture from cane.
fields.tasks: Designing cane furniture. Examining furniture to determine the best method for repair or restoration. Soaking rolls of cane in warm water. Stretching cane over frameworks. Crisscrossing cane strands to form a thick woven article. Gluing and tacking the cane ends. Recommending finishes and furniture styles, using knowledge of products, fashions and styles. Mixing finishing ingredients to obtain desired colours or shades. Painting and staining cane furniture.

fields.name: Canvas Goods Maker
fields.description: Fabricates and repairs canvas and related products such as awnings, tents, tarpaulins, horse rugs and caravan annexes.
fields.tasks: Laying out drawings for products such as awnings, tents and tarpaulins. Patching holes, sewing tears and ripped seams, or darning defects in items, using needles and thread. Attaching grommets, fastenings, and fittings. Operating powered cutting shears and sewing machines. Securing ropes or cables to finished products. Making frames for awnings, tents and other articles. Examining completed product for conformance to specifications. Preparing cost estimates and quotations.

fields.name: Car Compactor Operator
fields.description: Operates machinery to press and flatten cars.
fields.tasks: Driving portable car crushers/compactors to car junkyards, positioning them and setting them up. Loading cars onto the crushing bed by operating lifting claws or magnets that are built into car crushers/compactors. Operating crushers/compactors that crush cars as flat as possible in order to reduce their size and facilitate storage and transport to recycle plants. Keeping records of all crushing/compacting operations.

fields.name: Car Park Attendant
fields.description: Operates and maintains a car parking facility by guarding cars in parking areas and collecting fees at car park entry or exit points. May drive and park cars, and operate boom gates.
fields.tasks: Issuing parking tickets to customers at vehicle entry points. Calculating parking charges and collecting fees from customers at vehicle exit points. Maintaining automated ticket dispensing machines and ensuring that ticket blanks are available for printing. Clearing money from the “Pay on Foot’ machines and checking monitoring systems. Keeping parking areas clean and orderly to ensure that space usage is maximised. Lifting, positioning and removing barricades in order to open or close parking areas. Directing motorists to parking areas or parking spaces using hand signals as necessary. Patrolling parking areas in order to prevent vehicle damage and vehicle or property theft.

fields.name: Caravan Park and Camping Ground Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of caravan parks and camping grounds to provide accommodation and leisure services.
fields.tasks: Advising on the facilities available and promoting publicity in relation to events, shows and activities.      Checking and keeping custody of all cash receipts and making regular stock checks.      Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of staff.      Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.      Ensuring that facilities are kept clean and in good condition.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.         Planning and directing daily operations.      Planning and organising the range and mix of entertainment, attractions, cultural activities, and sports and fitness programmes to be offered by the park.

fields.name: Cardiac Technician
fields.description: Conducts tests on patients to record heart activity using specialised equipment, recording devices and laboratory instruments in support of cardiologists and other medical practitioners engaged in diagnosing, monitoring and treating heart disease.
fields.tasks: Explaining procedures, observing and positioning patients, and using protection devices to ensure safety and comfort during examination or treatment.   Position treatment equipment and adjusting settings and controls according to technical specifications.   Monitoring patients' conditions and reactions, reporting abnormal signs to a medical practitioner.   Following prescription issued by a medical practitioner.   Operating or overseeing operation equipment.   Reviewing and evaluating information and recording results of procedures.

fields.name: Cardiologist
fields.description: Investigates, diagnoses and treats diseases of the human heart. A Cardiologist is also known as a “Cardiothoracic Surgeon” and is commonly known among people in general as a “heart specialist”.
fields.tasks: Prescribing medication and recommending special diets and exercise to a patient. Performing corrective surgery where necessary. Working in conjunction with other specialists (especially Anaesthetists) during surgery. Conducting coronary bypass surgery. Removing fatty deposits from closed or inflamed blood vessels. On rare occasions transplanting a heart from a donor into a patient’s chest cavity.

fields.name: Careers Counsellor
fields.description: A Career Counsellor provides individuals and groups with information about career choices and assists individuals with self-development.
fields.tasks: Studying and analysing jobs performed in an establishment by various means, including interviews with workers, supervisors and management, and writing detailed position, job or occupation descriptions from information obtained. Preparing occupational information or working on occupational classification systems. Advising and working on the foregoing and other aspects of job and occupation analyses in such fields as personnel administration, workforce research and planning, training, or occupational information and vocational guidance. Studying and advising individuals on employment opportunities, career choices and further education or training that may be desirable.

fields.name: Caretaker
fields.description: Maintains and oversees the cleaning of a residential building, school, office, holiday camp or caravan park and associated grounds.
fields.tasks: Planning and preparing employee work schedules and supervising work with regard to cleaning and maintenance of the supervised property. Keeping a stock of supplies and equipment, and issuing these to workers. Filling out registration forms and providing tenants with copies of rules. Regulating the conduct of tenants and visitors in such matters as noise abatement or misuse of property. Providing small services to absent tenants such as accepting deliveries on their behalf or providing requested information to callers. Notifying management and owners of buildings of the need for repairs, and arranging for services such as painting, repair work and renovations. Inspecting the work of workers and contractors to ensure that it meets specifications and established standards. Performing or assisting with cleaning or maintenance duties as necessary. Investigating complaints about service or equipment, and taking corrective action. Instructing staff in work policies and procedures, and in the use and maintenance of equipment.

fields.name: Caretaker / cleaner
fields.description: Maintains and cleans a residential building, school, office, holiday camp or caravan park and associated grounds.
fields.tasks: Cleaning building floors, walls, windows, restrooms, fixtures and furniture by dusting, sweeping, mopping, scrubbing, vacuuming or polishing using specific equipment and procedures. Mixing water and detergents or acids in containers and preparing cleaning solutions according to specifications. Servicing and restocking restrooms. Gathering and emptying refuse bins and moving refuse to refuse collection area. Setting up, arranging or removing decorations, tables, chairs, ladders or scaffolding to prepare facilities for events such as banquets or meetings. Monitoring building security and safety by locking doors after operating hours and checking electrical appliance use to avoid hazardous situations. Mowing and trimming lawns and shrubbery using mowers and hand and power trimmers. Clearing debris and refuse from grounds. Making adjustments or minor repairs to heating, cooling, ventilating, plumbing or electrical systems. Notifying managers concerning the need for major repairs or additions to building operating systems.

fields.name: Carpenter
fields.description: Constructs, erects, installs, renovates and repairs structures and fixtures of wood, plywood, wallboard and other materials. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Making, altering and repairing structural and other woodwork at a work-bench and on a construction site. Constructing, erecting and installing heavy-framed wooden structures on building sites. Fitting, assembling and altering internal and external fixtures of buildings, such as walls, doors, door and window frames, facings and panelling. Making, repairing and fitting scenic equipment for theatrical performances, motion picture or television productions. Constructing, assembling, altering and repairing wooden fixtures and fittings in train coaches, aircraft, ships, boats, floats, and other vehicles.

fields.name: Carpenter and Joiner
fields.description: Constructs and installs structures and fixtures of wood, plywood, and wallboard and cuts, shapes and fits timber parts to form structures and fittings. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Making, altering and repairing structural and other woodwork at a work-bench and on a construction site. Constructing, erecting and installing heavy-framed wooden structures on building sites. Fitting, assembling and altering internal and external fixtures of buildings, such as walls, doors, door and window frames, facings and panelling. Making, repairing and fitting scenic equipment for theatrical performances, motion picture or television productions. Constructing, assembling, altering and repairing wooden fixtures and fittings in train coaches, aircraft, ships, boats, floats, and other vehicles.

fields.name: Carpet Cleaner
fields.description: Cleans carpets, rugs and furniture upholstery using powder, liquid and steam cleaning methods, and applies soil-repellent chemicals and deodorants.
fields.tasks: Inspecting carpets to identify the correct cleaning method required. Selecting and applying cleaning agents to remove stains from carpets and upholstery. Calculating correct solution strength for shampoos and cleaning chemicals. Filling carpet cleaning machines with correctly mixed cleaning solutions. Cleaning carpets and upholstered furniture using cleaning machines and their attachments. Inspecting the cleaned carpet after drying to ensure cleanliness.  Applying stain-repellent chemicals to the carpet and upholstery to help maintain its cleanliness. Pushing pile-lifting machines over carpets and brushing pile to raise and fluff it up.

fields.name: Cartographer
fields.description: Applies scientific and mathematical principles to design, prepare and revise maps and charts.
fields.tasks: Designing maps, graphics, illustrations and layouts. Using computers to compile and produce graphs for specialist and general users. Researching, selecting and evaluating map source data for use in the preparation or revision of maps and charts to various scales. Analysing and evaluating “mappable” information. Liaising with surveyors and designers regarding projects. Collating data provided by remote sensing techniques (the means by which spatial and environmental data about the earth are acquired by sensors located in satellites and aircraft). Operating a photogrammetric plotting instrument or a digital photogrammetric workstation (DPW), which views the photographs stereoscopically or in a 3D format. Designing and maintaining geographical information (GI) databases. Using desktop publishing packages to edit and formulate information. Generalising map data to allow for a reduction in scale (derived mapping). Checking and appraising the content and accuracy of maps, charts and printing proofs.

fields.name: Carver
fields.description: Make articles for personal or household use, or for decorative purposes by carving wood, stone and bone.
fields.tasks: Studying artistic objects or graphic materials to plan carving or cutting techniques. Selecting chisels, pneumatic or surfacing tools, or sandblasting nozzles and determining the sequence of use. Laying out designs or dimensions from sketches or blueprints onto surfaces by freehand or by transferring them from tracing paper using scribes or chalk and measuring instruments. Carving wood, stone and bone to make articles by employing knowledge of carving techniques and a sense of artistry to produce carvings consistent with designers' plans. Drilling holes and cutting grooves according to diagrams and patterns. Guiding nozzles, following stencil outlines or chipping along marks to create designs to work surfaces down to specified finishes. Shaping or touching up roughed-out designs with appropriate tools to finish carvings.

fields.name: Cash Van Salesperson
fields.description: Drives a van or light truck on established routes to sell goods and services.
fields.tasks: Trading from a caravan or a light motor vehicle. Developing lists of prospective customers and calling on them to obtain new business. Parking at street and market locations as permitted by municipal permit. Selling goods along specified route as specified by municipal permit. Receiving payments  for goods / services from customers and giving change. Recording transactions on customer receipts and sales records. Wrapping and packaging goods sold. Ordering and purchasing goods for sale, and monitoring and maintaining stock levels. May attract attention by playing music (soft serve and ice-cream vans), if permitted by by-laws.

fields.name: Casting Director
fields.description: Cast parts in a film or play.
fields.tasks: Choosing writers, studying scripts to determine artistic interpretation, and instructing actors on acting methods.      Creating, planning, writing scripts for recording, videotaping and editing programs.      Directing all aspects of dramatic productions on stage, television, radio or in motion pictures, including choice of actors, and decisions concerning costumes..      Engaging and supervising all technical personnel, and determining the treatment, scope and scheduling of production.      Maintaining production archives and negotiating royalties.      Planning, organising and controlling scheduling involved in the production of motion pictures, television shows and performances.

fields.name: Catering Production Manager
fields.description: Manages a catering outlet that produces meals through mass production to hospitals, airlines, and catering outlets.
fields.tasks: Negotiating arrangements with clients and suppliers. Arranging the purchasing and pricing of goods according to budget. Ensuring dining, kitchen and food storage facilities comply with health regulations and are clean and functional. Planning menus in consultation with chefs and cooks. Maintaining records of stock levels and financial transactions. Conferring with customers to assess their satisfaction with meals and service. Selecting, set staff work schedules, training and supervising waiting and kitchen staff.

fields.name: Caving Guide
fields.description: Plans, organises and provides guided cave exploring experiences for individuals and groups.
fields.tasks: Demonstrating the concepts and skills used in cave exploration.      Explaining and enforcing safety procedures, rules and regulations.   Planning and carrying out caving expeditions.   Instructing clients in the use of caving equipment.   Evaluating and monitoring clients during caving activities.

fields.name: Cement and Concrete Plant Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in manufacturing cement and concrete products such as greasing and assembling concrete moulds, holding reinforcing steel in position during concrete pours, striping mould from dried concrete products, and finishing products.
fields.tasks: Erecting concrete form work and laying steel reinforcing. Pouring, spreading and levelling concrete using screeds and templates. Tamping, smoothing, shaping and sealing concrete. .Operating trowelling machines to float, trowel and polish concrete surfaces. Forming expansion joints and edges using edging tools, jointers and straight edges. Installing fixtures in concrete such as anchor bolts, steel plates and door sills. Wetting concrete and rubbing it with abrasives to finish vertical surfaces. Covering concrete with plastic sheeting and sand to cure it.   Cutting lines in concrete using power cutters. Covering freshly poured concrete with colouring powders and other materials when necessary.

fields.name: Cement Production Plant Operator
fields.description: Operates plant to produce cement, lime and clinker.
fields.tasks: Reading work orders to determine production specifications or other relevant information. Weighing or measuring materials, ingredients or products, and inspecting these visually or with hands to ensure conformance to requirements. Dumping or pouring specified amounts of materials into machinery or equipment. Mixing or blending ingredients by starting machines and mixing for specified times. Compounding or processing ingredients according to formulas. Operating or minding machines that mix or blend a wide variety of cement products to ensure safe and efficient operation. Collecting samples of materials or products for laboratory testing. Stopping mixing or blending machines when specified product qualities are obtained, and opening valves and starting pumps to transfer products for packaging. Checking and maintaining production records including information about quantities produced. Arranging and assisting with plant and machinery maintenance and repair.

fields.name: Censorship Inspector
fields.description: Reviews any material before publication or dissemination.
fields.tasks: Advising distributors and exhibitors of films and games on the requirements of The Films and Publications Act of 1996, with regard to the distribution of censored material.   Ensuring that all films and games offered for sale have been classified in terms of this Act.   Checking relevant certificates of registration.   Examining films and games being offered for sale or hire to determine if they meet all standards.   Instructing that films, games and publications being offered for sale or hire that do not comply with requirements be removed.

fields.name: Chapel or Memorial Attendant
fields.description: Performs a variety of tasks during funerals.
fields.tasks: Assisting the funeral director in a variety of duties relating to the arrangement of funerals and the running of the funeral home. Transferring human remains from the place of death to the funeral home. Preparing the body for burial or cremation, and for viewing by bereaved friends and relatives. Placing the coffin in the viewing room or chapel prior to the funeral service. Organizing floral displays and adjusting lights around the coffin. Ushering mourners into the church or chapel seats. Assisting in closing the coffin and carrying flowers to the hearse. Cleaning and driving funeral vehicles. Issuing and storing funeral equipment, and performing general maintenance duties

fields.name: Charter and Tour Bus Driver
fields.description: Drives a coach to transport passengers long distances on scheduled intercity services over established routes.
fields.tasks: Driving a bus on specified routes or to specified destinations according to time schedules.   Assisting physically challenged passengers to board the bus.   Loading and unloading baggage into and out of baggage compartments.   Collecting tickets or cash fares from passengers.   Complying with traffic regulations to ensure that passengers have a smooth and safe ride.   Handling passenger emergencies and advising passengers to be seated and orderly while traveling on the bus.   Regulating the heating, lighting and ventilating systems for passenger comfort.   Performing routine vehicle maintenance such as regulating tyre pressure and adding petrol, oil and water.   Reporting delays or accidents and keeping a log book.   Maintaining the cleanliness of the bus.

fields.name: Chauffeur
fields.description: Drives a limousine, van or private car to transport passengers to destinations on a fee-for-service basis, usually on a long-term hiring arrangement.
fields.tasks: Picking up passengers at prearranged locations and driving them to their destination.   Assisting passengers with entering and exiting vehicles and helping them with any luggage. Having and sharing a comprehensive local knowledge on private sightseeing tours. Following the relevant safety regulations and laws governing vehicle operation. Ensuring that passengers follow safety regulations.   Testing vehicle equipment such as lights, brakes, hooters and windscreen wipers to ensure proper operation.   Performing routine vehicle maintenance such as regulating tyre pressure, and adding fuel, oil and water as necessary.

fields.name: Checkout Operator
fields.description: Operates cash registers and receives payments for goods purchased by customers.
fields.tasks: Assisting customers in supermarkets, department stores and other shops with items that they have chosen and taking payment for these items. Operating a computerised till system that has a barcode scanner. Entering prices into the till system by scanning items chosen by customers. Weighing and pricing certain items, such as fruit and vegetables at the check-out counter. Removing security tags or deactivating security strips on items purchased. Packing and wrapping customer purchases. Processing store loyalty cards, coupons and vouchers. Receiving payments from customers. Assisting with stocking shelves, checking stock and working at the customer service desk.

fields.name: Cheese Grader / Tester
fields.description: Evaluates and grades body, texture, flavour, and colour of natural cheese.
fields.tasks: Sorting cheese according to colour, appearance, smell, texture, flavour and quality to ensure correct processing and usage. Discarding inferior or defective products. Placing acceptable products in containers for further processing. Weighing products or estimating weight. Placing products in containers according to grade and marking grades on containers. Recording of identification numbers on tags or on shipping, receiving or sales sheets.

fields.name: Cheese Packer
fields.description: Weighs, cuts, wraps, seals and labels the different kinds of cheeses.
fields.tasks: Cutting or dividing cheese into appropriate portions prior to packaging. Identifying correct containers for specific types of cheese. Packaging various types of cheese according to packing standards and specifications. Sealing cheese packs correctly with plastic film, lids or by vacuum-packing it. Weighing and labelling the packaged cheese according to the type of cheese and packaging. Stacking the packs in crates or on palates for distribution. Packing cheeses in the display fridges for sale.  Maintaining Health and Food Safety standards throughout the packing process.  Recording product, packaging and order information on specified forms and records.

fields.name: Chef
fields.description: Plans and organises the preparation and cooking of food in dining or catering establishments.
fields.tasks: Planning and developing recipes and menus, estimating food and labour costs, and ordering food supplies. Monitoring quality of dishes at all stages of preparation and presentation. Discussing food preparation issues with managers, dieticians, kitchen and waiting staff. Supervising and coordinating the activities of cooks and other workers engaged in food preparation. Inspecting supplies, equipment, and work areas to ensure conformance to established standards. Determining how food should be presented, and creating decorative food displays. Preparing, seasoning and cooking speciality foods and complex dishes.

fields.name: Chemical Engineer
fields.description: A Chemical Engineer designs and prepares specifications for chemical process systems and the construction and operation of commercial-scale chemical plants. A chemical engineer also supervises industrial processing, fabrication and manufacturing of products undergoing physical and chemical changes and related technologies.
fields.tasks: Conducting research and advising on, and developing commercial-scale chemical processes to refine crude oil and other liquids or gases, and to produce substances and items such as petroleum derivatives, explosives, food and drink products, medicines, or synthetic materials. Specifying chemical production methods, materials and quality standards and ensuring that they conform to specifications. Establishing control standards and procedures to ensure safety and efficiency of chemical production operations and safety of workers operating equipment or working in close proximity to on-going chemical reactions. Designing chemical plant equipment and devising processes for manufacturing chemicals and products. Performing tests throughout stages of production to determine degree of control over variables, including temperature, density, specific gravity, and pressure. Developing safety procedures to be employed. Preparing estimates of production costs and production progress reports for management. Performing laboratory studies of steps in manufacture of new products and testing proposed process in small scale operation such as a pilot plant.

fields.name: Chemical Engineering Technician
fields.description: Tests new and existing engineering technologies related to chemical, biochemical, industrial chemistry, chemical quality control and environmental protection. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Assisting in research on and development of industrial chemical processes, plant and equipment, or testing prototypes. Conducting chemical and physical laboratory tests to assist scientists and engineers in making qualitative and quantitative analyses of solids, liquids, and gaseous materials. Designing and preparing layouts of chemical plants according to the specifications given. Monitoring technical aspects of the construction, installation, operation, maintenance and repair of chemical plants to ensure satisfactory performance and compliance with specifications and regulations. Preparing detailed estimates of quantities and costs of materials and labour required for manufacture and installation according to the specifications given.

fields.name: Chemical Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Analyses and modifies new and existing chemical engineering technologies and applies them in the testing and implementation of chemical engineering projects.
fields.tasks: Conducting research and advising on, and developing commercial-scale chemical processes to refine crude oil and other liquids or gases, and to produce substances and items such as petroleum derivatives, explosives, food and drink products, medicines, or synthetic materials. Specifying chemical production methods, materials and quality standards and ensuring that they conform to specifications. Establishing control standards and procedures to ensure safety and efficiency of chemical production operations and safety of workers operating equipment or working in close proximity to on-going chemical reactions. Designing chemical plant equipment and devising processes for manufacturing chemicals and products. Performing tests throughout stages of production to determine degree of control over variables, including temperature, density, specific gravity, and pressure. Developing safety procedures to be employed. Preparing estimates of production costs and production progress reports for management. Performing laboratory studies of steps in manufacture of new products and testing proposed process in small scale operation such as a pilot plant.

fields.name: Chemical Mixer
fields.description: Mixes chemicals as per prescription.
fields.tasks: Weighing or measuring quantities of chemical ingredients according to formulas and pouring them into mixing tank. Starting and tending equipment that mixes chemicals for use in manufacture. Injecting steam into solutions to dissolve the ingredients, or cooking solutions to achieve the specified consistency. Turning valves to transfer solutions from mixing tanks to storage tanks. Testing solutions in storage tanks to detect variations from standards and adding appropriate ingredients to restore solutions to standard strength. Recording test results, batches of solutions mixed and chemicals used in each batch for production and inventory purposes.

fields.name: Chemical Plant Controller
fields.description: Controls the operation of chemical production plant.
fields.tasks: Operating electronic or computerized control panel from a central control room to monitor and optimize physical and chemical processes for several processing units. Adjusting equipment, valves, pumps, controls and process equipment. Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of raw materials and processing agents such as catalysts and filtering media into plant. Controlling process start-up and shut-down, troubleshooting and monitoring outside process equipment. Verifying equipment for malfunctions, carrying out routine operating tests and arranging for maintenance. Analyzing sample products, performing tests, recording data and writing production logs.

fields.name: Chemical Plant Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in a chemical processing plant such as delivering materials to processing areas, dumping ingredients into hoppers, operating machines to heat, cool and agitate chemical solutions, filling and fasting covers on containers, and attach
fields.tasks: Delivering materials to processing areas for the manufacture of drugs, textiles, ammunition and plastics. Lifting, loading and unloading raw materials, ingredients, finished products and packed items either manually or using hoists. Operating machinery used in the production process, or assisting machine operators. Turning valves to feeding liquid and gaseous materials into production equipment. Taking samples for testing and examining products to verify conformance to quality standards. Counting finished products to determine if product orders are complete. Attaching labels and information onto products and marking or tagging identification on parts. Cleaning and lubricating production equipment. Recording production and product testing information.

fields.name: Chemical Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Monitors and operates machines to blend, mix, process and package a wide range of chemical products such as soaps, detergents, pharmaceuticals, toiletries and explosives.
fields.tasks: Setting up, starting, controlling, adjusting and stopping chemical production machines. Measuring, weighing and loading chemical ingredients following formulation cards. Monitoring meters, gauges and electronic instrumentation on one or more chemical or formulation units such as mixers, kettles, blenders, dryers, tableting, encapsulation, granulation and coating machines. Monitoring reaction processes and transferring products in conformance with safety procedures. Taking samples and performing routine chemical and physical tests of products and recording production data. Cleaning and performing minor repairs to machines.

fields.name: Chemical Sales Representative
fields.description: Represents companies selling chemical goods such as pesticides and veterinary products to wholesale, retail and farming establishments.
fields.tasks: Providing prospective customers with information about the characteristics and functions of the products and equipment for sale and demonstrating its uses and qualities.   Quoting prices and credit terms, recording orders and arranging deliveries.   Soliciting orders and selling goods to retail, industrial, wholesale and other establishments.   Following up clients to ensure satisfaction with products purchased.   Reporting customers’ reactions and requirements to suppliers and manufacturers.   Obtaining and updating knowledge of market conditions and competitors’ goods and services.

fields.name: Chemical Waste Controller
fields.description: Identifies, removes, stores or disposes of chemical waste.
fields.tasks: Storing and transporting chemicals waste and other hazardous materials.   Cleaning up chemical wastes and hazardous substance spills.   Identifying and removing particular hazardous substances, including asbestos, lead paint, oil spills, chemicals and radioactive materials.   Setting up and taking down scaffolding or other structures that allow workers to reach and remove hazardous materials.  Safely disposing of hazardous materials that were removed from clean-up sites.

fields.name: Chemist
fields.description: Studies the chemical and physical properties of substances, and develops and monitors chemical processes and production.
fields.tasks: Conducting research and improving or developing concepts, instruments, theories and operational methods related to chemistry. Conducting experiments, tests and analyses to investigate chemical composition and energy and chemical changes in various natural or synthetic substances, materials and products. Reproducing and synthesizing naturally occurring substances and creating new artificial substances. Preparing scientific papers and reports.

fields.name: Chemistry Technician
fields.description: Performs laboratory tests on organic and inorganic chemicals, analyses test data and carries out technical functions in support of chemists or chemical engineers and technologists in a wide variety of areas such as fuels, pharmaceuticals, paints, metals, plastics, textiles, detergents, paper, fertilisers and cosmetics.
fields.tasks: Collecting samples and preparing materials and equipment for experiments, tests and analyses. Carrying out routine laboratory tests and performing a variety of technical support functions to assist chemical and physical scientists in research, development, analysis and testing. Controlling the quality and quantity of laboratory supplies by testing samples and monitoring usage and preparing detailed estimates of quantities and costs of materials and labour required for projects, according to the specifications given. Setting up, operating, and maintaining laboratory instruments and equipment, monitoring experiments, making observations, and calculating and recording results. Preparing materials for experimentation such as freezing and slicing specimens and mixing chemicals.

fields.name: Chief Information Officer
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs controls and coordinates the ICT strategies, plans and operations of an organisation to ensure the ICT infrastructure supports the organisation's overall operations and priorities.
fields.tasks: Assigning, reviewing, managing and leading the work of systems analysts, programmers, and other computer-related workers.      Consulting with users, management, vendors, and technicians to assess computing needs and system requirements and specifying technology to meet those needs.      Directing ICT operations, analyzing workflow, establishing priorities, developing standards and setting deadlines.      Directing the selection and installation of ICT resources and the provision of user training.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Evaluating the organization's technology use and needs and recommending improvements, such as hardware and software upgrades.      Formulating and directing information and communication technology (ICT) strategies, policies and plans.      Overseeing the security of ICT systems, seminars and conferences.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Representing the enterprise or organization at ICT related conventions.

fields.name: Child and Youth Care Worker
fields.description: Assesses protective, developmental and therapeutic needs of a young person, providing information and acting as a mediator.
fields.tasks: Interviewing clients individually, in families, or in groups, to assess their situation and problems and determine the types of services required. Analysing the client's situation and presenting alternative approaches to resolving problems. Compiling case records or reports for courts and other legal proceedings Investigating cases of abuse or neglect and taking action to protect children and other at risk persons. Providing counselling, therapy and mediation services and facilitating group sessions to assist clients to develop skills and insights needed to deal with and resolve their social and personal problems.

fields.name: Child Care Centre Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the activities of a child care centre or service.
fields.tasks: Developing and implementing programs to enhance the physical, social, emotional and intellectual development of young children.      Directing and supervising child carers in providing care and supervision for young children.      Establishing and monitoring budgets and determining allocation of funds for staff, supplies, materials, equipment and maintenance.      Managing physical facilities and making sure all buildings and equipment are maintained to ensure the centre is a safe area for children, staff and visitors.      Monitoring children’s progress and conferring with parents or guardians.      Overseeing and coordinating the provision care for children in before-school, after-school, day, and vacation care centres.      Preparing and maintaining records and accounts for a child care centre.      Recruiting and evaluating staff and coordinating their professional development.

fields.name: Child Care Worker
fields.description: Provides care and supervision for children in programs such as long day care and occasional care in child care centres, hospitals and educational centres.
fields.tasks: Assisting children to wash, dress and feed themselves. Playing games with children, or entertaining them by reading or storytelling. Assisting in the preparation of materials and equipment for children's education and recreational activities. Managing children's behaviour and guiding their social development. Disciplining children and recommending or initiating other measures to control behaviour, such as caring for own clothing and picking up toys and books. Observing and monitoring children's play activities. Keeping records on individual children, including daily observations and information about activities, meals served, and medications administered.

fields.name: Child or Youth Residential Care Assistant
fields.description: Provides care and supervision for children in correctional services institutions.
fields.tasks: Undertaking  tasks relating to the personal care, boarding accommodation, meals, study, recreation and weekend activities of children and adolescents in the residential establishment. Living in or near the boarding establishment and working according to a set schedule. Ensuring good behaviour of the children or adolescents  in residence. Arranging and supervising activities promoting intellectual, physical, social and spiritual development. Ensuring living and hygiene standards are maintained by residents. Ensuring school attendance and supervising homework times. Ensuring attendance at appointments set for individuals with social workers or other professionals as required. Offering basic counselling and arranging for professional intervention as required. Performing minor domestic duties in residence. Accompany children and adolescents on weekend outings.

fields.name: Chimney Cleaner
fields.description: Unblocks and cleans chimneys.
fields.tasks: Removing soot from residential and industrial flues, chimneys and connecting pipes. Servicing all types of anthracite heaters. Covering furniture in the area near the chimney, as well as the entrance of the fireplace, with protective heavy duty plastic sheeting. Operating high powered vacuum cleaners with air filters to reduce the amount of cleaning required after the chimney has been swept. Diagnosing and repairing chimney hazards and conducting chimney maintenance.

fields.name: Chiropractor
fields.description: Diagnoses and treats physiological and mechanical disorders of the human locomotor system, particularly neuro-muscular skeletal disorders and provides advice on preventing these disorders.
fields.tasks: Interviewing and examining patients to obtain information on their health status and the nature and extent of injury, illness or other physical or mental health problem. Administering therapeutic care and treatment to patients, including the manual and physical chiropractic an osteopathic techniques. Monitoring patients' progress through treatment plans, and identifying signs and symptoms requiring referral to a medical doctor or other health professional. Recording information on patients' health status and responses to treatment in medical records-keeping systems. Sharing information with other health care providers when required to ensure continuing and comprehensive care.

fields.name: Cigar Maker
fields.description: Prepares and mixes tobacco leaves and make cigars by hand or simple machines.
fields.tasks: Grading cured tobacco leaves by type, quality and locality where grown. Removing midribs and stalks from tobacco leaves and shredding tobacco. Moistening tobacco for further processing. Mixing tobacco leaves according to formula to obtain a blend of a distinct flavour. Rolling cigars by hand or using simple machines such as bunch makers and rollers. Cleaning and lubricating molds. Pressing cigars into moulds or packing cigars around models to obtain a finished shape. Separating product from moulds or models and examining for accuracy.

fields.name: Cinema or Theatre Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of a theatre or cinema.
fields.tasks: Planning and organising the range and mix of entertainment, attractions and cultural activities to be offered by the theatre or cinema.      Planning and directing daily operations.   Keeping abreast of new trends and developments in the creative arts and arranging theatrical productions and performances by bands and orchestras.   Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.   Advising on the facilities available and promoting publicity in relation to events, shows and activities.      Checking and keeping custody of all cash receipts and making regular stock checks.      Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of staff.      Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.      Ensuring that facilities are kept clean and in good condition.

fields.name: Civil Celebrant
fields.description: Conducts civil marriage ceremonies, funerals, commitment ceremonies, naming and other ceremonies, and maintains appropriate records.
fields.tasks: Planning and performing civil (non-religious) marriage ceremonies, funerals, commitment ceremonies, christenings and other ceremonies, in consultation with individuals, couples and families. Working  with clients  to create a ceremony meeting their requirements. Organising and carrying out the personalised ceremonies. Performing marriages, ensuring legal paperwork is correct and submitted.   Communicating with clients who are dealing with significant life changes or events regarding their requirements for the ceremony.

fields.name: Civil Engineer
fields.description: Plans, designs, organises and oversees the construction and operation of civil engineering projects such as structural, transportation or hydraulic engineering systems.
fields.tasks: Conducting research and developing new or improved theories and methods related to civil engineering. Advising on and designing structures such as bridges, dams, docks, roads, airports, railways, canals, pipelines, waste-disposal and flood-control systems, and industrial and other large buildings. Determining and specifying construction methods, materials and quality standards, and directing construction work. Establishing control systems to ensure efficient functioning of structures as well as safety and environmental protection. Organising and directing maintenance and repair of existing civil engineering structures. Analysing the behaviour of soil and rock when placed under pressure by proposed structures and designing structural foundations. Analysing the stability of structures and testing the behaviour and durability of materials used in their construction.

fields.name: Civil Engineering Technician
fields.description: Conducts tests of construction materials, prepares sketches and tabulations, and assists in estimating costs in support of civil engineering professionals and engineering technologists.
fields.tasks: Performing or assisting with field and laboratory tests of soils and construction materials. Providing technical assistance connected with the construction of buildings and other structures, and with surveys or the preparation of survey reports. Ensuring compliance with design specifications, relevant legislation and regulations, and maintenance of desired standards of materials and work. Applying technical knowledge of building and civil engineering principles and practices in order to identify and solve problems arising. Assisting with the preparation of detailed estimates of quantities and costs of materials and labour required for projects, according to the specifications given. Inspecting buildings and structures during and after construction to ensure that they comply with building, grading, zoning and safety laws and approved plans, specifications and standards, as well as with other rules concerning quality and safety. Advising on the installation of fire detectors and sprinkler systems and the use of materials in the construction of buildings and means of transportation to reduce risk of fire and extent of damage and danger if fire occurs.

fields.name: Civil Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Analyses and modifies new and existing engineering technologies and applies them in the testing and implementation of civil, mechanical, electrical or electronic engineering projects.
fields.tasks: Conducting research and developing new or improved theories and methods related to civil engineering. Advising on and designing structures such as bridges, dams, docks, roads, airports, railways, canals, pipelines, waste-disposal and flood-control systems, and industrial and other large buildings. Determining and specifying construction methods, materials and quality standards, and directing construction work. Establishing control systems to ensure efficient functioning of structures as well as safety and environmental protection. Organising and directing maintenance and repair of existing civil engineering structures. Analysing the behaviour of soil and rock when placed under pressure by proposed structures and designing structural foundations. Analysing the stability of structures and testing the behaviour and durability of materials used in their construction.

fields.name: Civil Technology Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches civil technology (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Classified Advertising Clerk
fields.description: Receives and records advertising copies for publication and broadcasting.
fields.tasks: Identifying new markets, contacting potential clients and proposing advertising packages to serve them. Explaining advertising options and related costs to potential clients, and providing clients with cost estimates. Sending advertising contracts to clients. Contacting existing clients to sell new advertising packages, and to protect and increase existing advertising. Recommending appropriate sizes and formats for advertising. Informing clients of available options for advertisement artwork, and providing samples. Emailing advertising proofs to clients for approval. Processing all correspondence and paperwork related to client accounts.

fields.name: Clay Processing Factory Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in manufacturing clay and ceramic products such as loading clay into machines, stacking products on kiln cars, pallets and trolleys, and moving kiln cars and trolleys to and from kilns, dryers, sorting, storage and shipping areas.
fields.tasks: Gathering materials specified by work orders from storage areas. Transporting materials to scales using hand trucks or industrial trucks. Assisting with weighing materials such as clay, iron oxide, magnesium and water according to the formula for use in making clay and ceramic ware. Loading clay into mixers using hoists, or by shovelling materials into mixers. Placing green ware and glazed ware on the kiln conveyor for firing. Arranging wares on metal or firebrick slabs using kiln furniture such as saggers and setter pins to separate and support them during the firing cycle. Stacking products on kiln cars, pallets and trolleys. Moving kiln cars and trolleys to and from kilns, dryers, sorting, storage and shipping areas. Cleaning plant areas and cleaning equipment.

fields.name: Clay Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines to manufacture clay products such as bricks, tiles, insulators, porcelain and pottery by shaping and firing the clay.
fields.tasks: Operating machines that mix clay with water and knead it into a suitable plastic condition or semi-liquid form for making ceramic products. Setting and operating press machines to mould ceramic articles from moist clay. Tending machines that shape and fire the clay. Observing finished products to identify splits, cracks, breaks, colour irregularities and other imperfections. Operating and monitoring kilns that bake pottery and porcelain ware, and that bake bricks and tiles. Operating and monitoring machines that make glazes or abrasives.

fields.name: Cleaning Services Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of enterprises which provide cleaning services.
fields.tasks: Checking and keeping custody of all cash receipts and making regular stock checks.      Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of staff.      Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.      Ensuring that facilities are kept clean and in good condition.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.

fields.name: Clearing and Forwarding Agent
fields.description: Carries out customs clearing procedures and ensure that insurance, export/import licences and other formalities are in order.
fields.tasks: Carrying out customs clearing procedures for exports or imports. Checking import/export documentation to determine cargo contents, and classifying goods into different fee or tariff groups, using a tariff coding system. Ensuring that export/import licenses and other formalities are in order. Ensuring that insurance is in order. Signing and issuing bills of lading.

fields.name: Clerk of Court
fields.description: Administers court registry services and performs administrative functions in support of judges and magistrates.
fields.tasks: Providing administrative support to the judiciary, prosecution, attorneys and advocates. Organising and maintaining court files; making appropriate entries in files; stamping various documents; submitting files for signature; and ensuring the smooth flow of files through the court system. Being responsible for the filing and disposal of court records. Handling all general public enquiries related to court functions. Assisting the public with: cases of applications for maintenance and payment of maintenance monies; estate matters; small claims matters; payment of witness fees etc. Serving as the link between attorneys, advocates, the general public and the court. Granting of default judgments in civil cases, issuing of warrants of execution against properties in civil cases, etc. once appointed by the court to perform these functions. Performing digital recordings of court proceedings and ensuring the integrity of these. Operating and providing support to court systems including case flow management, video remands, document scanning, data-capturing etc.

fields.name: Clinic Manager (specialised Health Service)
fields.description: Plans, directs, coordinates and evaluates the provision of specialised health services in a clinics.
fields.tasks: Advising government bodies about measures to improve health and welfare services and facilities.      Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation and expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and performance standards for medical, nursing, technical and administrative staff.      Directing or conducting recruitment, hiring and training of personnel.      Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of medical, nursing, technical, clerical, service, maintenance, and other personnel.          Liaising with other health and welfare service providers, boards and funding bodies to coordinate the provision of services.      Monitoring the use of diagnostic services, inpatient beds, facilities, and staff to ensure effective use of resources and assess the need for additional staff, equipment, and services.      Providing overall direction and management for the service, facility, organisation or centre.      Representing the organisation in negotiations, and at conventions, seminars, public hearings and forums.

fields.name: Clinical Nurse Practitioner
fields.description: Provides advanced and extended nursing care to patients such as ordering diagnostic tests, undertaking diagnosis and health assessments, prescribing patient care management, medicines and therapies as authorised in relevant nursing legislation, and referr
fields.tasks: Coordinating the care of patients in consultation with other health professionals and members of health teams.   Developing and implementing care plans for the biological, social, and psychological treatment of patients in collaboration with other health professionals.   Practising in accordance with accepted scientific principles, legal requirements and ethical standards.   Planning and providing personal care, treatment and therapies including administering medications, and monitoring responses to treatment or care plans.   Planning and participating in health education programmes, health promotion and nurse education activities in clinical and community settings.   Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about health promotion, treatment and care, and the prevention of ill-health.   Supervising and teaching learners and students in the relevant clinical practice area.   Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers.

fields.name: Clinical Psychologist
fields.description: Consults with individuals and groups, assesses psychological disorders and administers programs of treatment.
fields.tasks: Analyzing the effect of heredity, social, occupational and other factors on individual thought and behaviour. Conducting counselling or therapeutic interviews with individuals and groups, and providing follow-up services. Developing theories, models and methods to interpret and describe human behaviour. Maintaining required contacts, such as those with family members, educational authorities or employers and recommending possible solutions to, and treatment of, problems. Planning and carrying out tests to measure mental, physical and other characteristics such as intelligence, abilities, aptitudes, potentialities, etc., interpreting and evaluating results, and providing advice. Studying psychological factors in the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of mental illnesses and emotional or personality disorders, and conferring with related professionals.

fields.name: Cloak Room Attendant
fields.description: Stores and keeps safe guests' coats, bags and other belongings during their stay, e.g. in theatres, concert halls, hotels, restaurants or museums.
fields.tasks: Looking after coats, bags and other items for customers at hotels, theatres, museums, nightclubs, airports, or at social events.   Attaching tickets or identification discs to items and issuing customers with a matching ticket or disc. Storing items on hangers or racks, on shelves or in lockers or, occasionally, in safety-deposit boxes. Keeping personal belongings safe and returning them to the owners when they leave. Returning items to customers on receiving the matching ticket or disc. Undertaking other tasks when not needed as a cloakroom attendant.

fields.name: Clothing, Footwear and Leather Patternmaker
fields.description: Produces sets of master patterns following sketches, sample articles and design specifications, and cuts out patterns for garments, footwear and general goods.
fields.tasks: Creating a pattern according to a designer's vision. Cutting patterns out of oak-tag (manila folder) paper. Making a small production run of selling samples. Creating a master pattern for each size within a range of garment sizes, using charts, drafting instruments, computers and/or grading devices. Creating the “blueprint” or pattern pieces for a particular apparel design with the aid of a computer. Drawing details on outlined parts to indicate where parts are to be joined, as well as the positions of pleats, pockets, buttonholes on garments, decorative stitching on shoe parts or eyelets on canvas products, using computers or drafting instruments. Performing pattern-making, marking and cutting tasks in the manufacture of other products such as soft furnishings and canvas goods. Testing patterns by making and fitting sample garments.

fields.name: Clothing, Textile and Leather Goods Production Operator
fields.description: Operates industrial machinery and equipment and performs preparatory tasks to cut, sew, press and finish textile and leather products
fields.tasks: Operating or tending sewing machines to perform garment sewing operations, such as joining, reinforcing, seaming or decorating garments or garment parts. Attaching buttons, hooks, zippers, fasteners, or other accessories to fabric, using feeding hoppers or clamp holders. Tending semiautomatic sewing machines with multiple-sewing heads controlled by pattern chain that embroiders various designs on garments. Operating machines, such as single or double needle serging and flat-bed felling machines, to automatically join, reinforce, or decorate material or articles. Operating fur sewing machines to join fur pelt strips to required size and shape and join pelts into garment sections or shells. Operating stitching machines to sew leather parts together for leather garments, handbags, gloves. Monitoring machine operation to detect problems such as defective stitching, breaks in thread, or machine malfunctions. Performing equipment maintenance tasks such as replacing needles.

fields.name: Clothing, Textile, Footwear and Leather Manufacturing Process Control Technician
fields.description: Provides technical support and services in the development of manufacturing methods, facilities and systems, and in the planning, estimating, measuring and scheduling of clothing, textile, footwear and leather manufacturing processes.
fields.tasks: Integration of electrical, steam, electronic, hydraulic, pneumatic and mechanical systems to engineer new products, understanding the impact and the interrelationship between the various systems and where each best applies in the CTFL sector. Sourcing new materials, chemicals and lubricants and making decisions to the benefit of the application of such materials. Maintaining advanced clothing machinery. Diagnosing and conducting major repairs to machines in dry process textile industry and set and adjust complex parameters to a textile dry process. Conducting major repairs to machines in the wet process in the textiles industry focussing on the application and implementation of practices to minimize downtime, wear and tear and on costs related to this.

fields.name: Club Membership Manager
fields.description: Organises, controls and promotes the activities of the clients membership function of a club or association.
fields.tasks: Advising on the facilities available and promoting publicity in relation to events, shows and activities.      Checking and keeping custody of all cash receipts and making regular stock checks.      Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of staff.      Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.      Ensuring that facilities are kept clean and in good condition.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.        Planning and directing daily operations.      Planning and organising the range and mix of entertainment, attractions, cultural activities, and sports and fitness programmes to be offered by the centre.

fields.name: Coating Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, maintains and operates a coating machine to apply various coatings and other specialised finishes to printed products.
fields.tasks: Setting up machines to product specifications. Examining job orders to determine quantities, stock specifications and special instructions. Operating machines. Conducting regular inspections and maintenance of machines.

fields.name: Coding Clerk
fields.description: Translates narrative descriptions and numeric information into classification or record systems.
fields.tasks: Organising and managing information and data by ensuring its quality, accuracy, accessibility and security in both paper and electronic systems. Using appropriate classification systems, coding and categorisation of information for databases and registries. Converting information into codes and classifying information by codes for data-processing purposes. Sorting documents for classification and filing. Sorting forms and marking them with identification numbers for filing or data capturing.

fields.name: Coffee and Tea Processing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines and performs routine tasks to dry, mill, blend, roast and package coffee, chicory and tea.
fields.tasks: Mixing, pulping, grinding, blending and separating foodstuffs and liquids with churning, pressing, sieving, grinding and filtering equipment.

fields.name: Combat Medical Support Operator
fields.description: Practises, exercises and employs medical support techniques and procedures during military war and peace operations.
fields.tasks: Assessing nature and extent of illness or injury to establish and prioritise medical procedures, given combat situation.      Communicating with dispatchers and treatment centre personnel to provide information about situation, to arrange evacuation and reception of patient, and to receive instructions for further treatment.      Immobilising patient for placement on stretcher and ambulance transport, using backboard or other spinal immobilisation device.      Maintaining vehicles, medical and communication equipment. Replenish first-aid equipment and supplies.      Observing, recording, and reporting to physician the patient's condition or injury, the treatment provided, and reactions to treatment.      Performing emergency diagnostic and treatment procedures.

fields.name: Commercial Cleaner
fields.description: Cleans offices, residential complexes, industrial work areas, industrial machines, construction sites and other commercial premises using heavy duty cleaning equipment.
fields.tasks: Sweeping, vacuum-cleaning, washing and polishing floors, furniture and other fixtures in buildings, trains and aircraft using appropriate industrial cleaning equipment. Cleaning rooms, hallways, lobbies, lounges, restrooms, corridors, elevators, stairways, locker rooms and other work areas so that health standards are met. Empting waste bins, containers and other waste receptacles and transporting refuse and waste to waste disposal areas. Cleaning and disinfecting laundry and bathroom fixtures, replenishing supplies and reporting defective plumbing. Cleaning windows, glass partitions and mirrors. Stripping wax from floors, re-waxing and polishing floors. Removing dust and dirt from ceilings, walls, overhead pipes and fixtures. Applying acids and solvents to surfaces to remove stains and dirt. Removing lint, dust, soot, oil, grease, sludge and other residues from machines, hulls and holds of ships, and interiors and exteriors of furnaces, boilers and tanks. Cleaning exteriors of buildings by sand-blasting and applying solvents.

fields.name: Commercial Digital Printer
fields.description: Sets up, operates and maintains a variety of commercial digital printing equipment to print specified printing jobs on a variety of substrates, such as paper, vinyl and plastic.
fields.tasks: Loading paper into printer feeding mechanisms. Maintaining, adjusting, repairing and cleaning machines. Mixing ink and solvents to standard, and regulating paper and ink supply during print runs. Monitoring machine operations and the quality of printing. Monitoring, evaluating and determining presses to check print quality standards against proofs and detect malfunctions. Producing digital print images, and transferring and outputting these images. Setting, adjusting and monitoring substrate-feed mechanisms, delivery mechanisms, inking systems and other printing machine functions

fields.name: Commercial Housekeeper
fields.description: Cleans, vacuums and mops floors, makes beds, and re-stocks mini bars and bathroom supplies in hotel rooms and other commercial premises.
fields.tasks: Preparing rooms for guest occupancy by making beds and replenishing supplies such as drinking glasses, writing supplies and bathroom items. Cleaning rooms, hallways, lobbies, lounges, restrooms, corridors, elevators, stairways, locker rooms and other relevant areas so that health standards are met. Carrying linens, towels, toilet items and cleaning supplies between rooms on wheeled carts. Keeping storage areas and carts well-stocked, clean and tidy. Sorting, counting and marking clean linen and storing it in linen closets. Disinfecting equipment and supplies with germicides or steam-operated sterilizers. Preparing rooms for conferences, arranging decorations, media equipment and furniture for social or business functions. Delivering television sets, ironing boards, baby cribs and rollaway beds to guests' rooms. Requesting repair and maintenance services and showing workers to the relevant rooms. Observing the precautions required to protect the institution and guest property and reporting damage, theft, and found articles to supervisors.

fields.name: Commercial Mailing Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, maintains and operates a mailing machine to insert/onsert products into envelopes and/or bags for mailing purposes.
fields.tasks: Sorting and routing incoming mail. Collecting outgoing mail. Sealing or opening envelops either by hand or using machines. Weighing packages and calculating postage. Lifting heavy packages and wrapping packages or bundles. Keeping mail machinery in working order and clearing jams in sorting equipment. Keeping detailed and accurate records.

fields.name: Commercial Sales Representative
fields.description: Represent companies to sell various goods and services to businesses and other organizations and provide product specific information as required.
fields.tasks: Providing prospective customers with information about the characteristics and functions of the products and equipment for sale and demonstrating its uses or qualities. Quoting prices and credit terms, recording orders and arranging deliveries. Soliciting orders and selling goods to retail, industrial, wholesale and other establishments. Following up on clients to ensure satisfaction with products purchased. Reporting customers’ reactions and requirements to suppliers and manufacturers. Obtaining and updating knowledge of market conditions and competitors’ goods and services.

fields.name: Commercial Services Sales Agent
fields.description: Sells commercial services, such as accounting, design, maintenance, printing, and supply of temporary personnel.
fields.tasks: Providing prospective customers with information about the characteristics and functions of the services, products and equipment for sale and demonstrating its uses or qualities.   Quoting prices and credit terms, recording orders and arranging deliveries.   Soliciting orders and selling goods to retail, industrial, wholesale and other establishments.   Following up on clients to ensure satisfaction with products purchased.   Reporting customers’ reactions and requirements to suppliers and manufacturers.   Obtaining and updating knowledge of market conditions and competitors’ goods and services.

fields.name: Commissioned Fire and Rescue Officer
fields.description: Provides high level management to support the running of a geographical or operational section of a fire and rescue service.
fields.tasks: Planning, directing and coordinating the provision of fire and rescue services.   Controlling the administrative operations of a fire and rescue department, such as budgeting, report preparation and expenditure.   Coordinating cooperation with other service provision agencies in the same or related fields.      Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and standards for staff.      Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of professional, technical, clerical, service, maintenance, and other personnel. Ensuring the efficient use of resources through monitoring and evaluating the resources devoted to the provision of services.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.

fields.name: Commissioned Police Officer
fields.description: Provides high level management to support the running of a geographical or operational section of the south African police services.
fields.tasks: Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation, expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Coordinating cooperation with other service provision agencies in the same or related fields.      Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and standards for staff.      Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of professional technical, clerical, service, maintenance, and other personnel.      Managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Monitoring and evaluating resources devoted to the provision of services.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Planning, directing and coordinating the provision of services.      Providing overall direction and management for a service, facility, organization or centre.

fields.name: Commodities Trader
fields.description: Operates as an independent agent to bring together buyers and sellers of commodities, negotiates private sales and arranges sales through established market places.
fields.tasks: Establishing contact between buyers and sellers of commodities. Discussing buying or selling requirements of clients and giving advice accordingly. Monitoring and analysing market trends and other factors affecting the supply and demand for commodities and shipping services. Identifying opportunities or developing channels for purchase or sale of commodities. Negotiating purchase or sale of commodities and commodity futures. Buying and selling cargo space on ships. Finding cargo and/or storage space for commodities and negotiating freight, shipping and storage charges.

fields.name: Communication Coordinator
fields.description: Implements and evaluates information and communication strategies which create an understanding and a favourable view of an organisation, its goods and services, and its role in the community.
fields.tasks: Connecting a company or client to the outside world to improve their public image by spreading news about them. Developing and implementing a company or client’s communication strategies to enhance productivity and build positive workplace relationships within the company. Contributing to the development of publications and websites, facilitating marketing campaigns, scheduling meetings, creating timelines, and help planning events such as product launches. Maintaining a company’s communication records (media archives) and participating in the designing or redesigning of company logos and signage. Coordinating all communication within the company as well as to the outside world e.g. print, electronic media and maintaining ongoing relationships with the media, graphic designers, mail houses, printers, photographers etcetera. Writing speeches for top managers and arranging interviews with the media/stakeholders. Coordinating in-house communication courses for employees.

fields.name: Communications Operator
fields.description: Transmits and receives radio messages by use of morse code, voice and radio teletype.
