Working alongside other Dental Specialists, such as Orthodontists and Periodontist and specialists in other fields such as Oncologists and Ear, Nose and Throat Surgeons. Alternate Occupation Names Community Dentistry Specialist Dental / Oral Surgeon Endodontist Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeon Oral Pathologist Orthodontist Paedodontist Periodontist Prosthodontist Stomatologist

fields.name: Dental Technician
fields.description: Constructs and repairs dentures and other dental appliances.
fields.tasks: Examining, interviewing, and measuring patients in order to determine their appliance needs, and to identify factors that could affect appliance fit. Conferring with medical and dental practitioners in order to formulate specifications and prescriptions for devices and appliances. Interpreting prescriptions or specifications to determine the type of product or device to be fabricated, and the materials and tools that will be required. Making or receiving casts or impressions of patients' torsos, limbs, mouths or teeth for use as fabrication patterns. Designing and making orthotic and prosthetic devices using materials such as thermoplastic and thermosetting materials, metal alloys and leather, and hand and power tools. Fitting appliances and devices onto patients, testing and evaluating them, and making adjustments for proper fit function, and comfort. Repairing, modifying, and maintaining medical and dental prosthetic and supportive devices, according to specifications. Bending, forming, and shaping fabric or material so that it conforms to prescribed contours needed to fabricate structural components. Fabricating full and partial dentures and constructing mouth guards, crowns, metal clasps, inlays, bridgework and other aids.

fields.name: Dental Therapist
fields.description: Examines and treats diseases of the teeth in pre-school, primary and secondary school children under the general supervision of a dentist.
fields.tasks: Recording the dental history of patients, and identifying medical risk cases that may complicate oral health treatment.   Performing examinations of patients and diagnosing their oral and dental status.   Providing dental care aimed at preventing oral disease and applying therapeutic measures to promote oral health.   Applying non-surgical procedures to remove teeth and roots under local anaesthetics and inserting sutures.   Scaling and polishing teeth and performing permitted aesthetic procedures.   Performing conservative procedures such as treating post-extraction complications and treating minor traumatic injuries to teeth and surrounding tissues.   Making impressions needed to make mouth guards and adjusting oral applications.

fields.name: Dentist
fields.description: Diagnoses and treats dental disease, injuries, decay and malformations of the teeth, periodontal tissue (gums), hard and soft tissue found on the mouth and other dento-facial structures using surgery and other techniques.
fields.tasks: Providing preventative oral health care such as periodontal treatments, fluoride applications and oral health promotion. Providing surgical treatments such as extraction of teeth and biopsy of tissue. Measuring and taking impressions of patients' jaws and teeth in order to determine the shape and size of dentures. Administering anaesthetics to limit the amount of pain experienced by patients during procedures. Taking x-rays and scans of teeth, gums and jaws to establish any problems that are not visible to the naked eye.

fields.name: Dermatologist
fields.description: Provides diagnostic, treatment and preventative medical services related to disorders of the human skin.
fields.tasks: Examining, diagnosing and treating conditions and diseases of the human skin, hair and nails.   Performing close-up examinations of the skin to detect abnormalities or malignancies while also noting accompanying health symptoms.   Examining skin scrapings, tissue samples and blood samples under a microscope or by means of chemical and other tests.   Advising patients on achieving and maintaining health skin.   Prescribing treatment and medication for a range of conditions such as acne, eczema, psoriasis, dermatitis and fungal infections.   Referring patients diagnosed with skin cancer for surgery, radiotherapy and other required treatment.

fields.name: Design Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches design (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Detective
fields.description: Investigates serious crimes such as terrorism, homicide, armed robbery, vice and arson, and gathers evidence to arrest and prosecute criminals.
fields.tasks: Analysing evidence in order to solve crimes, identify criminal activity and gather information for court cases. Establishing contacts and sources of information about crimes planned or committed, in order to prevent crimes or identify suspected offenders. Establishing contacts and sources of information in confidentiality in order to establish circumstances and assess behaviour, usually with the aim of preventing a crime or making an arrest. Obtaining and verifying evidence by examining crime and accident scenes for clues and physical evidence, interviewing witnesses and suspects and analysing documents and computer files. Testifying in courts of law or reporting to superiors about circumstances and results of investigations.

fields.name: Developer Programmer
fields.description: Interprets specifications, technical designs and flow charts, builds, maintains and modifies the code for software applications, constructs technical specifications from a business functional model, and tests and writes technical documentation.
fields.tasks: Assessing, developing, upgrading and documenting maintenance procedures for operating systems, communications environments and applications software.      Consulting with customers concerning maintenance of software system.      Consulting with engineering staff to evaluate interface between hardware and software.      Developing and directing software testing and validation procedures.      Directing software programming and development of documentation.      Modifying existing software to correct errors, to adapt it to new hardware or to upgrade interfaces and improve performance.      Researching, analysing and evaluating requirements for software applications and operating systems.

fields.name: Dialysis Technician
fields.description: Sets up and operates haemodialysis machine to provide dialysis treatment.
fields.tasks: Explaining procedures, observing and positioning patients, and using protection devices to ensure safety and comfort during examination or treatment.  Positioning treatment equipment and adjusting settings and controls according to technical specifications.  Monitoring patients' conditions and reactions, reporting abnormal signs to a medical practitioner.  Following prescription issued by a medical practitioner.  Operating or overseeing operation equipment.  Reviewing and evaluating information and recording results of procedures.

fields.name: Diamond and Gemstone Setter
fields.description: Sets gemstones and diamonds to produce jewellery and objects of art.
fields.tasks: Appraising the quality and value of jewellery. Cutting and dividing stones to approximate final shape, using precision hand and power tools and jigs. Securing stones and shapes, cutting angles, smoothing and polishing. Finishing articles using files, emery paper and buffing machines. Restyling old jewellery.

fields.name: Diamond Polisher
fields.description: Operates machines to cut and polish diamonds. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Setting up and operating stationary plant and machinery which grind, crush, cut, saw and slice rocks, minerals and stones according to the specifications for the job. Positioning blocks and slabs of stone onto machines for sawing, cutting and further working. Monitoring and maintaining the flow of unprocessed rocks, minerals and stones from conveyors into machines. Examining processed materials visually or with hands to ensure compliance with established standards and job specifications, and may collect samples for testing in laboratories. Recording information about processing completed during shifts, such as quantities, types and dimensions of materials produced. Sorting, stacking and moving processed minerals and stone for packaging, further processing or shipping.

fields.name: Die Sinker
fields.description: Lays out, machines, and finishes impression cavities in die blocks to produce forging dies according to blueprints. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Designing, modelling and striking of medals and coins. Sketching of plan to portray that which is envisaged. Moulding the model into a plaster negative and an acrylic positive. Supervision of the reducing process, where the acrylic positive is used to cut steel that will be the actual size of the final product. Printing of another negative from the positive die to which the necessary wording is added with letter and number punches. Engraving (either by hand or machine) of monograms, different letterforms, and decorative work on precious metals. Engraving is done on moulds, plastic and metal advertising signs, metal attachments, clasps, buckles, buttons, badges, medallions and memorial coins. Embossing rollers for tinfoil or plastic date stamps and plaques.

fields.name: Diesel Fitter
fields.description: Maintains, test and repairs diesel motors used for generating power in ships, locomotives, stationary plant and equipment. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Detecting faults and repairing and maintaining engines with a wide variety of applications. Measuring of parts in order to ascertain the extent of the damage and the wear and tear of parts Caring of the fuel injection system. Replacing mechanical parts or making minor adjustments. Making use of a number of hand and machine tools such as spanners; torque wrenches and specialised testing equipment. Thorough testing of the engine before returning it to owner. Attending to a wide range of machinery such as generator engines, drill rigs, pumps and marine installations.

fields.name: Diesel Mechanic
fields.description: Maintains, test and repairs commercial vehicles (more than 3 tons GMV) including engines, mechanical parts, transmissions, suspension, steering and brakes.
fields.tasks: Diagnosing and repairing the mechanical and electrical faults of diesel vehicles and machinery. Diagnosing engine trouble, dismantling the engine when necessary, and replacing or repairing defective parts. Reassembling the engine and repairing mechanical and electrical faults in construction machinery. Locating problems by using diagnostic equipment. On becoming an experienced diesel mechanic, a problem can be located by listening to the noise in an engine. Replacing mechanical parts or making minor adjustments. Completing job cards, furnishing information on the parts that should be ordered and assisting in training learners.

fields.name: Dietician
fields.description: Applies the science of human nutrition to help people understand the relationship between food and health, and makes appropriate dietary choices to attain and maintain health and prevent and treat illness and disease.
fields.tasks: Planning diets and menus, supervising the preparation and serving of meals, and monitoring food intake and quality to provide nutritional care in settings offering food services. Compiling and assessing data relating to health and nutritional status of individuals, groups and communities based on nutritional values of food served or consumed. Planning and conducting nutrition assessments, intervention programmes, and education and training to improve nutritional levels among individuals and communities. Developing and evaluating food and nutrition products to meet nutritional requirements. Conducting research on nutrition and disseminating the findings at scientific conferences and in other settings.

fields.name: Diplomat
fields.description: Promote bilateral and multilateral relations of South Africa and performs managerial and administers functions in missions.
fields.tasks: Protecting and promoting South African (SA) national interests and values through bilateral and multilateral interactions. Conducting and co-ordinating SA’s international relations and promote its foreign policy objectives. Monitoring international developments and advise government on foreign policy and related domestic matters. Protecting SA’s sovereignty and territorial integrity. Contributing to the formulation of international law and enhance respect for the provisions thereof. Promoting multilateralism to secure a rules based international system. Providing consular services to SA nationals abroad.

fields.name: Director (Enterprise / Organisation)
fields.description: Determines, formulates and reviews the general policy program and the overall direction of an organisation, within the framework established by a board of directors or a similar governing body.
fields.tasks: Authorising material, human and financial resources to implement organizational policies and programs.      Consulting with senior subordinate staff and reviewing recommendations and reports.      Determining objectives, strategies, policies and programs for the enterprise or organization.      Ensuring the organization complies with relevant legislation and regulations.      Monitoring and evaluating performance of the organization or enterprise against established objectives and policies.      Planning, directing and coordinating the general functioning of an enterprise or organization.      Providing overall direction and management to organizations.      Reviewing the operations and results of the enterprise, or organization and reporting to boards of directors and governing bodies.      Selecting, or approving the selection of senior staff.

fields.name: Director (Film, Television, Radio or Stage)
fields.description: Interprets and approves selection of scripts, and directs and instructs cast and crew during filming, recording or performance of productions. This occupation requires high levels of creative talent or personal commitment and interest as well as, or in pl
fields.tasks: Choosing writers, studying scripts to determine artistic interpretation, and instructing actors on acting methods.      Creating, planning, videotaping and editing video.     Engaging and supervising all technical personnel and determining the treatment, scope and scheduling of production.      Maintaining production archives and negotiating royalties.      Planning, organising and controlling the various stages and scheduling involved in the production of presentations, motion pictures, and television shows.      Supervising the positioning of scenery, props and lighting and sound equipment.

fields.name: Director of Marketing
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls, analyses and coordinates the marketing strategy activities and the organisational integration thereof.
fields.tasks: Determining price lists, discount and delivery terms, sales promotion budgets, sales methods, special incentives and campaigns.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures related to sales and marketing activities.      Establishing and managing budgets and controlling expenditure to ensure the efficient use of resources.      Leading and managing the activities of sales and marketing staff.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Planning and directing daily operations.      Planning and organizing special sales and marketing programmes based on sales records and market assessments.      Representing the enterprise or organization at sales and marketing conventions, trade exhibitions and other forums.

fields.name: Director of Photography
fields.description: Plans, directs and coordinates filming to control the quality and style of photography in films or videos.
fields.tasks: Creating, planning and writing scripts for film and video recordings.      Planning, organising and controlling the various stages and schedules involved in the production of motion pictures and television programs.   Directing the visual aspects of dramatic productions for television or film, including the choice of actors, costumes, set designs, and lighting effects.      Supervising the positioning of scenery, props and lighting and sound equipment.   Engaging and supervising all technical personnel, and determining the treatment, scope and scheduling of production.      Editing film and video programs.   Maintaining production archives.

fields.name: Disabilities Services Officer
fields.description: Works in a range of adult service units which provide education and community access to people with intellectual, physical, social and emotional disabilities.
fields.tasks: Collecting information relevant to clients’ needs and assessing their relevant skills, strengths and deficits Helping persons with disabilities or the elderly to obtain services and to improve their ability to function in society. Assisting clients to identify options and develop plans of action while providing necessary support and assistance. Assisting clients to identify and access community resources including legal, medical and financial assistance housing, employment, transportation, assistance with moves, day care and other referral services. Participating in the selection and admission of clients to appropriate programs. Assisting in evaluating the effectiveness of interventions and programs by monitoring and reporting on clients' progress. Maintaining contact with other social service agencies, schools and health care providers involved with clients to provide information and obtain feedback on clients' overall situation and progress.

fields.name: Dispatching and Receiving Clerk / Officer
fields.description: Verifies and maintains records of incoming and outgoing goods in a warehouse or distribution centre and prepares goods for dispatch.
fields.tasks: Identifying items and containers of incoming and outgoing shipments and verifying them against consignment records. Ensuring outgoing shipments are in good condition and meet specifications. Organising the external dispatch and internal distribution of goods with completed documentation. Maintaining prescribed records of goods received and dispatched. Providing information to customers on rates and charges. Calculating storage charges and billing customers accordingly.

fields.name: Distant Education Teacher / Correspondence School Teacher
fields.description: Teaches academic and living skills to students and promotes students intellectual development through distance education methods.
fields.tasks: Designing or modifying curricula and preparing and delivering programmes, lessons and activities adapted to students’ abilities and needs. Employing special educational strategies and techniques during instruction to improve the development of skills, language, cognition, and memory. Teaching academic subjects, and practical and self-help skills to students. Conferring with other staff members to plan and schedule lessons for students. Preparing and maintaining student data and other records and submitting reports. Administering various forms of assessment and evaluating progress of each student. Conferring with students, parents, head teacher and other relevant professionals involved in the students’ care to develop individual educational plans designed to promote students' development.

fields.name: Distillery Process Machine Operator
fields.description: Distils beverages containing alcohol from fruit, vegetables and grain.
fields.tasks: Mixing, pulping, grinding, blending and separating foodstuffs and liquids with churning, pressing, sieving, grinding and filtering equipment. Operating machinery to crush, mix, malt, cook and ferment grains and fruits to produce beer, wines, malt liquors, vinegar, yeast and related products.

fields.name: District Education Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates educational approaches and policy, and curriculum resources and development for teachers and administrators.
fields.tasks: Controlling the administrative operations of a school district including budgeting, report preparation, and expenditure. Determining educational programs based on frameworks established by education authorities and governing bodies. Directing administrative and clerical activities concerning student admissions and educational services in the district. Implementing systems and procedures to monitor school performance and student enrolments. Promoting the educational program, and representing the service or institution in the wider community. Providing leadership and guidance to teaching, academic and administrative staff in the district.

fields.name: Diver
fields.description: Swims underwater to undertake tasks such as seafood gathering, research, salvage and construction.
fields.tasks: Checking and maintaining diving equipment such as helmets, masks, air tanks, diving suits, harnesses and gauges. Obtaining information about diving tasks and environmental conditions. Taking safety precautions, such as monitoring dive lengths and depths, and registering with authorities before diving expeditions begin. Descending into water with the aid of diver helpers, using scuba gear or diving suits. Communicating with workers on the surface while underwater, using signal lines or telephones. Working under water to lay and repair bridges, piers and harbour-wall foundations. Drilling holes for underwater blasting. Removing underwater obstructions. Inspecting for suspected damage and making minor repairs to ships' hulls and underwater installations. Reporting on condition of wrecked ships. Performing various underwater tasks connected with salvage work or recovering dead bodies.

fields.name: Diversional Therapist
fields.description: Plans, designs, coordinates and implements recreation and leisure-based activity programs to support, challenge and enhance the psychological, spiritual, social, emotional and physical wellbeing of individuals.
fields.tasks: Assessing functional limitations of clients resulting from illness, disability or other impairment, and providing therapy.      Developing and implementing treatment plans for injuries, illnesses and other physical and mental impairments.      Evaluating and documenting patients' progress throughout treatment. Referring patients to medical doctors or other health care providers for specialised care services as needed.      Interviewing patients and conducting diagnostic tests to determine their health status and the nature of their health problems.      Planning and implementing therapeutic programs for improving physical, cognitive, emotional and social functioning.

fields.name: Dockmaster
fields.description: Ensures the smooth functioning of boats docking and departing a marina. Also provides special services or accommodations for those using the marina. The dockmaster is also responsible for inspecting the marina and making sure that necessary repairs get do
fields.tasks: Checking and keeping custody of all cash receipts and making regular stock checks.      Controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of staff.      Ensuring compliance with health and safety requirements.      Ensuring that facilities are kept clean and in good condition.      Establishing and managing budgets.      Keeping abreast of new trends and developments relevant to the service provided.      Planning and directing daily operations.      Planning and organizing the range and mix of services or activities provided.

fields.name: Dog Walker
fields.description: Walks dogs for their owners.
fields.tasks: Walking dogs for owners as per an agreed schedule and time period. Doing basic training and socialising of dogs while on walks. Taking dogs to areas where they are allowed to be off their leashes. Keeping records about dogs’ general behaviour. Giving feedback to owners regarding points of concern related to health or well-being of dogs. Collecting and delivering dog food, tick and flea drops and all other necessities from veterinary shops. Collecting and transporting dogs to the dog parlour for grooming. Collecting and transporting dogs for their visits to Veterinarians.

fields.name: Domestic Cleaner
fields.description: Cleans and tidies private dwellings such as houses, units, flats, apartments and townhouses.
fields.tasks: Tidying and cleaning domestic dwellings including houses, townhouses or apartments inside and outside. Washing laundry, ironing and folding dried items, and returning them to closets. Cleaning kitchens, and washing dishes, cooking utensils and silverware. Cleaning rugs, carpets, furniture and curtains, by dusting, sweeping, vacuum cleaning, washing and polishing. Cleaning and washing windows, walls, ceilings and outdoor paving as necessary. Polishing silver and brass accessories and metalwork, such as fixtures and fittings. Answering telephones and doorbells, and taking messages if required. Caring for children or elderly persons by overseeing their activities, providing companionship, and assisting them with dressing, bathing, eating and other needs. Cooking and serving meals and refreshments following employer's instructions or own methods.

fields.name: Domestic Housekeeper
fields.description: Cleans, cooks and performs other housekeeping tasks in private residences.
fields.tasks: Tiding and cleaning bathrooms, bedrooms and living areas as required, including sweeping floors and carpets, polishing floors and furniture, and cleaning rugs, carpets, upholstered furniture and curtains. Preparing meals, and cleaning and tidying kitchen and dining room after use. Collecting laundry, washing and ironing it, and returning the items to the appropriate places. Answering the door and telephone as required and taking messages. Feeding household pets and, where appropriate, exercising them. Ordering groceries or carrying out grocery shopping personally, and keeping records of expenditure. Caring and supervising children or supervising the nanny employed to look after children. Supervising and coordinating the work activities of domestic employees in a household that employs a number of staff. Training new domestic employees in work methods and routines as expected by the homeowner. Dealing with tradesmen and contractors as required.

fields.name: Door-to-door Salesperson
fields.description: Sells goods and services from door-to-door.
fields.tasks: Selling merchandise or services by going from door to door without making appointments. Displaying sample products and explaining the desirable qualities of these products. Traveling from one area to another, or within specified territory.  Obtaining leads and referrals for possible sales and following up in person, by telephone or by mail in order to closing a sale. Leaving samples, or distributing advertising literature explaining services or products. Writing and submitting orders to the supplier company. Liaising with suppliers regarding arrangements for collection and delivery of items ordered. Completing full, detailed step-by-step reports on all daily work activities. Reaching daily and months goals and targets successfully.

fields.name: Dragline Operator
fields.description: Operates draglines for the removal of topsoil and overburden.
fields.tasks: Operating power-driven crane equipped with dragline bucket suspended from boom by cable to excavate or move sand, gravel, clay, mud, coal or other materials.   Moving hand levers and depressing pedals to rotate crane on chassis and position boom above excavation point to raise and lower boom, to lower bucket to material, to drag bucket toward crane, to excavate or move material, to place bucket over unloading point and to tilt bucket to release material.   Directing workers engaged in placing blocks and outriggers to prevent capsizing of machine when lifting heavy loads.   Becoming familiar with digging plans, machine capabilities and limitations and with efficient and safe digging procedures in a given application.   Observing hand signals, grade stakes or other markings when operating machines so that work can be performed to specifications.   Acquiring and using knowledge of earthmoving fundamentals such as soil characteristics, ground conditions and map reading as well as relevant Mine Health and Safety Act and Regulations if applicable.

fields.name: Drainage, Sewerage and Storm Water Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in maintaining drainage, sewerage and storm water systems.
fields.tasks: Maintaining storm water drainage and sewerage systems by installing and maintaining piping systems, fixtures and water regulators. Checking for cracks and leaks in drainage and sewerage systems, and cleaning and carrying out minor repairs as necessary. Maintaining drainage systems including flow lines, curbs and gutters, drop inlets and culverts. Clearing and removing litter and weeds from roadside drainage areas. Digging holes and shovelling excavated material onto conveyors, wheelbarrows and trucks for removal. Spreading and levelling soil, gravel and sand on roads and driveways, trench bottoms and similar locations.

fields.name: Drama Teacher (Private Tuition)
fields.description: Teaches students in the practice, theory and performance of drama, in private training establishments.
fields.tasks: Assessing the students’ level of ability and determining needs and learning goals. Planning, preparing and delivering programs of study, lessons and workshops for individual students and groups. Preparing and presenting material on the theory and interpretation of music. Instructing and demonstrating practical aspects of singing or of playing a particular instrument. Teaching students to read and write musical notation. Assigning exercises and teaching pieces of music relevant to students’ level of ability, interests and talents. Assessing students and offering advice, criticism and encouragement. Revising curricula, course content, course materials and methods of instruction. Preparing students for examinations, performances and assessments. Arranging visits and tours to musical performances. Organising and assisting in auditions or performances of students' work.

fields.name: Dramatic Arts Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches dramatic arts (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Draughtsperson
fields.description: Prepares technical drawings, maps and illustrations from sketches, measurements and other data, and copy final drawings and paintings onto printing plates in support of architects, engineers and engineering technologists. Note: the terms drafting technici
fields.tasks: Preparing technical drawings from rough sketches, measurements or other data using computer-aided drafting (CAD) systems as well as traditional equipment such as drawing boards ,compasses, dividers, protractors, triangles and other drafting devices. Drawing plans for buildings (architectural draughters). Preparing plans for bridges, roads, irrigation and construction schemes (civil engineering draughters). Drawing plans for machines and engine parts, and  preparing and revising illustrations for reference works, brochures and technical manuals dealing with the assembly, installation, operation, maintenance and repair of machinery and other equipment and goods (mechanical engineering draughters). Planning and drawing electrical circuits and wiring systems in buildings (electrical engineering draughters). Preparing plans for towers and steel frames (structural engineering draughters). Drawing different types of maps such as cadastral, topographical and meteorological (cartographical drafters). Copying final drawings and paintings onto printing plates and arranging for completed drawings to be reproduced for use as working drawings.

fields.name: Dredge Operator
fields.description: Operates a power-driven dredge to excavate and maintain navigable channels in waterways and to mine sand and gravel at bottom of lakes, rivers and streams.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring cranes equipped with dredging attachments to dredge waterways and other areas.   Moving levers to position dredges for excavation, to engage hydraulic pumps, to raise and lower suction booms and to control rotation of cutter heads.   Starting and stopping engines to operate equipment.   Starting power winches that draw in or let out cables to change positions of dredges or pulling in and letting out cables manually.   Pumping water to clear machinery pipelines.   Lowering anchor poles to verify depths of excavations using winches or scan depth gauges to determine depths of excavations.   Directing or assisting workers placing shore anchors and cables, laying additional pipes from dredges to shore and pumping water from pontoons.

fields.name: Dressmaking Teacher (Private Tuition)
fields.description: Teaches students in the practice, theory and performance of dressmaking, in private training establishments.
fields.tasks: Assessing students’ level of ability and determining learning needs. Planning, preparing and delivering programs of study, lessons and workshops for individual students and groups. Preparing and presenting material on the theory of the subject area being studied. Instructing and demonstrating practical aspects of the subject area being studied. Assigning exercises and work relevant to students’ level of ability, interests and aptitude. Assessing students and offering advice, criticism and encouragement. Revising curricula, course content, course materials and methods of instruction. Preparing students for examinations and assessments. Counselling students regarding educational issues such as course and program selection, class scheduling, school adjustment, truancy, study habits, and career planning. Counselling students to help them understand and overcome personal, social, or behavioural problems affecting their education. Preparing students for later educational experiences by encouraging them to explore learning opportunities and to persevere with challenging tasks.

fields.name: Driller
fields.description: Positions, assembles and operates drilling machinery and related equipment to sink wells, extract ore, liquids and gases or for a variety of other purposes.
fields.tasks: Assembling and dismantling pipes, casings and drill heads, and replacing dysfunctional equipmen. Dismantling, moving and assembling drilling rigs and auxiliary equipment. Operating controls to lower and raise drill pipes and casings in and out of wells, regulate pressure in the well and control the speed of tools.

fields.name: Driller's Assistant
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in setting up, operating and dismantling a drilling site for extracting oil, gas, mineral ore and water.
fields.tasks: Assisting in the moving of drilling rigs and equipment from site to site. Setting up in the new site and connecting power cables or hoses for water and air supply. Assisting drillers with all drilling processes. Operating equipment such as pumps for air, water and mud. Mixing and testing drilling fluids, chemicals and grout. Assisting in obtaining high-quality drilling core samples. Assisting with slotting, welding and inserting casing screens. Assisting with well development and pumping tests. Cleaning and maintaining equipment, and carrying out routine maintenance and repairs.

fields.name: Driving Instructor
fields.description: Instructs individuals and groups in the theory and application of driving.
fields.tasks: Instructing and teaching learner drivers to drive private and commercial motor vehicles using the K53 method.   Teaching learners how to steer, change gears (if the vehicle has a manual transmission), reverse and park the vehicle. Teaching learners to understand the mechanical components and functions of the vehicle. Instructing learners on how to interpret and understand traffic conditions. Advising on and teaching advanced driving techniques for emergency situations. Teaching learners to drive buses and rigid or articulated vehicles if licenced to do so. Observing learners' driving habits and reactions under various driving conditions to ensure conformance with the K53 test procedure.

fields.name: Drycleaner
fields.description: Cleans clothing, garments, upholstery and other fabrics using dry-cleaning agents and machines.
fields.tasks: Interacting with customers regarding the cleaning and repair of fabrics and garments that cannot be washed in water. Sorting and tagging items for cleaning. Replacing buttons and making minor repairs when required. Inspecting stains and spots to determine their source and what chemical solvent should be used to remove the stain. Loading and unloading dry-cleaning machines. Packaging clean articles and preparing orders for dispatch. Placing articles on shelves and hanging articles for delivery and collection.

fields.name: Dump Truck Operator (Off-road)
fields.description: Operates dump trucks on surface or underground to haul ore and rock.
fields.tasks: Performing safety checks before operating the dump truck and ensuring all equipment function properly.   Driving truck equipped with dump body to transport and dump loose materials such as ore, sand, gravel, crushed rock or coal.   Manoeuvring truck into loading or unloading position, following signals from loading crew and checking that vehicle and loading equipment are properly positioned.   Loading truck by hand or by operating a mechanical loader.   Pulling levers or turning crank to tilt body and dump contents and moving hand and foot controls to jerk truck forward and backward to loosen and dump material adhering to body.   Conducting routine maintenance on dump truck such as lubricating, fuelling and cleaning.

fields.name: Early Childhood Development Practitioner
fields.description: Plans, organises and conducts activities to help pre-primary school students to develop a wide variety of skills including speech, reading, writing, motor skills and social interaction.
fields.tasks: Planning and organizing individual and group activities designed to facilitate the development of children's motor skills, cooperative and social skills, confidence and understanding. Promoting language development through story-telling, role-play, songs, rhymes and informal conversations and discussions. Leading children in activities that, provide opportunities for creative expression through the media of art, dramatic play, music and physical fitness. Observing children in order to evaluate progress and to detect signs of developmental, emotional or health related problems with parents. Observing and assessing nutritional health, welfare and safety needs of students and identifying factors which may impede students' progress. Supervising children's activities to ensure safety and resolve conflicts. Guiding and assisting children in the development of proper eating, dressing and toilet habits. Discussing progress or problems of children with parents and other staff members and identifying appropriate actions and referrals to other services. Establishing and maintaining collaborative relationships with other service providers working with young children.

fields.name: Earth and Soil Scientist
fields.description: Analyses the composition, structure and other physical attributes of soil.
fields.tasks: Conducting research, performing tests, collecting samples, performing field and laboratory analysis to identify sources of environmental problems and recommending ways to prevent, control and remediate the impact of environmental problems. Assessing the likely impact that potential or proposed activities, projects and developments may have on the environment, and recommending whether such developments should proceed. Developing and coordinating the implementation of environmental management systems to enable organizations to identify, monitor and control the impact of their activities, products and services on the environment. Conducting audits to evaluate environmental impact of existing activities, processes, wastes, noises and substances. Assessing an organization's compliance with government and internal environmental regulations and guidelines, identifying violations and determining appropriate remedial action. Providing technical advice and support services to organizations on how best to deal with environmental problems in order to reduce environmental damage and minimize financial loss. Developing conservation plans.

fields.name: Earthmoving Plant Operator (General)
fields.description: Operates a range of earthmoving plant to assist with the building of roads, rail, water supply, dams, treatment plants and agricultural earthworks.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring excavating machinery equipped with moveable shovel, grab-bucket or dragline bucket, to excavate and move earth, rock, sand, gravel or similar materials. Operating and monitoring machinery for digging trenches for sewers, drainage, water, oil, gas or similar pipelines. Operating and monitoring machinery equipped with concave steel blade to move, distribute and level earth, sand, snow and other materials. Operating and monitoring equipment to remove sand, gravel and mud from bottom of body of water. Operating and monitoring machines for hammering wooden, concrete or steel piles into ground. Operating and monitoring power roller to compact and smooth layers of materials in making roads, pavements and similar work. Operating and monitoring machines which spread and smooth concrete or bituminous or tar preparations to construct roadways, roads or similar surfaces.

fields.name: Earthmoving Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in excavating earth, clearing and levelling sites, and digging irrigation channels.
fields.tasks: Operating controls for excavating, breaking, drilling, levelling, compacting, moving, loading and spreading earth, rock, rubble, soil and other materials. Excavating earth, ore and rock, breaking up pavements, roads, rock and obstructions, and moving and loading earth, rock and debris. Levelling, smoothing and compacting surfaces in construction and other projects. Preparing and positioning plants for operation. Selecting, fitting and removing attachments such as buckets, winches, loading scoops, shovel blades and rock-breaking hammers. Raising, lowering and manipulating equipment attachments using manual and hydraulic controls. Monitoring plant operations, adjusting controls to regulate the pressure, speed and flow of operation. Ensuring the safety of other workers at all times when operating equipment. Servicing, lubricating, cleaning and refuelling the plant and performing minor adjustments and repairs.

fields.name: Economics and Management Sciences Teacher (Grades 4 - 9)
fields.description: Teaches economics and management sciences within a prescribed curriculum from grades 4 - 9 school students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Economics Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches economics (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Economist
fields.description: Performs economic research and analysis; develops and applies theories about production and distribution of goods and services, and people's spending and financial behaviour; and provides advice to governments and organisations on subjects relating to eco
fields.tasks: Forecasting changes in the economic environment for short-term budgeting, long-term planning and investment evaluation. Formulating recommendations, policies and plans for the economy, corporate strategies and investment, and undertaking feasibility studies for projects. Monitoring economic data to assess the effectiveness, and advise on the appropriateness, of monetary and fiscal policies. Forecasting production and consumption of specific products and services based on records of past production and consumption and general economic and industry-specific conditions. Preparing forecasts of income and expenditure, interest rates and exchange rates. Analysing factors that determine labour force participation, employment, wages, unemployment and other labour market outcomes. Applying mathematical formulae and statistical techniques and apply to test economic theories and devise solutions to economic problems. Compiling, analysing and interpreting economic data using economic theory and a variety of statistical and other techniques.

fields.name: Education or Training Advisor
fields.description: Conducts educational and training research and develops course curricula and associated teaching materials for use by educational and training institutions.
fields.tasks: Developing the structure, content and objectives of new educational courses and programs.      Documenting subjects and courses developed, and evaluating new courses.      Evaluating and advising on contents of courses and methods of examination.      Organising and conducting workshops and conferences to train teachers in new programs and methods.      Preparing reports and making recommendations to educational authorities.      Researching into audio-visual and other teaching aids and advising on, planning and organising their introduction in educational establishments.      Researching into current developments in curricula, teaching methods and other educational practices.      Visiting classrooms to observe teaching techniques and to evaluate teachers performance.      Visiting schools periodically and conferring with administrative and teaching staff.

fields.name: Education or Training Reviewer
fields.description: Reviews and examines the work of teachers, trainers and coaches in learning sites, and observes the results of the application of curriculum programs.
fields.tasks: Developing the structure, content and objectives of new educational courses and programs.      Documenting subjects and courses developed, and evaluating new courses.      Evaluating and advising on contents of courses and methods of examination.      Organising and conducting workshops and conferences to train teachers in new programs and methods.      Preparing reports and making recommendations to educational authorities.      Researching into audio-visual and other teaching aids and advising on, planning and organising their introduction in educational establishments.      Researching into current developments in curricula, teaching methods and other educational practices.      Visiting classrooms to observe teaching techniques and to evaluate teachers performance.      Visiting schools periodically and conferring with administrative and teaching staff.

fields.name: Educational Psychologist
fields.description: Investigates learning and teaching, and develops psychological techniques to foster the development and skills of individuals and groups in educational settings.
fields.tasks: Assessing the learning and emotional needs of children and adolescents by using formal testing tools, through observation of behaviour, and by consulting with teachers, education professionals and parents. Developing, advising on, implementing and supporting therapeutic and behaviour management programmes including psychotherapy, play therapy and individual and family counselling. Designing and developing courses on topics such as bullying for parents, teachers and others involved with the education of children and young people. Writing reports to make formal recommendations on actions to be taken. Attending case conferences, and liaising and discussing with other members of multidisciplinary teams on how best to meet the social, emotional, behavioural and learning needs of children and young people referred for help. Developing and applying effective interventions to promote psychological wellbeing, social, emotional and behavioural development, and to raise educational standards.

fields.name: Elected Official
fields.description: Oversees the implementation of policies, rules and regulations of an organisation, directs its application and represent the organisation or act on its behalf.
fields.tasks: Determining and formulating the policies, rules and regulations of the organization. Ensuring appropriate systems and procedures are developed and implemented to provide budgetary control. Monitoring and evaluating performance of the organization or enterprise against established objectives and policies. Negotiating on behalf of the organization, its members and relevant special-interest groups. Planning, directing and coordinating the general functioning of the organization. Planning, organising and directing sections charged with implementing the organization's policies, programmes, rules and regulations. Promoting the interests of the organization, its members and relevant special-interest groups before the legislature, government or general public. Representing the organization at official occasions and board meetings, in negotiations, at conventions, public hearings and forums. Reviewing the operations and results of the organization and reporting to boards of directors and governing bodies, the organization’s membership and funding agencies.

fields.name: Electric Substation Operations Manager
fields.description: Controls the operations of electric substations to load and distribute electrical power.
fields.tasks: Monitoring technical aspects of the manufacture, installation, utilisation, maintenance and repair of electrical systems and equipment to ensure satisfactory performance and compliance with specifications and regulations. Planning installation methods, checking completed installation for safety and controls or undertaking the initial running of the new electrical equipment or systems. Assembling, installing, testing, calibrating, modifying and repairing electrical equipment and installations to conform with regulations and safety requirements.

fields.name: Electrical and Electronic Equipment Assembler
fields.description: Assembles or modifies according to strictly laid down procedures, components of electrical, electromechanical and electronic equipment.
fields.tasks: Reviewing work orders, specifications, diagrams and drawings to determine materials needed and assembly instructions. Assembling component parts and electrical and electronic systems.   Positioning, aligning and fastening units to assemblies, sub-assemblies, or frames using hand or power tools, soldering and micro-welding equipment. Inspecting and testing completed components and assemblies, wiring installations and circuits, and rejecting faulty assembly components. Operating wire-coiling machines to wind wire coils used in electrical equipment and components such as registers, transformers, armature wires, electric motors and generators. Recording production and operational data on specified forms.

fields.name: Electrical Engineer
fields.description: Designs, develops and supervises the manufacture, installation, operation and maintenance of equipment, machines and systems for the generation, distribution, utilisation and control of electric power. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupati
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing power stations and systems which generate , transmit and distribute electrical power. Supervising, controlling and monitoring the operation of electrical generation, transmission and distribution systems. Advising on and designing systems for electrical motors, electrical traction and other equipment, or electrical domestic appliances. Specifying electrical installation and application in industrial and other buildings and objects. Establishing control standards and procedures to monitor performance and safety of electrical generating and distribution systems, motors and equipment. Determining manufacturing methods for electrical systems, as well as maintenance and repair of existing electrical systems, motors and equipment.

fields.name: Electrical Engineering Technician
fields.description: Conducts tests of electrical systems, prepares charts and tabulations, and assists in estimating costs in support of electrical engineers and engineering technologists. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Providing technical assistance in research on and development of electrical equipment and facilities, or testing prototypes. Designing and preparing blueprints of electrical installations and circuitry according to the specifications given. Preparing detailed estimates of quantities and costs of materials and labour required for manufacture and installation according to the specifications given. Monitoring technical aspects of the manufacture, installation, utilisation, maintenance and repair of electrical systems and equipment to ensure satisfactory performance and compliance with specifications and regulations. Planning installation methods, checking completed installation for safety and controls or undertaking the initial running of the new electrical equipment or systems. Assembling, installing, testing, calibrating, modifying and repairing electrical equipment and installations to conform with regulations and safety requirements.

fields.name: Electrical Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Analyses and modifies new and existing electrical engineering technologies and applies them in the testing and implementation of electrical engineering projects. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing power stations and systems which generate , transmit and distribute electrical power. Supervising, controlling and monitoring the operation of electrical generation, transmission and distribution systems. Advising on and designing systems for electrical motors, electrical traction and other equipment, or electrical domestic appliances. Specifying electrical installation and application in industrial and other buildings and objects. Establishing control standards and procedures to monitor performance and safety of electrical generating and distribution systems, motors and equipment. Determining manufacturing methods for electrical systems, as well as maintenance and repair of existing electrical systems, motors and equipment.

fields.name: Electrical Equipment Mechanic
fields.description: Services and repairs electrical equipment and household appliances. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Fitting, adjusting and repairing various kinds of electrical machinery and motors and related equipment. Fitting, adjusting and repairing electrical parts in appliances, industrial machines and other appliances. Installing, testing, connecting and maintaining electrical equipment. Installing, maintaining, servicing and repairing electric equipment. Connecting electrical systems to power supply. Replacing and repairing defective parts.

fields.name: Electrical Installation Inspector
fields.description: Inspects electrical installations to ensure compliance with relevant standards and regulations. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Inspecting electrical installations and ensuring that electrical installations comply with relevant standards and regulations. Inspecting electrical systems to identify hazards. Inspecting electrical components for defects. Inspecting electrical equipment for needed adjustments or repairs. Signing a certificate of inspection to certify that electrical installation work was carried out according to the requirements of the legislation and regulations.

fields.name: Electrical Line Mechanic
fields.description: Installs, maintains, repairs and patrols electrical sub-transmission and distribution systems. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Installing and repairing overhead and underground electrical power and electrical traction lines. Making joints in overhead and underground cables. Adhering to safety practices and procedures, such as checking equipment regularly and erecting barriers around work areas. Opening switches or attaching grounding devices to remove electrical hazards from disturbed or fallen lines to facilitate repairs. Installing and removing line equipment. Servicing, installing and removing street lights. Constructing and maintaining transmission lines. Constructing substations.

fields.name: Electrical or Telecommunications Trades Assistant
fields.description: Assists electrical and telecommunications trades workers to install and maintain electrical and telecommunications systems.
fields.tasks: Assisting electricians in installing and repairing wiring, fixtures and equipment. Handing over materials and tools as required. Measuring and cutting conduit to specified lengths. Connecting conduit couplings and conduit fittings. Securing conduit brackets to walls with screws and bolts. Pulling wires through conduit leading to connection boxes, switch panels and terminals. Stripping insulation from wire ends, using wire stripping pliers. Tying or screwing wires to terminals for subsequent soldering.

fields.name: Electrical Technology Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches electrical technology (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Electrician
fields.description: Installs, tests, connects, commissions, maintains and modifies electrical equipment, wiring and control systems.
fields.tasks: Installing, maintaining and repairing electrical wiring systems and related equipment in various buildings. Examining blueprints, wiring diagrams and specifications to determine sequences and methods of operation. Planning layout and installation of electrical wiring, equipment and fixtures, based on job specifications and relevant standards. Inspecting electrical systems, equipment, and components to identify hazards, defects, and the need for adjustment or repair. Selecting, cutting and connecting wire and cable to terminals and connectors. Measuring and laying out installation reference points. Positioning and installing electrical switchboards. Testing continuity of circuit.

fields.name: Electroencephalographic Technician
fields.description: Conducts tests on patients to record brainwaves, or other electrical impulses in the nervous system and spinal cord, by use of specialised equipment in support of specialists engaged in diagnosing, monitoring and treating neurological and related disorder
fields.tasks: Explaining procedures, observing and positioning patients, and using protection devices to ensure safety and comfort during examination or treatment. Positioning treatment equipment and adjusting settings and controls according to technical specifications. Monitoring patients' conditions and reactions, reporting abnormal signs to a medical practitioner. Following prescription issued by a medical practitioner. Operating or overseeing operation equipment.

fields.name: Electronic Engineering Technician
fields.description: Conducts tests of electronic systems, collects and analyses data, and assembles circuitry in support of electronics engineers and engineering technologists.
fields.tasks: Providing technical assistance in research and development of electronic equipment, or testing prototypes. Designing and preparing blueprints of electronic circuitry according to the specifications given. Preparing detailed estimates of quantities and costs of materials and labour required for the manufacture and installation of electronic equipment, according to the specifications given. Monitoring technical aspects of the manufacture, utilisation, maintenance and repair of electronic equipment to ensure satisfactory performance and ensure compliance with specifications and regulations. Assisting in the design, development, installation, operation and maintenance of electronic systems. Planning installation methods, checking completed installation for safety and controls or undertaking the initial running of the new electronic equipment or system. Conducting tests of electronic systems, collecting and analysing data, and assembling circuitry in support of electronics engineers.

fields.name: Electronic Equipment Mechanician
fields.description: Maintains, adjusts and repairs radio and television receivers, and related audio and visual reproduction equipment such as video cameras, digital versatile disc players, compact disc players and video cassette recorders. NOTE: This occupation is listed as
fields.tasks: Connecting components to assemblies such as radio systems, instruments, magnetos, inverters, and in-flight refuelling systems. Examining and testing machines, instruments, components, other equipment, instruments and control systems to identify faults. Adjusting, repairing, and replacing worn and defective parts and wiring, and maintaining machines, equipment and instruments. Reassembling, test operating and adjusting equipment. Installing electronic instruments and control systems. Coordinating work with that of engineers, technicians, and other maintenance personnel. Interpreting test data to diagnose malfunctions and systemic performance problems.

fields.name: Electronic Originator
fields.description: Manipulates sets and composes text and graphics into a format suitable for printing and other visual media.
fields.tasks: Addressing all aspects of work prior to the printing process. Doing type-setting. Preparing line or half-tone pictures in single or multi-colour separations which allow for the job being printed in colour. Making up and laying out of the job in its final form with text, graphics, special effects and all other instructions which may be given by the customer. Making positives or negatives and preparing the printing-plates for the presses. In addition, installing, maintaining and repairing of electrical equipment related to the printing process.

fields.name: Electronics and Telecommunications Trades Assistant
fields.description: Assists electronics and telecommunications trades workers to install and maintain electronics and telecommunications systems.
fields.tasks: Assisting with building, testing, repairing and modifying electronic components, parts, equipment and systems. Assisting technicians with the layout and assembly procedures and problems of electronic units. Undertaking basic installation procedures.    Setting up standard test equipment to test circuitry. Adjusting, calibrating, aligning, and modifying circuitry and components and recording their effects on unit performance. Testing the functioning of newly installed equipment to evaluate system performance under actual operating conditions.

fields.name: Electronics Engineer
fields.description: Designs, develops, adapts, installs, tests and maintains electronic components, circuits and systems used for computer systems, communication systems and other industrial applications.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing electronic devices or components, circuits, semi-conductors, and systems. Specifying production or installation methods, materials and quality standards and directing production or installation work of electronic products and systems. Establishing control standards and procedures to ensure efficient functioning and safety of electronic systems, motors and equipment. Organising and directing maintenance and repair of existing electronic systems and equipment. Designing electronic circuits and components for use in fields such as aerospace guidance and propulsion control, acoustics, or instruments and controls. Researching and advising on radar, telemetry and remote control systems, microwaves and other electronic equipment. Designing and developing signal processing algorithms and implementing these through appropriate choice of hardware and software. Developing apparatus and procedures to test electronic components, circuits and systems.

fields.name: Electronics Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Analyses, modifies, maintains and repairs new and existing electronic systems and applies them in the testing and implementation of electronic engineering projects. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing electronic devices or components, circuits, semi-conductors, and systems. Specifying production or installation methods, materials and quality standards and directing production or installation work of electronic products and systems. Establishing control standards and procedures to ensure efficient functioning and safety of electronic systems, motors and equipment. Organising and directing maintenance and repair of existing electronic systems and equipment. Designing electronic circuits and components for use in fields such as aerospace guidance and propulsion control, acoustics, or instruments and controls. Researching and advising on radar, telemetry and remote control systems, microwaves and other electronic equipment. Designing and developing signal processing algorithms and implementing these through appropriate choice of hardware and software. Developing apparatus and procedures to test electronic components, circuits and systems.

fields.name: Electroplater
fields.description: Operates and monitors equipment which finishes, plates and coats metal articles or parts, in order to give them improved resistance to corrosion and abrasion, for decorative purposes, or to impart electrical or magnetic properties.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring equipment which cleans metal articles in preparation for electroplating, galvanising, enamelling or similar processes. Operating and monitoring electroplating equipment. Operating and monitoring hot-dip equipment used to coat iron and steel products. Operating and monitoring machines which automatically coat wire with non-ferrous metal. Operating and monitoring equipment used to spray molten metal or other substances on metal products to provide a protective or decorative coating or to build up worn or damaged surfaces. Operating and monitoring equipment used to impart a rust-resistant finish to metal articles by treating them with chemicals and heating them. Checking proper thickness of plating using micrometers, callipers or other devices recording data and writing production logs. Preparing and mixing metalizing solutions according to formulas or specifications.

fields.name: Electrotherapist
fields.description: Uses electrical impulses to relieve discomfort and promote physical well-being.
fields.tasks: Administering electrical modality treatments, ultrasound, and other electrotherapies using specialised techniques and equipment.   Using therapeutic devices that produce small electrical impulses to stimulate muscles, increase local blood flow and assist with tissue repair.   Conferring with health care providers to evaluate patient information for planning, modifying, and coordinating treatment.   Instructing, safeguarding and assisting patients regarding the administration and after-care procedures of electrotherapy treatment.   Monitoring and recording patients' progress during treatments, including measuring their range-of-joint motion and vital signs.

fields.name: Embalmer
fields.description: Prepares bodies for interment in conformity with legal requirements.
fields.tasks: Preparing the bodies of deceased people for viewing and burial in accordance with strict health and safety regulations. Preserving the appearance of the person from the time of death until the funeral. Washing and disinfecting the body, replacing bodily fluids and gases with preservatives, washing and arranging hair, and if required, applying cosmetics. Reconstructing the appearance of the person if the death involved a traumatic event. Completing any necessary paperwork pertaining to the legal requirements of the funeral service industry. Helping with cleaning the mortuary. Assisting the bereaved to arrange the funeral by booking the funeral venue and coordinating the cremation or burial arrangements. Assisting with all other tasks related to the operation of the funeral home.

fields.name: Emergency Medicine Specialist
fields.description: Emergency physician provides diagnostic medical services and manages patients with acute and urgent illness and injury.
fields.tasks: Serving patients with critical and emergency conditions in pre-hospital and in-hospital settings and assessing patients that seek medical attention at any time of day or night.   Providing a full spectrum of medical interventions ranging from invasive surgical procedures to disease control.   Handling and treating medical emergencies, trauma and every imaginable acute and non-acute medical problem.   Applying knowledge and skills across many medical disciplines to manage patients with conditions spanning all areas of medicine.   Resuscitating and stabilising patients with life-threatening conditions and referring them to the appropriate medical department for further treatment in another medical discipline.   Controlling the flow of patients through the emergency department in a hospital and prioritising patients according to the severity of their conditions.   Communicating with Emergency Service and Rescue Officials and Paramedics, as well as with law enforcement agencies and patients’ families.

fields.name: Emergency Service and Rescue Official
fields.description: Attends the scene of reported emergencies to minimise risk to community and worker safety and security.
fields.tasks: Responding to calls for medical emergencies or rescue situations. Controlling the flow of crowds and traffic at emergency situations. Assessing the care and safety needs of victims, patients and bystanders at emergency situations. Providing care or rescue services based on assessed needs, and the level and type of qualification held.

fields.name: Emergency Vehicle Drivers
fields.description: Drives emergency vehicles. Alternate Occupation Names Ambulance Driver Fire Truck Driver Fire Van Driver Security Driver

fields.name: Employee Wellness Manager
fields.description: Defines and manages a wellness strategy that is linked with and in support of department's hr strategy and coordinates the services and outputs of wellness practitioners in the execution of programmes and projects.
fields.tasks: Managing fitness or recreation facilities and equipment and maintaining wellness- and fitness-related schedules, records or reports. Conducting or facilitating training sessions or seminars for wellness and fitness staff. Developing, implementing and coordinating a comprehensive range of health and wellness activities and programmes. Conducting presentations on wellness programs on topics such as stress management or the importance of healthy habits. Organising and overseeing fitness or wellness events, programs or health screenings. Supervising wellness workers such as fitness instructors, recreation workers, nutritionists and health educators. Preparing or implementing budgets and strategic, operational, purchasing or maintenance plans.

fields.name: Employee Wellness Practitioner
fields.description: Assesses physical and/or mental health and well-being of employees e.g. Employee fitness programs, smoking cessation, nutrition and weight loss counselling, alcohol and drug dependency counselling.
fields.tasks: Assessing the physical and/or mental health and well-being of employees of a company or department. Developing, implementing and coordinating a comprehensive range of health and wellness activities and programmes. Organising and overseeing fitness or health screenings and wellness events and programs. Conducting presentations on wellness programs on topics such as stress management or the importance of healthy habits. Providing counselling and support on health and wellness related issues such as HIV/Aids prevention and management, smoking cessation, nutrition and weight loss, and alcohol and drug dependency.

fields.name: Energy Broker
fields.description: Buy or sell energy or energy derivatives or products for customers.
fields.tasks: Purchasing or selling energy or energy derivatives for customers. Contacting prospective buyers or sellers of power to arrange transactions. Creating product packages based on assessment of customers' or potential customers' needs. Negotiating  prices or contracts for energy sales or purchases. Pricing energy based on market conditions. Developing or delivering proposals or presentations on topics such as the purchase or sale of energy. Educating customers and answering customer questions related to the buying or selling of energy, energy markets or alternative energy sources. Explaining contracts or related documents to customers. Forecasting energy supply and demand to minimize the cost of meeting load demands and to maximize the value of supply resources. Researching and recommending new products or services, such as alternative energy sources or renewable energy credits.

fields.name: Energy Efficiency Technician
fields.description: Evaluates electrical installations, equipment and processes and collects data and makes recommendations on energy usage and efficiency.
fields.tasks: Providing technical assistance in research on and development of electrical equipment and facilities, or testing prototypes. Designing and preparing blueprints of electrical installations and circuitry according to the specifications given.
