Monitoring technical aspects of the manufacture, installation, utilisation, maintenance and repair of electrical systems and equipment to ensure satisfactory performance and compliance with specifications and regulations. Planning installation methods, checking completed installation for safety and controls or undertaking the initial running of the new electrical equipment or systems. Assembling, installing, testing, calibrating, modifying and repairing electrical equipment and installations to conform with regulations and safety requirements.

fields.name: Energy Engineer
fields.description: Plans, designs, organises and oversees the construction or remodeling of energy generation plants and designs, develops, or evaluates energy related projects to reduce energy costs or improve energy efficiency.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing power stations and systems which generate , transmit and distribute electrical power. Supervising, controlling and monitoring the operation of electrical generation, transmission and distribution systems. Advising on and designing systems for electrical motors, electrical traction and other equipment, or electrical domestic appliances. Specifying electrical installation and application in industrial and other buildings and objects. Establishing control standards and procedures to monitor performance and safety of electrical generating and distribution systems, motors and equipment. Determining manufacturing methods for electrical systems, as well as maintenance and repair of existing electrical systems, motors and equipment.

fields.name: Energy Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Analyses and modifies new and existing engineering technologies relating to the design and construction of nuclear reactors and auxiliary facilities.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing power stations and systems which generate , transmit and distribute electrical power. Supervising, controlling and monitoring the operation of electrical generation, transmission and distribution systems. Advising on and designing systems for electrical motors, electrical traction and other equipment, or electrical domestic appliances. Specifying electrical installation and application in industrial and other buildings and objects. Establishing control standards and procedures to monitor performance and safety of electrical generating and distribution systems, motors and equipment. Determining manufacturing methods for electrical systems, as well as maintenance and repair of existing electrical systems, motors and equipment.

fields.name: Engineer Soldier
fields.description: Practise, exercise and employ military engineer tactics, techniques and procedures during military war and peace operations.
fields.tasks: Coordinating armour, artillery, and air support units.      Directing deployment of land defence weapons, vehicles, and equipment. Directing location, construction, and camouflage of landward defence positions and equipment.      Managing field communications.      Driving and operating specialised military vehicles designed for combat operations.      Performing strategic and tactical planning, including battle plan development and reconnaissance operations.

fields.name: Engineering Graphics & Design Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches engineering graphics & design (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Engineering Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the design and construction of engineering and process plants.
fields.tasks: Identifying business opportunities and determining products to be manufactured. Determining, implementing and monitoring production strategies, policies and plans. Planning details of production activities in terms of output quality and quantity, cost, time available and labour requirements. Overseeing the provision of quotes for the manufacture of specialised goods and establishing contracts with customers and suppliers. Establishing and managing budgets, monitoring production output and costs, and adjusting processes and resources to minimize costs. Consulting with and informing other managers about production matters. Controlling the preparation of production records and reports.

fields.name: Engineering Production Systems Worker
fields.description: Performs a range of production process tasks to refine and treat metals and mineral ore, fire ceramics, and operate plant to produce and finish metal products such as rods, tubing and structural shapes, and moulds for casting. Alternate Occupation Names Alumina Refinery Operator Automated Machine Operator Ball Sorter Brake Press Operator Computer Numeric Control (CNC) Machine Operator Die Setter Guillotine Operator Metal Hammer Hand Laser Cutting Operator Lead Worker Pneumatic Press Operator Press Pour Operator Sheet Metal Production / Process Worker Steel Worker Turret Lathe Operator Turret Punch Operator Waste Thinner Wire Drawer Wire Goods Maker Wire Product Machine Operator

fields.name: Engraver
fields.description: Inscribes letters, figures and designs on metal, glass, wood, rubber, plastic and other surfaces. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Measuring and computing dimensions of lettering, designs, or patterns to be engraved. Engraving and printing patterns, ornamental designs, etchings, trademarks, figures or lettering onto flat or curved surfaces of a wide variety of metal, glass, plastic, or ceramic items. Engraving (either by hand or machine) of monograms, different letterforms, and decorative work on precious metals. Engraving is done on moulds, plastic and metal advertising signs, metal attachments, clasps, buckles, buttons, badges, medallions and memorial coins. Transferring from paper transfers decorative or ornamental designs on articles. Laying out and painting in one or more languages letters, figures, monograms and designs to make signs. Sketching or tracing design or lettering onto work piece or pattern material to prepare pattern or stencil. Designing and producing normal flat cut lettering or lettering that is shadowed with applied vinyl or lettering that is ready cut for application.

fields.name: Enquiry Clerk
fields.description: Responds to personal, written and telephone inquiries and complaints about the organisation's goods and services, provides information and refers people to other sources.
fields.tasks: Greeting visitors or clients, determining the nature and purpose of their visit, and directing or escorting them to the correct destinations. Answering enquiries about products or services and providing information about availability, location, price and related information. Issuing relevant forms, information kits and brochures to interested parties or customers, or sending information or documents to customers via mail, email or fax. Accessing information via computer networks and operating communication systems such as public address and paging systems. Operating switchboards and answering, screening and forwarding calls, or providing information, taking messages or scheduling appointments. Responding to enquiries about problems and providing advice and assistance. Resolving complaints from customers or the public. Recording information about enquiries and complaints, and filing and maintaining related records.

fields.name: Enrolled Nurse
fields.description: Provides nursing care to patients in a variety of health, aged care, welfare and community settings under the supervision of registered nurses.
fields.tasks: Providing nursing and personal care and treatment and health advice to patients as per care plans established by health professionals. Administering medications and other treatments to patients, monitoring patients' condition and responses to treatment, and referring patients and their families to a health professional for specialised care as needed. Cleaning wounds and applying surgical dressings. Updating information on patients' condition and treatments received in records-keeping systems. Assisting in planning and managing the care of individual patients. Assisting in giving first-aid treatment in emergencies.

fields.name: Entertainer or Variety Artist
fields.description: Entertains by performing a variety of acts through the use of a mix of acting, singing, dance and movement skills. This occupation requires high levels of creative talent or personal commitment and interest as well as, or in place of, formal qualification
fields.tasks: Performing at auditions and casting sessions. Learning and retaining performance routines. Performing on stage or recording performances. Communicating and co-operating with technical staff.

fields.name: Envelope Machine Technician
fields.description: Sets up, operates and maintains envelope manufacturing and printing machines to produce plain or printed envelopes on a variety of paper substrates. Alternate Occupation Names Envelope Machine Adjuster

fields.name: Environmental and Occupational Health Inspector
fields.description: Investigates the implementation of rules and regulations relating to environmental factors that may affect human health, safety in the workplace, and safety of processes for the production of goods and services.
fields.tasks: Inspecting places of work to ensure that the working environment, machinery and equipment conform to government and other rules, regulations and standards. Giving advice on environmental sanitary problems and techniques. Inspecting places of work and, by interviews, observations and other means, obtaining information about work practices and accidents to determine compliance with safety rules and regulations. Inspecting areas of production, processing, transport, handling, storage and sale of products to ensure conformity with government and other rules, regulations and standards. Advising enterprises and the general public on the implementation of government and other rules and regulations concerning hygiene, sanitation, purity and grading of primary products, food, drugs, cosmetics and similar goods. Inspecting establishments to ensure that they conform to government and other rules and regulations concerning emission of pollutants and disposal of dangerous wastes. Initiating action to maintain or improve hygiene and prevent pollution of water, air, food or soil. Promoting preventive and corrective measures such as control of disease carrying organisms and of harmful substances in the air, hygienic food handling, proper disposal of waste and cleaning of public places. Estimating quantities and costs of materials and labour required for health, safety and sanitation remediation project.

fields.name: Environmental Engineer
fields.description: Environmental Engineers are part of the larger Civil Engineering occupational group. An Environmental Engineer conducts research, advise on, design and direct implementation of solutions to prevent control or remedy negative impacts of human activity on the environment and conducts environmental assessments of construction and civil engineering projects and apply engineering principles to pollution control, recycling and waste disposal.
fields.tasks: Conducting research, assessing and reporting on the environmental impact of existing and proposed construction, civil engineering and other activities. Inspecting industrial and municipal facilities and programs to evaluate operational effectiveness and ensure compliance with environmental regulations. Designing and overseeing the development of systems, processes and equipment for control, management, or remediation of water, air, or soil quality. Providing environmental engineering assistance in network analysis, regulatory analysis, and planning or reviewing database development. Obtaining, updating, and maintaining plans, permits, and standard operating procedures. Providing engineering and technical support for environmental remediation and litigation projects, including remediation system design and determination of regulatory applicability. Monitoring progress of environmental improvement programs. Advising corporations and government agencies of procedures to follow in cleaning up contaminated sites to protect people and the environment. Collaborating with environmental scientists, planners, hazardous waste technicians, engineers from other disciplines, and specialists in law and business to address environmental problems.

fields.name: Environmental Engineering Technician
fields.description: Tests and implements new and existing engineering technologies relating to pollution control, recycling and waste disposal to remedy negative impacts of human activity on the environment to recommend improvement in the efficiency of environmental assessments of construction and civil engineering projects related to pollution control, recycling and waste disposal.
fields.tasks: Assisting scientists and engineers with safety and environmental engineering. Aiding in the identification of potential hazards and introducing safety procedures and devices. Assisting in the development of environmental pollution remediation devices under the direction of an engineer. Testing and implementing new and existing engineering technologies relating to pollution control, recycling and waste disposal to remedy negative impacts of human activity on the environment. Modifying and testing equipment and devices used in the prevention, control, and remediation of environmental pollution, site remediation, and land reclamation. Producing environmental assessment reports, tabulating data and preparing charts, graphs, or sketches.

fields.name: Environmental Health Officer
fields.description: Develops, enforces and evaluates environmental health policies, programs and strategies to improve health outcomes and oversees the implementation and monitoring of environmental health legislation.
fields.tasks: Developing, implementing and reviewing programs and policies to minimize potential environmental and occupational risks to health and safety. Preparing and implementing plans and strategies for the safe, economic and suitable disposal of commercial, industrial, medical and household wastes. Implementing prevention programs and strategies for communicable diseases, food safety, waste water treatment and disposal systems, recreation and domestic water quality, contaminated and hazardous substances. Identifying, reporting and documenting hazards, and assessing and controlling risks in the environment and workplace and advising on compliance with relevant law and regulations. Developing, implementing and monitoring programs to minimize workplace and environmental pollution involving chemical, physical and biological hazards. Advising methods to prevent, eliminate, control, or reduce the exposure of workers, students, the public and the environment to radiological and other hazards. Recording and investigating injuries and equipment damage, and reporting safety performance.

fields.name: Environmental Impact and Restoration Analyst
fields.description: An Environmental Impact and Restoration Analyst is an Environmental Engineer which forms part of the larger Civil Engineers occupational group. An Environmental Impact and Restoration Analyst analyses and modifies new and existing environmental engineering technologies and applies them in the prevention, control, and remediation of environmental problems, including waste treatment and site remediation.
fields.tasks: Conducting research, assessing and reporting on the environmental impact of existing and proposed construction, civil engineering and other activities. Inspecting industrial and municipal facilities and programs to evaluate operational effectiveness and ensure compliance with environmental regulations. Designing and overseeing the development of systems, processes and equipment for control, management, or remediation of water, air, or soil quality. Providing environmental engineering assistance in network analysis, regulatory analysis, and planning or reviewing database development. Obtaining, updating, and maintaining plans, permits, and standard operating procedures. Providing engineering and technical support for environmental remediation and litigation projects, including remediation system design and determination of regulatory applicability. Monitoring progress of environmental improvement programs. Advising corporations and government agencies of procedures to follow in cleaning up contaminated sites to protect people and the environment. Collaborating with environmental scientists, planners, hazardous waste technicians, engineers from other disciplines, and specialists in law and business to address environmental problems.

fields.name: Environmental Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the development and implementation of an environmental management system within an organisation by identifying, solving and alleviating environmental issues such as pollution and waste treatment in compliance with environmental legislation and ensures corporate sustainable development.
fields.tasks: Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation, expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.     Coordinating cooperation with other service provision agencies in the environmental or related fields.          Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and standards for staff.          Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of personnel.          Managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.          Monitoring and evaluating resources devoted to the provision of services.          Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.          Planning, directing and coordinating environmental services.

fields.name: Environmental Practices Inspector
fields.description: Examines places of business to ensure compliance to environmental practice requirements. May issue certificates. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Examining places of business and scrutinising permits, licences and records to ensure compliance with relevant national and municipal environmental practice requirements, and issuing certificates of compliance accordingly.  Investigating complaints of illegal dumping, pollution, nuisance to neighbouring premises, community health and safety complaints, problems relating to pesticides, product quality etc. from individuals or businesses. Inspecting water and waste treatment facilities, and collecting samples for testing, to make sure they are in compliance with standards and regulations. Being an expert witness and testifying in court about environmental violations. Making sure that landfills are processing rubbish in compliance with local environmental regulations. Monitoring follow-up actions in cases where violations were found, and reviewing compliance monitoring reports. Evaluating label information for accuracy and conformance to regulatory requirements. Preparing, organising and maintaining inspection records and producing reports summarising requirements and regulations.

fields.name: Environmental Science Technician
fields.description: Performs tests and experiments, and provide technical support functions to assist environmental scientists and technologists in research and teaching.
fields.tasks: Collecting samples of gases, soils, water, industrial wastewater, or asbestos products to conduct tests on pollutant levels or identify sources of pollution. Recording test data and preparing reports, summaries, or charts that interpret test results. Developing or implementing programs for monitoring of environmental pollution or radiation. Setting up equipment or stations to monitor and collect pollutants from sites, such as smoke stacks, manufacturing plants or mechanical equipment. Maintaining files such as hazardous waste databases, chemical usage data, personnel exposure information or diagrams showing equipment locations. Preparing samples or photomicrographs for testing and analysis. Examining and analysing material for presence and concentration of contaminants such as asbestos, using variety of microscopes.

fields.name: Environmental Scientist
fields.description: Studies and develops policies and plans for the control of factors which may produce pollution, imbalance or degradation of the environment. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Conducting research, performing tests, collecting samples, performing field and laboratory analysis to identify sources of environmental problems and recommending ways to prevent, control and remediate the impact of environmental problems. Assessing the likely impact that potential or proposed activities, projects and developments may have on the environment, and recommending whether such developments should proceed. Developing and coordinating the implementation of environmental management systems to enable organizations to identify, monitor and control the impact of their activities, products and services on the environment. Conducting audits to evaluate environmental impact of existing activities, processes, wastes, noises and substances. Assessing an organization's compliance with government and internal environmental regulations and guidelines, identifying violations and determining appropriate remedial action. Providing technical advice and support services to organizations on how best to deal with environmental problems in order to reduce environmental damage and minimize financial loss. Developing conservation plans.

fields.name: Ephemeral Artist
fields.description: Conceives and develops ideas for artistic presentations and selects and arranges subjects.
fields.tasks: Conceiving and developing ideas, designs and styles for works of ephemeral art. Selecting artistic media, method and materials.    Arranging and positioning objects and models (including self) according to the chosen subject matter.   Presenting and explaining works of ephemeral art.

fields.name: Ergonomist
fields.description: Designs objects, systems and environments which are suited to the needs of users and the tasks they perform. Analyses human activity in domestic, leisure or working settings as well as the demands, effects and implications of these activities.
fields.tasks: Investigating the physical and psychological capabilities and limitations of the human body in activities of daily living, and especially in the workplace.   Analysing how people use equipment and machinery in their environment at work, home, and leisure and whilst travelling.   Using detailed knowledge of the movements of the human body to improve the design of products that humans use every day such as cars, office furniture and leisure facilities.   Undertaking workplace risk assessments, studying work environments and work tasks to determine how these affect users physically and emotionally.   Assessing whether the present or planned demands in the work environment are compatible with human capacity.   Using assessment results to identify areas for improvement and designing practical solutions to improve human health, human performance and human productivity in the workplace.   Producing user manuals to ensure the best use of new systems or products.   Reporting on findings, making recommendations and writing proposals to improve a wide range of environments that humans use in their daily activities.

fields.name: Event Assistant
fields.description: Assist with the implementing of an event's design, activities and production.
fields.tasks: Assisting event organisers in planning and organising events such as festivals, exhibitions, conferences, product launches and social events. Working as part of a team within an event management company, or in-house for a company or organisation. Assisting clients with queries and concerns before, during and after events. Liaising with internal and external clients during the event preparation stage, and assisting with preliminary event planning. Responding to emergencies or incidents prior to or during the event and finding solutions to problems. Fulfilling other responsibilities such as office administration duties as assigned.

fields.name: Event Producer
fields.description: Conceives of, develops, creates and refines event concepts in response to a client's brief.
fields.tasks: Conducting pre-event consultation with clients, and putting together proposals, concepts and plans. Managing, planning and implementing events and multifaceted projects on behalf of clients. Organising product launches, conferences, gala dinners, road shows, corporate events and hospitality events. Coordinating all event logistics such as venue selection, staffing, agenda development and event flow, promotion, and the printing and shipping of related documentation. Managing the budget and expenditure. Managing participant registration and related travel arrangements. Evaluating the success of an event by getting feedback from clients and participants. Work closely with teams involved in marketing, sales and public relations, and with executive management in order to achieve business goals through event organisation.

fields.name: Event Stylist
fields.description: Prepares special exhibits.
fields.tasks: Assisting with defining the colour scheme, mood, theme and style for events such as exhibitions, conferences, product launches and other social events. Liaising with internal and external clients during event preparation stages regarding theme and other aspects of styling.   Advising on venue themes, décor colours and creating the visual elements of the style. Giving advice on props and decorations, and sourcing the required items. Keeping up-to-date on all the latest trends regarding colours, décors and event styling.

fields.name: Events Manager
fields.description: Organises and coordinates services related to all aspects of an event from design and planning to production.
fields.tasks: Managing all aspects of the planning, design, marketing and production of events for various sectors including business, tourism, leisure, incentives, sports and government. Arranging and coordinating services such as conference facilities, catering, signage, displays, audio-visual and computer equipment, accommodation, transport and social events for participants, and logistical arrangements for event presenters. Meeting with clients to discuss their needs and outlining package options to meet these needs. Negotiating the type and costs of services to be provided within budget. Organising registration of participants. Overseeing work by contractors and reporting on variations to work orders. Promoting conferences, conventions and trade shows to potential customers. Responding to inquiries concerning services provided and costs for room and equipment hire, catering and related services.

fields.name: Examination Supervisor
fields.description: Supervises those who are busy writing an exam/ test so that no cheating takes place.

fields.name: Excavator Operator
fields.description: Operates heavy excavation plant to excavate, move and load earth, rock and rubble.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring excavating machinery equipped with moveable shovels, grab-buckets or dragline buckets to excavate and move earth, rock, sand, gravel or similar materials. Operating and monitoring machinery for digging trenches for sewers, drainage, water, oil, gas or similar pipelines. Operating and monitoring machinery equipped with concave steel blades to move, distribute and level earth, sand, snow and other materials. Operating and monitoring equipment to remove sand, gravel and mud from the bottom of a body of water.

fields.name: Explosive Ordnance Engineer
fields.description: Designs, tests, and coordinates development of explosive ordnance material.
fields.tasks: Designing, testing, and coordinating the development of explosive ordnance material to meet military procurement specifications. Designing and overseeing construction and operation of nuclear reactors and power plants and nuclear fuels reprocessing and reclamation systems. Designing and developing nuclear equipment such as reactor cores, radiation shielding, and associated instrumentation and control mechanisms. Assessing damage and providing calculations for marine salvage operations. Studying and advising on engineering aspects of particular manufacturing processes, such as those related to glass, ceramics, textiles, leather products, wood, and printing. Identifying potential hazards and introducing safety procedures and devices.

fields.name: Explosives and Dangerous Goods Inspector
fields.description: Inspects and examines premises, vehicle, vessel or aircraft where suspect explosives or dangerous goods may be found.
fields.tasks: Conducting research and advising on, and developing commercial-scale chemical processes to refine crude oil and other liquids or gases, and to produce substances and items such as petroleum derivatives, explosives, food and drink products, medicines, or synthetic materials. Specifying chemical production methods, materials and quality standards and ensuring that they conform to specifications. Establishing control standards and procedures to ensure safety and efficiency of chemical production operations and safety of workers operating equipment or working in close proximity to on-going chemical reactions. Designing chemical plant equipment and devising processes for manufacturing chemicals and products. Performing tests throughout stages of production to determine degree of control over variables, including temperature, density, specific gravity, and pressure. Developing safety procedures to be employed. Preparing estimates of production costs and production progress reports for management. Performing laboratory studies of steps in manufacture of new products and testing proposed process in small scale operation such as a pilot plant.

fields.name: External Auditor
fields.description: Designs and operates information and reporting systems, procedures and controls to meet external financial reporting requirements.
fields.tasks: Performing independent, third-party reviews of all the financial records of a company or corporation. Evaluating all accounting, payroll and purchasing records, as well as any documents related to investments, stocks or loans. Providing an accurate, unbiased analysis of the company’s financial condition in an audit report.

fields.name: Fabric and Textile Factory Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in a fabric and textile factory such as the manual cutting of canvas, upholstery and curtain fabrics, delivering materials to machines, operating automatic machines using computerised patterns, pressing partially completed and finis
fields.tasks: Cutting component parts for footwear and clothing, and assembling and joining component parts. Performing various footwear and clothing making operations and outwork processes. Finishing and dressing footwear. Pressing finished garments and ensuring their dispatch. Operating, controlling, monitoring and maintaining textile and fibre manufacturing processes. Preparing dyeing and print colouration for material. Applying textile testing techniques. Operating and controlling an inspection process.

fields.name: Facilities Manager
fields.description: Organises, controls and coordinates the strategic and operational management of facilities in a public or private organisation.
fields.tasks: Advising on the facilities available and promoting publicity in their usage.   Planning and organizing the range and mix of events to be hosted in or presented by the facility.      Planning and directing daily operations.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.   Checking and keeping custody of all cash receipts and making regular stock checks.      Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.   Ensuring that facilities are kept clean and in good condition.   Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of staff.

fields.name: Faculty Head
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the educational and administrative aspects of a department, faculty or school within a university or other tertiary education institution.
fields.tasks: Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation, expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Controlling selection, training and supervision of staff.      Determining educational programs based on frameworks established by education authorities and governing bodies.      Developing and enforcing a disciplinary code to create a safe and conducive environment for students and teachers.      Directing administrative and clerical activities concerning student admissions and educational services.      Evaluating the work of teachers and lecturers by visiting classrooms, observing teaching methods, reviewing instructional objectives and examining learning materials.      Implementing systems and procedures to monitor school performance and student enrolments.      Organising and implementing methods of raising additional funds in conjunction with parent and community groups and sponsors.      Promoting the educational program, and representing the service or institution in the wider community.      Providing leadership and guidance to teaching, academic and administrative staff as well as to students.

fields.name: Family Court Registrar
fields.description: No descriptor
fields.tasks: Inspecting and copying documents filed for court purposes. Filing documents and maintaining of court records. Issuing subpoenas. Arranging the use of court facilities. Ensuring that all the administrative aspects of a trial run smoothly in court. Rendering support to all stakeholders making use of the court facilities. Communicating with all the other relevant departments in the justice value chain, e.g. Correctional Services, Social Development and the South African Police Service.

fields.name: Family Day Care Worker
fields.description: Provides care and supervision for babies and children, usually in worker’s own home, under local government or community based schemes.
fields.tasks: Assisting children to wash, dress and feed themselves. Taking children to and from school or outdoors for recreation. Playing games with children, or entertaining them by reading or storytelling. Assisting in the preparation of materials and equipment for children's education and recreational activities. Managing children's behaviour and guiding their social development. Disciplining children and recommending or initiating other measures to control behaviour, such as caring for own clothing and picking up toys and books. Keeping records on individual children, including daily observations and information about activities, meals served, and medications administered.

fields.name: Farm Maintenance Worker
fields.description: Assists farmers or farm managers or foremen and can be involved in maintenance of tractors and other farming implements, and/or the construction and maintenance of farm buildings and fences.
fields.tasks: Caring for farm animals by providing food and water and cleaning barns, stables, pens and kennels. Observing animal behaviour and health and; isolating sick or injured animals and notifying farm manager if an animal needs veterinary care. Marking livestock to identify ownership. Driving or operating farm equipment to plough, plant, cultivate or harvest crops. Irrigating soil and maintaining ditches or pipes and pumps. Constructing and repairing of farm buildings, fences and gates. Operating and maintaining a variety of farm vehicles, power tools and equipment as well as various hand tools required for construction, carpentry, plumbing and maintenance duties.

fields.name: Farrier
fields.description: Inspects, trims and shapes horses’ hooves, and forms, fits and nails horseshoes.
fields.tasks: Trimming hoofs and shoeing. Dealing with injured or diseased hooves and application of special shoes for racing, training or "cosmetic" purposes. Combining technical competence with horsemanship. Heating metal in forge furnace and manufacturing and repairing metal by drawing, bending, cutting, hammering metal on an anvil, punching, shearing, joining and hardening or tempering. Shaping heated metal into forgings on power hammer equipped with open dies. Operating closed-die drop hammer to forge metal articles. Operating a power-press machine equipped with closed dies to forge metal articles. Measuring and inspecting machine parts to ensure conformance to product specifications.

fields.name: Fashion Designer
fields.description: Conceptualises, designs and develops clothing, accessories, footwear or other items of personal apparel using historical styles and contexts, contemporary and cultural trends, colour, material, decoration and the techniques and processes available for man
fields.tasks: Creating and visualising an idea and producing a design by hand or using computer-aided design (CAD). Keeping up to date with emerging fashion trends as well as general trends relating to fabrics, colours and shapes. Planning and developing clothing ranges. Working with other people in the design team, such as buyers and forecasters in developing new products. Liaising closely with sales, buying and production teams on an ongoing basis to ensure the item suits the customer, market and price. Understanding design from a technical perspective, i.e. producing patterns, toiles and technical specifications for designs. Sourcing, selecting and buying fabrics, trims, fastenings and embellishments. Developing a pattern that is cut and sewn into sample garments and supervising the making up of these, including fitting, detailing and adaptations. Overseeing production and negotiating with customers and suppliers. Managing the marketing, finances and other business activities of your company, if self-employed.

fields.name: Fast Food Cook
fields.description: Prepares a restricted range of foods in fast food establishments.
fields.tasks: Taking and receiving food and beverage orders, receiving payments from customers, and preparing food. Operating large-volume cooking equipment such as grills, deep-fat fryers or griddles. Cooking and packaging batches of food, such as hamburgers and fried chicken, which are prepared to order or kept warm until sold. Preparing specialty foods such as pizzas, fish and chips, toasted sandwiches, following specific methods that require a short preparation time. Preparing and serving beverages such as coffee and fountain drinks. Preparing pre-mixed ingredients such as pancake or waffle batters. Washing, cutting, and preparing foods designated for cooking. Ordering and taking delivery of supplies. Maintaining sanitation, health and safety standards in work areas, and verifying that prepared food meets the requirements for quality and quantity. Cleaning, stocking and restocking workstations, cooking surfaces, utensils and display cases.

fields.name: Fellmonger
fields.description: Removes hair or wool from hides in preparation for leather making.
fields.tasks: Scraping particles of flesh, fat or protective tissue from skins or pelts to clean and then soften them. Removing hair from skin or hides by soaking them in lime water. Washing and drying the wool. Preparing hides by curing them with salt. Removing wrinkles and setting grains on wet hide or skin. Preparing bark and myrobalan liquor for treating hides or skins. Seasoning leather by applying chemical solution or oil evenly on surface by hand brush and allowing it to dry in the open. Removing any remaining protein from surfaces of the skins or hides by using a bating process. Dealing in prepared fells or skins.

fields.name: Fencer
fields.description: Erects and repairs fences and gates.
fields.tasks: Constructing and repairing barriers, retaining walls, trellises and other types of fences, walls and gates. Aligning fencing posts using ground lines or by sighting. Verifying vertical alignment of fencing posts using plumb bobs or spirit levels. Digging holes for fence posts manually or using a posthole digger, erecting posts and cementing them into place. Attaching rails or tension wires along bottoms of posts to form fencing frames. Attaching fence rail supports to fence posts using hammers and pliers. Completing top fence rails of metal fences by connecting tube sections using metal sleeves. Assembling and fastening gates into position using hand tools. Sliding vibracrete slabs into position between erected posts.

fields.name: FET College Principal
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the educational, training and administrative aspects of an fet college.
fields.tasks: Controlling the administrative operations of a FET College including budgeting, report preparation, and expenditure. Controlling the selection, training and supervision of staff. Determining educational programs based on frameworks established by education authorities and governing bodies. Developing and enforcing a disciplinary code to create a safe and conducive environment for learners and lecturers. Directing administrative and clerical activities concerning learner admissions and educational services. Evaluating the work of lecturers by visiting classrooms, observing teaching methods, reviewing instructional objectives and examining learning materials. Implementing systems and procedures to monitor college performance and learner enrolments. Organising and implementing methods of raising additional funds in conjunction with learners, community groups and sponsors. Promoting the educational program, and representing the service or institution in the wider community. Providing leadership and guidance to teaching, academic and administrative staff as well as to learners.

fields.name: Fibre Preparing, Spinning and Winding Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates and monitors machines which prepare fibres, and spin, double, twist and wind yarn and thread from natural textile fibres.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines for tearing woollen rags into fibre. Operating and monitoring machines for cleaning and turning woollen yarn waste into fluffed wool. Operating and monitoring machines which combine textile fibres into uniform blends. Operating and monitoring machines which clean and fluff textile fibres, transform them into sliver, comb them into sliver for first drawing, combine slivers into sliver lap or sliver laps into ribbon lap. Operating draw frame (machine) having number of drawing sets, each set combining several slivers into one of nearly same weight and thickness as any of original sliver. Operating and monitoring machines which spin thread and yarn from roving, wind two or more threads onto bobbin, twist two or more strands of yarn or thread into single strands of yarn to increase strength, smoothness and/or uniformity of yarn, or wind yarn.

fields.name: Fibre-cement Moulder
fields.description: Operates machines to manufacture moulded fibre cement.
fields.tasks: Making shuttering or assembling prefabricated forms for moulding concrete.

fields.name: Fibrous Plasterer
fields.description: Applies and fixes plasterboard partitions, suspended ceilings, fire rating systems, acoustic tiles, and composite wall linings to buildings.
fields.tasks: Measuring room walls in order to lay out plasterboard, install moisture barriers, fire-rated wall barriers or acoustic walls. Positioning panels and fastening them to walls and ceilings of commercial and domestic buildings. Preparing corner beading panel mouldings, ceiling centres and other plaster fittings. Covering joins and nail holes with wet plaster or sealing compounds and smoothing them using wet brushes and sand paper. Spraying fibrous materials over surfaces to be covered. Making and installing decorative plaster fixtures of fibrous plaster. Fixing fire rating systems or acoustic tiles to buildings. Setting up and maintaining equipment as required.

fields.name: Field Vegetable Farmer
fields.description: Plans, organises and performs farming operations to grow field vegetables.
fields.tasks: Monitoring market activity and conditions, determining types and quantities of crops to be grown, and planning and coordinating production accordingly. Preparing soil by hand or machine, and spreading fertilizers and manure. Selecting and sowing seeds, and planting seedlings. Maintaining crops by cultivating soil, by transplanting, pruning or thinning plants, and by setting up and operating irrigation equipment. Controlling weeds, pests and diseases, by applying herbicides and pesticides. Harvesting crops and destroying diseased or superfluous crops.

fields.name: Filing or Registry Clerk
fields.description: Processes and handles information and documents to maintain access to and security of database and record management systems.
fields.tasks: Keeping records of materials filed or removed, using logbooks or computer databases. Tracking materials removed from files to ensure that borrowed files are returned. Collecting materials to be filed from departments or employees. Classifying data according to criteria such as content, purpose, or chronological, alphabetical or numerical order. Finding and retrieving information from files in response to requests from authorised users. Scanning or reading materials to determine how and where they should be classified or filed. Creating new records as required or adding new material to existing records. Placing materials into storage units, according to classification and identification information. Assigning and recording or stamping identification numbers or codes to index materials for filing.   Performing general clerical office duties.

fields.name: Filling Line Operator
fields.description: Fills and seals containers with products such as food, beverages, paints, oils and lotions, and packages the filled containers.
fields.tasks: Operating machines that fill and seal tubes, bottles, cans, boxes, bags and other containers with products such as food, beverages, paints, oils and lotions. Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of raw materials and in-process products into the machines. Controlling process start-up and shut-down, troubleshooting and monitoring outside process equipment. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of machine and verify specified processing conditions. Analysing sample products, performing tests, recording data and writing production logs. Informing supervisors if machine requires adjustment, maintenance or repair.

fields.name: Film and Television Production Manager
fields.description: Plans, administers and reviews activities concerned with the production of films or television programs.
fields.tasks: Choosing writers, studying scripts to determine artistic interpretation, and instructing actors on acting methods.      Creating, planning, videotaping and editing video.      Engaging and supervising all technical personnel, and determining the treatment, scope and scheduling of production.      Maintaining production archives and negotiating royalties.      Planning, organising and controlling the various stages and scheduling involved in the production of presentations, motion pictures, and television shows.      Supervising the positioning of scenery, props and lighting and sound equipment.

fields.name: Film and Video Editor
fields.description: Makes and implements editorial decisions regarding mood, pace and climax of films, television programs, video productions or commercials.
fields.tasks: Choosing writers and studying scripts to determine the artistic interpretation.   Creating, planning, videotaping and editing films and videos.   Planning, organising and controlling the various stages and schedules involved in the production of presentations, motion pictures, and television shows.   Supervising the positioning of scenery, props and lighting and sound equipment.     Instructing actors on relevant acting methods.     Engaging and supervising all technical personnel, and determining the treatment, scope and scheduling of production.      Maintaining production archives and negotiating royalties.

fields.name: Film Technician
fields.description: Performs work involved in developing and processing photographic images from film or digital media. May perform precision tasks such as editing photographic negatives and prints.
fields.tasks: Converting archive films to digital master or video format files using specialist equipment and computer software. Preparing copies of film for use by broadcasting companies or private clients. Using digital asset management including company software and hardware systems. Looking after and restoring old nitrate or acetate film stock, such as mending tears or removing dirt. Preparing film to be sent for copying to media laboratories, making sure they are returned in the same condition. Using computer graphics software to remove blemishes, such as dust and scratches, or adjust colour on digital film copies. Doing routine tasks such as editing batches of clips for online use or copying and labelling DVDs and tapes. Writing reports on the repairs carried out, and maintaining databases and filing records.

fields.name: Finance Broker
fields.description: Operates as an independent agent in the course of financial negotiations and arranges loans of money on behalf of other persons.
fields.tasks: Contacting prospective customers to present information and explain available services. Determining customers' financial services needs and preparing proposals to sell services that address these needs. Selling financial services such as trusts, investments, or checking processing services. Preparing forms or agreements to complete sales. Reviewing business trends to advise customers regarding expected fluctuations. Developing prospects from current commercial customers, referral leads, or sales or trade meetings. Evaluating costs and revenue of agreements to determine continued profitability.

fields.name: Finance Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the financial and accounting activities within an organisation.
fields.tasks: Assessing the financial situation of the enterprise or organization, preparing budgets and overseeing financial operations. Consulting with the chief executive and with managers of other departments or sections. Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures. Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources. Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff. Planning and directing daily operations. Planning, directing and coordinating the financial operations of an enterprise or organization. Representing the enterprise or organisation in dealings with outside bodies.

fields.name: Financial Accountant
fields.description: Contributes to the development and implementation of the organisation's accounting systems, policies and procedures.
fields.tasks: Categorising, measuring and documenting the transactions of an organisation. Preparing performance reports including profit and loss statements, balance sheets and cash flow statements. Preparing financial reports that paint an accurate picture of an organisation’s performance for external users including shareholders, creditors and taxing agencies. Exploring any factors that alter the intrinsic risk of investment in the organisation for shareholders or creditors.

fields.name: Financial Investment Advisor
fields.description: Develops and implements financial plans for individuals and organisations, and advises on investment strategies and their taxation implications, securities, insurance, pension plans and real estate.
fields.tasks: Interviewing prospective clients to determine financial status and objectives, discussing financial options and developing financial plans and investment strategies. Monitoring investment performance and reviewing and revising investment plans based on modified needs and changes in markets. Recommending and arranging insurance cover for clients. Arranging to buy and sell stocks and bonds for clients. Advising on investment strategies, sources of funds and the distribution of earnings. Setting financial objectives and developing and implementing strategies for achieving the financial objectives. Managing funds raised from personal superannuation savings policies and unit trusts. Adhering to financial compliance and operational procedures.

fields.name: Financial Markets Business Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the general operational activities of a stock broking or similar financial institution.
fields.tasks: Managing clients’ money and investments by buying and selling stocks listed on the stock market. Staying up-to-date on the latest tax laws, market research and financial news to inform investment decisions and provide clients with the best return. Recruiting customers by calling and following up with prospective clients. Providing existing and prospective clients with seminars or workshops on the value and opportunities of investment. Building and maintaining a relationship of trust with clients by them weekly or monthly to update them on their portfolio or new investment opportunities. Cultivating a relationship with other industry professionals. Maintaining records of all financial transactions undertaken.

fields.name: Financial Markets Practitioner
fields.description: Analyses individual securities, industries and the economy, provides investment advice to clients in respect of securities and other financial instruments and executes transactions in securities with/on behalf of clients and/or for an exchange member.
fields.tasks: Obtaining information on securities and market conditions. Analysing individual securities, industries and the economy. Identifying the profile and related investment needs of the client. Providing investment advice to clients in respect of securities and other financial instruments. Executing transactions in securities with or on behalf of clients (trading and settlement of transactions).

fields.name: Financial Markets Settlement Officer
fields.description: Manages an exchange member’s or a central securities depository participant (CSDP) obligations in relation to the settlement of transactions in securities effected by the exchange member and its clients or the clients of a CSDP.
fields.tasks: Operating within the rules and directives of the financial markets exchanges. Analysing and evaluating financial markets. Offering investment advice to clients based on their needs. Advising on or negotiating terms for loans and placement of stocks and bonds in the financial market to raise capital for customers. Informing prospective customers about market conditions and prospects. Processing settlements applicable to financial markets.

fields.name: Fire Fighter
fields.description: Responds to fire alarms and emergency calls, controls and extinguishes fires, and protects life and property.
fields.tasks: Controlling and extinguishing fires using manual and power equipment and fire-fighting chemicals.      Fighting special types of fires in industrial establishments and using special equipment.      Informing the public about fire prevention.      Preventing or limiting the spread of dangerous substances in case of fires or other accidents.      Rescuing people from burning buildings and accident sites and those trapped in dangerous situations.      Responding to fire alarms and other calls for assistance, such as automobile and industrial accidents, bomb threats and other emergencies.

fields.name: Fire Investigator
fields.description: Conducts investigations to determine causes of fires and explosions.
fields.tasks: Examining fire sites and collect evidence such as glass, metal fragments, charred wood, and accelerant residue for use in determining the cause of a fire. Analysing evidence and other information to determine probable cause of fire or explosion. Testifying in court cases involving fires, suspected arson, and false alarms. Preparing  and maintaining reports of investigation results, and records of convicted arsonists and arson suspects. Testing sites and materials to establish facts, such as burn patterns and flash points of materials, using test equipment.

fields.name: Fire Services Plumber
fields.description: Installs, tests and repairs fire services equipment.
fields.tasks: Installing fire protection equipment and sprinkler systems mostly in commercial construction. Selecting materials according to specifications. Measuring and marking pipes for cutting or threading. Using equipment such as ladders and scaffolding to perform installations. Attaching pipes to walls and structures using brackets, clamps, tools, or welding equipment. Testing equipment as required by local plumbing regulations. Removing and replacing worn components of fire services equipment systems.

fields.name: First Aid Attendant
fields.description: Renders immediate or temporary treatment of a victim of sudden injury/illness.
fields.tasks: Providing immediate or temporary treatment of a victim of sudden injury or illness. Rendering first aid and subsequent treatments to injured or ill employees at an industrial plant, commercial establishment, mine or construction site. Sterilising, disinfecting and bandaging minor cuts and burns. Stabilising broken limbs until medical attention is obtained. Applying artificial respiration or administering oxygen in cases of suffocation or choking. Administering medications such as aspirin or antiseptic solution to relieve pain or prevent infection until the patient can receive professional medical care. Assists paramedics or doctors during emergency situations.

fields.name: Fish or Seafood Packer
fields.description: Weighs, wraps, seals and labels fish and other seafood products.
fields.tasks: Packing various cleaned fish, cuts of fish and seafood for distribution or sale. Identifying correct containers and moisture-absorbing sheets to be used. Packing the fish or seafood in the correct manner according to packing standards. Wrapping protective material around fish and seafood, or placing them in sealing bags and containers, and attaching pre-printed labels. Unpacking and displaying whole fish on beds of ice or in display fridges for customers to choose from. Packing the prepared fish whole or filleting it according to the customer's preferences. Weighing and labelling the packed fish. Stacking the packs in crates or on palates for distribution. Maintaining Health and Food Safety standards throughout the packing process.  Recording product, packaging, and order information on specified forms and records.

fields.name: Fisheries Officer
fields.description: Inspects fishing vessels, gear, licenses and catches to ensure that fisheries laws and regulations are obeyed.
fields.tasks: Enforcing compliance with fishing regulations promulgated under the Marine Living Resources Act (MLRA) of South Africa (Act no. 18, 1998). Handling fish specimens. Identifying species of marine and estuarine fish by using scientific identification keys regarding species, classification and biological characteristics. Reporting on fishing activities, including methods used, catches and conservation practices. Functioning as a shore or ship based scientific observer in the inshore and coastal fisheries. Determining the position of a vessel or landing site using charts and electronic navigation aids. Developing a set of values and ethics regarding conservation and environmental issues.

fields.name: Fishing Hand
fields.description: Catches fish and shellfish using nets, pots, lines and traps in ocean and inland waters.
fields.tasks: Attaching nets, slings, hooks, blades and/or lifting devices to cables, booms, hoists and/or dredges. Connecting accessories such as floats, weights, flags, lights or markers to nets, lines or traps. Placing fishing equipment into water and anchoring or towing equipment according to the fishing method used.  Pulling and guiding nets, traps and lines onto vessels, by hand or by using hoisting equipment. Removing catches from fishing equipment and measuring them to ensure compliance with legal size limits. Signalling other workers to move, hoist and position catch loads. Sorting, packing and storing the catch in holds with salt and ice. Loading and unloading fishing vessel equipment and supplies by hand or by using hoisting equipment. Washing decks, conveyors, knives and other equipment. Performing minor repairs on fishing equipment.

fields.name: Fishmonger
fields.description: Scales, cleans, fillets, cuts, shells, grades and packages fish and shellfish.
fields.tasks: Finding reliable sources for fish and seafood. Gutting and cleaning fish and seafood. De-scaling fish and removing bones. Cutting fish into smaller pieces. Cleaning tools used on a regular basis. Ensuring that fish and seafood are stored properly at all times. Arranging displays of fish in display counters. Dressing seafood products. Reviewing stock on a regular basis. Taking deliveries of fresh fish and seafood and placing orders.

fields.name: Fitness Centre Manager
fields.description: Organises, controls and promotes the activities, facilities and resources of a fitness centre. May coach, instruct and train clients.
fields.tasks: Planning and organising the range and mix of entertainment, sports and fitness programmes to be offered by the centre.     Planning and directing daily operations.   Advising on the facilities available and promoting publicity in relation to sports and fitness events and activities.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.   Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of staff.   Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.      Ensuring that facilities are kept clean and in good condition.   Checking and keeping custody of all cash receipts and making regular stock checks.

fields.name: Fitness Instructor
fields.description: Directs, instructs and guides an individual or group in the pursuit of physical fitness and well-being.
fields.tasks: Planning and presenting fitness classes and activities.      Demonstrating and teaching body movements, concepts and skills used in fitness routines in classes or to individuals.      Evaluating and monitoring clients’ physical abilities.      Explaining and enforcing safety procedures, rules and regulations during exercises.      Instructing clients in the use of exercise and fitness equipment.      Monitoring fitness activities to ensure safety and provide emergency or first aid assistance when required.

fields.name: Fitter and Turner
fields.description: Fits, assembles, grinds and shapes metal parts and sub-assemblies to fabricate production machines and other equipment.
fields.tasks: Setting one or more types of machine tool for production of metal articles in standardised series. Operating and monitoring metalworking machines, such as lathes, milling, and planning, boring, drilling, grinding or honing machines, including multi-purpose numerically controlled metalworking machines. Performing similar tasks when machining plastics and other metal substitutes. Observing machine operations to detect work piece defects or machine malfunctions, adjusting machines as necessary. Inspecting work pieces for defects, and measuring work pieces to determine accuracy of machine operation, using rules, templates, or other measuring instruments. Changing worn machine accessories, such as cutting tools and brushes, using hand tools.

fields.name: Fitter-welder
fields.description: Fits, assembles and welds metal parts and sub-assemblies to fabricate production machines, other equipment and pipe systems.
fields.tasks: Positioning parts and assemblies according to specifications, using straightedge, combination square, callipers, and ruler. Welding components and assemblies, using electric, gas, arc, or other welding equipment. Cutting work piece, using powered saws, hand shears, or chipping knife. Examining work pieces for defects and measuring work pieces with straight edges or templates to ensure conformance with specifications. Melting lead bar, wire, or scrap to add lead to joint or to extrude melted scrap into reusable form. Installing or repairing equipment, such as lead pipes, valves, floors, and tank linings. Observing tests on welded surfaces, such as hydrostatic, x-ray, and dimension tolerance to evaluate weld quality and conformance to specifications. Monitoring the fitting, burning, and welding processes to avoid overheating of parts or warping, shrinking, distortion, or expansion of material.

fields.name: Fleet Manager
fields.description: Organises the buying, selling and maintenance of vehicles and coordinates the usage thereof.
fields.tasks: Determining, implementing and monitoring purchasing, storage and distribution strategies, policies and plans.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Liaising with other departments and customers concerning requirements for outward goods and associated forwarding transportation.      Monitoring and reviewing storage and inventory systems to meet supply requirements and control stock levels.      Negotiating contracts with suppliers to meet quality, cost and delivery requirements.      Operating recording systems to track all movements of goods, and ensuring re-ordering and re-stocking at optimal times.      Overseeing the recording of purchase, storage and distribution transactions.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.

fields.name: Flight Attendant
fields.description: Provides services for the safety and comfort of aircraft passengers.
fields.tasks: Conducting pre-flight cabin checks. Assisting with Standard Operating Procedures (Safety, Security and Service). Assessing the passenger cabin, ensuring that there are adequate supplies of food, beverages, and blankets. Checking boarding passes and directing passengers to seats and showing passengers where to store their coats and carry-on bags. Advising passengers of safety regulations and checking to see that passengers' seat belts are fastened, seats are in the upright position, and bags are properly stowed prior to take off. Serving meals and drinks. Helping passengers in the event of an emergency. Providing first aid treatment and assisting sick passengers. Anticipating and providing assistance to passengers needing special attention, including unaccompanied children, parents with infants, people with disability, the elderly. Taking action in the event of decompression, turbulence, mechanical malfunction or unlawful acts by passengers. Preparing for emergency landings and the evacuation of passengers.

fields.name: Flight Engineer
fields.description: Monitors the mechanical performance of an aircraft in flight.
fields.tasks: Flying and navigating aircraft in accordance with established control and operating procedures. Preparing and submitting flight plan or examining standard flight plan. Controlling the operation of mechanical, electrical and electronic equipment and ensuring that all instruments and controls work properly. Applying knowledge of principles and practices of flying in order to identify and solve problems arising in the course of their work. Examining maintenance records and conducting inspections to ensure that aircraft are mechanically sound, maintenance has been performed and that all equipment is operational. Signing necessary certificates and maintaining official records of flight. Obtaining briefings and clearances before flights and maintaining contact with air traffic or flight control during flight.

fields.name: Floor Finisher
fields.description: Measures, cuts, installs and repairs soft and resilient floor coverings.
fields.tasks: Preparing floor areas for covering. Measuring, cutting and laying floor covering materials on floors according to design and other specifications. Installing floor coverings according to specifications. Sanding floor edges using disk-type sanders and areas inaccessible to sanders using sandpaper. Applying filler compound and coats of finish to floors in order to seal wood. Removing excess glue from joints using knives, scrapers, or wood chisels. Inspecting floors for smoothness. Maintaining and repairing flooring and floor covers.

fields.name: Florist
fields.description: Prepares and sells floral arrangements and flowers.
fields.tasks: Obtaining orders from customers and liaising with customers regarding the floral arrangement requirements for specific venues or events. Selecting and buying flowers from flower markets, wholesalers, gardeners and horticultural specialists. Designing and creating arrangements of flowers in wreaths, bouquets, vases and centrepiece elements. Caring for flowers and ensuring that they last as long as possible. Packaging flowers and floral arrangements and preparing them to be transported to customers. Delivering flowers and displays to customers. Managing a florist shop.

fields.name: Flying Instructor
fields.description: Teaches the theory and practical skills of flying aircraft.
fields.tasks: Flying and navigating aircraft in accordance with established control and operating procedures. Preparing and submitting flight plan or examining standard flight plan. Controlling the operation of mechanical, electrical and electronic equipment and ensuring that all instruments and controls work properly. Applying knowledge of principles and practices of flying in order to identify and solve problems arising in the course of their work. Examining maintenance records and conducting inspections to ensure that aircraft are mechanically sound, maintenance has been performed and that all equipment is operational. Signing necessary certificates and maintaining official records of flight. Obtaining briefings and clearances before flights and maintaining contact with air traffic or flight control during flight.

fields.name: Foiling Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, maintains and operates a coating machine to apply various foil finishes.
fields.tasks: Setting up machines to product specifications. Examining job orders to determine quantities, stock specifications and special instructions. Operating machines. Conducting regular inspections and maintenance of machines.

fields.name: Folding Machine Operator (Paper Products)
fields.description: Sets up, maintains and operates a variety of folding machines to fold various styles and formats of paper products.
fields.tasks: Setting up paper-product folding machines according to product specifications. Examining job orders to determine the quantities to be folded, stock specifications and any special instructions. Operating paper-product folding machines. Conducting regular inspections and maintenance of folding machines. Checking the quality and conformance to specifications of products. Keeping records of products produced.

fields.name: Food and Beverage Factory Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in manufacturing food and beverages.
fields.tasks: Conveying goods, material, and equipment. Loading and unloading vehicles, trucks and trolleys. Clearing machine blockages, cleaning machinery, equipment and tools. Carrying out manual sorting of products or components.

fields.name: Food and Beverage Manufacturing Process Controller
fields.description: Monitors and controls food and beverage automated or semi-automated production processes.
fields.tasks: Controlling quality and compliance to specification and order requirement. Filling orders, maintaining buffer stock levels and achieving production targets. Rotating stock and stock management. Taking stock monthly. Ensuring product yields remain within specification. Managing the process of each product line. Solving problems to ensure the continuous running of the production line. Supervising the cleaning of the entire production area at the end of each shift.

fields.name: Food and Beverage Scientist
fields.description: Studies the physical and chemical properties of food and beverages and develops new and improved food and beverage products, and sets standards for producing, packaging and marketing food and beverages.
fields.tasks: Applying the findings of research in food processing to the development and improvement of products. Scientifically studying and analysing food substances and components and the changes it undergoes during various processes. Researching preservation techniques, food quality and deterioration and developing new products. Preparing scientific reports for research into food nutrition.

fields.name: Food and Beverage Technician
fields.description: Tests new and existing engineering technologies relating to agricultural, food or beverage products, analyses test data and carries out technical functions in support of food and beverage scientists.
fields.tasks: Collecting data and providing technical assistance regarding efficient, safe and economic utilisation of personnel, material and equipment; methods of work and sequence of operations and supervision of their implementation; and efficient layout of plant. Aiding in the identification of potential hazards and introducing safety procedures and devices.

fields.name: Food Service Counter Attendant
fields.description: Serves customers at food counters and finish preparation of simple food items in restaurants, cafes, hotels, fast food outlets, cafeterias, hospitals and other settings.
fields.tasks: Serving food to customers at counters. Ascertaining the products desired by the customer, assisting customer in making a choice and taking orders. Cleaning, peeling, slicing and trimming foodstuffs using manual and electric appliances. Preparing simple food items and reheating prepared meals. Portioning and wrapping food or placing it directly on plates for service to patrons. Packaging take-away food. Stocking refrigerators, salad and buffet bars and keeping records of the quantities of food used. Receiving payment for food items purchased.

fields.name: Food Taster / Grader
fields.description: Tastes samples of food or beverages to determine palatability of product or to prepare blending formulas.
fields.tasks: Inspecting, testing, tasting and smelling agricultural products, food and beverages at various stages of processing. Determining quality, acceptability to consumer tastes and approximate value of products and grading them into appropriate classes. Discarding inferior products. Recording the grade and/or identification numbers on tags, receiving, or sales sheets. Weighing and measuring products.

fields.name: Food Trade Assistant
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in support of cooks, chefs and butchers.
fields.tasks: Cleaning kitchens, food preparation areas and service areas. Assisting cooks and chefs in preparation of food by washing, peeling, chopping, cutting up measuring and mixing ingredients. Assembling dishes for service. Unpacking and storing supplies in refrigerators, cupboards and other storage areas. Washing dishes and cooking utensils and putting them away. Checking, transferring, weighing and storing supplies in refrigerators, cupboards and other storage areas. Preparing, cooking, toasting and heating simple food items.

fields.name: Footballer
fields.description: Plays football professionally in competitions. This occupation requires high levels of physical fitness, sporting ability and personal commitment as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications or experience.
fields.tasks: Adhering to the rules and regulations associated with football. Participating in regular practice and training sessions and undertaking training to maintain the required standard of fitness and skill. Maintaining a high degree of expertise in football. Assessing other competitors and conditions at venues. Deciding on strategies in consultation with coaches and other team members. Competing in football games. Undertaking sports promotional activities and media interviews.

fields.name: Footwear and Leather Factory Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in manufacturing footwear, delivering materials to machines, and inspecting and finishing completed footwear; tanning and finishing leather, hide and skin such as fleshing, laying out for classing and drying, arranging heaters and s
fields.tasks: Delivering materials and components to machines. Inspecting and finishing completed footwear. Applying leather curing, tanning, re-tanning, finishing and cutting practices.  Delivering, collecting and moving necessary equipment. Arranging equipment as per requirements. Assisting in any other routine tasks in leather production and footwear manufacturing.

fields.name: Footwear Bottom Stock Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and operates footwear bottom stock machinery and equipment.
fields.tasks: Lifting and loading products into machines that are necessary to create footwear. Preparing machines by selecting and installing attachments and components for specific functions. Loading drums with hides and skins and dyeing and tanning solutions. Starting machines and monitoring operation to detect faults and ensure effectiveness of operation. Carrying out foundation footwear operations safely and at a rate which maintains work flow and meets production targets. Checking for any imperfections, dust or contaminations. Regulating machinery to create quality materials.

fields.name: Footwear Closing Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and operates footwear sewing or closing machines.
fields.tasks: Preparing machines by selecting and installing attachments and components for specific tasks. Starting machines and monitoring operations to detect faults and ensure effectiveness of operation. Preparing and stitching together pieces of leather to form the upper (top material side of the shoe). Regulating machinery to create quality materials.
