Operating and monitoring machines which edge, polish or apply ornaments. Examining finished products for defects and variations, reporting faults in machines and carrying out quality control procedures.

fields.name: Footwear Designer
fields.description: Conceptualises, designs and develops footwear and related products for manufacture and prepare designs and specifications of products for mass, batch and one-off production.
fields.tasks: Harmonizing aesthetic considerations with technical, functional, ecological and production requirements. Preparing sketches, diagrams, illustrations, plans, samples and models to communicate design concepts. Negotiating design solutions with clients, management, and sales and manufacturing staff. Selecting, specifying and recommending functional and aesthetic materials, production methods and finishes for manufacture. Detailing and documenting the selected design for production. Preparing and commissioning prototypes and samples.

fields.name: Footwear Finishing Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and operates footwear finishing machinery and equipment.
fields.tasks: Performing finishing tasks in the footwear production process. Using hand equipment or machines to complete the final touches. Placing the labels onto shoes. Inserting laces into shoes. Cleaning shoes and putting on its relevant surface finishing. Boxing completed shoes in pairs.

fields.name: Footwear Lasting Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and operates footwear lasting machinery and equipment.
fields.tasks: Preparing and setting up footwear lasting machinery and equipment. Pulling the footwear ‘upper’ over the last to allow it to take shape. Operating machinery to bring together and assemble various components of footwear. Monitoring operations to detect faults and to ensure the effectiveness of operations. Attaching the footwear sole to the upper and finishing off the sole as necessary. Removing the last from the completed shoe.

fields.name: Footwear Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Prepares, sets up, operates and monitors textile and footwear manufacturing machinery and equipment.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines which mark patterns and cut shoe parts. Operating and monitoring machines which sew shoe parts together, or edge, polish, or apply ornaments and perform finishing tasks.

fields.name: Forensic Accountant
fields.description: Examines financial records to detect and deter fraud and white collar crime.
fields.tasks: Interpreting financial evidence. Tracking and analysing data to find missing funds, trace illegal business activities and identify fraud. Presenting evidence and interpreting, summarising and presenting complex financial and business related issues in a manner which is both understandable and properly supported by evidence. Developing computerised applications to assist in the analysis and presentation of financial evidence. Communicating findings in the form of reports, exhibits and collections of documents. Assisting in legal proceedings, including testifying in court as an expert witness and preparing visual aids to support trial evidence.

fields.name: Forensic Technician (Biology, Toxicology)
fields.description: Provides technical support to forensic scientists by collecting and investigating evidence and preparing documents, charts, photographs, tables, and reports on findings.
fields.tasks: Providing technical support to forensic scientists by collecting and investigating evidence and preparing documents, charts, photographs, tables, and reports on findings. Collecting evidence from crime scenes, storing it in conditions that preserve its integrity, keep records and prepare reports detailing findings, investigative methods, and laboratory techniques. Using chemicals or other substances to examine latent fingerprint evidence and compare developed prints to those of known persons in databases. Taking photographs of evidence, visit morgues, examine scenes of crimes, or contact other sources to obtain evidence or information to be used in investigations. Collecting  impressions of dust from surfaces to obtain and identify fingerprints, reconstruct crime scenes to determine relationships among pieces of evidence and operate and maintain laboratory equipment and apparatus. Testifying in court about investigative or analytical methods or findings.

fields.name: Forest and Conservation Workers
fields.description: Develops, maintains, or protects areas such as forests, forested areas, woodlands, wetlands, and rangelands through such activities as raising and transporting seedlings; combating insects, pests, and diseases harmful to plant life; and building structures to control water, erosion, and leaching of soil.
fields.tasks: Assessing sites for reforestation, selecting seedlings and planting trees using manual planting tools and establishing and caring for forest stands.   Collecting seed cones, pruning trees, assisting in planting surveys and marking trees for subsequent operations.   Controlling weeds and undergrowth in regenerating forest stands using manual tools and chemicals.   Keeping watch to detect forest fires, participating in firefighting operations, completing firefighting reports and maintaining firefighting equipment.

fields.name: Forester / Forest Scientist
fields.description: Studies, develops and manages forest areas to maintain commercial and recreational uses, conserve flora and fauna, and protect against fire, pests and diseases.
fields.tasks: Monitoring forestry activities to assure adherence to government regulations. Developing short- and long-term plans for management of forest lands and forest resources. Studying different tree species' classification, life history, light and soil requirements, adaptation to new environmental conditions and resistance to disease and insects. Analysing the effect of forest conditions on tree growth rates and tree species prevalence and the yield, duration, seed production, growth viability, and germination of different species. Selecting and preparing sites for new trees, using controlled burning, bulldozers, or herbicides to clear weeds, brush, and logging debris. Planning and supervising forestry projects, such as determining the type, number and placement of trees to be planted, managing tree nurseries, thinning forest and monitoring growth of new seedlings. Determining methods of cutting and removing timber with minimum waste and environmental damage. Planning and implementing projects for conservation of wildlife habitats and soil and water quality. Negotiating terms and conditions of agreements and contracts for forest harvesting, forest management and leasing of forest lands.

fields.name: Forestry Research Technician
fields.description: Performs tests and experiments, and provides technical support to assist forestry scientists and technologists in areas such as research, production, servicing and marketing.
fields.tasks: Designing and setting in motion research programmes relating to tree propagation, treatment of diseases, yield increase of forests, industrial and commercial applications of forestry products and by-products.   Writing and presenting research results in an understandable format, including suggesting a pathway to achieving desired results by the implementing of research results.

fields.name: Forestry Technician
fields.description: Performs tests and experiments, and provides technical support to assist forestry scientists and technologists in areas such as research, production, servicing and marketing.
fields.tasks: Managing forest protection activities including fire control, fire crew training, and coordination of fire detection and public education programs. Training and leading forest and conservation workers in seasonal activities, such as planting tree seedlings, putting out forest fires and maintaining recreational facilities. Surveying, measuring and mapping access roads and forest areas such as burns, cut-over areas, experimental plots and timber sales sections. Selecting and marking trees for thinning or logging, drawing detailed plans that include access roads. Supervising forest nursery operations, timber harvesting, land use activities such as livestock grazing as well as disease or insect control programs. Monitoring activities of logging companies and contractors. Thinning and spacing trees and controling weeds and undergrowth, using manual tools and chemicals or supervising workers performing these tasks.

fields.name: Forestry Worker
fields.description: Assists with cultivating, maintaining and protecting forests.
fields.tasks: Assisting with maintaining forest facilities such as roads and campsites. Planting tree seedlings in specified patterns using mattocks, planting hoes or dibbles. Cutting out diseased, weak or undesirable trees. Pruning the limbs of young trees to deter knot growth, using handsaws, power saws and pruning tools. Assisting with felling trees, clearing brush from fire breaks and extinguishing flames and embers to suppress forest fires. Piling and clearing brush, limbs and other debris from roadsides, fire breaks and camping areas. Erecting signs and fences using posthole diggers, shovels or other hand tools. Cleaning kitchens and rest rooms, and replenishing firewood and other supplies at campsites or recreational facilities on forestry property.

fields.name: Forging Press Worker
fields.description: Forges bars, rods, ingots and plates of iron, steel or other metals.
fields.tasks: Reading work orders or blueprints to determine specified tolerances and sequences of operations for machine setup. Setting up and starting machines, and producing, measuring and inspecting sample workpeices to verify that setup and production conform to specifications. Operating presses and forging machines to perform hot or cold forging by flattening, straightening, bending, cutting, piercing, or other operations to taper, shape, or form metal. Turning handles or knobs to set pressures and depths of ram strokes and to synchronize machine operations. Selecting, aligning, and bolting positioning fixtures, stops and specified dies to rams and anvils, forging rolls, or presses and hammers. Trimming and compressing finished forgings to specified tolerances. Installing, adjusting, and removing dies as necessary, and synchronizing cams, forging hammers and stop guides using overhead cranes or other hoisting devices and hand tools. Observing operations to detect machine malfunctions. Repairing, maintaining, and replacing parts on machine dies and sharpening cutting tools and drill bits, using bench grinders.

fields.name: Forklift Driver
fields.description: Operates a forklift to move bulk materials, containers, crates, palletised goods, cartons and bales.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring lifting-truck and similar equipment to load and unload, transport, lift and stack goods and pallets in terminals, harbours, ware-houses, factories and other establishments.   Positioning lifting devices under, over, or around loaded pallets, skids and boxes and securing material or products for transport to designated areas.   Inspecting equipment to identify wear and damage.   Keeping records of work undertaken and breakdowns of forklifts.   Performing routine maintenance on forklifts and equipment.

fields.name: Forklift Mechanic
fields.description: Maintains, tests and repairs forklifts.
fields.tasks: Operating and inspecting machines or heavy equipment to diagnose defects. Overhauling and testing machines or equipment to ensure operating efficiency. Repairing, rewiring, and troubleshooting electrical systems. Fitting bearings to adjust, repair, or overhaul mobile mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic equipment. Examining parts for damage or excessive wear, using micrometers and gauges. Welding or soldering broken parts and structural members, using electric or gas welders and soldering tools. Adjusting and maintaining industrial machinery, using control and regulating devices.

fields.name: Fossil Power Plant Process Controller
fields.description: Provides technical support and services in the installation, operation and maintenance of fossil power plant processes, systems, facilities and equipment.
fields.tasks: Operating, monitoring and inspecting various types of energy generating power plants. Operating and controlling power generating systems and equipment including boilers, turbines, generators, condensers, and reactors in hydro, thermal, coal, oil, natural gas, and nuclear power plants to generate and distribute electrical power. Controlling start-up and shut-down of power plant equipment, controlling switching operations, regulating water levels and communicating with systems operators to regulate and coordinate transmission loads, frequency and line voltages. Taking readings from charts, meters and gauges at established intervals, troubleshooting and performing corrective action as necessary. Completing and maintaining station records, logs and reports, and communicating with other plant personnel to assess equipment operating status. Cleaning and maintaining equipment such as generators, boilers, turbines, pumps, and compressors in order to prevent equipment failure or deterioration.

fields.name: Foundational Phase School Teacher
fields.description: Teaches and coordinates a range of subjects from grade r - 3 within a prescribed curriculum to primary school students.
fields.tasks: Preparing daily and longer term lesson plans in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Instructing children individually and in groups, using various teaching methods and materials (e.g. computers, books, games), adapting to children’s varying needs. Maintaining discipline and good working habits in the classroom. Planning and conduct activities with the children such as sporting activities, concerts and excursions. Assigning and grading class work and homework. Preparing, administering, and grading tests and assignments to evaluate children’s progress. Observing and evaluating children’s performance and behaviour. Supervising children during classes and at other times in the school day, including the playground during breaks. Participating in staff meetings and other sessions, and conferring with other teachers concerning educational issues. Preparing for and attending parent meetings to discuss children’s progress and problems.

fields.name: Franchise Manager
fields.description: Maintains relationship with and support franchise partners.
fields.tasks: Providing consultative services to franchisees on all business related matters. Assisting in the development and implementation of programs that improve sales, financial controls and profitability. Providing structured feedback and effective coaching and counselling to franchisees on overall operational performance and developmental needs. Conducting business planning and sessions to support franchisees in goal setting and the execution of action items to achieve set goals.

fields.name: Freight Handler (Rail or Road)
fields.description: Loads and unloads freight trucks, containers and rail cars.
fields.tasks: Moving freight to and from storage or production areas, loading docks, trucks, containers, rail cars or containers, by hand or using trucks, tractors or other equipment. Sorting freight before loading and unloading it. Attaching slings, hooks, or other devices to lift cargo and guide loads in or out of freight trucks, containers and rail cars. Guiding loads being lifted to prevent swinging. Attaching identifying tags to containers or marking them with identifying information. Fastening protective devices such as bracing, padding or strapping, to prevent shifting or damage to items being transported. Recording the numbers of units handled or moved. Keeping the freight handling and storage areas clean.

fields.name: Fresh Produce Packing Controller
fields.description: Monitors and controls the operation, produce flow and equipment settings of treatment, sorting and packing of fresh produce.
fields.tasks: Handling the monitoring and management necessary to achieve food safety in perishable produce packing.

fields.name: Fruit and Vegetable Grader / Classer
fields.description: Grades, sorts, or classifies unprocessed fruit and vegetables by size, weight, colour, or condition.
fields.tasks: Sorting of fruit and vegetables according to type, colour, appearance and quality to ensure correct processing and usage. Discarding inferior fruit and vegetables. Grading fruit and vegetables into appropriate classes. Weighing and measuring fruit and vegetables or estimating weight, visually or by feel. Inspecting and testing fruit and vegetables at various stages of processing. Recording grade or identification numbers on tags or on shipping, receiving, or sales sheets.

fields.name: Fruit and Vegetable Processing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines and performs routine tasks to prepare canned and frozen food and vegetables, and make and package sauces, jams and juices.
fields.tasks: Mixing, pulping, grinding, blending and separating foodstuffs and liquids with churning, pressing, sieving, grinding and filtering equipment. Operating machinery to crush, mix, malt, cook and ferment grains and fruits to produce beer, wines, malt liquors, vinegar, yeast and related products.

fields.name: Fruit or Vegetable Preserver
fields.description: Preserves fruit and vegetables.
fields.tasks: Extracting juices from various fruits. Extracting oils from oil-bearing seeds, nuts or fruits. Cooking, salting or drying fruit, vegetables and related foods. Mixing and adding ingredients such as pectin, sugar, spices and vinegar to assist preservation and enhance texture, appearance and flavour. Transferring preserved foods to sterile jars, bottles or other containers.

fields.name: Funeral Director
fields.description: Plans and coordinates arrangements for funerals according to the wishes of the deceased or their relatives.
fields.tasks: Planning and coordinating arrangements for funerals according to the wishes of the deceased or their relatives. Informing the relatives about the necessary legal procedures and assisting the relatives in completing the required paperwork. Acquiring death certificates and cremation documents, and registering the death at the Department of Home Affairs. Obtaining all clearances and adhering to regulations associated with burials and cremations. Advising on and ordering memorials such as tombstones or plaques. Organising the details of the funeral service such the date, time and venue, flowers, funeral programme, transportation etc. and making arrangements with the cemetery or crematorium. Conducting the funeral service if required or arranging for the appropriate religious leader to do so. Preparing the body for viewing, burial or cremation. Managing the operational functions of the funeral home or branch.

fields.name: Furniture Finisher
fields.description: Applies finishes such as stain, lacquer, paint, oil and varnish to furniture, and polishes and waxes finished furniture surfaces.
fields.tasks: Examining furniture to determine the extent of damage or deterioration, and deciding on the best method for repair or restoration. Recommending woods, colours, finishes, and furniture styles, using knowledge of wood products, fashions, and styles. Removing old finishes and damaged or deteriorated parts, using hand tools, stripping tools, sandpaper, steel wool, abrasives, solvents or dip baths. Filling cracks, removing marks and imperfections, and repairing broken parts by using plastic or wood putty, glue, nails or screws. Selecting appropriate finishing ingredients such as paint, stain, lacquer, shellac, or varnish, depending on factors such as wood hardness and surface type. Mixing the ingredients to obtain the desired colours or shades. Brushing, spraying or hand-rubbing the ingredients, such as paint, oil, stain, or wax, onto and into wood grain and applying lacquer or other sealers. Painting metal surfaces electrostatically or using a spray gun or other painting equipment. Smoothing, shaping and touching up surfaces to prepare them for finishing, using sandpaper, pumice stones, steel wool, chisels, sanders, or grinders.

fields.name: Furniture Removalist
fields.description: Drives a removal van or truck to move household and office furniture and equipment between locations.
fields.tasks: Driving trucks, vans and other vehicles to move domestic and commercial furniture between different locations.   Examining the items to be moved, packing and labelling articles and keeping an inventory of items.   Assisting with or carrying out loading and unloading operations.   Ensuring goods are stowed and securely covered to prevent loss and damage during transport.   Estimating weights to comply with load limitations and ensuring the safe distribution of weights.   Determining the most appropriate routes for travel.   Performing routine vehicle maintenance such as regulating tyre pressure and adding petrol, oil and water, and cleaning vehicles as necessary.   Reporting delays or accidents and keeping a log book.

fields.name: Furrier
fields.description: Designs, makes, alters, restyles, and repairs fur garments.
fields.tasks: Conferring with customers to determine garment styles desired. Selecting and modifying commercial patterns to customers' and clothing manufacturers' specifications and fit. Estimating how much a garment will cost to make based on factors such as time and material requirements. Measuring customers using tape measures, and recording measurements. Selecting fabrics or fur pelts matching the desired size, colour, texture and quality of a garment. Cutting fabric according to garment patterns. Fitting and studying garments on customers to determine required alterations. Fitting and attaching padding and shaping materials. Reclaiming furs or skins from old coats, gluing fabric to interior of fur coats and trimming fur garments.

fields.name: Gallery or Museum Curator
fields.description: Plans and organises a museum or gallery collection by drafting collection policies and arranging acquisitions of pieces.
fields.tasks: Researching the origin, distribution and use of materials and objects of cultural and historical interest. Appraising and acquiring pieces of art or articles of historical value to build and develop an art or historical collection.     Directing or carrying out the preparation of indexes, bibliographies, microfilm copies and other reference aids to the collected material and making them available to users. Directing or undertaking classification and cataloguing of museum and art gallery collections.      Evaluating and preserving records for administrative, historical, legal, evidential and other purposes. Planning and implementing the computerised management of catalogues, indexes and other management information systems.      Organising exhibitions at museums and art galleries, publicising exhibits and arranging special displays for general, specialised or educational interest. Preparing scholarly papers and reports.

fields.name: Gallery or Museum Guide
fields.description: Answers inquires and directs and guides visitors in galleries or museums.
fields.tasks: Escorting visitors through places of interest such as museums, exhibitions, theme parks, factories and other industrial establishments.   Greeting and registering visitors and tour participants, and issuing any required identification badges or safety devices.      Distributing brochures, showing audio-visual presentations, and explaining procedures and operations at tour sites.      Describing and providing information on points of interest and exhibits and responding to questions.      Conducting educational activities for school children in a gallery or museum.      Monitoring visitors' activities to ensure compliance with establishment or tour regulations and safety practices.      Providing for the physical safety of groups, and performing activities such as providing first aid and directing emergency evacuations.

fields.name: Gallery or Museum Technician
fields.description: Prepares artworks, specimens and artefacts artworks for collections, and arranges and constructs gallery exhibits.
fields.tasks: Assisting in setting up lighting and display equipment.      Cataloguing printed and recorded material.      Designing and arranging exhibit furnishings, display cases and display areas.      Entering data into databases and editing computer records.      Mounting and preparing objects for display.      Operating audiovisual and reprographic equipment.      Ordering new library materials and maintaining library records and circulation systems.      Receiving, shipping, packing and unpacking exhibits.      Searching and verifying bibliographic data.

fields.name: Game Farm Worker / Assistant
fields.description: Performs routine tasks on a game farm such as feeding, catching, counting and moving game.
fields.tasks: Monitoring grazing and water supplies in different camps, and rotating animals between grazing areas as necessary. Patrolling camps to examine animals to detect illness, injury or disease and to check physical characteristics such as the rate of weight gain.   Patrolling grazing lands on horseback or on foot  to check numbers and recent births.   Assisting movement of game from one location to another by herding them on foot or by using trucks or carts.  Participating in game captures to fulfil orders placed by buyers.   Marking game to identify ownership using brands, tags, paint or tattoos.   Segregating animals according to weight, age, sex and/ or physical condition. Assisting in animal selection and capture for breeding programmes.   Cleaning holding pens and equipment. Inspecting, maintaining and repairing basic equipment, buildings, pens, yards and game fences.

fields.name: Game Farmer
fields.description: Plans, organises and performs farming operations to breed and raise game.
fields.tasks: Monitoring and examining animals to detect illness, injury, or disease, and to check physical condition such as rate of weight gain.   Monitoring market activity and conditions, determining kinds and amounts of products to produce, planning and coordinating production accordingly.   Performing duties related to animal reproduction, such as breeding, artificial insemination, and helping with animal births.   Promoting and marketing products, arranging the sale, purchase and transportation of stock, produce and supplies and maintaining and evaluating records of activities and transactions.   Raising, feeding and tending animals.   Slaughtering and skinning animals and preparing them for market.   Storing and carrying out some processing of produce.   Training and supervising workers in animal care procedures, maintenance duties, and health and safety precautions.

fields.name: Gaming Manager
fields.description: Plan, organise, direct, control and coordinate gaming operations. Formulate gaming policies for their area of responsibility.
fields.tasks: Planning and directing the daily operations of a gaming centre. Planning and organising the range and mix of entertainment programmes offered. Keeping abreast of new trends and developments in the gaming arena. Advising on the facilities available and promoting publicity in relation to events, shows and activities. Checking and keeping custody of all cash receipts and making regular stock checks. Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources. Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of gaming centre staff. Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations. Ensuring that facilities are kept clean and in good condition.

fields.name: Gaming Operations Compliance Officer
fields.description: Administers applications and monitors adherence to regulations governing gaming establishments.
fields.tasks: Working for the national and provincial boards that regulate and supervise gaming, gambling and other related activities. Ensuring that licensees adhere to the rules, regulations and conditions of their operating licences. Developing, initiating, maintaining and revising policies and procedures to prevent illegal, unethical or improper conduct within the gaming industry.   Providing guidance to management and employees of gaming operations by developing, reviewing and updating standards of conduct.   Responding to alleged violations of rules, regulations and policies.   Working jointly with other departments to direct compliance issues to the  appropriate channels for investigation and resolution.   Identifying potential areas of compliance vulnerability and risk.   Developing and implementing corrective action plans for the resolution of problematic issues, and providing guidance on how to deal with or avoid similar situations in the future.   Compiling reports on a regular basis.

fields.name: Gaming Worker
fields.description: Provides gaming services within a casino or other gambling establishment.
fields.tasks: Standing or sitting behind gaming tables and dispensing the appropriate number of cards or blocks to players. Operating table games such as roulette, poker or blackjack. Inspecting cards to ensure compliance with gaming standards, and checking players' bets. Comparing players' hands with the house, determining and announcing a winner and beginning a new game. Distributing winnings and collecting players' chips. Answering questions about game rules and variations. Watching for scammers or cheaters and taking necessary action. Notifying Pit Supervisors of any irregularities.

fields.name: Garden Workers
fields.description: Assists in cultivating and maintaining gardens.
fields.tasks: Maintaining gardens by watering, weeding and trimming plants and shrubs in flowerbeds. Mowing lawns and trimming grass around flowerbeds and paving. Pruning trees and trimming shrubs and hedges. Putting compost on flowerbeds and top dressing on lawns. Controlling garden pests by spraying. Assisting with planting and transplanting flowers, shrubs, trees and lawns. Assisting with propagating, planting and potting seedlings, bulbs and cuttings. Removing garden rubbish and maintaining a compost heap. Performing minor repairs to and painting garden fixtures, buildings and fences. Preparing garden sites and plots using hand tools and simple machines.

fields.name: Gas Cutter
fields.description: Cuts metal parts using gas flame.
fields.tasks: Analysing engineering drawings, blueprints, specifications, sketches or work orders and determining the required equipment settings. Preparing, positioning and securing workpieces, using hoists, cranes, wire, and banding machines or hand tools. Signalling crane operators to move large workpieces. Connecting and turning regulator valves to activate and adjust gas flow and pressure so that desired flames are obtained. Cutting metal pieces using a gas (oxy-acetylene) flame. Monitoring the cutting process to avoid overheating of parts or warping, shrinking, distortion, or expansion of material. Examining workpieces for defects and measuring workpieces with straight edges or templates to ensure conformance with specifications. Removing rough spots from workpieces, using portable grinders, hand files, or scrapers. Operating safety equipment and using safe work habits.

fields.name: Gas or Petroleum Controller
fields.description: Operates and monitors plants and adjust and maintain processing units and equipment which pump, refine, distil and treat petroleum, petroleum-based products and by-products, or natural gas.
fields.tasks: Operating electronic or computerized control panel from a central control room to monitor and optimize physical and chemical processes for several processing units. Adjusting equipment, valves, pumps, controls and process equipment. Controlling process start-up and shut-down, troubleshooting and monitoring outside process equipment. Verifying equipment for malfunctions, testing well pipes for leaks and fractures and arranging for maintenance. Analyzing sample products, performing tests, recording data and writing production logs.

fields.name: Gasfitter
fields.description: Installs, tests and repairs gas water heating systems and equipment.
fields.tasks: Repairing and extending gas mains. Installing, repairing and servicing pipes and fittings between mains and buildings. Installing and maintaining piping and appliances in residential, commercial and industrial buildings. Installing and repairing underground gas mains and distribution pipes. Responding to calls about escaping gas. Assisting in the investigation of gas fires and explosions. Converting motor vehicles or appliances to use other fuels (for example, propane or natural gas).

fields.name: Gathering Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, maintains and operates a gathering line to collate signatures (sections of a book).
fields.tasks: Examining job orders to determine the quantities, stock specifications and any special instructions. Setting up and operating machines to achieve product specifications. Conducting regular inspections and maintenance of machines. Checking the quality and conformance to specifications of products. Keeping records of products produced.

fields.name: Gemologist
fields.description: Examines, identifies and grades stones and gems, such as diamonds, emeralds, rubies, topaz, and jade.
fields.tasks: Creating new jewellery designs and modifying existing designs, using computer technology as necessary. Constructing preliminary models of wax, metal, clay, or plaster and forming sample castings in moulds to create jewellery items. Fabricating jewellery articles from materials such as gold, silver, platinum and precious or semiprecious stones. Repairing jewellery such as enlarging or reducing ring sizes, soldering pieces of jewellery together, and replacing broken clasps and mountings. Smoothing soldered joints and rough spots, using hand files and emery paper, and polish smoothed areas with polishing wheels or buffing wire. Positioning stones and metal pieces and set, mount and secure items in place, using setting and hand tools. Cleaning and polishing metal items and jewellery pieces, using jewellers’ tools, polishing wheels and chemical baths. Marking, engraving or embossing designs on metal pieces such as castings, wire, or jewellery, following specifications. Selecting and acquiring metals and gems for designs. Determining appraised values of diamonds and other gemstones based on price guides, market fluctuations and stone grades and rarity. Grading stones based on their colour, perfection and quality of cut. Plating articles such as jewellery pieces and watch dials, using silver, gold, nickel, or other metals. Writing or modifying design specifications such as the metal contents and weights of items. Examining gemstone surfaces like jade, sapphires and rubies and their internal structures to evaluate genuineness, quality, and value, using polariscopes, refractometers and other optical instruments. Researching and analysing reference materials and consulting with interested parties in order to develop new products or modify existing designs. Computing costs of labour and materials in order to determine production costs of products. Buying and selling jewellery, or serve as agents between buyers and sellers.

fields.name: Gemstone Cutter
fields.description: Cuts, shapes and polishes gems.
fields.tasks: Setting up and operating stationary plant and machinery that cut, saw and slice rocks, minerals and stones according to the specifications for the job. Adjusting valves and controls of machines to ensure the safe and efficient operation of equipment. Positioning blocks and slabs of stone onto machines for sawing, cutting and further working. Examining gems to ascertain the shape, cut and width of cut stones, or to select the cuts that will result in the biggest, best quality stones. Examining gems during processing to ensure accuracy of angles and positions of cuts or bores, using magnifying glasses, loupes or shadowgraphs. Examining processed materials visually or with hands to ensure compliance with established standards and job specifications. Recording information about processing completed during shifts, such as quantities, types and dimensions of materials produced.

fields.name: Gemstone Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates industrial machines to cut, polish and finish ornamental gemstones.
fields.tasks: Setting up and operating stationary plant and machinery which cut, saw and slice rocks, minerals and stones according to the specifications for the job. Adjusting valves and controls of machines to ensure the safe and efficient operation of equipment. Positioning blocks and slabs of stone onto machines for sawing, cutting and further working. Examining gems to ascertain the shape, cut and width of cut stones, or to select the cuts that will result in the biggest, best quality stones. Examining gems during processing to ensure accuracy of angles and positions of cuts or bores, using magnifying glasses, loupes or shadowgraphs. Examining processed materials visually or with hands to ensure compliance with established standards and job specifications. Recording information about processing completed during shifts, such as quantities, types and dimensions of materials produced.

fields.name: Genealogist
fields.description: Conducts research into genealogical background of individual or family in order to establish descent from specific ancestor or to discover and identify forebears of individual or family.
fields.tasks: Conducting research into family histories by accessing information available in archives, libraries, museums and other institutions.      Consulting and comparing primary sources, such as original or contemporary records of past events, and secondary sources such as archaeological or anthropological findings.       Extracting relevant material, checking its authenticity, and researching into and describing the history of a particular period, country or region, or a particular group of people.      Interviewing people on their family histories, looking into various aspects such as migration, marriages, offspring and medical histories. Analysing data and developing family trees.      Preparing papers and reports.      Presenting findings and conclusions for publication or use by interested persons.

fields.name: General Clerk
fields.description: Performs a range of clerical and administrative tasks.
fields.tasks: Collecting, typing, recording, proof-reading, copying, sorting and storing information, records and reports.   Operating office equipment, such as photocopiers and fax machines. Completing and mailing accounts, contracts, policies, invoices and other related documentation.  Transcribing dictation, and composing and typing letters and other correspondence. Ordering materials, supplies and services, and completing the relevant records and reports.  Undertaking duties such as banking, credit control or payroll functions, if required. Undertaking various broad and specialist administrative functions as required by the company.

fields.name: General Manager Public Service
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and reviews the day-to-day operations and major functions within a division of the public service.
fields.tasks: Advising national, state, regional or local governments and legislators on policy matters. Advising on the preparation of government budgets, laws and regulations, including amendments. Coordinating activities with other senior government managers and officials. Ensuring appropriate systems and procedures are developed and implemented to provide budgetary control. Establishing objectives for government departments or agencies in accordance with government legislation and policy. Formulating or approving and evaluating programs and procedures for the implementation of government polices in conjunction or consultation with government. Making presentations to legislative and other government committees regarding policies programs or budgets. Overseeing the interpretation and implementation of government policies and legislation by government departments and agencies. Recommending, reviewing, evaluating and approving documents, briefs and reports submitted by middle managers and senior staff members.

fields.name: General Medical Practitioner
fields.description: Diagnoses, treats and prevents illness, disease, injury, and other physical and mental impairments. They maintain general health in humans through the application of of principles and procedures of modern medicine.
fields.tasks: Conducting physical examinations of patients and interviewing them and their families to determine their health status. Ordering laboratory tests, X-rays and other diagnostic procedures and analysing findings to determine the nature of disorders or illnesses. Providing continuing medical care for patients including prescribing, administering, counselling on and monitoring curative treatments and preventive measures. Performing surgery and other clinical procedures. Advising individuals, families and communities on health, nutrition and lifestyle that aids prevention or treatment of disease and disorders. Providing referrals to patients and families for specialised care in hospitals, rehabilitation centres or other types of health care centres. Identifying, managing and providing referrals for complications before, during and after childbirth.

fields.name: Geographer
fields.description: Studies and analyses the relationships between human activities and the natural and built environment.
fields.tasks: Studying the world's physical features, such as its landforms, bodies of water, climates, soils, and plants as well as people, their distribution, habitation and migration patterns and interactions. Collecting geographic data through field observations, maps, photographs, satellite imagery, censuses, surveys, and various qualitative research techniques. Analysing data through statistical and qualitative methods. Creating and modifying maps, graphs, diagrams, or other visual representations of geographic data. Using geographic information systems (GIS) to collect, capture, analyse and represent geographic information Writing reports and presenting research findings. Combining geographic data with data from other disciplines such as economics, health and politics. Advising on aspects such as land usage, city planning, migration policies and various socio-political decisions.

fields.name: Geographic Information Systems Technicians
fields.description: Assists scientists, technologists, or related professionals in building, maintaining, modifying, or using geographic information system (GIS) databases. May also perform some custom application development or provide user support.
fields.tasks: Reviewing existing and incoming data for accuracy, usefulness, quality or completeness of documentation.   Designing and coordinating the development of integrated Geographic Information Systems (GIS) databases. Designing or preparing graphic representations of GIS data, using GIS hardware or software applications. Maintaining or modifying existing GIS databases. Entering data into GIS databases. Performing geospatial data building, modelling or analysis. Selecting cartographic elements needed for effective presentation of information. Providing technical support to users or clients regarding the maintenance, development or operation of GIS databases, equipment or applications.

fields.name: Geography Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches geography (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Geologist
fields.description: Studies the composition, structure and other physical attributes of the earth to increase scientific knowledge and to develop practical applications in fields such as mineral exploration, civil engineering, environmental protection and rehabilitation of land after mining.
fields.tasks: Studying composition and structure of the earth's crust, examining rocks, minerals, fossils and other materials, to determine processes affecting the development of the Earth, trace evolution of past life, establish nature and chronology of geological formations and assess their commercial applications.   Locating and determining the nature and extent of oil, gas and mineral deposits using seismological, gravimetric, magnetic, electrical or radiometric methods.   Studying and measuring physical properties of seas and the atmosphere and their inter-relationship, such as the exchange of thermal energy.   Estimating weight, size and mass of the earth and composition and structure of its interior, and studying the nature, activity and predictability of volcanoes.   Using various remote sensing programs to investigate and measure seismic, gravitational, electrical, thermal, and magnetic forces affecting the earth.   Applying geological knowledge to problems encountered in civil engineering projects such as the construction of dams, bridges, tunnels, and large buildings; and land reclamation projects.   Interpreting research data and preparing geological reports, maps, charts and diagrams, reports and papers.

fields.name: Geophysical Technician
fields.description: Assists scientists or engineers in the use of electronic, sonic, or nuclear measuring instruments in both laboratory and production activities to obtain data indicating potential resources such as metallic ore, minerals, gas, coal, or petroleum.
fields.tasks: Providing technical assistance to research on and development of processes to determine the properties of metals and new alloys. Using microscopes, electromagnetic irradiation machines, spectrometers, spectrographs, densitometers and tension testing machines. Assisting scientists in the use of electrical, sonic, or nuclear measuring instruments in both laboratory and production activities to obtain data indicating potential sources of metallic ore, gas, or petroleum.

fields.name: Geophysicist
fields.description: Studies the composition, structure and other physical attributes of the earth, locates minerals, petroleum or ground water, and detects, monitors and forecasts seismic, magnetic, electrical, thermal and oceanographic activity.
fields.tasks: Conducting research and improving or developing concepts, theories and operational methods related to geophysics. Using various remote sensing programs to investigate and measure seismic, gravitational, electrical, thermal, and magnetic forces affecting the earth. Estimating weight, size and mass of the earth and composition and structure of its interior, and studying the nature, activity and predictability of volcanoes. Using various remote sensing programs to investigate and measure seismic, gravitational, electrical, thermal, and magnetic forces affecting the earth. Estimating weight, size and mass of the earth and composition and structure of its interior, and studying the nature, activity and predictability of volcanoes. Charting the earth's magnetic field and applying this and other collected data for broadcasting, navigation and other purposes. Studying and measuring physical properties of seas and the atmosphere and their inter-relationship, such as the exchange of thermal energy. Locating and determining the nature and extent of oil, gas and mineral deposits using seismological, gravimetric, magnetic, electrical or radiometric methods.

fields.name: Geothermal Technicians
fields.description: Performs technical activities at power plants or individual installations necessary for the generation of power from geothermal energy sources. Monitors and controls operating activities at geothermal power generation facilities and performs maintenance and repairs as necessary. Installs, tests, and maintains residential and commercial geothermal heat pumps.

fields.name: Glass Maker
fields.description: Blows, moulds, presses, cuts, trims, grinds and polishes and shape molten glass according to patterns. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Observing gauges, computer printouts and video monitors to verify specified processing conditions and make adjustments as necessary. Positioning pattern or drawing on glass, measuring dimensions, and marking cutting lines, using glass cutting tools and cutting glass along marked outlines or around pattern. Setting up, operating and adjusting computerized or robotic glass cutting equipment. Inspecting, weighing, and measuring products to verify conformance to specifications, using instruments such as micrometers, callipers, magnifiers, and rulers. Regulating oven temperatures according to glass types to be processed. Transferring pattern for individual stained glass parts from full size drawing to pattern paper, using stylus to trace drawings. Spraying silver solution on glass to provide mirrored surface, using spray gun. Laying out cutting and grinding optical and other glass to specified dimensions and weight for moulding into lens blanks and for use as watch crystals.

fields.name: Glass Processing Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in manufacturing glass fibre and glassware such as setting up, adjusting and repairing automatic machines and equipment, and checking weight of glassware.
fields.tasks: Weighing, measuring and mixing ingredients required to make glass. Operating machines that combine and process ingredients. Monitoring the operation or automatic glass-making machines and adjusting pressure, temperature and other controls to ensure product specifications. Collecting product samples for laboratory analysis, and measuring and testing products. Weighing and packaging finished products. Cleaning and lubricating equipment, and cleaning plant.

fields.name: Glass Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines to manufacture molten glass and shape glassware products such as containers, sheet glass, structural and stained glass, glass lenses and prisms.
fields.tasks: Operating and maintaining machines that press or blow molten glass in moulds to form or shape containers such as bottles, jars and drinking glasses. Operating and monitoring glass-making furnaces to make glass by melting and fusing pre-mixed ingredients. Operating and monitoring machines for making glaze or abrasives. Operating and monitoring machines which extrude molten glass to form fibreglass filaments. Operating drawing kiln to process molten glass into continuous sheet of flat glass. Operating and monitoring a floating-glass production plant. Operating hand presses to mould glass into required shapes. Operating and maintaining finishing machines to grind, drill, sand, bevel, decorate, wash or polish glass or glass products. Tending hot- or cold-end spray equipment used to coat glassware with surface hardener. Observing finished products to identify splits, cracks, breaks, colour and other imperfections.

fields.name: Glass, Clay and Stone Manufacturing Machine Setter and Minder
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and runs and monitors glass, clay and stone manufacturing machinery and equipment.
fields.tasks: Checking production plans and specifications to determine and select materials, ingredients, procedures and adjustments for machines that mix, extrude, pump, compact and cut to manufacture and finish glass, clay and stone products. Selecting and installing machine components such as dies, moulds and cutters according to specifications. Using hand tools and measuring devices as necessary. Minding plant and machinery that assemble and fill moulds with mixtures for glass, clay or stone as required. Turning controls to adjust machine functions such as regulating air pressure, creating vacuums and adjusting coolant flow. Finishing the surfaces of products by cutting, sandblasting and polishing products to specifications. Collecting and examining samples of mixtures and finished products for conformity to specifications and adjusting machine settings accordingly. Recording and maintaining production data such as meter readings and quantities, types and dimensions of materials produced. Arranging and assisting with plant and machinery maintenance and repair.

fields.name: Glazier
fields.description: Measures, cuts, finishes, fits and installs flat glass and mirrors. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Determining type and dimensions of glass required Laying glass over patterns on padded tables and in jigs. Measuring and marking glass for cutting Examining glass and marking defective areas. Cutting along patterns and templates. Breaking off sheets and excess glass with notched tools and glass pliers Installing glass and mirrors in windows, skylights, display cases, interior walls and ceilings. Smoothing rough edges, using belt sanders and smoothing wheels.

fields.name: Goldsmith
fields.description: Designs, makes and repairs jewellery such as rings, brooches, chains and bracelets; crafts objects out of precious metals to produce jewellery and objects of art. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Examining designs and specifications for jewellery and precious metal objects. Shaping moulded metal by cutting, filing, beating, turning and bending, using specialised hand and power tools. Assembling articles by soldering, screwing, riveting and otherwise joining. Securing precious stones in retaining prongs and ridges and smoothing and checking final settings. Engraving designs on ring settings, brooches, bracelets and other articles. Repairing jewellery by soldering, replacing and rebuilding worn and broken parts.

fields.name: Golfer
fields.description: Plays golf professionally in tournaments or as a resident professional, organises golf related activities. This occupation requires high levels of physical fitness, sporting ability and personal commitment as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications
fields.tasks: Adhering to the rules and regulations associated with golf. Participating in regular practice and training sessions and undertaking training to maintain the required standard of fitness and skill. Maintaining a high degree of expertise in golf. Assessing other competitors and conditions at venues. Deciding on strategies in consultation with coaches. Competing in golf tournaments. Undertaking golf promotional activities and media interviews.

fields.name: Grader Operator
fields.description: Operates a grader to spread and level materials in construction projects.
fields.tasks: Performing safety checks before operating the grader and ensuring all equipment function properly. Using laser instruments to set the desired plane for the grader. Using levers and control consoles to adjust the angle and height of the blade and to operate the blade rotation and the circle shift. Levelling dirt and road surfaces bringing the road to final stage for the road roller. Cutting, digging and shaping ditches and slopes. Maintaining haul roads for other earthmoving equipment. Mixing and spreading surface materials that had been placed in windrows on the roadbed or the fill. Performing many different operations with special attachments such as a short blade, elevating conveyor, pavement widener, shallow trenching blade and scarifier. Conducting routine maintenance on loader such as lubricating, fuelling and cleaning.

fields.name: Grain Depot Manager
fields.description: Plans, directs and coordinates the receipt, storage and outloading of grain stored in silos.
fields.tasks: Determining, implementing and monitoring purchasing, storage and distribution strategies, policies and plans.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Liaising with other departments and customers concerning requirements for outward goods and associated forwarding transportation.      Monitoring and reviewing storage and inventory systems to meet supply requirements and control stock levels.      Negotiating contracts with suppliers to meet quality, cost and delivery requirements.      Operating recording systems to track all movements of goods, and ensuring re-ordering and re-stocking at optimal times.      Overseeing the recording of purchase, storage and distribution transactions.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.

fields.name: Grain Handling Controller
fields.description: Monitors and controls processes in the storage and distribution of cereals.
fields.tasks: Managing the process of grain manufacturing. Sampling grain, determining mass, grading wheat, grouping wheat, unloading consignment, managing intake and storage facility and implementing storage hygiene and combat contamination in grain.

fields.name: Grain Handling Operator
fields.description: Receives, ships, and handles grain and perform preventive maintenance and cleaning as needed.
fields.tasks: Performing grain handling according to industry quality standards. Harvesting, cleaning and drying grain. Storing grain at farms or in warehouses. Controlling rodents and insects in grain storage areas. Handling grain fumigation equipment. Performing routine maintenance of machinery and equipment. Depleting grain bins. Preparing grain dispatch containers. Unloading of grain consignments in bulk. Apply communication and numeric skills in a grain handling environment.

fields.name: Granite Cutter
fields.description: Cuts and shapes granite blocks.
fields.tasks: Driving wedges into quarried stone to break it into slabs or blocks.   Selecting and grading slabs and blocks of granite, marble, and other stone.   Cutting, shaping and finishing building and monumental stone such as granite or marble by using hand or hand-powered tools.   Making patterns and marking shapes on stone for subsequent sawing, planning, drilling and other dressing and cutting operations.   Cutting and carving characters, figures or designs on stone blocks used for monuments or memorials.   Repairing and replacing stonework on old buildings, churches and monuments.   Setting stone in the erection of monuments and memorials.

fields.name: Graphic Designer
fields.description: Plans, designs, develops and prepares information for publication and reproduction using text, symbols, pictures, colours and layout to achieve commercial and communicating needs with particular emphasis on tailoring the message for the intended audience.
fields.tasks: Meeting clients or account managers to discuss the business objectives and requirements of the job. Interpreting the client's business needs and developing a concept to suit their purpose. Estimating the time required to complete the work and providing quotes for clients. Developing design briefs by gathering information and data through research and thinking creatively to produce new ideas and concepts. Presenting finalised ideas and concepts to clients. Working with a wide range of media, including photography and computer-aided design (CAD). Contributing ideas and design artwork to the overall brief. Demonstrating illustrative skills with rough sketches. Working on layouts and art working pages ready for print. Keeping abreast of emerging technologies in new media, particularly design programmes. Developing interactive design.

fields.name: Gravure Cylinder Preparation Technician
fields.description: Inspects and/or repairs Coppers, Chromes and engraves gravure cylinders for subsequent printing and finishing processes.
fields.tasks: Addressing all aspects of work prior to the printing process. Doing type-setting. Preparing line or half-tone pictures in single or multi-colour separations which allow for the job being printed in colour. Making up and laying out of the job in its final form with text, graphics, special effects and all other instructions which may be given by the customer. Making positives or negatives and preparing the printing-plates for the presses.

fields.name: Green Keeper
fields.description: Establishes and maintains fine turf, grassed areas and synthetic surfaces used for sporting events.
fields.tasks: Checking the health of the greens, identifying and treating weeds, pests and diseases, and applying mulch and fertilisers. Preparing land for sport lawns by conditioning the soil, levelling the ground, and installing and operating irrigation and drainage systems. Constructing greens, tees, and bunkers. Rolling, mowing, aerating and edging greens and lawns. Raking the bunkers, cutting holes and moving tee-markers. Operating and maintaining machinery such as tractors and sit-on mowers.

fields.name: Green Tobacco Storage Controller / Manager
fields.description: No descriptor
fields.tasks: Managing the storage of green tobacco (flue-cured or air-cured tobacco that has not been through the redrying process). Determining the moisture content of the tobacco before baling in order to discern if the tobacco is suitable for baling and storage. Layering tobacco uniformly in the bales to allow the movement of moisture from the interior to the exterior of the bales during storage. Assuring that the bales of tobacco receive adequate airflow around all sides including the base. Placing the bales on slats or on pallets to improve air circulation around the base. Observing temperature, humidity, and pressure gauges of storage. Inspecting and measuring tobacco samples in order to maintain prescribed storage conditions. Adjusting controls, such as thermostats and valves as required.

fields.name: Grinder
fields.description: Grinds metal surfaces.
fields.tasks: Applying knowledge of abrasives and grinding procedures. Measuring workpieces and laying out work, using precision measuring devices. Selecting, mounting and positioning grinding tools in machine chucks, spindles, or other tool-holding devices, using hand tools. Switching on and operating grinding and related tools that remove excess material or burrs from surfaces, sharpen edges or corners, or buff, hone, or polish metal or plastic workpieces. Observing machine operations to detect any problems and making necessary adjustments to correct problems. Brushing or spraying lubricating compounds on workpieces, or turning valve handles and directing the flow of coolants against tools and workpieces. Moving machine controls to index workpieces and to adjust machines for pre-selected operational settings.

fields.name: Guest House Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operation of a bed and breakfast or guest house in providing accommodation and leisure services.
fields.tasks: Directing and overseeing reservation, reception, room service and housekeeping activities. Providing guests with local tourism information, and arranging tours and transportation. Undertaking budgeting for the establishment and overseeing accounting and purchasing activities. Controlling selection, training and supervision of staff. Ensuring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations. Assessing and reviewing customer satisfaction. Supervising security arrangements, and garden and property maintenance.

fields.name: Gunsmith
fields.description: Modifies, services and repairs rifles, revolvers and other firearms.
fields.tasks: Repairing and modifying guns and other small arms. Designing and building complete rifles by fitting stock barrels to stock receivers; fabricating or purchasing additional parts as needed. Designing and building a complete rifle starting with several pieces of blank steel and a slab of walnut. Fabricating replacement parts from metal stock. Troubleshooting and repairing feeding, ejecting & firing problems. Ensuring proper operation and test-fire firearms with conventional loads. Positioning, securing and measuring metal stock or castings to lay out for machining. Setting up, operating and maintaining conventional and computer numerically controlled machine tools to cut, turn, mill, plane, drill, bore, grind or otherwise shape work piece to prescribed dimensions.

fields.name: Hair or Beauty Salon Assistant
fields.description: Assists hairdressers and beauty therapists by performing routine tasks in a hairdressing or beauty salon.
fields.tasks: Dealing with enquires telephonically and in person, and booking salon appointments.  Greeting customers as they arrive at the salon and making sure they feel they feel comfortable while waiting for their appointment.  Serving refreshments to customers waiting for appointments. Preparing clients for service, by shampooing their hair or giving them a gown to change into.  Performing basic tasks such as blow-drying hair, and doing facials, basic manicures and pedicures. Advising on and selling products stocked by the salon to customers. Monitoring and replenishing stock levels. Processing salon treatment payments. Assisting in keeping the salon clean and tidy.

fields.name: Hair Removal Technician
fields.description: Provides hair removal services to clients.
fields.tasks: Removing unwanted facial and body hair by using techniques such as waxing, sugaring and threading (depilation). Removing unwanted facial and body hair by using electrolysis (epilation). Keeping documentation and keeping clients' files updated. Maintaining hair-removal equipment and an inventory of products. Keeping the therapy room clean and stocked. Suggesting and promoting retail products or additional services. Upholding hygiene standards and following health and safety regulations.

fields.name: Hairdresser
fields.description: Cuts, styles, colours, straightens and permanently wave hair, and treat hair and scalp conditions. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Cutting, washing, tinting and waving hair. Shaving or trimming beards and moustaches. Giving scalp treatment. Fitting wigs according to customers’ requirements. Providing advice on hair care, beauty products and hairstyles. Styling hair into dreadlocks and braids and adding hair extensions. Cleaning work areas and sanitizing instruments.

fields.name: Handicrafts Teacher (Private Tuition)
fields.description: Teaches students in the practice, theory and performance of handicrafts, in private training establishments.
fields.tasks: Assessing students’ level of ability and determining learning needs. Planning, preparing and delivering programs of study, lessons and workshops for individual students and groups. Preparing and presenting material on the theory of the subject area being studied. Instructing and demonstrating practical aspects of the subject area being studied. Assigning exercises and work relevant to students’ level of ability, interests and aptitude. Assessing students and offering advice, criticism and encouragement. Revising curricula, course content, course materials and methods of instruction. Preparing students for examinations and assessments. Counselling students regarding educational issues such as course and program selection, class scheduling, school adjustment, truancy, study habits, and career planning. Counselling students to help them understand and overcome personal, social, or behavioural problems affecting their education. Preparing students for later educational experiences by encouraging them to explore learning opportunities and to persevere with challenging tasks.

fields.name: Handyperson
fields.description: Cleans, paints, repairs and maintains buildings, grounds and facilities.
fields.tasks: Maintaining and performing minor repairs to the physical structures of factories, office buildings, apartment houses, logging and mining constructions, using hand and power tools. Assisting qualified tradespeople in doing major repairs to buildings and equipment. Carrying out general maintenance and building maintenance as directed. Undertaking minor repairs to furniture and fixtures, windows, locks, gutters, fences and paths. Painting structures and repairing woodwork using carpenter's tools. Loading, unloading and moving furniture and equipment as necessary. Assisting with minor repairs to electrical installations. Providing basic plumbing assistance, drain cleaning, unblocking drains etc. Assisting in basic air-conditioning maintenance. Assisting in grass-cutting and the maintenance of garden features.

fields.name: Harvester / Picker
fields.description: Assists in the harvesting process of the crop from the orchard / field ensuring that quality is not compromised during the handling process.
fields.tasks: Carrying and positioning work aids, such as ladders, canvas drop cloths and buckets. Selecting the fruit or vegetables to be harvested according to size, shape and colour. Harvesting fruits, nuts and vegetables by hand or by using tools such as shears, rubber mallets, pronged scoops, hooked poles, knives, machetes or sickles exercising care to avoid damage to plant or crop. Tying crops in bundles, placing them in piles, or into bags, buckets or trays as required. Picking up and carrying bundles, bales, containers or stacks of harvested crop to collection point. Emptying filled containers into collection boxes and bins. Loading piles or containers of crops onto conveyors, trucks or trailers by hand or by using hoists or hooks.

fields.name: Hat Maker
fields.description: Makes, alters and repairs hats.
fields.tasks: Drawing and cutting patterns according to specifications. Selecting fabrics or leather matching the desired size, colour, texture, and quality of a hat to be made. Cutting and shaping a hat according to design and pattern. Sewing, joining, reinforcing and finishing hats, using needles and thread or other materials. Decorating hats according to design and specifications. Fitting, altering and repairing hats according to customers' requests. Making various types of hats for theatrical, television and motion picture productions.

fields.name: Hazardous Materials Removal Workers
fields.description: Identifies, removes, packs, transports, or disposes of hazardous materials.
fields.tasks: Depending on area of expertise; disposing asbestos, nuclear and radioactive waste, arsenic, lead and other hazardous materials that are flammable, corrosive, reactive or toxic.   Complying with safety procedures and laws regarding waste disposal.   Wearing fully enclosed protective suits for several hours at a time if required.   Constructing scaffolding or building containment areas prior to beginning abatement or decontamination work.   Loading or unloading materials into containers or onto trucks, using hoists or forklifts.    Driving trucks or other heavy equipment to convey contaminated waste to designated sea or ground locations.    Cleaning contaminated equipment or areas for re-use, using detergents or solvents, sandblasters, filter pumps or steam cleaners.   Recording numbers of containers stored at disposal sites, specifying amounts or types of equipment or waste disposed.

fields.name: Head of Department (Teacher)
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the educational and administrative aspects of a department of a school.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Health and Safety Manager
fields.description: Manages, reviews and evaluates work environments and oversee the design of programs and procedures to control, eliminate, and prevent disease or injury caused by chemical, physical, and biological agents or ergonomic factors.
fields.tasks: Keeping workers and communities surrounding workplaces healthy and safe. Ensuring compliance with national, provincial and local laws and regulations in the work environment. Assessing health risk in a workplace eg sampling air to determine if there are harmful substances present. Measuring noise levels in factories. Supervising safe removal of asbestos from buildings. Providing practical advice on how workers can be protected from job-relates health and safety risks.

fields.name: Health Information Manager
fields.description: Plans, develops, implements and manages health information services such as patient information systems, and clinical and administrative data to meet the medical, legal, ethical and administrative requirements of health care delivery.
fields.tasks: Planning, developing, maintaining and operating a variety of health record indexes and storage and retrieval systems to collect, classify, store and analyze information. Transcribing, compiling and processing patient medical records, admission and discharge documents, and other medical reports into records-keeping systems to process. Epidemiological monitoring, research, billing, cost control and care improvement. Reviewing records for completeness, accuracy and compliance with regulations. Translating narrative descriptions and numeric information from medical records and other documents on health services delivery into codes associated with standard classification systems. Protecting the security of medical records to ensure that confidentiality is maintained and releasing information to authorized persons and agencies in accordance with regulations. Supervising clerical and administrative workers involved in the maintenance of medical records.

fields.name: Health Promotion Officer
fields.description: Assists health and community groups to improve the health of individuals and the community by raising awareness of healthy lifestyles, disease and disability, and other health-related issues.
fields.tasks: Providing information to families and communities on a range of health issues including nutrition, hygiene, infant and child care, immunizations, family planning, risk factors and prevention of common infectious diseases, poisoning prevention, first aid for treatment of simple and common ailments, substance abuse, domestic violence, and other topics. Visiting families in their homes to provide information on the health, social and other services available and support them in gaining access to these services. Visiting families who do not usually access medical establishments to monitor on a regular basis certain conditions, such as progress with pregnancy, child growth and development, and environmental sanitation. Distributing to households medical supplies for the prevention and treatment of endemic diseases such as malaria, pneumonia and diarrhoeal diseases, and instructing family and community members in the use of these products. Conducting outreach efforts to groups who do not usually access medical establishments with information and basic medical supplies for prevention and management of certain health conditions for which they are most at risk, such as HIV/AIDS and other communicable diseases. Collecting data from households and communities who do not usually access medical establishments for purposes of patient monitoring and referral and reporting to meet health regulations.

fields.name: Health Technical Support Officer
fields.description: Provides technical, administrative and program development support to health care professionals and practitioners.
fields.tasks: Explaining procedures, observing and positioning patients, and using protection devices to ensure safety and comfort during examination, scan, or treatment. Position imaging or treatment equipment, monitoring video displays, and adjusting settings and controls according to technical specifications. Reviewing and evaluating developed x-rays, video tape, or computer generated information to determine if images are satisfactory for diagnostic purposes. Recording the results of procedures. Monitoring patients' conditions and reactions, and reporting abnormal signs to a medical practitioner. Following instructions issued by a medical practitioner. Preparing and maintaining medical equipment. Working as part of the medical team.

fields.name: Healthcare Cleaner
fields.description: Cleans floors and above the floors in all risk areas, disposes of hazardous waste, cares and cleans medical instruments and equipment in hospitals, clinics, frail care centres and other health related institutions.
fields.tasks: Cleaning areas in hospitals, clinics, frail care centres, medical rooms and other health related institutions. Cleaning hospital patient waiting rooms and wards, bathrooms, laboratories, offices, halls and other areas. Disposing of hazardous waste in correct disposal bins. Cleaning medical instruments and equipment. Disinfecting equipment and supplies using germicides. Keeping utility and storage rooms in clean and in an orderly condition. Distributing laundered articles and linens. Replacing soiled linen and cubicle curtains.

fields.name: Heat Pump Installer
fields.description: Installs, tests, maintains and repairs air source type heat pump water heating systems and equipment.
fields.tasks: Determining locations for installing heat pump systems, components and ancillary equipment.  Identify plumbing, electrical, environmental or safety hazards associated with heat pump installations.  Assessing collector sites to ensure structural integrity of potential mounting surfaces.  Connecting hoses and pipelines to pumps and vessels using hand tools. Connecting water heaters and storage tanks to power and water sources.  Turning valves and starting pumps to start and/or to regulate flows. Monitoring gauges and flowmeters and inspecting equipment to ensure that tank levels, temperatures, volumes and pressures are at specified levels, and dealing with abnormalities as necessary.
