Cleaning, maintaining and repairing pumps and storage vessels as necessary using hand tools and equipment.

fields.name: Heavy Equipment Mechanic
fields.description: Maintains, tests and repairs heavy equipment such as earth moving or mining including engines, mechanical parts and hydraulically or electrically powered systems. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Diagnosing faults or malfunctions to determine required repairs, using engine diagnostic equipment such as computerized test equipment and calibration devices. Dismantling and reassembling heavy equipment using hoists and hand tools. Cleaning, lubricating, and performing other routine maintenance work on equipment and vehicles. Examining parts for damage or excessive wear, using micrometers and gauges. Scheduling maintenance for industrial machines and equipment, and keeping equipment service records. Assembling gear systems, and aligning frames and gears. Fitting bearings to adjust, repair, or overhaul mobile mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic equipment.

fields.name: Helicopter Pilot
fields.description: Flies helicopters to transport passengers, mail or freight, or provide agricultural, aviation or aerial surveillance services.
fields.tasks: Flying and navigating aircraft in accordance with established control and operating procedures. Preparing and submitting flight plan or examining standard flight plan. Controlling the operation of mechanical, electrical and electronic equipment and ensuring that all instruments and controls work properly. Applying knowledge of principles and practices of flying in order to identify and solve problems arising in the course of their work. Examining maintenance records and conducting inspections to ensure that aircraft are mechanically sound, maintenance has been performed and that all equipment is operational. Signing necessary certificates and maintaining official records of flight. Obtaining briefings and clearances before flights and maintaining contact with air traffic or flight control during flight.

fields.name: Heritage Consultant
fields.description: Provides guidance in the conservation, management and monitoring of heritage resources of national and other significance.
fields.tasks: Identifying opportunities and providing guidance on the management, maintenance and environmental protection of historic buildings and sites. Conducting building surveys to diagnose the condition, historic significance and value of existing buildings. Providing advice on the legal obligations, planning consents and costs required for the restoration of, and alterations and repairs to historic buildings. Working with building owners, architects and other professionals as part of a team, outlining the importance of construction, materials or other significant features of buildings, and recommending ways of preservation and incorporation of those features in the reuse of the structure. Sourcing rare traditional building materials and fixtures such as hardware and lighting fixtures, studying original paint colours and finishes, and bringing in and supervising specialist tradespeople to restore a building. Undertaking specialist restoration work for significant projects, such as the recreation of wallpapers. Engaging with communities and various other stakeholders in the formulation of appraisals of areas of historic significance and in the formulation of visions, strategies and implementation plans for the restoration and/or preservation of such areas.

fields.name: Historian
fields.description: Researches the history of human activity and prepares accounts of findings.
fields.tasks: Conducting research in past and present theory and practice of social systems, institutions, behaviour or events.      Consulting and comparing primary sources, such as original or contemporary records of past events, and secondary sources such as archaeological or anthropological findings.      Developing theories, models and methods to interpret and describe the nature of human experience and historical and political events and behaviour.      Extracting relevant material, checking its authenticity, and researching into and describing the history of a particular period, country or region, or a particular facet of society for example the economy, politics or religions.      Observing contemporary political institutions and opinions, collecting data on them from various sources, including interviews with government and political party officials and other relevant persons. Researching, mostly by reasoning, into the general causes, principles and meanings of the world, human actions, experience and existence, and interpreting and developing philosophical concepts and theories.         Preparing scholarly papers and reports.      Presenting findings and conclusions for publication or use by government, political parties or other organisations and interested persons.

fields.name: History Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches history (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Home Improvement Installer
fields.description: Installs functional and decorative home improvements such as awnings, curtains, blinds, security screens, garage doors, exterior cladding, shower screens and prefabricated windows and doors.
fields.tasks: Examining plans, specifications and work sites to determine the type and quality and location of installations required. Providing quotes for home improvements to homeowners. Measuring and marking locations for frames, brackets or hinges. Preparing the site for installation and insulation of fittings. Fitting frames and home improvements to structures and fastening them into position, using methods such as bolting, screwing and nailing. Attaching and adjusting mechanical fittings, such as cranks, locks and pull-cords. Installing flashing and weatherproofing to fittings such as awnings, shower screens and prefabricated windows and doors.

fields.name: Homoeopath
fields.description: Treats the immune and defence system by assessing the whole person and using minute amounts of natural remedies made from substances such as plants, minerals and animal sources.
fields.tasks: Using alternative and complementary medicine to treat a range of medical conditions and adverse health problems.   Adopting a holistic approach to assess and treat patients’ medical problems in a unique and personalised manner.   Assessing and examining patients to compile their history of symptoms and ill-health complaints.   Providing treatment and remedies to address the patient’s lifestyle and overall well-being, rather than individual symptoms.   Using diluted substances to stimulate the natural healing system in the human body.   Providing remedies or a series of remedies to treat conditions such as allergies and arthritis.   Monitoring and evaluating the progress of patients and the effects of remedies.

fields.name: Horticultural Farmer
fields.description: Plans, organises and performs farming operations to grow crop such as fruit, nuts etc.
fields.tasks: Preparing soil by hand or machine, and spreading fertilisers and manure.   Selecting and sowing seeds, and planting seedlings.   Maintaining crops by cultivating soil, by transplanting, pruning or thinning trees and shrubs, and by setting up and operating irrigation equipment.   Controlling weeds, pests and diseases, by applying herbicides and pesticides.   Tending trees or bushes, collecting sap and harvesting crops. Inspecting, cleaning, grading, packaging, storing and loading crops for sale or delivery to market.   Storing and carrying out some processing of harvested produce.   Promoting and marketing products, and arranging the sale, purchase and transportation of produce and supplies. Maintaining and evaluating records of farm activities and transactions.

fields.name: Hospital Orderly
fields.description: Assists with the provision of care to patients in hospitals by ensuring wards are neat and tidy, lifting and turning patients and transporting them in wheelchairs or on movable beds, and providing direct care and support.
fields.tasks: Moving patients on stretchers, trolleys, beds and wheelchairs between different locations in the hospital. Moving patients from the ambulances into the hospital and between the wards, operating theatres, delivery rooms and the X-ray section. Moving patients who have just undergone surgery and are often still anaesthetized from operating tables to trolleys and to beds. Ensuring that trolleys are always made up with fresh linen and blankets and that equipment such as oxygen cylinders and cot sides are available.

fields.name: Hospital Pharmacist
fields.description: Prepares and dispenses pharmaceuticals, drugs and medicines in a hospital pharmacy.
fields.tasks: Being an indispensable and acceptable link in the health system and providing cost-effective and efficient services for the community. Receiving prescriptions for medicinal products from medical doctors and other health professionals, checking patients' medicine histories, and ensuring proper dosage and methods of administration and drug compatibility before dispensing. Preparing or supervising the preparation and labelling of liquid medicines, ointments, powders, tablets and other medications to fill prescriptions. Maintaining prescription files and recording issue of narcotics, poisons and habit-forming drugs in accordance with legal and professional requirements. Storing and preserving vaccines, serums and other drugs subject to deterioration.

fields.name: Hospitality Studies Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches hospitality studies (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Hostel Parent
fields.description: Operates a residential child care establishment which provides a home environment for children.
fields.tasks: Undertaking all  tasks relating to the personal care, boarding accommodation, meals, study, recreation and weekend activities of children and adolescents in a residential home. Ensuring good behaviour of the children and adolescents in their charge. Supervising and arranging activities, promoting intellectual, physical, social and spiritual development of children and adolescents. Ensuring living and hygiene standards are maintained. Ensuring students are attending classes. Assisting  with problems or providing a basic counselling service. Performing minor domestic duties. Accompanying students on weekend outings.

fields.name: Hotel Cellar Hand
fields.description: Receives, handles and collects wine and liqueurs from cellar.
fields.tasks: Assisting staff in collecting wines or other alcoholic beverages from the hotel cellar. Receiving, unpacking and storing alcoholic beverages correctly. Ensuring that fridges, freezers and shelves are stocked and well presented. Assisting and supporting beverage managers in their day-to-day operational tasks.  Maintaining the cellar and storage area in a neat and orderly manner.  Escalating any issues necessary to the appropriate individuals. Assisting with other hotel related tasks when not busy.

fields.name: Hotel or Motel Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of a hotel or motel to provide guest accommodation, meals and other services.
fields.tasks: Directing and overseeing reservation, reception, room service and housekeeping activities. Planning and supervising bar, restaurant, function and conference activities. Observing liquor, gaming, and other laws and regulations. Supervising security arrangements, and garden and property maintenance. Undertaking budgeting for the establishment and overseeing accounting and purchasing activities. Assessing and reviewing customer satisfaction and ensuring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations. Controlling selection, training and supervision of staff.

fields.name: Hotel or Motel Receptionist
fields.description: Greets guests, checks guests in, and looks after their needs on arrival and during their stay in a hotel or motel.
fields.tasks: Dealing with hotel, motel or guesthouse bookings by phone, e-mail, letter, fax or face-to-face. Booking rooms and updating details on a computerised booking system. Registering arriving guests, assigning rooms, verifying customers’ credit details and issuing room keys or access cards. Completing checking in and checking out procedures when guests arrive and leave. Taking and passing on messages to guests. Dealing with special requests from guests (such as booking theatre tickets or storing valuable items). Answering questions about what the hotel offers and the attractions in the surrounding area. Responding to guests’ requests for housekeeping and maintenance services. Reviewing statements of charges, handing them to departing guests and receiving payments. Dealing with complaints or problems.

fields.name: Hotel Service Manager
fields.description: Supervises and coordinates the activities of hotel service workers.
fields.tasks: Ensuring the smooth running of all hotel services and the maintenance of a high level of service by staff by supervising all aspects of hotel services and ensuring that staff carry out their duties appropriately. Determining staff work requirements and allocating duties to the relevant departments. Maintaining staff attendance records and rosters. Liaising with senior members of staff and making decisions about resources including finance and staffing levels. Assisting in the effective running of the hotel as a business. Dealing with complaints from guests and disagreements between staff. Performing front office and hotel reception duties in smaller establishments. Assisting with the management of hotel conference facilities where applicable. Explaining and enforcing safety regulations.

fields.name: House Builder
fields.description: Erects, maintains and repairs houses and similar small buildings using either traditional or modern techniques and materials.
fields.tasks: Preparing ground for erecting buildings or other structures. Interpreting building plans and measuring out foundations. Planning building activities, ordering building materials and ensuring the timeous delivery of materials on site. Coordinating with, interpreting and following instructions of architects and engineers. Arranging for specialised work such as concrete work, bricklaying, painting, plumbing and electrical wiring to be done by subcontractors. Coordinating and supervising the activities of subcontractors, labourers and other workers. Managing the finances of a building project. Maintaining and repairing existing structures.

fields.name: Housekeeping Service Manager
fields.description: Supervises and coordinates the activities of service workers in private institutions and other institutions such as schools and prisons.
fields.tasks: Ensuring the cleanliness and orderliness of bedrooms, bathrooms and other hotel or motel facilities. Establishing schedules and planning daily work assignments for housekeeping staff, and supervising and inspecting housekeepers in conducting their duties. Examining rooms, halls and lobbies to determine the need for repairs, or for the replacement of furniture or equipment, and reporting requirements to management. Advising managers, desk clerks or admitting personnel of readiness of rooms for occupancy. Investigating and managing customer problems related to housekeeping and taking corrective action. Maintaining stock inventories, ensuring adequate supplies and issuing supplies and relevant equipment to workers. Conducting and organising relevant training for new and existing employees related to company policies, housekeeping work procedures, and the use and maintenance of equipment. Ensuring all operational and safety procedures are properly followed. Maintaining records of work assignments, personnel actions and time cards, and preparing periodic reports. Attending management meetings to provide feedback on housekeeping issues and recommendations on improving service and efficient levels.

fields.name: Human Resource Advisor
fields.description: Provides staffing and personnel administration services in support of an organisation's human resources policies and programs.
fields.tasks: Developing and advising on the implementation of policies and practices relating to the effective use of employees within a company. Ensuring that the company employs the right balance of staff in terms of skills and experience, and that training and development opportunities are available to employees. Working closely with departments (especially human resource consultants) . Assisting managers to understand and implement human resource policies and procedures in accordance with company culture. Recruiting new staff by developing job descriptions and requirements, preparing job advertisements, reading through application forms, shortlisting applicants and interviewing and selecting candidates for positions. Assisting with performance interviews and advising on pay and other remuneration issues, including promotion and benefits. Interpreting and advising on labour laws, deal with grievances and implement disciplinary procedures. Planning and sometimes delivering training, including induction for new employees.

fields.name: Human Resources Clerk
fields.description: Maintains and updates personnel records such as information on promotions, employee leave taken and accumulated, salaries, superannuation and taxation, qualifications and training.
fields.tasks: Updating information on, employment history, salaries, performance evaluations, qualifications and training and leave taken and accumulated. Initiating records for newly appointed workers and checking records for completeness. Processing applications for employment and promotions and advising applicants of results. Receiving and answering inquiries about employment entitlements and conditions. Sending out job applications and announcements of job openings and job examinations. Maintaining and updating manual and computerized filing and registration systems, and compiling and preparing reports and documents relating to personnel activities. Storing and retrieving personnel records and files on request.

fields.name: Hunter
fields.description: Hunts, traps or shoots animals for food, pelts, research or for pest control.
fields.tasks: Killing trapped or free mammals, birds or reptiles with firearms or other weapons. Travelling on foot or using vehicles, boats or helicopters to reach hunting areas. Tracking animals by checking for signs such as droppings or destruction of vegetation. Selecting and setting traps and poison according to species, size, habits, and environments or reasons for trapping or hunting. Skinning and treating killed mammals, birds or reptiles and stretching pelts on frames to obtain desired products for sale or delivery. Maintaining and repairing trapping or hunting equipment. Applying legislative professional hunting requirements when working in the professional hunting industry. Interacting with clients in the professional hunting environment. Dealing with hunting trophies in the correct manner when working in the hunting outfitting industry.

fields.name: Hydro Power Plant Process Controller
fields.description: Provides technical support and services in the installation, operation and maintenance of hydro power plant processes, systems, facilities and equipment.
fields.tasks: Operating, monitoring and inspecting various types of energy generating power plants. Operating and controlling power generating systems and equipment including boilers, turbines, generators, condensers, and reactors in hydro, thermal, coal, oil, natural gas, and nuclear power plants to generate and distribute electrical power. Controlling start-up and shut-down of power plant equipment, controlling switching operations, regulating water levels and communicating with systems operators to regulate and coordinate transmission loads, frequency and line voltages. Taking readings from charts, meters and gauges at established intervals, troubleshooting and performing corrective action as necessary. Completing and maintaining station records, logs and reports, and communicating with other plant personnel to assess equipment operating status. Cleaning and maintaining equipment such as generators, boilers, turbines, pumps, and compressors in order to prevent equipment failure or deterioration.

fields.name: Hydrotherapist
fields.description: Uses water to relieve discomfort and promote physical well-being.
fields.tasks: Providing water-based therapeutic exercise that is designed to improve patients’ functional activities and relieve joint pain and muscular pain. Conferring with other health care providers to evaluate patient information for planning, modifying, and coordinating treatment. Instructing, motivating, safeguarding and assisting patients as they practice water-based physical exercises, relaxation techniques and functional activities. Monitoring and recording patients' progress during treatments, including measuring their range-of-joint motion and vital signs.

fields.name: Hypnotist
fields.description: Entertains by hypnotising people.
fields.tasks: Performing at auditions and casting sessions. Learning and retaining performance routines. Performing live or on camera. Communicating and co-operating with technical staff.

fields.name: ICT Account Manager
fields.description: Manages sale of computer hardware, software and services to existing account clients and identifies further sales opportunities within these accounts, builds new account clients, manages customer satisfaction and retention, and coordinates the preparation
fields.tasks: Arranging delivery of goods, installation of equipment and the provision of services.      Discussing the needs of new and existing customers and providing specialised information about how particular equipment, supplies and services meet those needs.      Quoting and negotiating prices and credit terms, and completing contracts and recording orders.      Reporting customers' reactions and requirements to manufacturers.      Selling technical equipment, supplies and related services to business establishments or individuals.      Soliciting orders and selling goods to retail, industrial, wholesale and other establishments.      Updating customer records and preparing sales reports.

fields.name: ICT Business Development Manager
fields.description: Identifies and generates new ICT business opportunities to further improve market share and awareness by gaining an understanding of customers' ICT needs and promoting goods and services to these customers. Works closely with colleagues to close sales opp
fields.tasks: Arranging delivery of goods, installation of equipment and the provision of services.      Discussing the needs of new and existing customers and providing specialised information about how particular equipment, supplies and services meet those needs.      Quoting and negotiating prices and credit terms, and completing contracts and recording orders.      Reporting customers' reactions and requirements to manufacturers.      Selling technical equipment, supplies and related services to business establishments or individuals.      Soliciting orders and selling goods to retail, industrial, wholesale and other establishments.      Updating customer records and preparing sales reports.

fields.name: ICT Communications Assistant
fields.description: Provides technical assistance to users, including diagnosing and resolving issues and problems with software, hardware, computer peripheral equipment, networks, databases, systems and the internet.
fields.tasks: Providing telephonic, face-to-face and online support to customers. Responding to enquiries about software and hardware issues. Adapting existing programs to meet users' requirements. Downloading  and installing appropriate software. Ensuring efficient use of applications and equipment. Liaising with external companies for repair and maintenance of equipment that cannot be maintained in-house. Undertaking maintenance, documenting all requests for help and services and actions taken.

fields.name: ICT Project Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates ICT projects. Accountable for day-to-day operations of resourcing, scheduling, prioritisation and task coordination, and meeting project milestones, objectives and deliverables within agreed timeframes and budget.
fields.tasks: Directing ICT operations, analysing workflow, establishing priorities, developing standards and setting deadlines. Directing the selection and installation of ICT resources and the provision of user training. Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources. Formulating and directing information and communication technology (ICT) strategies, policies and plans. Overseeing the security of ICT systems.

fields.name: ICT Sales Assistant
fields.description: Sells computing and telecommunications related goods and services in a retail or wholesale establishment.
fields.tasks: Talking to clients and potential clients, establishing their hardware and software requirements. Providing information and comparisons on products. prices and maintenance requirements. Evaluating customer requests for products according to price range, services and applications, and suggesting appropriate systems and options. Developing  proposals and information technology (IT) solution cost options for customers. Selling computers, office equipment and accessories, telephones, software and other information and communication technology (ICT) products. Processing sales orders, collecting payment and setting up service plans for customers. Managing the sourcing and delivery of products, and providing after-sales support to customers. Attending product presentations to update own knowledge of products.

fields.name: ICT Sales Representative
fields.description: Develops and converts sales opportunities into sales of computer hardware, software and ICT services.
fields.tasks: Arranging delivery of goods, installation of equipment and the provision of services.      Discussing the needs of new and existing customers and providing specialised information about how particular equipment, supplies and services meet those needs.      Quoting and negotiating prices and credit terms, and completing contracts and recording orders.      Reporting customers' reactions and requirements to manufacturers.      Selling technical equipment, supplies and related services to business establishments or individuals.      Soliciting orders and selling goods to retail, industrial, wholesale and other establishments.      Updating customer records and preparing sales reports.

fields.name: ICT Security Specialist
fields.description: Establishes, manages and administers an organisation's ICT security policy and procedures to ensure preventive and recovery strategies are in place, and minimise the risk of internal and external security threats.
fields.tasks: Conferring with users to discuss issues such as computer data access needs, security violations, and programming changes.      Developing plans to safeguard computer files against accidental or unauthorised modification, destruction, or disclosure and to meet emergency data processing needs.      Encrypting data transmissions and erecting firewalls to conceal confidential information as it is being transmitted and to keep out tainted digital transfers.      Modifying computer security files to incorporate new software, correct errors, or change individual access status.      Monitoring current reports of computer viruses to determine when to update virus protection systems.      Monitoring use of data files and regulate access to safeguard information in computer files.      Training users and promoting security awareness to ensure system security and to improve server and network efficiency. Performing risk assessments and executing tests of data processing system to ensure functioning of data processing activities and security measures.

fields.name: ICT Systems Analyst
fields.description: Evaluates processes and methods used in existing ICT systems, proposes modifications, additional system components or new systems to meet user needs as expressed in specifications and other documentation.
fields.tasks: Consulting with users to formulate and document requirements and with management to ensure agreement on systems principles.      Coordinating and linking the computer systems within an organisation to increase compatibility.      Developing functional specifications for use by systems developers.      Expanding or modifying systems to improve work flow or serve new purposes.      Identifying and analysing business processes, procedures and work practices.      Identifying and evaluating inefficiencies and recommending optimal business practices, and system functionality and behaviours.      Taking responsibility for deploying functional solutions, such as creating, adopting and implementing system test plans.

fields.name: ICT Trainer
fields.description: Analyses and evaluates information based system training needs and objectives, and develops, schedules and conducts ICT based system training programs and courses.
fields.tasks: Designing, coordinating, scheduling and conducting training and development programs. Gathering, investigating and researching background materials to gain a full understanding of the subject matter and systems.      Identifying the information technology training needs and requirements of individual users and organisations.      Keeping up-to-date with new product version releases, advances in software, and general information technology trends. Monitoring and performing ongoing evaluation and assessment of training quality and effectiveness.      Preparing and developing instructional training material and aids such as handbooks, visual aids, online tutorials, demonstration models, and supporting documentation.

fields.name: Illustrator
fields.description: Plans, designs, develops, and prepares pictures and diagrams to communicate messages, clarify meaning, assist in presentations and illustrate stories using traditional and digital media such as drawing, painting, drafting, collage, models, photography, an
fields.tasks: Liaising with clients, editors and authors in order to understand and interpret their illustration requirements. Analysing briefs’ specification and the text to be illustrated, and researching appropriate illustration styles. Thinking creatively and using own imagination to produce new ideas, and presenting these to the client. Negotiating pricing and deadlines. Creating illustrations, images and designs by using the traditional hand skills of drawing and painting alongside other technologically based techniques, in order to meet the design briefs and negotiated agreements. Using computer-aided design (CAD) packages to scan images and to change size, colours and other elements. Providing rough drafts for approval and redefining a brief through further consultation with the client. Researching appropriate galleries and finding suitable venues to exhibit original work for self-promotion if working as a freelancer.

fields.name: Immigration Officer
fields.description: Examines and assesses the entry of people from other countries, administers visas and residency applications according to immigration legislation, rules and policies, and where necessary uses legal powers to detain and remove illegal entrants.
fields.tasks: Checking travel documents of persons crossing national borders to ensure that they have the necessary authorisations and certificates. Issuing cross border permits to all eligible travellers and emergency travel documents to all eligible RSA citizens in accordance with the relevant legislation. Dealing with asylum seekers in terms of the relevant legislation. Conducting interviews and investigations of foreigners who are suspected to be illegal in the country. Detaining persons found to be in violation of immigration laws. Coordinating and cooperating with other agencies involved in law enforcement, deportation and prosecution. Patrolling national borders and coastal waters to stop persons from illegally entering or leaving the country. Performing related administrative tasks to record findings, violations and determinations. Retrieving expenses incurred from illegal foreigners in relation to their deportation, detention, maintenance and custody. Testifying in a court of law when necessary about the circumstances and results of investigations carried out.

fields.name: Importer or Exporter
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the operations of an importing or exporting establishment.
fields.tasks: Determining product mix, stock levels and service standards. Formulating and implementing purchasing and marketing policies, and setting prices.      Maintaining records of stock levels and financial transactions.      Promoting and advertising the establishment’s goods and services.      Undertaking budgeting for the establishment.    Ensuring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations. Controlling selection, training and supervision of staff.

fields.name: Import-export Administrator
fields.description: Arranges the clearance and collection of imported cargo from customs and bond stores, and the shipment of cargo for export.
fields.tasks: Classifying goods according to tariff coding system.   Preparing and processing import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.   Paying or arranging for payment of taxes and duties on shipments.   Signing documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.   Clearing goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.   Calculating duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.   Staying abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences or conferring with colleagues.   Requesting or compiling necessary import documentation such as customs invoices, certificates of origin and cargo-control documents.   Advising customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas or other customs-related matters.   Monitoring or tracing the location of goods.

fields.name: Inbound Contact Centre Consultant
fields.description: Provides expert response to complex customer enquiries according to agreed key performance indicators.
fields.tasks: Responding appropriately to calls from existing and prospective clients from a call centre environment.  Providing expert responses to a range of questions and enquiries, from basic to complex. Resolving customer problems. Providing information about company policies, products and services telephonically and via electronic communication. Assisting the employer in building and maintaining good client relationships. Dealing with highly confidential information in a secure environment.

fields.name: Indigenous Heath Worker (Inyanga)
fields.description: Liaises with patients and clients and works as a team member to arrange, coordinate and provide health care delivery in accordance with indigenous traditions.
fields.tasks: Examining patients and interviewing them and their families to determine their health status and the nature of physical or mental disorders or illnesses or other ailments. Recommending and providing care and treatment for illnesses and other ailments using traditional techniques and medicaments, such as physical manipulation and exercises, blood-letting using natural vessels, and preparations using herbs, plants, insects and animal extracts. Providing care and treatment for physical injuries such as setting and healing fractured and dislocated bones using traditional methods of physical manipulation and herbal therapies. Advising individuals, families and the community on health, nutrition, hygiene, lifestyle and other issues to maintain or improve health and well-being. Referring patients to, and exchanging information with, other health care providers to ensure comprehensive and continuing care.

fields.name: Indoor Plant Worker
fields.description: Assist with the planting and care of indoor plants.
fields.tasks: Watering indoor plants according to a contract schedule, and identifying when the watering schedule needs to be changed due to environmental factors. Feeding and fertilizing plants according to schedule, and conducting simple soil tests to determine the nutrients needed. Pruning and tidying indoor plants by removing old leaves and trimming leaf tips. Spraying foliage to control pests, fungi and viruses that attack indoor plants. Dusting and washing plants that have become dusty. Identifying and replacing plants that are not in a healthy or attractive condition. Moving plants around offices and buildings as required. Reporting any actions that need to be taken regarding the indoor plants to supervisor.

fields.name: Industrial Designer
fields.description: Plans, designs, develops and documents industrial, commercial or consumer products for manufacture with particular emphasis on ergonomic (human) factors, marketing considerations and manufacturability, and prepares them for mass or batch production.
fields.tasks: Detailing and documenting the selected design for production.     Determining the objectives and constraints of the design brief by consulting with clients and stakeholders.          Formulating design concepts for clothing, textiles, industrial, commercial and consumer products, and jewellery.      Harmonising aesthetic considerations with technical, functional, ecological and production requirements.      Negotiating design solutions with clients, management, and sales and manufacturing staff.          Preparing and commissioning prototypes and samples.          Preparing sketches, diagrams, illustrations, plans, samples and models to communicate design concepts.          Selecting, specifying and recommending functional and aesthetic materials, production methods and finishes for manufacture.          Supervising the preparation of patterns, programs and tooling, and the manufacturing process.

fields.name: Industrial Diamond Polishing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines to polish diamonds.
fields.tasks: Checking production plans and specifications to determine and select materials, settings and adjustments of finishing and polishing machines. Setting up, operating tools and attending machines using industrial diamonds as an abrasive to polish, smooth, sharpen, bore, cut or grind a wide range of workpieces, materials and surfaces. Operating and monitoring machines that use industrial diamond paste and powders to finish and polish items including gemstones, jewel bearings, ceramics, glass, metals or plastics. Monitoring plant and machines during operation by observing instruments such as temperature and pressure gauges, and adjusting controls and reporting malfunctions as necessary. Checking and maintaining production records, including information about quantities, dimensions and types of products processed.

fields.name: Industrial Engineer
fields.description: Investigates and reviews the utilisation of personnel, facilities, equipment and materials, current operational processes and established practices, to recommend improvement in the efficiency of operations in a variety of commercial, industrial and produc
fields.tasks: Studying functional statements, organizational charts and project information to determine functions and responsibilities of workers and work units and to identify areas of duplication. Establishing work measurement programs and analysing work samples to develop standards for labour utilisation. Analysing workforce utilisation, facility layout, operational data and production schedules and costs to determine optimum worker and equipment .efficiencies. Developing specifications for manufacture, and determining materials, equipment, piping, material flows, capacities and layout of plant and systems. Organising and managing project labour and the delivery of materials, plant and equipment. Establishing standards and policies for installation, modification, quality control, testing, inspection and maintenance according to engineering principles and safety regulations. Inspecting plant to improve and maintain performance. Directing the maintenance of plant buildings and equipment, and coordinating the requirements for new designs, surveys and maintenance schedules. Advising management on new production methods, techniques and equipment. Liaising with materials buying, storing and controlling departments to ensure a steady flow of supplies.

fields.name: Industrial Engineering Technician
fields.description: Tests new and existing engineering technologies relating to the utilisation of personnel, facilities, equipment and materials, current operational processes and established practices, to recommend improvement in the efficiency of operations in a variety of commercial, industrial and production environments.
fields.tasks: Collect data, provide technical assistance regarding efficient, safe and economic utilisation of personnel, material, equipment, work methods, and sequence of operations. Assist in the identification of potential hazards and in the introduction of safety procedures and devices. Modify and test equipment and devices used in the prevention, control, and remediation of environmental pollution and assist in site remediation and land reclamation. Assist in the development of environmental pollution remediation devices under the direction of an engineer. Assist engineers in the testing and design of robotic equipment Supervise the implementation of equipment and methods; and the efficient layout of plants.

fields.name: Industrial Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Analyses and modifies new and existing industrial engineering technologies and applies them in the testing and implementation of industrial engineering projects.
fields.tasks: Studying functional statements, organizational charts and project information to determine functions and responsibilities of workers and work units and to identify areas of duplication. Establishing work measurement programs and analysing work samples to develop standards for labour utilisation. Analysing workforce utilisation, facility layout, operational data and production schedules and costs to determine optimum worker and equipment efficiencies. Developing specifications for manufacture, and determining materials, equipment, piping, material flows, capacities and layout of plant and systems. Organising and managing project labour and the delivery of materials, plant and equipment. Establishing standards and policies for installation, modification, quality control, testing, inspection and maintenance according to engineering principles and safety regulations. Inspecting plant to improve and maintain performance. Directing the maintenance of plant buildings and equipment, and coordinating the requirements for new designs, surveys and maintenance schedules. Advising management on new production methods, techniques and equipment. Liaising with materials buying, storing and controlling departments to ensure a steady flow of supplies.

fields.name: Industrial Machinery Mechanic
fields.description: Fits, installs, examines, services and repairs engines, agricultural and industrial machinery and mechanical equipment (except motor vehicle, aircraft, tractors and electric motors).
fields.tasks: Fitting, installing, examining, servicing and repairing engines, machinery and mechanical equipment. Oiling and greasing stationary engines and machinery. Inspecting and testing new machinery and mechanical equipment for conformity with standards and specifications. Disassembling machinery and equipment to remove parts and make repairs. Examining parts for defects such as breakage and excessive wear. Operating newly repaired machinery and equipment to verify the adequacy of repairs. Recording repairs and maintenance performed.

fields.name: Industrial Pharmacist
fields.description: Undertakes research, testing and analysis related to the development, production, storage, quality control and distribution of drugs and related supplies.
fields.tasks: Being an indispensable and acceptable link in the health system and providing cost-effective and efficient services for the community. Receiving prescriptions for medicinal products from medical doctors and other health professionals, checking patients' medicine histories, and ensuring proper dosage and methods of administration and drug compatibility before dispensing. Preparing or supervising the preparation and labelling of liquid medicines, ointments, powders, tablets and other medications to fill prescriptions. Working in laboraties as pharmaceutical manufactucturers. Storing and preserving vaccines, serums and other drugs subject to deterioration.

fields.name: Industrial Spraypainter
fields.description: Operates spray painting equipment to paint and apply other industrial coatings to manufactured items.
fields.tasks: Applying paint as well as protective coatings of enamel or varnish on metal, wooden and other manufactured products, usually with a hand-spraying device. Preparing surfaces to be coated using a variety of methods to remove grease, dirt and rust. Mixing paints until the exact colour is matched. Covering or masking areas that are not going to be spray painted or coated. Applying numerous coats of the required colour of paint, varnish or enamel evenly on the surface, and allowing it to dry between coats. Working alongside other artisans in the manufacture of products.

fields.name: Infantry Soldier
fields.description: Practise, exercise and employ infantry tactics, techniques and procedures during military war and peace operations.
fields.tasks: Coordinating armour, artillery, and air support units.      Directing deployment of land defence weapons, vehicles, and equipment. Directing location, construction, and camouflage of landward defence positions and equipment.      Managing field communications.      Driving and operating specialised military vehicles designed for combat operations.      Performing strategic and tactical planning, including battle plan development and reconnaissance operations.

fields.name: Information Services Manager
fields.description: Designs, implements and administers record systems and related information services, to support efficient access, movement, updating, storage, retention and disposal of files and other organisational records.
fields.tasks: Directing and coordinating the planning, controlling, integrating, designing and implementation of information systems and services in a company. Overseeing the management of electronic and/or paper-based information. Storing, arranging, indexing and classifying records. Facilitating the development of filing systems, and maintaining these to meet administrative, legal and financial requirements. Devising and ensuring the implementation of retention and disposal schedules. Designing, setting up, maintaining, reviewing and documenting records systems. Advising on and implementing new records management policies and classification systems. Providing a policy framework to guide staff in the management of their records and use of the employer's records system. Preserving corporate memory and heritage.

fields.name: Information Systems Director
fields.description: Oversees the streamlined operation of the it department and ensures it aligns with the business objectives of the organization.
fields.tasks: Assigning, reviewing, managing and leading the work of systems analysts, programmers, and other computer-related workers.      Consulting with users, management, vendors, and technicians to assess computing needs and system requirements and specifying technology to meet those needs.      Directing ICT operations, analyzing workflow, establishing priorities, developing standards and setting deadlines.      Directing the selection and installation of ICT resources and the provision of user training.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Evaluating the organization's technology use and needs and recommending improvements, such as hardware and software upgrades.      Formulating and directing information and communication technology (ICT) strategies, policies and plans.      Overseeing the security of ICT systems, seminars and conferences.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Representing the enterprise or organization at ICT related conventions.

fields.name: Information Technology Manager
fields.description: Plans, coordinates, directs, and designs it-related activities of the organization, as well as provide administrative direction and support for daily operational activities of the it department.
fields.tasks: Assigning, reviewing, managing and leading the work of systems analysts, programmers, and other computer-related workers.      Consulting with users, management, vendors, and technicians to assess computing needs and system requirements and specifying technology to meet those needs.      Directing ICT operations, analyzing workflow, establishing priorities, developing standards and setting deadlines.      Directing the selection and installation of ICT resources and the provision of user training.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Evaluating the organization's technology use and needs and recommending improvements, such as hardware and software upgrades.      Formulating and directing information and communication technology (ICT) strategies, policies and plans.      Overseeing the security of ICT systems, seminars and conferences.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Representing the enterprise or organization at ICT related conventions.

fields.name: Information Technology Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches information technology (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organisational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Insect Farm Worker / Assistant
fields.description: Performs routine tasks on an insect farm such as feeding, catching, moving and harvesting insects.
fields.tasks: Giving insects food and water according to feeding schedules. Segregating insects according to specified characteristics. Collecting insects and insect products. Monitoring insects to detect if there are problems with their health or growth. Assisting with moving equipment from one location to another manually or using trucks or carts.

fields.name: Insect Farmer
fields.description: Plans, organises and performs farming operations to breed and raise insects.
fields.tasks: Arranging the sale, purchase and transportation of stock, produce and supplies and maintaining and evaluating records of farming activities.   Breeding, raising and tending insects and collecting their products.   Monitoring market activity, determining kinds and amounts of insect products to produce, planning and coordinating production accordingly.   Purchasing insects and growing or purchasing feed and other supplies.   Renting or investing in and maintaining and cleaning buildings, machinery, equipment , and structures.   Storing and carrying out some processing of produce.   Training and supervising workers in production procedures, maintenance duties, and health and safety precautions, and hiring and discharging workers and contractors.

fields.name: Instrument Mechanician
fields.description: Installs, modifies, maintains and repairs electronic instruments and control systems.
fields.tasks: Examining and testing machines, instruments, components, other equipment, instruments and control systems to identify faults. Adjusting, repairing, and replacing worn and defective parts and wiring, and maintaining machines, equipment and instruments. Reassembling, test operating and adjusting equipment. Installing electronic instruments and control systems. Coordinating work with that of engineers, technicians, and other maintenance personnel. Interpreting test data to diagnose malfunctions and systemic performance problems. Installing, adjusting, repairing or replacing electrical and electronic components using hand tools, power tools, or soldering irons.

fields.name: Insurance Administrator
fields.description: Prepares and checks documentation associated with insurance. May work in a call centre.
fields.tasks: Issuing new insurance policies, and dealing with amendments to and renewing of policies. Liaising with insurance companies and policyholders. Collecting relevant underwriting data. Administering all accounting-related functions of insurance administration. Controlling, collecting and maintaining insurance-related records and data. Handling queries and any other ad hoc administrative tasks.

fields.name: Insurance Agent
fields.description: Represents insurance companies in selling insurance to clients.
fields.tasks: Understanding the influences on the financial services environment and staying up to date with developments in the industry. Establishing and maintaining customer relationships. Identifying and analysing the customer’s financial, insurance and risk needs, and recommending and implementing insurance and financial solutions. Evaluating the risks and exposures of potential clients (if involved in underwriting activities) and deciding whether or not to insure, and if so on the cover and premiums.

fields.name: Insurance Broker
fields.description: Operates as an independent agent to sell life, fire, accident, industrial or other forms of insurance for a range of insurance companies.
fields.tasks: Understanding influences on the financial services environment and staying up to date with developments in the industry. Establishing and maintaining customer relationships. Identifying and analysing the customer’s financial, insurance and risk needs. Recommending and implementing insurance and financial solutions.

fields.name: Insurance Claims Administrator
fields.description: Determines liability and negotiates and audits insurance settlements.
fields.tasks: Applying insurance rating systems and calculating the value of a claim. Contacting insured or other persons to obtain missing information. Posting or attaching information to the claim file. Preparing and reviewing insurance claim forms and related documents for completeness. Providing customer service by giving limited instructions on how to proceed with claims or providing referrals to auto repair facilities or local contractors. Reviewing insurance policies to determine coverage. Forwarding claims for payment or further investigation.

fields.name: Insurance Investigator
fields.description: Conducts investigations into insurance claims to ensure their validity.
fields.tasks: Receiving notification of a claim and investigating the validity of the claim. Assessing a claim to determine the claims' outcome, which may include seeking expert opinions, reports and recommendations. Mitigating and finalising the claims' process by recommending to settle, to conditionally settle or to reject the claim in terms of the policy contract. Commenting on risk improvements where applicable.

fields.name: Insurance Loss Adjuster
fields.description: Inspects and assesses the damage and loss to insured property and business, estimates insurance costs, and acts to minimise the cost of claims to an insurance company.
fields.tasks: Receiving claim information from a Claims Investigator, Claims Assessor or Negotiator of an Insurance Company and investigating the circumstances around the claim to ensure that the peril which caused the loss or damage is in fact an insured peril. Assessing a claim to make recommendations to an insurer on whether the claim should be settled or rejected. Calculating the value of the claim. Producing a report to the insurer detailing the investigation process, findings of the investigation and recommendation on how to proceed with the claim and risk mitigation where applicable.

fields.name: Insurance Policy Administration Manager
fields.description: Manages, controls and audits the administration of insurance policies of existing businesses and specialist products.
fields.tasks: Providing overall direction and management for an insurance policy administration service.   Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation, expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Coordinating cooperation with other service provision agencies in the same or related fields.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.   Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and standards for staff.      Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of other insurance administration personnel.      Managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Monitoring and evaluating resources devoted to the provision of services.

fields.name: Insurance Risk Surveyor
fields.description: Inspects items and properties to evaluate conditions affecting underwriting standards, and develops and promotes safety programs.
fields.tasks: Receiving requests from an insurance company to conduct risk surveys for underwriting purpose of a new risk, renewal purposes or after a claim incident. Assessing the risk of premises, construction sites or business processes by evaluating materials used, safety procedures implemented, legislative compliance factors and various other risk factors which may be affected. Preparing reports for underwriters outlining the process followed, findings made, and the recommendations proposed on risk mitigating factors and how to manage or rate the risk.

fields.name: Integrated Manufacturing Line Machine Setter
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and runs and monitors a range of machines and equipment in an integrated manufacturing line.
fields.tasks: Starting, monitoring and adjusting machines as needed. Watching gauges, dials, or other indicators to make sure a machine is working properly. Controlling operations of equipment or systems. Conducting tests and inspections of products, services, or processes to evaluate quality or performance. Inspecting products to verify that they meet specifications and determining whether machine adjustment is needed. Replacing depleted supply packages with full packages. Observing operations to detect defects, malfunctions, or supply shortages. Operating machines for test runs to verify adjustments and to obtain product samples.

fields.name: Integrated Manufacturing Line Process Control Technician
fields.description: Provides technical support and services in the development of manufacturing methods, facilities and systems, and in the planning, estimating, measuring and scheduling of an integrated manufacturing line.
fields.tasks: Performing production maintenance activities and reporting irregularities within organisational structures. Applying the fundamental concepts relating to production planning, scheduling and control. Applying quality control and quality assurance practices for efficient and effective production processes.

fields.name: Integrated Manufacturing Line Technician
fields.description: Provides technical support and services in the development of manufacturing methods, facilities and systems, and in the planning, estimating, measuring and scheduling of an integrated manufacturing line.
fields.tasks: Optimising organisational structures, functions and processes in order to contribute to achieving production specifications. Demonstrating an understanding of production technology practices, terminology and systems as applied in manufacturing, engineering and technology.

fields.name: Integration Aide
fields.description: Assists children with developmental disabilities in mainstream schools.
fields.tasks: Assessing students' abilities and limitations with regard to intellectual, physical, social and emotional impairments, exceptional intellectual gifts, or other specific problems.   Conferring with other staff members to plan and schedule lessons for special needs students.   Conferring with students, parents, teachers and other relevant professionals involved in the students’ care to develop individual educational plans designed to promote students' development.   Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and policies and procedures to maintain order among students.   Preparing and maintaining student data and other records and submitting reports.   Stimulating and developing students’ confidence interests, abilities, manual skills and coordination.   Tutoring academic subjects, and practical and self-help skills to students with impairments.

fields.name: Intelligence Officer
fields.description: Manages the collection and processing of data to produce intelligence for public and private sector organisations in their planning, operations and personnel functions.
fields.tasks: Collecting and analysing information and data to produce intelligence for an organisation to support planning, operations and human resource unctions. Collating and validating intelligence, evaluating the reliability of sources and credibility of information. Building up intelligence pictures, identifying potential agents and targets. Developing relationships with clients to understand their intelligence requirements. Delivering information in formal reports or as presentations and desk-level briefings to clients such as the SA government, which include, among other things, Defence, Foreign Affairs, Customs, the State Security Agency and the South African Police Service (SAPS). Liaising and collaborating with colleagues in South Africa’s intelligence and security agencies to get further information which may help to put together the whole picture.

fields.name: Intelligence Operator
fields.description: Collects information for the purpose of contributing to the intelligence process.
fields.tasks: Collecting information through various methods including internet and document searches, interviews, surveillance etc.. Managing databases of relevant information. Analysing information.      Contributing to the compilation of intelligence products.      Controlling and distribution of information.      Liaising with relevant role-players in the process of information collection.

fields.name: Intensive Care Ambulance Paramedic / Ambulance Paramedic
fields.description: Provides specialised pre-hospital health care to injured, sick, infirm and aged persons and emergency transport to medical facilities.
fields.tasks: Assessing the health status of persons involved in accidents, natural disasters and other emergency situations, and determining needs for immediate and specialised medical assistance. Rescuing people from emergency situations or from potential emergency situations. Attending and/or patrolling large-scale public gatherings and other events where health emergencies are more likely to occur. Monitoring changes in the health status of patients during transport to and from medical, rehabilitation and other health care facilities. Performing medical procedures and administering drugs and other therapies according to protocol for emergency medical treatment and level of training, including resuscitating and defibrillating patients and operating life-support equipment. Providing information and training to community groups and essential service workers in first aid for initial care of an illness or injury. Recording information on patients' conditions and treatments provided in medical records-keeping systems. Driving emergency care vehicles such as ambulances.

fields.name: Intensive Care Technician
fields.description: Administers first aid treatment and transport sick or injured persons to medical facilities, working as a member of an emergency medical team.
fields.tasks: Explaining procedures, observing and positioning patients, and using protection devices to ensure safety and comfort during examination or treatment.   Positioning treatment equipment and adjusting settings and controls according to technical specifications.   Monitoring patients' conditions and reactions, reporting abnormal signs to a medical practitioner.   Following prescription issued by a medical practitioner.   Operating or overseeing operation equipment.   Reviewing and evaluating information and recording results of procedures.

fields.name: Interactive and Direct Marketing Strategist
fields.description: Plan, organize, direct, control and evaluate the design, development and maintenance of interactive and direct marketing strategies, this includes internet and intranet sites to manage an organization's internet presence, public relations, communications
fields.tasks: Determining price lists, discount and delivery terms, sales promotion budgets, sales methods, special incentives and campaigns.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures related to sales and marketing activities.      Establishing and managing budgets and controlling expenditure to ensure the efficient use of resources.      Leading and managing the activities of sales and marketing staff.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Planning and directing daily operations.      Planning and organizing special sales and marketing programmes based on sales records and market assessments.      Representing the enterprise or organization at sales and marketing conventions, trade exhibitions and other forums.

fields.name: Interior Decorator
fields.description: Plans the interior design of commercial or residential premises and arranges for decorating work to be done.
fields.tasks: Visiting clients' premises to look at existing conditions and advising them on the selection of colour schemes, layout, lighting, furniture, floor coverings, curtains, paint, wallpaper and hardware products.   Conferring with clients to determine factors affecting planning interior environments such as budget, architectural preferences, purpose and function.   Advising clients on interior design factors such as space planning, layout and utilization of furnishings or equipment as well as colour coordination.   Preparing sketches, diagrams, illustrations and plans to communicate design concepts and estimated costs.   Selecting, specifying and recommending functional and aesthetic materials, furniture and products for interiors.   Subcontracting fabrication and installation of carpeting, fixtures, accessories, draperies, paint and wall coverings, art work, furniture and related items.

fields.name: Interior Designer
fields.description: Plans, designs, details and supervises the construction of commercial, industrial, retail and residential building interiors to produce an environment tailored to a purpose, with particular emphasis on space creation, space planning, and factors that enha
fields.tasks: Conferring with clients to determine factors affecting planning interior environments, such as budget, architectural preferences, purpose and function.   Researching and analysing spatial, functional, efficiency, safety and aesthetic requirements.   Advising clients on interior design factors such as space planning, layout and utilisation of furnishings or equipment as well as colour coordination. Preparing sketches, diagrams, illustrations and plans to communicate design concepts sometimes using computer-aided drafting (CAD) and related software to produce these documents.   Estimating material requirements and costs and negotiating design solutions with clients, management, suppliers and construction staff.   Coordinating with other professionals, such as contractors, architects, engineers and plumbers to ensure job success.

fields.name: Internal Audit Manager
fields.description: Advises organisations on a systematic and disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of the organisations risk management, control and governance processes in accordance with the Internal Audit Charter.
fields.tasks: Planning, directing, and supervising the internal audit functions of an organisation. Conducting contract and business reviews. Assessing key risks of the organisation. Reviewing management controls. Preparing and presenting reports to management and to the audit committee of the organisation. Liaising between management and auditors in the internal audit function.

fields.name: Internal Auditor
fields.description: Evaluates and improves the effectiveness of risk management, control, and governance processes within an organisation.
fields.tasks: Providing internal audit assurance and reporting to the audit committee of an organisation. Providing an independent view on the organisation’s governance,  risk management and control processes. Evaluating controls and advising managers at all levels on the efficiency of control mechanisms. Evaluating and reporting on the effectiveness and efficiency of the implementation of management policies. Identifying and evaluating key risk factors in the organisation and ensuring that risks are effectively managed. Reviewing and ensuring compliance with rules, regulations, laws, codes of practice, guidelines and principles as they apply individually and collectively to all parts of the organisation.

fields.name: Interpreter
fields.description: Transfers a spoken or signed language into another spoken or signed language, usually within a limited time frame in the presence of the participants requiring the translation.
fields.tasks: Interpreting from a spoken or a signed language into another spoken or signed language , in particular at conferences, meetings and similar occasions, and ensuring that the correct meaning and, as far as possible, the spirit of the original are transmitted.      Revising and correcting translated material.

fields.name: Investment Advisor
fields.description: Advises clients in respect of securities and other financial investments and instruments.
fields.tasks: Providing investment and retirement planning to clients. Giving advice about securities to clients i.e. receiving compensation for giving advice on investing in stocks, bonds, mutual funds, or exchange traded funds. Marketing services to new investment business clients. Preparing and presenting proposals to potential clients using state of the art financial planning tools. Managing and maintaining new and existing client relationships. Adhering to financial compliance and operational procedures.

fields.name: Investment Analyst
fields.description: Analyses individual securities, industries and the economy, publishes reports and makes recommendations regarding investments.
fields.tasks: Researching and reading the financial statements and market data of companies. Analysing  the financial information relating to specific companies, e.g. company results, profit and loss, balance sheet and cash flow statements to determine how a company is positioned to deliver for investors. Keeping up to date with market developments, new investment products and all other areas that can affect the markets, e.g. movements in the economies of relevant countries. Conducting financial modelling and projections and writing research reports for fund manager or clients. Considering how the economic implications of factors such as natural disasters, might influence the performance of companies and funds. Meeting with and providing information and recommendations to fund managers e.g. summaries of research, investment ideas, key events. Monitoring the financial news using specialist media sources.

fields.name: Investment Manager
fields.description: Manages a portfolio of securities, in which he/she may exercise his/her own discretion, on behalf of clients.
fields.tasks: Making investment decisions on how their clients’ assets should be used or managing a financial institution's asset and liability (loan and deposit) portfolios. Making decisions about investment mix and policy, matching investments to objectives, asset allocation for individuals and institutions, and balancing risk against performance. Designing customised investment solutions for clients as per their income, age as well as their ability to undertake risks. Managing and working with a team of analysts and researchers to establish an investment strategy, selecting appropriate investments and allocating each investment properly for a fund. Keeping abreast with the latest changes in the financial market by reading reports, talking to company managers and monitoring industry and economic trends.

fields.name: Ironer or Presser
fields.description: Irons or presses garments and other fabrics such as delicate and formal wear in a commercial laundry or private residence.
fields.tasks: Sorting, folding and packing linen, clothing and other laundered items than do not require ironing. Doing flatwork ironing such as sheets and tablecloths using special ironing machines. Folding and stacking sheets, towels, diapers or other flatwork. Ironing shirts, ruffled curtains, blankets, or other items that require special pressing and finishing using specialised equipment. Using hand irons to finish certain items that cannot be done on with specialised ironing presses. Folding finished items, placing them on hangers, packaging articles and preparing orders for delivery or collection. Replacing buttons and making minor repairs to laundered items. Carrying out other laundry tasks if required.

fields.name: Irrigationist
fields.description: Installs and maintains irrigation systems to ensure optimum soil moisture levels for the production of fruit, crop, flowers or trees. May work on a farm.
fields.tasks: Starting water pumps, opening valves and plugging and unplugging pipes to direct irrigation water.    Regulating water flow into canals by operating gates, checking turnouts and waste ways and adjusting valves. Assembling and disassembling portable irrigation systems and moving them as required. Measuring or estimating the quantity of water required and delivered to crops. Shovelling and packing soil in low spots of embankments to seal them, or cutting trenches in high areas to direct water flow. Patrolling the irrigated area to detect leaks, breaks, weak areas, or obstructions and damage to the irrigation system. Lubricating, adjusting, and repairing or replacing parts to maintain irrigation systems, using hand tools as necessary. Assisting with other farm-related activities when not involved with irrigation.

fields.name: Jam Maker
fields.description: Selects and mixes fruit and vegetables and cooks jam.
fields.tasks: Weighing or measuring ingredients, or products to ensure conformance to requirements. Operating or tending machines to mix or blend fruits or vegetables with other ingredients as required. Adding ingredients such as sugar, spices and vinegar to assist preservation and enhance texture, appearance and flavor. Using hand tools or other devices in the processing of ingredients. Cooking ingredients according to specified time and instructions. Examining ingredients or products visually or with hands to ensure conformance to established standards. Stopping mixing or blending machines when specified product qualities are obtained. Open valves and starting pumps to transfer mixtures. Testing samples of products to ensure compliance with specifications, using testing equipment. Transferring jam to sterile jars, bottles or other containers.

fields.name: Jetty Operator
fields.description: Controls and operates mooring, pollution control and safety equipment on a jetties.
