fields.tasks: Undertaking jetty operations in a safe and efficient manner ensuring that operational and client requirements are met and complying with the port’s legal operating procedures.   Ensuring tasks are carried out in a safe and efficient manner minimising any potential hazards including environmental damage.   Connecting / disconnecting loading arms, spool pieces, samplers etc. in accordance with discharge / loading orders in a safe manner to ensure cargo is loaded and unloaded in a timely manner. Monitoring of ship to shore interface during loading / discharge / bunkering / ballasting or any vessel operation whilst alongside the jetties.  Monitoring of terminal storage tank levels whilst product movements are in progress to avoid under or overloading. Maintaining jetty logs and ensuring that a concise jetty handover is undertaken on shift change to ensure continuity of service and minimise the possibility of errors.  Pre-arrival and post departure checking and cleaning up of jetty area to maintain good housekeeping.  Providing information for incident investigations as required ensuring continuous improvement and standards are maintained.  Reporting all observations of defects, near misses and incidents that could have or did compromise health, safety, environment, plant integrity or security.

fields.name: Jewellery Designer
fields.description: Conceptualises and designs prototypes and details for the manufacture of jewellery and objects for personal adornment including watches and spectacles, home wares and other objects such as trophies and silverware using metals, precious stones, plastics, e
fields.tasks: Determining the objectives and constraints of the design brief by consulting with clients and stakeholders. Harmonizing aesthetic considerations with technical, functional, ecological and production requirements. Preparing sketches, diagrams, illustrations, plans, samples and models to communicate design concepts. Negotiating design solutions with clients, management, and sales and manufacturing staff. Selecting, specifying and recommending functional and aesthetic materials, production methods and finishes for manufacture. Detailing and documenting the selected design for production.

fields.name: Jewellery Evaluator
fields.description: Evaluates gemstones and jewellery to determine their monitory value.
fields.tasks: Comparing colours, shapes, textures, or grades gemstones with colour charts or samples to verify conformance to standards. Examining gem surfaces and internal structures using microscopes and other optical instruments to differentiate between stones, detect flaws or peculiarities affecting gem values. Immersing stones in prescribed chemical solutions to determine specific gravities and key properties of gemstones or substitutes. Identifying and documenting stones' clarity characteristics using plot diagrams. Writing test or inspection reports describing results, recommendations or needed repairs of jewellery. Estimating wholesale and retail value of gemstones and jewellery following pricing guides, market fluctuations, and other relevant economic factors.

fields.name: Jewellery Processing and Finishing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines to plate or electroplate metals or coat materials.
fields.tasks: Setting up and operating machinery which plates or coats metals or other materials as part of jewellery production. Observing meters and gauges, and adjusting valves and controls to ensure the safe and efficient operation of equipment. Detecting malfunctions and assisting with machinery maintenance and repair. Examining samples visually or by hand to verify qualities such as clarity, cleanliness, consistency, dryness and texture. Recording information about processing completed during shifts such as the quantities, types and dimensions of materials produced. Collecting samples for testing in laboratories if so required. Sorting, stacking and moving processed minerals for packaging, further processing or shipping.

fields.name: Jockey
fields.description: Rides horses in competitive races, race trials, and in exercises. This occupation requires high levels of physical fitness, sporting ability and personal commitment as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications or experience.
fields.tasks: Adhering to the rules and regulations associated with horse racing. Participating in regular practice and training sessions and undertaking training to maintain the required standard of fitness and skill. Maintaining a high degree of expertise in horse racing. Assessing other competitors and conditions at race courses. Deciding on strategies in consultation with trainers. Competing in horse races. Undertaking horse racing promotional activities and media interviews.

fields.name: Joiner
fields.description: Cuts, shapes and fits timber parts in workshops to form structures and fittings, ready for installation.
fields.tasks: Making, altering and repairing structural and other woodwork at a work-bench and on a construction site. Constructing, erecting and installing heavy-framed wooden structures on building sites. Fitting, assembling and altering internal and external fixtures of buildings, such as walls, doors, door and window frames, facings and panelling. Making, repairing and fitting scenic equipment for theatrical performances, motion picture or television productions. Constructing, assembling, altering and repairing wooden fixtures and fittings in train coaches, aircraft, ships, boats, floats, and other vehicles.

fields.name: Judge
fields.description: Presides over civil and criminal proceedings in a court of law.
fields.tasks: Determining the rights and obligations of the parties involved in court cases. Interpreting and enforcing rules of procedure and making rulings regarding the admissibility of evidence in a case. Presiding over civil and criminal trials and hearings in the high courts. Weighing and considering evidence and deciding legal guilt or innocence, or the degree of liability of the accused or defendant. Passing sentence on persons convicted in criminal cases. Determining damages or other appropriate remedy in civil cases. Issuing court orders. Researching legal issues and writing opinions on the issues. Serving on various committees and boards.

fields.name: Judicial Court Manager
fields.description: Manages and controls the administrative component of the court.
fields.tasks: Controlling and managing the administrative operations of the court such as business and budget planning, statistical analysis and statutory report preparation, and expenditure on supplies, equipment and services. Coordinating cooperation with service providers and stakeholders, including managing service level agreements and communication and relations with both internal and external stakeholders. Supporting case flow management at the court. Managing the facility, physical resources, information and communication related to the court including coordinating and managing risks and security. Monitoring and evaluating court services by compiling and analysing court statistics to show performance and trends. Overseeing the selection, training and performance of court staff. Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and standards for court staff. Directing, supervising, coordinating and evaluating the work activities of personnel employed by the court. Planning, directing, coordinating and improving the provision of court services.

fields.name: Juice Extraction and Blending Process Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines and performs routine tasks to extract and process juice from fresh agricultural produce and produce, store and package concentrated and formulated juice products.
fields.tasks: Mixing, pulping, grinding, blending and separating foodstuffs and liquids with churning, pressing, sieving, grinding and filtering equipment. Operating machinery to crush, mix, malt, cook and ferment grains and fruits to produce beer, wines, malt liquors, vinegar, yeast and related products.

fields.name: Juice Extraction Process Controller
fields.description: Monitors and controls mechanical and operational efficiency of production facilities, equipment, plant and related resources in the extraction and processing of juice from fresh agricultural produce.
fields.tasks: Manufacturing a safe, quality assured fruit and vegetable products by operating, controlling and maintaining fruit and vegetable processing line, from the raw materials until fruit and vegetable products are manufactured.

fields.name: Kitchenhand
fields.description: Assists kitchen and service staff prepare and serve food, and cleans food preparation and service areas.
fields.tasks: Washing worktables, walls, refrigerators and meat blocks in food preparation areas and sculleries in commercial kitchens. Mopping floors in kitchens and storage areas. Scraping scraps of food from dirty dishes and washing them by hand or placing them in dishwashing machines.  Removing refuse, placing it in designated containers and steam-cleaning or hosing out garbage cans. Washing pots, pans and trays by hand. Transferring supplies and equipment between storage and work areas by hand or by using a hand truck. Washing and peeling vegetables, using knives or peeling machines. Assembling and preparing ingredients for cooking. Packing food and beverage trays for serving. Loading or unloading trucks, and picking up or delivering supplies and food.

fields.name: Knitting Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, loads, operates and monitors knitting machinery and equipment to produce knitted products.
fields.tasks: Threading machines for knitting. Turning knobs, screws and dials to adjust settings of knitting machines. Setting up and operating batteries of automatic, link-type knitting machines to knit garments of specified patterns and designs. Operating and monitoring knitting machines to knit lace, trimming and hosiery of desired pattern or design. Tending circular knitting machines with automatic pattern controls that knit seamless hose. Performing equipment maintenance tasks such as replacing needles and sanding rough areas of needles. Cleaning, oiling and lubricating machines using air hoses, cleaning solutions, oil cans and/or grease guns.

fields.name: Labelling Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates and monitors machines which label various products.
fields.tasks: Operating machines that label products, packages and various containers by gluing or other methods. Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of raw materials and processing agents or in-process products into the machines. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of machine and verify specified processing conditions. Analysing sample products, performing tests, recording data and writing production logs. Informing supervisors if machine requires adjustment, maintenance or repair.

fields.name: Laboratory Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the operations of a research or production laboratory.
fields.tasks: Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation, expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Coordinating cooperation with other service provision agencies in the same or related fields.      Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and standards for staff.      Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of professional, technical, clerical, service, maintenance, and other personnel.      Managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Monitoring and evaluating resources devoted to the provision of services.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Planning, directing and coordinating the provision of services.      Providing overall direction and management for a laboratory.

fields.name: Labour Dispute Enforcement Agent
fields.description: Monitors the compliance with regard to grievance, disciplinary and dispute procedures.
fields.tasks: Providing advice and information to employers and employees about their rights and obligations under the Labour Relations Act.   Investigating the nature and causes of labour disputes.   Interviewing claimants, agents, or witnesses to obtain information about disputed issues.   Conferring with disputants to clarify issues, identify underlying concerns and develop an understanding of their respective needs and interests.   Assisting parties to reach resolutions on disputed issues.   Preparing settlement agreements for disputants to sign. Monitoring the implementation of policies to ensure compliance with dispute agreements and labour contracts.   Using records of actions taken in respect of grievances, arbitration and mediation cases, and other related labour relations activities, to identify potential problem areas.   Performing any other functions that may be necessary to promote workplace harmony and cooperation.   Writing statistical reports on activities undertaken.

fields.name: Labour Inspector
fields.description: Ensure compliance to labour related legislation through law enforcement inspections, guidance and corrective actions performed on site (on site includes international, national, local).
fields.tasks: Conducting occupational inspections with the aim of ensuring compliance with all labour legislations, promoting good labour practices and providing information and advice on labour laws. Co-ordinating, monitoring, organising, planning, checking and verifying of inspectorate activities.  Allocating proactive and reactive inspections. Ensuring that inspections and enforcements are carried out according to standards, directives and policies of the Department of Labour. Compiling monthly statistics on inspections. Undertaking ad-hoc inspections.

fields.name: Labour Market Analyst
fields.description: Analyses, interprets and verifies employment statistical data to produce reports related to occupational staffing, wage rates, employment and unemployment patterns and estimates.
fields.tasks: Designing and conducting quantitative labour market research projects on labour market conditions, the availability and development of skills, laws and policies impacting on the labour market and models of employment. Keeping up with national and international research and knowledge of labour market information e.g.policies, indicators and benchmarks. Maintaining databases of statistical data relating to socio-economics and labour market trends, per economic sector. Presenting technical and analytical results in a simply and clear way, orally or in writing to non-expert audiences. Working individually or as member of a team in monitoring labour market conditions and updating labour market forecasting. Developing and improving labour market forecasting models, products, and tools.

fields.name: Labour Recruitment Consultant: Permanent Employment Agency (PEA)
fields.description: Establishes, develops and maintains long-term relationships with candidates and clients by providing recruitment and selection services and suitable placements.
fields.tasks: Using sales, business development, marketing techniques and social networking in order to attract business from client companies and employment candidates. Discussing with enterprises/organizations the skills and other characteristics of the workers they need to fill permanent vacancies. Visiting client organisations to build and develop relationships and to develop a good understanding of their companies, industry, work culture and environment. Advertising vacancies for permanent positions by drafting and placing adverts in a wide range of media including newspapers, websites, and magazines. Headhunting (or identifying and approaching suitable candidates who may already be employed). Using candidate databases to match the right person to the clients’ vacancies. Receiving and reviewing job applications, preparing CV’s, conducting interviews and tests, requesting candidate references, and creating a shortlist of candidates for the client organisation. Briefing the candidate about the responsibilities, salary and benefits of the job in question. Organising interviews for candidates as requested by the client and informing candidates about the results of their interviews. Negotiating pay and salary rates and finalising arrangements between client and candidates. Offering advice to both clients and candidates on pay rates, training and career progression.

fields.name: Labour Recruitment Consultant: Temporary Employment Services (TES)
fields.description: Provides and manages outsourced staff including recruitment and selection, industrial relations, people management, payroll & site supervision.
fields.tasks: Using sales, business development, marketing techniques and social networking in order to attract business from client companies and employment candidates. Discussing with enterprises/organizations the skills and other characteristics of the workers they need to fill temporary staffing positions in their particular economic sector. Visiting client organisations to build and develop relationships and to develop a good understanding of their companies, industry, work culture and environment. Advertising vacancies for temporary staffing positions by drafting and placing adverts in a wide range of media including newspapers, websites, and magazines. Receiving and reviewing CV’s, managing and conducting interviews and tests and requesting candidate references. Maintaining a database of candidates who are available for short-term employment assignments, keeping their information up to date and removing candidates from the database that have been placed in permanent positions. Using candidate databases to match the right person to the clients’ staffing requirements. Maintaining relationships with temporary employees and with management at the companies/organisations at which they are placed, and addressing any labour-related issues as they arise.  Being up to date with the latest labour legislation for industrial relations related matters. Managing most of the Human Resources aspects of temporary workers’ employment including administration, payroll, performance, discipline, transport etc.

fields.name: Labour Recruitment Manager
fields.description: Manages people and resources to ensure compliance and operational delivery of recruitment services.
fields.tasks: Liaising with project directors and business unit heads to collate recruitment needs. Liaising with project directors and business unit heads to collate external recruitment needs. Selecting appropriate manpower by screening, interviewing and testing applicants. Managing of a team of Recruitment Officers/Coordinators. Organisation of recruitment trips to find promising job applicants. Writing management reports on labour recruitment activity.

fields.name: Labour Relations Case Administrator
fields.description: Provides administrative, screening and pre-conciliation services for referred labour disputes.
fields.tasks: Providing administrative support in industrial relations cases. Coordinating meetings, conferences and appointments for the Industrial Relations manager. Preparing documents, meeting agendas, correspondence and memoranda that require the signature of the Industrial Relations manager. Maintaining grievance files and ensuring that personnel records are up-to-date. Facilitating the management of disciplinary and grievance hearings.   Taking minutes at disciplinary and grievance hearing meetings. Advising, coaching and supporting line managers on the implementation of human resources policies and procedures. Participating in the reporting and administration of other human resources policies and procedures.

fields.name: Lagger
fields.description: Applies insulating materials such as felt, fibreglass, polyurethane and cork to pipes, steam generators, process vats and ducting, and secures insulation with wire, wire netting, staples, metal strapping and using welding torches.
fields.tasks: Applying insulating material to structures such as air ducts, hot and cold pipes, storage tanks and cold storage room walls. Brushing on adhesives or attaching metal adhesive-backed pins to flat surfaces as necessary to facilitate the application of insulation material. Measuring and cutting insulation material to the required size and shape for encasing flat or round surfaces. Fitting, wrapping or attaching required insulation material following application specifications. Covering or sealing insulation with plastic covers, canvas strips, sealant or tape, according to the type of insulation used and structure being insulated.

fields.name: Lampman
fields.description: Issues and receives lamproom equipment, applies good housekeeping, charges, stores, maintains and repairs equipment.
fields.tasks: Managing the activities in a lamproom in the mining environment. Maintaining lamproom equipment including access control turnstiles, time and attendance systems, battery charger racks, and gas calibration stations. Managing and maintaining portable mine lighting equipment and portable gas detection instruments. Complying with the law and code of practice that is specific to each shaft and mine. Planning and executing mine health and safety programmes efficiently.

fields.name: Landscape Architect
fields.description: Plans and designs land areas for projects such as open space networks, parks, schools, institutions, roads, external areas for all building types, land subdivisions, and commercial, industrial and residential sites.
fields.tasks: Designing projects such as urban regeneration schemes, pedestrian schemes, road or retail schemes that deliver function while maintaining the character and natural beauty of sites. Liaising with clients to establish the general landscaping requirements. Conducting preliminary assessments of the site including contours, soil, ecology and existing infrastructure to determine if the site has the potential to meet the client's specifications. Carrying out environmental impact assessments and seeking and taking into account the views of local residents, potential users and parties with a vested interest in the project. Preparing and presenting detailed plans and working drawings, including applications, construction details and specifications for the project using computer-aided design (CAD) packages. Presenting proposals to clients, dealing with enquiries and negotiating any amendments to the final design. Managing, conducting and monitoring work on-site and contacting and coordinating manufacturers and suppliers to ensure that deadlines are met. Liaising with other professionals such as civil engineers, hydrologists and architects on projects.

fields.name: Landscape Gardener
fields.description: Plans and constructs garden landscapes.
fields.tasks: Preparing land by conditioning soil, levelling ground and installing and operating irrigation and drainage systems.   Planting trees, hedges, garden plants and grass.   Pruning and trimming trees, shrubs and hedges, installing plant supports and protection, and rolling, mowing aerating and edging lawns.   Constructing features and facilities within gardens such as paths or paved areas, walls, rockeries, garden beds ponds and water features, sheds and fences.   Checking the health of plants and trees, identifying and treating weeds, pests and diseases, and applying mulch and fertilisers.   Producing saplings, bulbs and seeds and raising plants from seeds or cuttings.   Maintaining buildings, greenhouses and other structures, equipment and water supply systems.

fields.name: Language Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches language (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Laundry Machine Operator
fields.description: Sorts, cleans, irons, folds and packages linen, clothing and other garments in a commercial laundry.
fields.tasks: Sorting articles for cleaning according to the type, colour, fabric and cleaning treatment required. Placing sorted articles into receptacles and onto conveyor belts for cleaning in a commercial laundry. Checking and removing stains from garments, and replacing buttons and making minor repairs. Loading and unloading washing machines, driers and extractors. Adding cleaning agents and starches to washing machines. Stopping and starting machines to untangle, straighten and remove articles. Smoothing articles and guiding them through cleaning machines. Packaging clean articles and preparing orders for dispatch. Placing articles on shelves and hanging articles for delivery and collection.

fields.name: Laundry Worker (General)
fields.description: Sorts, cleans, irons, and folds linen, clothing and other garments by hand.
fields.tasks: Sorting and weighing soiled laundry, and loading and unloading washing machines. Selecting correct cycles, formulas, temperatures and drying times. Preparing and loading laundry chemicals including detergent, bleach, fabric softener and other washing chemicals into machine dispensers. Operating washing machines, dryers, extractors, ironers, steam cabinets, folders and sewing machines. Monitoring machines for problems and performing minor maintenance. Storing and securing laundry supplies and equipment, and cleaning the laundry area. Inspecting, mending and marking clean laundry. Placing laundered articles on shelves and hanging articles for delivery and collection. Performing ironing or pressing tasks if required.

fields.name: Law Clerk
fields.description: Performs specialised clerical work associated with legal practice and law courts.
fields.tasks: Working under the supervision of a Principle Attorney. Handling facts and applying legal principles to factual situations. Researching legal problems by utilising the proper sources of the law. Assisting in advocacy by arguing elementary cases before the courts and tribunals and effectively presenting written legal arguments. Managing office procedure and routine including keeping attorney’s books and files and preparing and rendering bills of costs. Drafting documents including straightforward contracts, wills, pleadings, legal opinions etc. Communicating with clients, witnesses and others in the legal sector through interviewing, taking instructions and giving advice and writing letters etc. Assisting in negotiating with a view to settling the terms of an agreement or an out-of-court settlement etc. Preparing legal opinions and briefs for Counsel. Keeping proper accounting records and handling trust money.

fields.name: Leaflet or Newspaper Deliverer
fields.description: Collects leaflets or newspapers from a collection point and delivers them to homes in a specified area.
fields.tasks: Collecting leaflets or newspapers from designated collection points and delivering them to homes in a specified area. Delivering newspapers to subscribers along prescribed routes. Reviewing lists of subscribers for changes in newspaper deliveries. Keeping records of subscription deliveries made. Distributing promotional material to customers along with newspaper deliveries. Keeping records pertaining to driving expenses such as mileage, oil and petrol used if own car is used for deliveries.

fields.name: Leather Processing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines and equipment to convert raw hides and skins into finished leather for use in clothing, footwear, upholstery and leather goods.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines which remove flesh and fat from hides or pelts to clean and soften them. Operating and monitoring machines which remove long coarse hair from fur pelts, trim hair to even length and dye, stretch and smooth dressed pelts. Operating and monitoring machines to remove epidermis hair roots, pigment cells and lime salts from grain side of skin. Operating and monitoring machines to reduce thickness of hide or skin to uniform size. Operating and monitoring machines to polish or roughen hides or skins to specified finish. Operating and monitoring machines which separate residual wool from skins, or flesh and hair from hides. Operating and monitoring machines in which hides are split edgeways to form two or more pieces or to give uniform thickness. Operating and monitoring machines which treat hides and skins in solutions to convert them into leather. Treating surface of leather with oil and operating glazing machine to give glossy finish to leather. Operating and monitoring machines which apply dyes and stains to leather. Maintaining and repairing vats and other machinery.

fields.name: Legal Executive
fields.description: Acts for and on behalf of clients in the areas of company and business law, trusts, wills, probate and litigation under the general supervision of a barrister or solicitor.

fields.name: Legal Secretary
fields.description: Performs secretarial, clerical and other administrative tasks in support of legal professionals.
fields.tasks: Assisting in the preparation of budgets, monitoring of expenditure, drafting of contracts and purchasing or acquisition orders. Mailing, faxing, or arranging for delivery of legal correspondence to clients, witnesses, and court officials. Organising and maintaining documents, case files and law libraries. Preparing and processing legal documents and papers, such as subpoenas, deeds, wills, affidavits and briefs. Reviewing and proofreading documents and correspondence to ensure compliance with legal procedures. Screening requests for meetings, scheduling and organising meetings, and receiving visitors. Supervising the work of office support workers.

fields.name: Librarian
fields.description: Develops, organises and manages library services such as collections of information, recreational resources and reader information services.
fields.tasks: Conducting research and analysing or modifying library and information services in accordance with changes in users' needs. Devising and implementing schemes and conceptual models for the storage, organisation, classification and retrieval of information Managing library borrowing and inter-library loan facilities and information networks. Organising, classifying and cataloguing library material. Organising, developing and maintaining a systematic collection of books, periodicals and other printed, audio-visually and digitally recorded material. Performing manual, on-line and interactive media reference searches, making interlibrary loans and performing other functions to assist users in accessing library materials. Preparing scholarly papers and reports. Retrieving material and providing information to business and other users based on the collection itself or on library and information-network systems. Selecting and recommending acquisitions of books and other printed or audio-visually and digitally recorded material.

fields.name: Library Assistant
fields.description: Issues, receives and shelves library items and maintains associated records.
fields.tasks: Sorting library materials according to classification or catalogue numbers. Issuing identification cards to borrowers. Assisting library users to find print and non-print materials. Issuing items from library collections to borrowers, and recording identification data and due dates. Checking records to compile lists of overdue items, and issuing overdue notices to borrowers. Inspecting returned items for damage, and making minor repairs as needed. Returning library materials to shelves or other storage areas. Answering telephone enquiries and assisting librarians with queries. Performing inter-library loan functions.

fields.name: Library Manager
fields.description: Manages the selection, acquiring, cataloguing, classifying, circulating, and maintaining of library materials; and oversee the furnishing of reference, bibliographical, and readers' advisory services.
fields.tasks: Providing overall direction and management for the administrative and working operations of a library. Conducting research and analysing or modifying library and information services in accordance with changes in users' needs. Devising and implementing schemes and conceptual models for the storage, organisation, cataloguing, classification and retrieval of information and library material. Organising, developing and maintaining a systematic collection of books, periodicals and other printed, audio-visually and digitally recorded material. Performing manual, on-line and interactive media reference searches, making and managing inter-library loans and performing other functions to assist users in accessing library materials and other information from information-network systems. Selecting and recommending acquisitions of books and other printed or audio-visually and digitally recorded material. Preparing scholarly papers and reports. Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of librarians and clerical, service, maintenance, and other personnel. Managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources. Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and standards.

fields.name: Library Technician
fields.description: Assists librarians and other information managers in organising and operating systems for handling recorded material and files.

fields.name: Licensed Club Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of a licensed club to provide food, beverages, gaming, entertainment, sporting and other amenities for members.
fields.tasks: Taking reservations, greeting guests and assisting in taking orders. Arranging the purchasing and pricing of goods according to budget and maintaining records of stock levels and financial transactions. Conferring with customers to assess their satisfaction with meals and service. Ensuring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations. Planning and organising special functions and planning menus in consultation with chefs and cooks. Selecting, set staff work schedules, training and supervising waiting and kitchen staff. Negotiating arrangements with clients and suppliers and observing liquor, gaming, and other laws and regulations.

fields.name: Life Orientation Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches life orientation (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Life Science Technician
fields.description: Identifies and collects living organisms and conducts field and laboratory studies in support of life scientists and technologists.
fields.tasks: Setting up, calibrating, operating and maintaining laboratory instruments and equipment. Collecting and preparing specimens and samples, chemical solutions and slides and growing cultures for use in experiments. Monitoring experiments to ensure adherence to correct laboratory quality control procedures and health and safety guidelines. Making observations of tests, and analyzing, calculating, recording and reporting test results using appropriate scientific methods. Preserving, classifying and cataloguing specimens and samples. Performing routine field and laboratory tests. Keeping detailed logs of worked performed.

fields.name: Life Sciences Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches life sciences (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Life Skills Teacher (Grades 4 - 9)
fields.description: Teaches life skills within a prescribed curriculum from grades 4 - 9 school students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Lifeguard
fields.description: Looks after the safety of people at beaches or swimming pools through public relations, public education, accident prevention and rescue.
fields.tasks: Monitoring ocean currents and weather conditions to locate safe areas for people to swim.      Patrolling an assigned area to enforce regulations.      Patrolling beaches and swimming pools to prevent accidents and to rescue bathers from drowning.      Responding to citizen concerns and issuing warnings and citations to enforce regulations. Responding in emergency situations to rescuing people from drowning. Applying first aid in situations where necessary.

fields.name: Lift Mechanic
fields.description: Designs, installs, maintains, services and repairs electric and hydraulic passenger and freight lifts, escalators, moving walkways and other lift equipment.
fields.tasks: Involved with the construction, assembly, testing and maintenance of lifts, escalators and hoists, in accordance with regulations. Installing and repairing elevators, escalators and similar equipment. Connecting up the electrical wiring and controls. Assembling and installing elevator cars. Maintaining and carrying out repairs when necessary. Replacing old equipment with newer models in accordance with requirements .

fields.name: Lift Operator
fields.description: Operates stationary and mobile lifts to lift and place materials, equipment and people in areas such as building sites, factories, mines, sawmills, wharves and shipyards.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring lifting-truck and similar equipment to load and unload, transport, lift and stack goods and pallets in terminals, harbours, ware-houses, factories and other establishments.   Positioning lifting devices under, over, or around loaded pallets, skids and boxes and securing material or products for transport to designated areas.   Inspecting equipment to identify wear and damage.   Keeping records of work undertaken and breakdowns of lifts.   Performing routine maintenance on lifts and equipment.

fields.name: Light Technician
fields.description: Positions and controls lighting equipment for stage performances or television, video or film productions.
fields.tasks: Rigging stage and location sets and controlling artificial, electric lights for art and entertainment venues, in video, television, or film production. Laying electrical cables and wire fixtures. Installing colour effects or image patterns. Focussing the lights on the desired object. Assisting in creating lighting effects or programming lighting sequences.

fields.name: Lighthouse Keeper
fields.description: Tends to and cares for a lighthouse.
fields.tasks: Maintaining and guarding lighthouse and surrounding grounds.   Inspecting, cleaning and maintaining lights and light lenses.    Reporting power failures to authorities and ensuring back-up generator takes over.   Cleaning windows of the lighthouse and doing minor painting and repairing work on the light station when needed.   Logging observed weather and information about wind and swell received from weather buoy.   Reporting perceived and potential problems to authorities and rescue services.   Providing upkeep of garden, sidewalks, driveways and parking lots.   Monitoring visitor’s activities to ensure compliance with regulations and safety practices.   Greeting visitors and sharing interesting facts and stories about the lighthouse.   Escorting individuals or groups on a tour through the lighthouse.

fields.name: Linemarker
fields.description: Operates plant to apply markings to roads and other surfaces such as car parks, airports and sports grounds.
fields.tasks: Preparing and loading materials and products into linemarker machines and equipment. Using a pre-marker to draw a field sketch in advance to avoid faulty marking. Applying road markings using various types of material and methods including compressed air or high-pressure airless spraying techniques. Operating large self-propelled linemarker machines and making use of auxiliary equipment when necessary. Cleaning out old or incorrect markings by using a road marking remover. Cleaning and maintaining machinery, equipment and work areas to ensure proper functioning.

fields.name: Linguist
fields.description: Studies the nature, structure, and variation of language, including phonetics, phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics, sociolinguistics, and pragmatics.
fields.tasks: Advising on or preparing language classification systems, grammar systems, dictionaries and similar materials.      Developing methods for the use of computers and other instruments to improve productivity and quality of translation.      Revising and correcting translated material.      Studying relationships between ancient parent languages and modern language groups, tracing the origin evolution of words, grammar and language forms, and presenting findings.      Translating from one language into another and ensuring that the correct meaning of the original is retained, that legal, technical or scientific works are correctly rendered, and that the phraseology and terminology of the spirit and style of literary works.

fields.name: Lithographic Printing Technician
fields.description: Sets up, operates and maintains sheetfed lithographic printing presses to print specified printing jobs on a variety of substrates (excluding metal), such as paper, paperboard, vinyl and plastic.
fields.tasks: Mixing ink and solvents to standard, and regulating paper and ink supply during print runs. Monitoring, evaluating and determining press to check print quality standards against proofs and detect malfunctions. Producing a variety of printed products using relief, lithographic, flexographic and gravure printing presses, and in-line finishing systems. Preparing plates, blankets and impression cylinders on small offset lithographic printing presses. Loading paper into feeding mechanisms. Monitoring machine operations and quality of printing. Maintaining, adjusting, repairing and cleaning machines. Producing digital print images, and transferring and outputting images.

fields.name: Livestock Farm Worker / Assistant
fields.description: Performs routine tasks on a livestock farm such as feeding, mustering, counting and moving livestock, and assisting with animal husbandry.
fields.tasks: Feeding and watering livestock, monitoring food and water supplies and rotating animals between grazing areas. Handling and hay, straw and other types of animal feed and bedding. Mixing feeds and additives in prescribed portions and assisting with food distribution to animals in pastures. Milking animals such as cows and goats, by hand or using milking machines. Examining animals to detect illness, injury or disease,  dipping livestock with disinfectants and insecticides, and assisting with administering medications and vaccinations. Marking livestock to identify ownership using brands, tags, paint or tattoos. Segregating animals according to weight, age, sex and/ or physical condition. Assisting with moving farming equipment or livestock from one location to another, either manually or using trucks or carts. Cleaning, inspecting, maintaining and repairing buildings, pens, yards and fences. Performing basic duties related to livestock reproduction, such as breeding animals within appropriate timeframes, performing artificial inseminations, and helping with animal births.

fields.name: Livestock Farmer
fields.description: Plans, organises and performs farming operations to breed and raise livestock such as cattle, horses, pigs, sheep etc.
fields.tasks: Cultivating pastures and providing and monitoring fodder and water supplies to maintain appropriate nutritional levels and condition of livestock.   Monitoring and examining animals to detect illness, injury, or disease, and to check physical condition such as rate of weight gain.   Grooming, marking, clipping, trimming, drenching and/or castrating animals and shearing coats to collect hair or wool.   Herding livestock to pastures for grazing or to scales, sheds, vehicles, or other enclosures Mixing feed, additives, and medicines in prescribed portions and distributing or hand-feeding to animals for consumption.   Performing duties related to livestock reproduction, such as breeding, artificial insemination, and helping with animal births.   Slaughtering and skinning animals and preparing them for market.   Promoting and marketing products, arranging the sale, purchase and transportation of livestock, produce and supplies and maintaining and evaluating records of farm activities and transactions.   Monitoring market activity and conditions, determining kinds and amounts of stock to produce, planning and coordinating production accordingly.   Training and supervising workers in animal care procedures, maintenance duties, and health and safety precautions and hiring and discharging workers and contractors.

fields.name: Livestock Inspector
fields.description: Inspects livestock for disease to ensure compliance with laws and regulations to prevent the spread of exotic pests and diseases.
fields.tasks: Conducting regular testing, monitoring and surveillance of livestock and domestic animals for diseases that may impact on food production and food security.   Inspecting livestock markets, hatcheries, pet dealers, animal shelters, production facilities, research laboratories, feedlots, and quarantine facilities and ensuring that they are operating in compliance with regulations for animal health, food safety, and welfare.   Implementing vaccination programmes and parasite control programmes in livestock.   Carrying out abattoir and meat inspections.   Coordinating with Veterinarians in conducting disease testing on animal populations at inspected facilities.   Collecting a variety of samples for biological and epidemiological testing including blood, milk, body fluids, and tissue.   Implementing and marketing sound animal health strategies, veterinary extension services and primary animal health care activities.   Giving recommendations to animal facilities for improving biosecurity and reducing the incidence of disease.   Assisting with investigating and shutting down unlicensed animal operations.

fields.name: Livestock Product Analyst
fields.description: Analyse livestock produce for quality and conformance with technical produce standards and regulatory provisions.
fields.tasks: Analysing livestock produce for quality. Determining conformance of livestock produce with technical produce standards and regulatory provisions. Discarding inferior livestock products. Grading livestock into appropriate classes according to consumer tastes and value. Weighing and measuring products. Inspecting and testing livestock produce at various stages of processing. Recording the grade and/or identification numbers on tags, receiving, or sales sheets.

fields.name: Loader Operator
fields.description: Operates a motorised loader to move and load soil, rock and other material.
fields.tasks: Performing safety checks before operating the loader and ensuring all equipment function properly.   Starting engine, shifting gears, pressing pedals and turning steering wheel to operate loader.   Operating the straight or articulated tractor-type vehicle equipped with front-mounted hydraulically powered bucket or scoop to lift and transport bulk materials.   Moving levers to lower and tilt bucket and drives loader forward to force bucket into bulk material, raising and tilting bucket when filled and driving vehicle to a site to dump material.   Transporting materials to and from storage or processing areas, feeding conveyors, hoppers or chutes and loading trucks or rail cars.   Performing many different operations with special attachments such as a bale or pallet fork, bale hugger, debris or root grapple, free-stall scraper, rock bucket, rotary broom and front blade.   Conducting routine maintenance on loader such as lubricating, fuelling and cleaning.

fields.name: Local Authority Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls, reviews and oversees the interpretation and implementation of local government policies and legislation.
fields.tasks: The role of a Local Authority Manager can be divided into three broad functions.  A Local Authority Manager performs procedural duties according to political structures; is the head of the administration of a municipality as well as the municipality’s accounting officer. Some of the Authority Manager's tasks include: Advising on the preparation of government budgets, laws and regulations, including amendments. Ensuring appropriate systems and procedures are developed and implemented to provide budgetary control. Establishing objectives for government departments or agencies in accordance with government legislation and policy. Formulating or approving and evaluating programs and procedures for the implementation of government polices in conjunction or consultation with government. Making presentations to legislative and other government committees regarding policies programs or budgets. Overseeing the interpretation and implementation of government policies and legislation by government departments and agencies. Recommending, reviewing, evaluating and approving documents, briefs and reports submitted by middle managers and senior staff members.

fields.name: Local or Provincial Government Legislator
fields.description: Represents the interests of people in a constituency as their elected member of a government authority.
fields.tasks: As members of the government, directing senior administrators and officials of government departments and agencies in the interpretation and implementation of government policies. Attending community functions and meetings to provide service to the community, understand public opinion and provide information on government plans. Determining, formulating, and directing policies of national, state, regional or local governments. Investigating matters of concern to the public and promoting the interests of the constituencies which they represent. Making, ratifying, amending or repealing laws, public rules and regulations within a statutory or constitutional framework. Negotiating with other legislators and representatives of interest groups in order to reconcile differing interests, and to create policies and agreements. Presiding over or participating in the proceedings of legislative bodies and administrative councils of national, state, regional or local governments or legislative assemblies. Serving on government administrative boards or official committees.

fields.name: Location Manager (Film or Television)
fields.description: Organises and coordinates the logistics to secures locations for the successful completion of production.
fields.tasks: Choosing locations and landscapes and overseeing all activities related to locations for filming.      Engaging and supervising technical personnel, and determining scope and scheduling of production.      Maintaining administration and negotiating payments involved in filming locations.      Planning, organising and controlling scheduling involved in the production of motion pictures and television shows

fields.name: Lock Master (Water Transport)
fields.description: Operates equipment to close off a section of a waterway.

fields.name: Locksmith
fields.description: Installs and maintains locks and related security devices and systems.
fields.tasks: Making, fitting, assembling, repairing and installing lock parts and locks. Making and repairing metal patterns for preparation of foundry moulds. Positioning, securing and measuring metal stock or castings to lay out for machining. Setting up, operating and maintaining conventional and computer numerically controlled machine tools to cut, turn, mill, plane, drill, bore, grind or otherwise shape work piece to prescribed dimensions and finish Installating of high quality lock-sets and designing, implementing and managing of keying and key control systems. Electronic lock servicing, such as making keys for transponder-equipped vehicles. Implementing and applying of access control systems protecting individuals and assets.

fields.name: Logging Assistant
fields.description: Assists with logging, felling and sawing of trees in forests.
fields.tasks: Felling trees, removing major branches and tree tops, trimming branches and sawing trunks into logs.   Securing cables to logs and to tractor to skid logs to landings. Loading logs onto trucks by hand or using winches. Maintaining forest roads, buildings, facilities, signs and equipment. Killing weeds, felling and de-barking non-productive trees and thinning out young plantations. Maintaining a look-out for fires in forests. Clearing surrounding area of saplings and debris prior to tree-felling. Operating and maintaining manual and machine saws to fell trees and to cut felled trees into logs.

fields.name: Logging Plant Operator
fields.description: Operates plant to fell trees and drag, transport and load logs onto trucks.
fields.tasks: Driving straight or articulated tractors equipped with accessories such as bulldozer blades, grapples, logging arches, cable winches and crane booms to skid, load, unload or stack logs, pull stumps or clear brush.   Driving crawler or wheeled tractors to drag or transport logs from felling sites to log landing areas for processing and loading.   Preparing and positioning logging equipment for operation.   Controlling hydraulic tractors equipped with tree clamps and booms to lift, swing and bunch sheared trees.   Driving and manoeuvring tractors and tree harvesters to shear the tops off of trees, cut and limb the trees and cut the logs into desired lengths.   Driving tractors for the purpose of building or repairing logging and skid roads.   Inspecting equipment for safety prior to use, and performing necessary basic maintenance tasks.   Fill out required job or shift report forms.

fields.name: Logistics Manager
fields.description: Plans, directs, or coordinates purchasing, warehousing, distribution, forecasting, customer service, or planning services. Manages logistics personnel and logistics systems and direct daily operations.
fields.tasks: Determining, implementing and monitoring purchasing, storage and distribution strategies, policies and plans. Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures. Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources. Monitoring and reviewing storage and inventory systems to meet supply requirements and control stock levels. Negotiating contracts with suppliers to meet quality, cost and delivery requirements. Planning and directing daily operations. Overseeing the recording of purchase, storage and distribution transactions.

fields.name: Lotto Operator
fields.description: No descriptor
fields.tasks: Generating lottery tickets by operating lottery terminals using the numbers chosen by the participant, or the numbers generated randomly by the terminal. Issuing lottery tickets to members of the public who wish to participate in the draw. Receiving payment for lottery tickets. Checking that participants and winners are age 18 years or older. Checking that tickets submitted for winnings are not damaged and have not been tampered with.   Paying out on winning tickets. Answering questions related to lottery participation.

fields.name: Lubrication Equipment Mechanic
fields.description: Installs and maintains lubrication equipment and systems.
fields.tasks: Disassembling machinery and equipment to remove parts and make repairs. Examining parts for defects such as breakage and excessive wear. Fitting, installing, examining, servicing and repairing engines, machinery and mechanical equipment. Inspecting and testing new machinery and mechanical equipment for conformity with standards and specifications. Oiling and greasing stationary engines and machinery. Operating newly repaired machinery and equipment to verify the adequacy of repairs. Recording repairs and maintenance performed.

fields.name: Luggage Porter
fields.description: Assists guests in an accommodation establishment or passengers in a transport terminal by attending to and carrying luggage, welcoming and escorting guests, and attending to their general needs on arrival and departure.
fields.tasks: Accepting luggage, tagging it and giving identification slips to guests or passengers. Loading or unloading luggage and taking it to the receiving area. Explaining details of hotel room services and facilities to guests as they arrive. Carrying luggage or arriving guests while showing them to their rooms. Carrying luggage of departing guests to cars, buses or taxis. Maintaining cleanliness and appearance of the front of house area.

fields.name: Machine Shorthand Reporter
fields.description: Records and reproduces the spoken word in court and parliamentary proceedings, television programming and for the deaf and hearing impaired using handwritten shorthand, stenotype shorthand machines, computer-assisted transcription software and sound recor Alternate Occupation Names Braille Transcriber Court Reporter / Taker Hansard Reporter Stenocaptioner

fields.name: Machinery Assembler
fields.description: Assembles machinery and parts thereof.
fields.tasks: Reviewing work orders, specifications, diagrams and drawings to determine materials needed and assembly instructions. Assembling and installing prefabricated parts or components to form sub-assemblies, mechanical machinery, engines and finished motor vehicles. Inspecting and testing completed components and assemblies. Recording production and operational data on specified forms. Rejecting faulty assemblies and components.

fields.name: Magistrate
fields.description: Hears criminal matters to determine whether defendants will be committed for trial and adjudicates minor criminal offences without a jury.
fields.tasks: Determining the rights and obligations of the parties involved in court cases. Interpreting and enforcing rules of procedure and making rulings regarding the admissibility of evidence in a case. Presiding over civil and criminal trials and hearings in district and regional (magistrates) courts. Weighing and considering evidence and deciding legal guilt or innocence, or the degree of liability of the accused or defendant. Passing sentence on persons convicted in criminal cases. Determining damages or other appropriate remedy in civil cases. Issuing court orders. Researching legal issues and writing opinions on the issues. Acting as a representative for other state departments, for instance, as a receiver of revenue, registrar of births, marriages and deaths, and other similar duties. Serving on various committees and boards.

fields.name: Mail Clerk
fields.description: Collects, sorts and dispatches mail within an organisation.
fields.tasks: Sorting, date-stamping and collating incoming mail, and disposing of junk mail. Placing mail in the correct bins and delivering it to departments for distribution. Receiving outgoing mail, weighing and sizing the mail, and applying the correct postage. Taking outgoing mail to post office or arranging for courier collection. Recording registered mail in a register. Folding letters, circulars or other documents and inserting into envelopes for distribution. Ensuring that the office is adequately stocked with mail supplies. Operating fax and scanning machines. Stocking copiers and printers with paper and toner.

fields.name: Maintenance Planner
fields.description: Develops maintenance planning strategies, and schedules, coordinates and monitors the maintenance of all plant equipment.
fields.tasks: Ensuring safety of workers. Identifying shortage of staff or components. Instructing and training new staff. Organizing and planning the daily work with regard to plans, economy, staff and environment. Preparing cost estimates, records and reports.

fields.name: Make Up Artist
fields.description: Designs and applies make up to actors, presenters and other performing artists.
fields.tasks: Clarifying the visual make-up requirements with directors of productions. Reading scripts to ascertain the look and materials required. Producing sketches of design ideas for hairstyles and make-up. Liaising with other production team members to ensure that the overall look or effect is consistent. Understanding lighting, the photographic process, colours and the impact of special effects on make-up on the skin. Casting facial and body moulds and sculpting latex foam prosthetics for special effects. Fitting and maintaining wigs, hairpieces and prosthetics.

fields.name: Management Accountant
fields.description: Plans, reviews and administers accounting systems and procedures, analyses the financial information needs of organisations, provides advice on financial planning and risk management, and provides management with reports to assist in decision-making. May
fields.tasks: Advising on, planning and installing budgetary, accounts controlling and other accounting policies and systems. Preparing or reporting on profit forecasts and budgets. Advising management on financial aspects of productivity, stockholdings, sales, new products, etc. Devising and controlling a system to determine unit cost of products and services.

fields.name: Management Consultant
fields.description: Assists organisations to achieve greater efficiency and solve organisational problems.
fields.tasks: Analysing and evaluating current systems and structures in organisations. Undertaking and reviewing work studies by analysing existing and proposed methods and procedures such as administrative and clerical procedures. Discussing current systems with staff and observing systems at all levels of the organisation. Preparing and recommending proposals to revise methods and procedures, alter work flows, redefine job functions and resolve organisational problems. Recording and analysing organisations’ work flow charts, records, reports, manuals and job descriptions. Assisting and encouraging the development of objectives, strategies and plans aimed at achieving customer satisfaction and the efficient use of organisations’ resources. Assisting in implementing approved recommendations, issuing revised instructions and procedure manuals and drafting other documentation. Directing clients towards more efficient organisation and developing solutions to organisational problems. Reviewing operating procedures and advising on departures from procedures and standards.

fields.name: Man-made Fibre Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, loads, operates, monitors extrusion machinery and equipment to produce man-made (synthetic and regenerated) filament from a variety of polymers.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines which clean and fluff textile fibres. Operating and monitoring machines which combine textile fibers into uniform blends. Transforming and combing fibers into slivers. Operating and monitoring drawing machines which convert slivers into loosely twisted strands. Operating and monitoring spinning frames that produce yarn. Spinning thread and yarn to increase strength, smoothness and/or uniformity, or winding yarn or thread from one package to another. Finishing cloth and yarn by using mixtures of ingredients such as starch, tallow, resins, soaps and water. Treating textiles with chemicals to make them water resistant. Resurfacing the metal drawing rolls of various spinning, combing and lapping machines with new rubber or leather covers.

fields.name: Manufacturer
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the operations of a small manufacturing establishment.
fields.tasks: Consulting with and informing other managers about production matters.      Controlling the operation of production plant and quality procedures through planning of maintenance, designation of operating hours and supply of parts and tools.      Controlling the preparation of production records and reports.      Coordinating the implementation of occupational health and safety requirements.      Determining, implementing and monitoring production strategies, policies and plans.      Establishing and managing budgets, monitoring production output and costs, and adjusting processes and resources to minimize costs.      Identifying business opportunities and determining products to be manufactured.      Overseeing the acquisition and installation of new plant and equipment.      Overseeing the provision of quotes for the manufacture of specialised goods and establishing contracts with customers and suppliers.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.

fields.name: Manufacturers Representative
fields.description: Sells a manufacturer's products to wholesale and retail customers.
fields.tasks: Providing prospective customers with information about the characteristics and functions of the products and equipment for sale and demonstrating its uses and qualities.   Quoting prices and credit terms, recording orders and arranging deliveries.   Soliciting orders and selling goods to retail, industrial, wholesale and other establishments.   Following up on clients to ensure satisfaction with products purchased.   Reporting customers’ reactions and requirements to suppliers and manufacturers.   Obtaining and updating knowledge of market conditions and competitors’ goods and services.

fields.name: Manufacturing Production Technicians
fields.description: Sets up, tests, and adjusts manufacturing machinery or equipment, using any combination of electrical, electronic, mechanical, hydraulic, pneumatic, or computer technologies.
fields.tasks: Setting up manufacturing machinery and equipment. Knowing and applying electrical, electronic, mechanical, hydraulic, pneumatic and computer technologies in an integrated way. Controlling the process of start-up and shut-down of manufacturing machinery or equipment. Taking readings from charts, meters and gauges at established intervals. Applying quality control and quality assurance practices for efficient and effective production processes. Inspecting machinery and equipment to detect malfunctions, and performing cleaning and maintenance as necessary. Communicating with other personnel to assess equipment operating status. Maintaining records, logs and reports. Supervising plant and machine operators and other workers.

fields.name: Manufacturing Technician
fields.description: Provides technical support and services in the development of manufacturing methods, facilities and systems, and in the planning, estimating, measuring and scheduling of manufacturing work.
fields.tasks: Collecting data and providing technical assistance regarding efficient, safe and economic utilisation of personnel, material and equipment, methods of work and sequence of operations and supervision of their implementation, and efficient layout of plant or establishment.

fields.name: Mariculture Farmer
fields.description: Plans, organises and performs farming operations to breed and raise salt water fish and other aquatic stock such as abalone, crayfish, mussels, oysters and prawns.
fields.tasks: Breeding, raising and cultivating fish, mussels, oysters and other forms of aquatic life as cash crops or for release into saltwater. Cleaning, freezing, icing or salting catch on- or offshore and preparing fish and other products for shipment. Collecting and recording growth, production, and environmental data. Conducting and supervising stock examinations in order to identify diseases or parasites. Delivering or marketing products. Directing and monitoring trapping and spawning of fish, egg incubation, and fry rearing, applying knowledge of management and fish culturing techniques. Maintaining buildings, tanks, machinery, boats and other equipment. Monitoring environments to ensure maintenance of optimum conditions for aquatic life. Renting or investing in buildings, equipment and machinery and purchasing food and other supplies. Supervising and training aquaculture and fish hatchery support workers.

fields.name: Marine Biologist
fields.description: Studies the anatomy, physiology, functions, characteristics, behaviour and environments of all forms of life living in the sea and connected water bodies.
fields.tasks: Studying all aspects of plant and animal life in the water and also environmental conditions affecting them. Investigating salinity, temperature, acidity, light, oxygen content plus other physical conditions of water to define their relationship to aquatic life. Examining various types of water life, like plankton, worms, clams, mussels and snails.  Collecting samples, building and testing equipment and analysing data. Researching the marine system as a whole or focusing on a particular marine species to understand marine life and to ensure the production of food from the sea at a sustained level. Assisting in establishing the ecological effects of projects like the construction of harbours and piers.

fields.name: Marine Certification & Surveillance Manager
fields.description: Surveys marine vessels in accordance with international safety standards determine seaworthiness.
fields.tasks: Performing inspections required by domestic statutes and international conventions by the International Maritime Organization (IMO). Evaluating and appraising marine vessels to determine overall condition an ensure quality and safety. Testing emergency and safety machinery and equipment. Performing a ship registration survey and issuing marine certification. Investigating accidents at sea (e.g. oil spillages) and preparing accident reports for insurance purposes.

fields.name: Marine Engineer
fields.description: Designs, constructs and repairs ships, boats, other marine vessels and offshore structures, both civil and military.
fields.tasks: Designing, building and operating offshore platforms, rigs, pipelines and equipment. Ensuring that equipment, operation and maintenance comply with design specifications and safety standards. Establishing control standards and procedures to ensure efficient functioning and safety of machines, machinery, tools, motors, engines, industrial plant, equipment, or systems. Examining ships and offshore installations, looking at their seaworthiness, safety and maintenance needs. Making sure engines, instruments and systems work safely and efficiently. Working on the design, development, construction and maintenance of ships, boats and machinery.

fields.name: Marine Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Analyses and modifies new and existing engineering technologies relating to the design and construction of ships, boats, other marine vessels and offshore structures, both civil and military.
fields.tasks: Designing, building and operating offshore platforms, rigs, pipelines and equipment. Ensuring that equipment, operation and maintenance comply with design specifications and safety standards. Establishing control standards and procedures to ensure efficient functioning and safety of machines, machinery, tools, motors, engines, industrial plant, equipment, or systems. Examining ships and offshore installations, looking at their seaworthiness, safety and maintenance needs. Making sure engines, instruments and systems work safely and efficiently. Working on the design, development, construction and maintenance of ships, boats and machinery.

fields.name: Marine Safety Officer
fields.description: Inspects all parts of a vessel for safety regulations and also look for environmental hazards. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Advising employers and workers on rules and regulations concerning occupational safety in the shipping environment.   Estimating quantities and costs of materials and labour required for health, safety and sanitation remediation projects.   Giving advice on environmental sanitary problems and techniques.   Inspecting areas processing, transport, handling, storage on vessels to ensure conformity with government and other rules, regulations and standards.   Inspecting places of work and, by interviews, observations and other means, obtaining information about work practices and accidents to determine compliance with safety rules and regulations.   Promoting preventive and corrective to ensure the safety of mariners.

fields.name: Marine Salvage Engineer
fields.description: Plans, designs, organises and oversees the process of recovering a ship, its cargo, or other property after a shipwreck.

fields.name: Marine Steward
fields.description: Provides services for the safety and comfort of passengers travelling by ship.
fields.tasks: Attending to comfort  and safety of passengers aboard ship. Maintaining assigned section of guest staterooms (and balconies if present). Cleaning and servicing of rooms as per schedule, changing linens and towels, and making up beds and berths. Maintaining ice stations, service lockers, trolleys and corridors in assigned section of ship. Conducting safety checks and demonstrations of safety equipment and procedures when required. Assisting passengers in emergency drills, carrying out emergency procedures, assisting and directing passengers in emergencies. Performing any other housekeeping functions throughout the ship as required.

fields.name: Market Campaign Analyst
fields.description: Analyses market needs of a contact centre and plans responding campaigns. Works in a contact centre.
fields.tasks: Monitoring the implementation of marketing campaigns against established benchmarks to increase the performance (income) of  a company Analysing marketing campaigns and report on their outcome and making recommendations on improvements. Assisting the operational team with theory and data to plan and execute marketing campaigns. Compiling and presenting reports and graphs that highlight the effectiveness of media campaigns. Identifying opportunities for new ideas and campaigns to optimise the performance of a marketing strategy.

fields.name: Market Research Analyst
fields.description: Determines the market for new goods and services, develops advertising strategies, and evaluates the best business sites for commercial organisations.
fields.tasks: Studying information to help your employer or client to make informed decisions about their markets, e.g. what products should be produced and how to sell them. Researching the effectiveness of company advertising and advising management on sales and distribution policies. Conducting surveys to determine the acceptability of new products, comparing the products with existing and competitive items and making suggestions regarding packaging and product names. Identifying trends and patterns relevant to your employer or client’s market or industry. Writing detailed reports and presenting results to advising your employer or client on how to best use research findings. Monitoring the progress of research projects according to time frames and budgets.

fields.name: Marketing / Communication Strategist
fields.description: Develops strategic marketing and communication strategies and advises executives on the implications of their policies, programs and practices.
