fields.tasks: Dealing with all promotional aspects of the company and liaising with media and communication agencies and other stakeholders to portray the correct image of the company. Developing marketing and communication strategies and implementation plans in collaboration with clients and partners. Using industry and financial trends to assess the impact of the company’s communication plans. Adhering to budgets and enhancing and promoting the company’s image, products and services effectively. Advising executive management on the implications of marketing policies, programmes and communication practices. Managing and coordinating creative departments to develop creative ideas, tools and campaigns. Assisting with the development of presentations and company information for print and electronic media to ensure that stakeholders are aware of the company’s brand and use their products and services.

fields.name: Marketing Coordinator
fields.description: Provides marketing support services to a marketing function within an organisation.
fields.tasks: Assisting marketing managers and practitioners by providing any necessary support services. Organising market research. Writing press releases and online content. Arranging and doing the administration related to marketing and promotional events. Distributing marketing material. Assessing the results of marketing campaigns. Analysing data and writing reports. Communicating with internal and external clients.

fields.name: Marketing Practitioner
fields.description: Identifies market opportunities and advises on the development, coordination and implementation of plans for pricing and promoting an organisation's goods and services.
fields.tasks: Developing and implementing marketing and advertising campaigns and strategies. Planning, organising and coordinating promotional meetings, events and trade shows. Preparing marketing reports by collecting, analysing, and summarising sales, expense, and new business data. Managing the availability of promotional materials by coordinating graphics requirements. Managing inventory stock, placing orders and verifying receipt. Supporting sales staff by providing relevant data and new product information and by relaying customer services requests. Researching competitive products and maintaining databases related to this research. Monitoring and coordinating marketing and advertising budgets.

fields.name: Marriage and Family Counsellor
fields.description: Assists individuals, couples and families with marriage and relationship difficulties.
fields.tasks: Interviewing clients individually and in families to assess their situation and problems and determine the types of services required, Analysing the client's situation and presenting alternative approaches to resolving problems, Conducting counselling or therapeutic interviews with individuals and families, Investigating cases of abuse or neglect and taking action to protect children and other at risk persons,

fields.name: Massage Therapist
fields.description: Performs therapeutic massage and administers body treatments for relaxation, health, fitness and remedial purposes.
fields.tasks: Applying finger and hand pressure to the human body in order to provide pain-relief and general wellness.   Taking the medical histories of clients, and noting any problems with stress and/or pain in order to determine whether therapeutic massage would be helpful.   Assessing the condition of soft tissues, muscle strength, joint function and range of motion to determine which types of therapeutic massage to apply.   Mobilising and kneading the soft tissues and muscles to enable relaxation and restore functional use.   Using a variety of bodyworks techniques including massage, aromatherapy, reflexology and other specialist techniques to improve circulatory functions.   Preparing and blending oils and applying the blends to clients’ skin.   Instructing, motivating, safeguarding and assisting patients as they practice physical exercises, relaxation techniques and functional activities.   Conferring with other health and allied health care providers to evaluate patient information for planning, modifying, and coordinating treatment.

fields.name: Master Fisher
fields.description: Controls fishing operations from a trawler to catch and preserve fish for sale or delivery to wholesale buyers, marketing organizations or at markets.
fields.tasks: Commanding and operating fishing vessels to from and at deep-sea fishing grounds. Directing fishing operations and supervising crew activities. Preparing and repairing nets and other fishing gear and equipment. Baiting, setting and hauling in fishing gear. Cleaning, freezing, icing or salting catch on- or offshore. Recording fishing progress, activities, weather and sea conditions on ship's log. Determining areas for fishing, plotting courses and computing navigational positions using compass, charts, tables and other aids. Steering vessels and operating navigational instruments and electronic fishing aids. Selecting and training vessel crews.

fields.name: Master of The Court
fields.description: Listens to testimonies and prepares reports which, when approved by the presiding judge, becomes the decision of the court.
fields.tasks: Administering the estates of deceased and insolvent persons. Protecting the interests of minors and legally incapacitated persons. Protecting and administering the funds of minors, contractually incapacitated and determined and absent heirs. Supervising the administration of companies and close corporations. Determining and assessing estate duties. Supervising trusts. Safeguarding all documentary material received in respect of estates, insolvencies, liquidations, trusts, etc. Process enquiries by executors, attorneys, beneficiaries and other interested parties. Appoint impartial and capable persons as executors, trustees, curators and liquidators.

fields.name: Master Toolmaker
fields.description: No descriptor
fields.tasks: Developing and setting up master moulds and jigs for specific manufacturing sectors and/or processes. Reading and interpreting engineering drawings and specifications of tools, dies, prototypes or models. Preparing templates and sketches, and determining work processes. Visualising and computing dimensions, sizes, shapes, and tolerances of assemblies, based on specifications. Positioning, securing and measuring metal stock or castings to lay out for machining. Setting up, operating and maintaining conventional and computer numerically controlled machine tools to cut, turn, mill, plane, drill, bore, grind or otherwise shape work piece to prescribed dimensions and finish. Fitting and assembling parts to make and repair jigs, fixtures and gauges. Repairing and modifying sports guns and other small arms. Making, fitting, assembling, repairing and installing lock parts and locks.

fields.name: Materials Engineer
fields.description: Plans and directs the engineering and commercial application of materials, manufacturing processes, products and related technologies.
fields.tasks: Analysing product failure data and laboratory test results to determine causes of problems and develop solutions. Conducting or supervising tests on raw materials or finished products to ensure their quality. Evaluating technical specifications and economic factors relating to process or product design objectives. Monitoring material performance and evaluate material deterioration. Planning and evaluating new projects, consulting with other engineers and corporate executives as necessary. Reviewing new product plans and making recommendations for material selection based on design objectives, such as strength, weight, heat resistance, electrical conductivity, and cost. Supervising the work of technologists, technicians, and other engineers and scientists.

fields.name: Materials Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Supports engineering teams to select and test materials for particular industrial and engineering uses and investigate materials related problems.
fields.tasks: Analyze product failure data and laboratory test results to determine causes of problems and develop solutions. Conduct or supervise tests on raw materials or finished products to ensure their quality. Evaluate technical specifications and economic factors relating to process or product design objectives. Monitor material performance and evaluate material deterioration. Plan and evaluate new projects, consulting with other engineers and corporate executives as necessary. Review new product plans and make recommendations for material selection based on design objectives, such as strength, weight, heat resistance, electrical conductivity, and cost. Supervise the work of technologists, technicians, and other engineers and scientists.

fields.name: Materials Recycler
fields.description: Salvages materials from industrial, commercial and private establishments for resale.
fields.tasks: Grading, sorting, cleaning and baling scrap materials for recycling. Weighing and recording each load. Grading and sorting it according to quality and value, either by hand or machine. Using metal cutters and burners to dismantle large items like industrial machinery. Using hydraulic shears or fragmenters to shred scrap into small pieces. Cleaning scrap metal. Using machines (balers) to crush the scrap into bales. Operating lift trucks or cranes to stack or load the sorted metal. Selling scrap to recycling plants.

fields.name: Materials Scientist
fields.description: Studies the structures, properties and uses of metals, alloys, ceramics, semiconductors and polymers.
fields.tasks: Conducting research and improving or developing concepts, theories and operational methods related to geology and geophysics. Studying composition and structure of the earth's crust, examining rocks, minerals, fossils and other materials, to determine processes affecting the development of the Earth, trace evolution of past life, establish nature and chronology of geological formations and assess their commercial applications. Interpreting research data and preparing geological reports, maps, charts and diagrams, reports and papers. Applying geological knowledge to problems encountered in civil engineering projects such as the construction of dams, bridges, tunnels, and large buildings; and land reclamation projects. Using various remote sensing programs to investigate and measure seismic, gravitational, electrical, thermal, and magnetic forces affecting the earth. Estimating weight, size and mass of the earth and composition and structure of its interior, and studying the nature, activity and predictability of volcanoes, glaciers and earthquakes. Charting the earth's magnetic field and applying this and other collected data for broadcasting, navigation and other purposes. Studying and measuring physical properties of seas and the atmosphere and their inter-relationship, such as the exchange of thermal energy. Locating and determining the nature and extent of oil, gas and mineral deposits using seismological, gravimetric, magnetic, electrical or radiometric methods. Identifying deposits of construction materials and determining their characteristics and suitability for use as concrete aggregates, road fill or for other applications. Researching the movement, distribution and physical properties of ground and surface waters. Advising in areas such as waste management, route and site selection and the restoration of contaminated sites.

fields.name: Mathematical Literacy Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches mathematical literacy (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Mathematician
fields.description: Develops and applies mathematical principles and techniques to solve problems in all areas of the sciences, engineering, technology, social sciences, business, industry or commerce.
fields.tasks: Addressing the relationships of quantities, magnitudes, and forms through the use of numbers and symbols. Working in the field of mathematics, studying quantities, space, structure, patterns and change. Conducting research to extend mathematical knowledge in traditional areas, such as algebra, geometry, probability, and logic. Developing new principles and new relationships between existing mathematical principles to advance mathematical science. Applying theories and techniques to practical problems, developing statistical models, designing systems of encryption, creating computer simulations, solving complex problems and teaching others.

fields.name: Mathematics Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches mathematics (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Maths Teacher (Grades 4 - 9)
fields.description: Teaches maths within a prescribed curriculum from grades 4 - 9 school students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Maxillo-facial Oral Surgeon
fields.description: A Maxillo-facial Oral Surgeon diagnoses and treats diseases, injuries, irregularities and malformations of teeth and associated structures in the mouth and jaw using surgery and other specialist techniques.
fields.tasks: Performing reconstructive surgery to treat hard and soft tissue injuries in the upper and/or lower jaws resulting from injury or trauma, cancer surgery or long-term denture wear.   Performing specialist surgery to correct oral and facial deformities caused by genetic or hereditary conditions such as cleft lip and palate.   Diagnosing and treating infections in the lower face, jaws and mouth to prevent them from developing into life-threatening illnesses.   Repairing facial trauma, including fractures and performing facial cosmetic procedures.   Removing impacted teeth and placing dental implants.

fields.name: Meat Packer
fields.description: Weighs, wraps, seals and labels meat and meat products.
fields.tasks: Identifying correct containers and moisture-absorbing sheets to be used for meat packing. Packing various cuts of fresh meat in the correct manner and according to packing standards. Sealing the meat packs correctly with plastic film, or using vacuum sealing equipment when appropriate. Weighing and labelling the packed meat. Stacking meat packs in crates or on palates for distribution. Packing meat packs in the meat display fridges for sale.  Maintaining Health and Food Safety standards throughout the packing process.  Recording product, packaging and order information on specified forms and records.

fields.name: Meat Processing Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets, operates and attends machinery used to slaughter animals, trim meat from carcasses and otherwise process of meat.
fields.tasks: Operating machines used for meat processing or canning. Operating meat sterilising and drying equipment. Grinding meat with grinding equipment. Tending machines to mix or blend spices into meat products. Tending sausage processing machines. Using freezing, cooling or heating equipment and machines to freeze, cool or heat meat products. Operating meat roasting, blanching or smoking equipment.

fields.name: Mechanical Engineer
fields.description: Plans, designs, organises and oversees the assembly, erection, operation and maintenance of mechanical and process plant and installations.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing machinery and tools for manufacturing, mining, construction, agricultural, and other industrial purposes. Advising on and designing steam, internal combustion and other non-electric motors and engines used for propulsion of railway locomotives, road vehicles or aircraft, or for driving industrial or other machinery. Advising on and designing: hulls, superstructures and propulsion systems of ships; mechanical plant and equipment for the release, control and utilisation of energy; heating, ventilation and refrigeration systems, steering gear, pumps, and other mechanical equipment. Advising on and designing airframes, undercarriages and other equipment for aircraft as well as suspension systems, brakes, vehicle bodies and other components of road vehicles. Advising on and designing non-electrical parts of apparatus or products such as word processors, computers, precision instruments, cameras and projectors. Establishing control standards and procedures to ensure efficient functioning and safety of machines, machinery, tools, motors, engines, industrial plant, equipment, or systems. Ensuring that equipment, operation and maintenance comply with design specifications and safety standards.

fields.name: Mechanical Engineering Technician
fields.description: Conducts tests of mechanical systems, collects and analyses data, and assembles and installs mechanical assemblies in support of mechanical engineers and engineering technologists.
fields.tasks: Assembling and installing new and modified mechanical assemblies, components, machine tools and controls, and hydraulic power systems. Conducting tests of mechanical systems, collecting and analysing data, and assembling and installing mechanical assemblies in support of mechanical engineers. Designing and preparing layouts of machines and mechanical installations, facilities and components according to the specifications given. Developing and monitoring the implementation of safety standards and procedures for marine survey work in relation to ships' hulls, equipment and cargoes. Ensuring that mechanical engineering designs and finished work are within specifications, regulations and contract provisions. Monitoring technical aspects of manufacture, utilisation, maintenance and repair of machines and mechanical installations, facilities and components to ensure satisfactory performance and compliance with specifications and regulations. Preparing detailed estimates of quantities and costs of materials and labour required for manufacture and installation according to the specifications given. Providing technical assistance in research on and development of machines and mechanical installations, facilities and components or testing prototypes.

fields.name: Mechanical Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Analyses and modifies new and existing mechanical engineering technologies and applies them in the testing and implementation of mechanical engineering projects.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing machinery and tools for manufacturing, mining, construction, agricultural, and other industrial purposes. Advising on and designing steam, internal combustion and other non-electric motors and engines used for propulsion of railway locomotives, road vehicles or aircraft, or for driving industrial or other machinery. Advising on and designing: hulls, superstructures and propulsion systems of ships; mechanical plant and equipment for the release, control and utilisation of energy; heating, ventilation and refrigeration systems, steering gear, pumps, and other mechanical equipment. Advising on and designing airframes, undercarriages and other equipment for aircraft as well as suspension systems, brakes, vehicle bodies and other components of road vehicles. Advising on and designing non-electrical parts of apparatus or products such as word processors, computers, precision instruments, cameras and projectors. Establishing control standards and procedures to ensure efficient functioning and safety of machines, machinery, tools, motors, engines, industrial plant, equipment, or systems. Ensuring that equipment, operation and maintenance comply with design specifications and safety standards.

fields.name: Mechanical Equipment Repairer
fields.description: Fits installs, examines, services and repairs engines, machinery and mechanical equipment.
fields.tasks: Disassembling machinery and equipment to remove parts and make repairs. Examining parts for defects such as breakage and excessive wear. Fitting, installing, examining, servicing and repairing engines, machinery and mechanical equipment. Inspecting and testing new machinery and mechanical equipment for conformity with standards and specifications. Oiling and greasing stationary engines and machinery. Operating newly repaired machinery and equipment to verify the adequacy of repairs. Recording repairs and maintenance performed.

fields.name: Mechanical Fitter
fields.description: Fits and assembles metal parts and sub-assemblies to fabricate production machines and other equipment.
fields.tasks: Operating powered machines that may be manually or computer controlled. Erecting machinery and equipment on site. Inspecting machinery regularly and making any adjustments or repairs needed by removing any worn or damaged parts to install replacements, by sending a damaged part to the machine shop for repair or by doing the repair work themselves. Marking the shape and dimensions of a part to be machined by studying blueprints and using measuring instruments. Assembling and fitting machined parts, using drill holes and tap threads, if necessary, for bolting parts together. Checking tightness of joints and operation of moving parts, and filing or chiselling parts to make final adjustments if the fit is not perfect. Cutting, threading, bending and installing hydraulic and pneumatic pipes and lines.

fields.name: Mechanical Technology Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches mechanical technology (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Mechanic's Assistant
fields.description: Assists motor mechanics to replace and repair worn and defective parts, re-assemble mechanical components, change oil and filters, and perform other routine mechanical tasks.
fields.tasks: Assisting motor mechanics in the general overhaul and repair of engines, transmissions on automobiles and other heavy equipment. Providing routine maintenance checks on vehicles. Carrying out oil changes and changing filters for customers. Replacing spark plugs and shock absorbers, and adjusting clutches. Checking and balancing wheels, and checking for proper tyre alignment. Performing minor tune-ups on vehicles. Installing batteries and terminals in vehicles. Repairing light bulbs and adjusting lights. Repairing generators and starters. Using a variety of tools and equipment to fix and replace parts on vehicles.

fields.name: Mechanised Bookbinding Technician
fields.description: Sets up, maintains and operates a variety of machinery and equipment to manufacture commercial products and other soft cover publications.
fields.tasks: Setting up and supervising the operation of automatic binding and finishing equipment for books, magazines and other publications. Programming electronically operated units for pre-press and post-press paper cutting and trimming. Operating photographic and electronic reproduction devices. Operating systems to insert printed material into newspapers, magazines and envelopes. Embellishing printed products using automatic machinery.

fields.name: Mechanised Hard-cover Bookbinding Technician
fields.description: Sets up, maintains and operates a variety of machinery and equipment to manufacture hard cover case bound books.
fields.tasks: Making use of specialised machines, such as folding, cutting, stitching, punching, indexing, assembling and binding machines. Making a book from flat sheets or folded sections of paper. Binding the book together and making various types of covers to hold the book block. Using specialised machines for cutting, folding, gathering, stitching, gluing, forming, case-making, etc. Folding printed sheets into sections of 16 or 32 pages and arranged into order. Inserting plates at the assigned places. Sewing the book together and/or making use of glue. Colouring or gilding may be applied to page edges. Preparing the cover and putting the cover and book together.

fields.name: Mechanized soft-cover bookbinding technician
fields.description: Sets-up, maintains and operates a variety of machinery and equipment and manufactures commercial products and soft cover publications.
fields.tasks: Making use of specialised machines, such as folding, cutting, stitching, punching, indexing, assembling and binding machines. Making a book from flat sheets or folded sections of paper. Binding the book together and making various types of covers to hold the book block. Using specialised machines for cutting, folding, gathering, stitching, gluing, forming, case-making, etc. Folding printed sheets into sections of 16 or 32 pages and arranged into order. Inserting plates at the assigned places. Sewing the book together and/or making use of glue. Colouring or gilding may be applied to page edges. Preparing the cover and putting the cover and book together.

fields.name: Mechatronics Technician
fields.description: Repairs and maintains integrated industrial systems based on mechanical, electrical, electronic and information technology and advanced technology components.
fields.tasks: Connecting electrical systems to power supply. Studying specifications to determine installation procedures. Testing faulty equipment to diagnose malfunctions, using test equipment or software. Performing preventive maintenance tasks, such as checking, cleaning, or repairing equipment. Inspecting components of industrial equipment for accurate assembly and installation or for defects. Maintaining equipment logs that record performance problems, repairs, calibrations, or tests. Setting up and testing industrial equipment to ensure that it functions properly.

fields.name: Media Monitor
fields.description: Presents the central findings of one or more research studies.
fields.tasks: Collecting local, national and international news through interviews, investigation and observation, attending public events, seeking out records, reviewing written work.      Collecting, reporting and commenting on news and current affairs for publication. Receiving, analysing and verifying news and other copy for accuracy.      Researching and reporting on developments in specialised fields such as medicine, science and technology.      Selecting, assembling and preparing publicity material about business or other organisations for publication.      Writing critical reviews on knowledge, judgement and experience.      Writing commentaries on topics of current interest to stimulate public interest.

fields.name: Media Producer
fields.description: Plans, administers and reviews activities concerned with publishing, or the production of films, television or radio programs, theatre, music, festivals or other artistic activities.
fields.tasks: Choosing sound and video recordings, and editing and shaping clips into a meaningful product. Applying interpretive skills to fulfil a vision for audio-visual products in terms of the product's intended purpose.      Determining the scope of the production.      Creating, planning and writing scripts for recording, videotaping and editing programs and sound clips.      Planning, organising and controlling the scheduling involved in production.

fields.name: Medical Assistant
fields.description: Performs basic clinical and administrative tasks to support patient care under the direct supervision of a medical practitioner or other health professional.
fields.tasks: Assisting General Medical Practitioners and Medical Specialists to examine and treat patients, including measuring and recording vital signs, administering medications, and performing routine clinical procedures such as giving injections and removing sutures. Interviewing patients and their families to obtain information on their health status and medical history. Getting patients ready for examination and treatment, including explaining procedures and showing them to examination rooms. Preparing and handling medical instruments and supplies, including sterilising instruments and disposing of contaminated supplies in accordance with safety procedures. Collecting blood, tissue or other specimens, and preparing them for laboratory testing. Providing prescription and drug refill information to pharmacies. Providing information to patients and families on health care topics including medications prescribed by a General Medical Practitioner or Medical Specialist. Recording information on patients' medical history, diagnostic testing and treatment procedures and results, and other information in medical records-keeping systems. Maintaining cleanliness of patient waiting and examination rooms.

fields.name: Medical Diagnostic Radiographer
fields.description: A Medical Diagnostic Radiographer or Medical Imaging Technologist operates x-ray and other medical imaging equipment to produce images for medical diagnostic purposes in conjunction with radiologists or other medical specialists.
fields.tasks: Operating or overseeing operation of radiologic, ultrasound and magnetic imaging equipment to produce images of the body for diagnostic purposes. Explaining procedures, observing and positioning patients, and using protection devices to ensure safety and comfort during examination, scan, or treatment. Position imaging or treatment equipment, monitoring video displays, and adjusting settings and controls according to technical specifications. Reviewing and evaluating developed x-rays, video tape, or computer generated information to determine if images are satisfactory for diagnostic purposes and recording results of procedures. Monitoring patients' conditions and reactions, reporting abnormal signs to a medical practitioner. Recording and disposing of radioactive materials and storing radiopharmaceuticals, following radiation safety procedures.

fields.name: Medical Electronic Equipment Operator
fields.description: Operates, inspects and maintains laboratory or healthcare equipment.
fields.tasks: Operating, inspecting and maintaining laboratory or clinical healthcare equipment.   Overseeing the smooth functioning of technical equipment used for specialised clinical procedures.   Performing clinical investigative procedures with the aid of appropriate technology under the guidance of a General Medical Practitioner or Medical Specialist.   Performing corrective and therapeutic procedures under the guidance of a General Medical Practitioner or Medical Specialist.   Using extra-corporeal apparatus to support or take over the natural body functions of a patient on a temporary basis.   Positioning treatment equipment and adjusting settings and controls according to technical specifications.   Explaining procedures, observing and positioning patients, and using protection devices to ensure safety and comfort during examination or treatment.

fields.name: Medical Laboratory Technician
fields.description: Performs routine medical laboratory tests and operates diagnostic laboratory equipment under the supervision of medical laboratory scientists and pathologists.
fields.tasks: Analysing human tissue, bodily fluid or excretion in a medical or diagnostic laboratory to enable a General Medical Practitioner or Medical Specialist to make a diagnosis.   Using sophisticated and automated microscopes, computers and laboratory equipment to analyse samples and identify abnormalities.   Interpreting and consulting on the analysis of human tissue, bodily fluid or excretion.   Conducting chemical analysis of body fluids, including blood, urine, and spinal fluid, to determine presence of normal and abnormal components.   Entering data from analysis of laboratory tests and clinical results into records-keeping systems and reporting results to medical practitioners and other health professionals.   Establishing and monitoring programs to ensure the accuracy of laboratory results and developing, standardizing, evaluating, and modifying procedures, techniques and tests used in the analysis of specimens.   Conducting quality controls on laboratory processes used to analyse human tissue, bodily fluid or excretion.   Teaching, training and conducting research on the analysis of human tissue, bodily fluid or excretion.   Setting up, cleaning, and maintaining laboratory equipment.

fields.name: Medical Radiation Therapist
fields.description: Operates high energy x-ray and other radiation and electron generating and monitoring equipment to administer radiation treatment for medical purposes in conjunction with radiologists or other medical specialists.
fields.tasks: Operating or overseeing operation of radiologic, ultrasound and magnetic imaging equipment to produce images of the body for diagnostic purposes. Explaining procedures, observing and positioning patients, and using protection devices to ensure safety and comfort during examination, scan, or treatment. Positioning imaging or treatment equipment, monitoring video displays, and adjusting settings and controls according to technical specifications. Reviewing and evaluating developed x-rays, video tape, or computer generated information to determine if images are satisfactory for diagnostic purposes and recording results of procedures. Monitoring patients' conditions and reactions, reporting abnormal signs to a medical practitioner. Measuring and recording radiation dosage or radiopharmaceuticals received and used for patients, following prescription issued by a medical practitioner. Administering, detecting and mapping radiopharmaceuticals or radiation in patients' bodies, using radioisotope, camera or other equipment for diagnosing and treating diseases.

fields.name: Medical Receptionist
fields.description: Greets patients and other clients in a health facility such as a clinic, practice, centre or surgery, and responds to personal, telephone and written inquiries and requests.
fields.tasks: Greeting arriving patients and retrieving their medical files from the file room. Checking patient details recorded in medical files and amending if necessary. Processing medical aid co-payments and medical aid submissions. Maintaining patient records and patient accounts. Answering phones, scheduling appointments, screening calls and taking messages. Handling incoming and outgoing mail and general emails. Preparing electronic and written correspondence to patients, medical aids and other medical practitioners. Performing general office receptionist duties that may be required. Performing specific duties relating to the specialisation of the practice or medical facility.

fields.name: Medical Scientist
fields.description: Conducts medical laboratory tests to assist in the diagnosis, treatment and prevention of disease.
fields.tasks: Studying human diseases, doing research to determine causes of diseases and developing ways to prevent or treat the diseases.   Carrying out laboratory-based tasks to test, measure and examine specimens gathered from the human body.   Providing clinical pathology services to analyse bodily fluids in order to help diagnose and manage diseases.   Applying and evaluating scientific procedures involving humans, human biological material and medical equipment to inform the diagnosis, treatment and genetic counselling of patients.   Providing clinical services and consultations to medical specialists and oncologists to plan radiation treatment for cancer patients and measuring radiation output from devices used in cancer therapy.   Conducting research on a range of matters relevant in medical science such as mechanisms of biological change in patients receiving radiation treatment and the use of high-energy machines to treat patients.   Working in multi-disciplined teams to run clinical trials for new treatment options, medicines and vaccines.   Using high tech microscopes, cell counters, computers and other laboratory equipment to analyse and test specimens and scientific devices.

fields.name: Medical Secretary
fields.description: Assist health professionals and other workers by performing a variety of communication, documentation, administrative and internal coordination functions, to support health workers in medical facilities and other health-care related organizations.
fields.tasks: Scheduling and confirming medical appointments and communicating messages for medical staff and patients. Completing medical insurance and other claims forms. Interviewing patients to complete forms, documents and case histories. Compiling, recording and reviewing medical charts, reports, documents and correspondence. Maintaining medical files and records and technical library. Preparing financial statements and billing procedures. Assisting in the preparation of budgets, drafting of contracts and purchasing or acquisition orders. Supervising the work of office support workers and other office staff.

fields.name: Medical Superintendent
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates medical programs and clinical services in a hospital or other health service facility; maintains standards of medical care and provides leadership to ensure an appropriately skilled medical workforce and
fields.tasks: Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation and expenditure on supplies, equipment and services. Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and performance standards for medical, nursing, technical and administrative staff. Directing or conducting recruitment, hiring and training of personnel. Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of medical, nursing, technical, clerical, service, maintenance, and other personnel. Liaising with other health and welfare service providers, boards and funding bodies to coordinate the provision of services. Monitoring the use of diagnostic services, inpatient beds, facilities, and staff to ensure effective use of resources and assess the need for additional staff, equipment, and services. Providing overall direction and management for the service, facility, organization or centre. Representing the organization in negotiations, and at conventions, seminars, public hearings and forums.

fields.name: Melter
fields.description: Prepares, operates, tests, repairs and maintains melting equipment and system components (including refractory material installations, water cooling and charge material control and handling systems) to produce metal castings in foundries.
fields.tasks: Melting gold, or gold and silver alloys, using furnace, electric heating unit, or torch, and pouring molten metal ingot in moulds to prepare metal for use in making jewellery. Placing crucible in preheated oven or heating crucible with torch to melt metal. Observing colour changes in metals to ensure that specified temperature is attained. Opening mould, lifting out ingot with tongs, and quenching ingot in water. Turning valves to circulate water through core or spraying water on filled moulds to cool and solidify metal. Assembling and imbedding cores in casting frames, using hand tools and equipment. Operating roller machine to roll ingots into metal strips for use in stamping out jewellery blanks.

fields.name: Member of Parliament / Parliamentarian
fields.description: Represents the interests of people in a constituency as their elected member to national government.
fields.tasks: As members of the government, directing senior administrators and officials of government departments and agencies in the interpretation and implementation of government policies.    Attending community functions and meetings to provide service to the community, understand public opinion and provide information on government plans.    Determining, formulating, and directing policies of national, state, regional or local governments.    Investigating matters of concern to the public and promoting the interests of the constituencies which they represent.   Making, ratifying, amending or repealing laws, public rules and regulations within a statutory or constitutional framework.    Negotiating with other legislators and representatives of interest groups in order to reconcile differing interests, and to create policies and agreements. Presiding over or participating in the proceedings of legislative bodies and administrative councils of national, state, regional or local governments or legislative assemblies.    Serving on government administrative boards or official committees.

fields.name: Metal Engineering Process Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in manufacturing metal products.
fields.tasks: Conveying goods, material and equipment. Loading and unloading vehicles, trucks and trolleys. Clearing machine blockages, cleaning machinery, equipment and tools. Carrying out manual sorting of products or components.

fields.name: Metal Fabricator
fields.description: Marks off and fabricates structural steel and other metal stock to make or repair metal products and structures.
fields.tasks: Marking metal framework as a guide when drilling, cutting, and shaping them for use in buildings, ships and other structures. Drilling, cutting and shaping structural steel in a workshop. Erecting steel framework for buildings, bridges and other constructions. Assembling and erecting the framework and other metal parts of ships' structures. Shaping and fitting structural-steel plates of ships under construction or repair. Riveting structural-metal members by hand, machine or pneumatic riveter. Shaping and bending metal sections and pipes using hand and machine tools or by heating and hammering. Aligning parts to be joined using hand tools and measuring instruments.

fields.name: Metal Machinist
fields.description: Sets up and operates machine tools to shape and form metal stock and castings to fine tolerances, using detailed drawings and specifications. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Producing a part (metal or plastic that is unique or needed in thousands) from material by cutting. Producing a specific part by using various machine tools. Planning a logical workflow through a series of machines when a large number of parts are needed. Using a Computer numerically controlled (CNC) machine (a special precision computer-driven tool that can machine a large variety of shapes) if required. Configuring machine tools according to the strategy provided by an engineer and according to blueprints and engineering drawings to produce detailed specifications of a part. Observing machine operations to detect work piece defects or machine malfunctions and adjusting machines as necessary. Working with the quality department in ensuring that specifications are maintained in finished products.

fields.name: Metal Manufacturing Machine Setter and Minder
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and runs and monitors metal manufacturing machinery and equipment to produce metals.
fields.tasks: Setting up, preparing and adjusting mineral ore and metal processing machinery to carry out one step in the overall mineral ore or metal processing operation. Operating single-function machinery to grind, separate, filter, mix, treat, cast, roll, refine or otherwise process metals and mineral ores. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of machine and verify specified processing conditions. Adjusting equipment, valves, pumps, controls and process equipment. Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of raw materials and processing agents into plant. Controlling process start-up and shut-down, troubleshooting and monitoring outside process equipment. Verifying equipment for malfunctions, carrying out routine operating tests and arranging for maintenance.

fields.name: Metal Manufacturing Process Control Technician
fields.description: Operates and monitors multi-function process control machinery and equipment to control the processing of metal, converting and refining furnaces, metal-rolling mills, metal heat-treating, or metal-extrusion plant.
fields.tasks: Coordinating and monitoring the operation of a particular aspect of metal processing production through control panels, computer terminals or other control systems, usually from a central control room. Operating multi-function central process control machinery to grind, separate, filter, melt, roast, treat, refine or otherwise process metals. Observing computer printouts, video monitors and gauges to verify specified processing conditions and to make necessary adjustments. Coordinating and supervising production crew such as machine and process operators, assistants and helpers. Starting up and shutting down the production system in cases of emergency or as required by schedule. Providing and organising training for members of production crew. Maintaining shift log of production and other data and preparing production and other reports.

fields.name: Metal Polisher
fields.description: Polishes metal to impart smooth, reflective or other finishes.
fields.tasks: Applying knowledge of abrasives and grinding procedures. Selecting grinding wheels according to specifications and mounting these on machines using hand tools. Dressing grinding wheels, and operating fixed or portable buffing and polishing machines. Inspecting, feeling and measuring workpieces to ensure that surfaces and dimensions meet specifications. Monitoring machine operations to determine whether adjustments are necessary, and stopping machines when problems occur.

fields.name: Metal Processing Plant Operator
fields.description: Operates, monitors, adjusts and maintains, single process machinery and equipment to process and convert mineral ores and refine, harden, roll and extrude metals.
fields.tasks: Operating single-function machinery to grind, separate, filter, mix, treat, cast, roll, refine or otherwise process metals and mineral ores. Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of raw materials and processing agents into the plant. Controlling process start-up and shut-down, troubleshooting and monitoring outside process equipment. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of machine and verify specified processing conditions. Analysing sample products, performing tests, recording data and writing production logs. Informing supervisors if machine requires adjustment, maintenance or repair.

fields.name: Metal Toymaker
fields.description: Applies traditional techniques and patterns to produce non-precious metals and stone articles for household.
fields.tasks: Designing metal toys and/or interpreting drawings for metal toy design. Cutting, bending and shaping metal parts for metal toys using traditional, hand tools and/or electric tools. Hand-painting or spray-painting frames and other metal parts. Assembling metal toys. Examining and repairing metal toys.

fields.name: Metallurgical Engineer
fields.description: Plans, designs, organises and oversees the quality, process capability, production and commercial application of metals in products and related technologies.
fields.tasks: Performing laboratory studies of steps in manufacture of new products and testing proposed process in small scale operation such as a pilot plant. Determining the location and planning the extraction of coal, metallic ores, non-metallic minerals, and building materials, such as stone and gravel. Determining most suitable methods of efficient mining and extraction, types of machinery to be used, planning layout and directing construction of shafts and tunnels. Determining drilling site and devising methods of controlling the flow of water, oil or gas from wells. Planning and directing storage, initial treatment and transportation of water, oil or gas. Establishing safety standards and procedures and first-aid facilities, especially underground. Conducting research, developing methods of extracting metals from their ores and advising on their application. Investigating properties of metals and alloys, developing new alloys and advising on and supervising technical aspects of metal and alloy manufacture and processing. Maintaining technical liaison and consultancy with other relevant specialists such as geologists and geophysicists. Examining deposits or mines to evaluate profitability.

fields.name: Metallurgical Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Analyses and modifies new and existing metallurgical engineering technologies and applies them in the testing and implementation of metallurgical engineering projects.
fields.tasks: Performing laboratory studies of steps in manufacture of new products and testing proposed process in small scale operation such as a pilot plant. Determining the location and planning the extraction of coal, metallic ores, non-metallic minerals, and building materials, such as stone and gravel. Determining most suitable methods of efficient mining and extraction, types of machinery to be used, planning layout and directing construction of shafts and tunnels. Determining drilling site and devising methods of controlling the flow of water, oil or gas from wells. Planning and directing storage, initial treatment and transportation of water, oil or gas. Establishing safety standards and procedures and first-aid facilities, especially underground. Conducting research, developing methods of extracting metals from their ores and advising on their application. Investigating properties of metals and alloys, developing new alloys and advising on and supervising technical aspects of metal and alloy manufacture and processing. Maintaining technical liaison and consultancy with other relevant specialists such as geologists and geophysicists. Examining deposits or mines to evaluate profitability.

fields.name: Metallurgical or Materials Technician
fields.description: Tests materials as part of mineral and metal processing and refining, or for research into metals, ceramics, polymers and other materials in support of metallurgists and materials engineers.
fields.tasks: Providing technical assistance to aid in research on and development of processes to determine the properties of metals and new alloys. Providing technical assistance in geological and topographical surveys, and in the design and layout of oil, natural gas and mineral ore extraction and transportation systems, and processing and refining plants for minerals and metals. Preparing detailed estimates of quantities and costs of materials and labour required for mineral, oil and natural gas exploration, extraction, processing and transport projects. Monitoring technical, regulatory and safety aspects of the construction, installation, operation, maintenance and repair of mineral ore, oil and natural gas exploration, extraction, transport and storage installations and of mineral processing plants. Collecting and preparing rock, mineral and metal samples, performing laboratory tests to determine properties, analyzing and reporting test results and maintaining testing equipment. Assisting scientists in the use of electrical, sonic, or nuclear measuring instruments in both laboratory and production activities to obtain data indicating potential sources of metallic ore, gas, or petroleum.

fields.name: Metallurgist
fields.description: Researches, develops, controls and provides advice on processes used in extracting metals from their ores, and processes used for casting, alloying, heat treating or welding refined metals, alloys and other materials to produce commercial metal products o
fields.tasks: Performing laboratory studies of steps in manufacture of new products and testing proposed process in small scale operation such as a pilot plant. Determining the location and planning the extraction of coal, metallic ores, non-metallic minerals, and building materials, such as stone and gravel. Determining most suitable methods of efficient mining and extraction, types of machinery to be used, planning layout and directing construction of shafts and tunnels. Determining drilling site and devising methods of controlling the flow of water, oil or gas from wells. Planning and directing storage, initial treatment and transportation of water, oil or gas. Establishing safety standards and procedures and first-aid facilities, especially underground. Conducting research, developing methods of extracting metals from their ores and advising on their application. Investigating properties of metals and alloys, developing new alloys and advising on and supervising technical aspects of metal and alloy manufacture and processing. Maintaining technical liaison and consultancy with other relevant specialists such as geologists and geophysicists. Examining deposits or mines to evaluate profitability.

fields.name: Meteorologist
fields.description: Studies the physics and dynamics of the atmosphere to increase understanding of weather and climate, and to forecast changes in the weather and long term climatic trends.
fields.tasks: A meteorologist's work falls into two main categories, i.e. forecasting and research. In weather forecasting, typical work activities are Collecting data from satellite images, radar, remote sensors and weather stations all over the world. Measuring factors such as air pressure, temperature and humidity at various atmospheric levels. Analysing and presenting this information to customers in the form of weather briefings e.g. on television or radio. Coding weather reports for transmission over international networks. Applying physical and mathematical relationships and sophisticated computer models to make short and long-range weather forecasts. Liaising with colleagues and clients from around the country and worldwide. In research, typical work activities are Investigating subjects such as airflow in the lowest kilometre of the atmosphere; the physics of clouds and precipitation; global climate change. Developing and improving numerical and computer models to predict atmospheric processes and improve the accuracy of forecasts. Monitoring climate variability and change. Researching seasonal forecasting, ocean forecasting and climate prediction. Monitoring and investigating changes in the stratosphere, including the ozone layer. Applying the results of research in order, for example, to give flood warnings or estimate the likely effects of global warming.

fields.name: Meter Reader
fields.description: Reads electric, gas and water meters, records usage, inspects meters and connections for defects and damage, and reports irregularities.
fields.tasks: Opening meter boxes, checking readings and recording them manually or by using an electronic devices. Reporting meters with problems, meters with suspected tampering, and damaged meters. Taking start readings and final readings. Checking meter readings when disputes arise. Disconnecting and reconnecting meters.

fields.name: Microbiologist
fields.description: Studies microscopic forms of life such as bacteria, viruses and protozoa.
fields.tasks: Observing, monitoring, identifying and tracking microorganisms in a range of environments. Collecting, monitoring and assessing samples from different types of environments, such as agricultural sites. Using a variety of identification methods, including molecular techniques, to test samples. Developing and registering new medicines, vaccines, diagnostic tests and pharmaceutical products. Developing products, such as enzymes, vitamins, hormones, and antimicrobials planning and implementing and evaluating them in clinical trials. Conducting quality control in manufacturing processes, e.g. checking for signs of contamination. Using specialist computer software to undertake research. Managing and overseeing laboratory work. Maintaining accurate and up-to-date records and writing up research findings and producing reports.

fields.name: Microphone Boom Operator
fields.description: Positions microphones in proximity of performers during filming of motion picture or television broadcasts.
fields.tasks: Ensuring equipment is kept in good working order. Capturing sound by placing microphones and connecting cables to recording equipment. Carrying recording equipment between recording locations. Learning of equipment and which microphones to use under different acoustic and sound circumstances. Keeping record of recorded audio.

fields.name: Microsystems Engineers
fields.description: Researches, designs, develops or tests microelectromecanical systems (MEMS) devices.
fields.tasks: Designing and developing micro electromechanical systems (MEMS) devices or applications for fields such as electronics, health care and materials technology. Integrating and applying an in-depth knowledge of electronic and mechanical engineering theory and methods and manufacturing technology in the design of MEMS devices. Planning or scheduling engineering research or development projects involving MEMS technology. Developing or implementing MEMS processing tools, fixtures, gages, dies, moulds or trays. Developing and verifying customer or consumer documentation such as performance specifications, training manuals and operating instructions for MEMS devices. Developing or filing intellectual property and patent disclosure or application documents related to MEMS devices, products, or systems.

fields.name: Midwife
fields.description: Provides care and advice to women during pregnancy, labour and childbirth, and postnatal care for women and babies in a range of settings such as the home, community, hospitals, clinics and health units.
fields.tasks: Planning, providing and evaluating care and support services for women and babies before, during and after pregnancy and childbirth according to the practice and standards of modern midwifery care. Providing advice to women and families and conducting community education on health, nutrition, hygiene, exercise, birth and emergency plans, breastfeeding, infant care, family planning and contraception, lifestyle and other topics related to pregnancy and childbirth. Assessing progress during pregnancy and childbirth, managing complications and recognising warning signs requiring referral to a medical doctor with specialised skills in obstetrics. Monitoring the health status of newborns, managing complications and recognising warning signs requiring referral to a medical doctor with specialised skills in neonatology. Monitoring pain and discomfort experienced by women during labour and delivery and alleviating pain using a variety of therapies, including the use of pain-killing drugs. Reporting births to government authorities to meet legal and professional requirements. Conducting research on midwifery practices and procedures and disseminating findings such as through scientific papers and reports. Planning and conducting midwifery education activities in clinical and community settings.

fields.name: Military Commander
fields.description: Train, prepare, employ, command and direct military capabilities, organised as formations or units, in military operations during war and peace for the defence of the territorial integrity and sovereignty of the RSA, to promote regional and continental pe
fields.tasks: Controlling the collection and interpretation of management information to monitor performance.      Controlling the use of, and accounting for, the assets and facilities of the organisation.      Establishing administrative and operational procedures, taking account of the organisation's operating environment and national legislative, security and emergency policies and procedures.      Establishing lines of control and delegating responsibilities to subordinate staff.      Instructing and teaching subordinates in dress, deportment, demeanour, behaviour, drill and devotion to duty to maintain military traditions, customs and standards.      Making policy decisions and accepting responsibility for operations, performance of staff, achievement of targets and adherence to budgets, standards and procedures.      Monitoring the morale, welfare and behaviour of subordinates, and advising commanding officers accordingly.    Preparing reports, authorising the release of information and handling public relations activities.

fields.name: Military Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and reviews the day-to-day military operations and major functions of organisational units of the south African national defence force. Manage units other than combat units and act as staff officers to military commande
fields.tasks: Controlling the collection and interpretation of management information to monitor performance.      Controlling the use of, and accounting for, the assets and facilities of the organisation.      Establishing administrative and operational procedures, taking account of the organisation's operating environment and national legislative, security and emergency policies and procedures.      Establishing lines of control and delegating responsibilities to subordinate staff.      Instructing and teaching subordinates in dress, deportment, demeanour, behaviour, drill and devotion to duty to maintain military traditions, customs and standards.      Making policy decisions and accepting responsibility for operations, performance of staff, achievement of targets and adherence to budgets, standards and procedures.      Monitoring the morale, welfare and behaviour of subordinates, and advising commanding officers accordingly.    Preparing budgets and other management plans.      Preparing reports, authorising the release of information and handling public relations activities.      Representing the organisation in dealings with other organisations and the public.

fields.name: Military Police Official
fields.description: Provides a military policing support to the armed forces in peace time as well as during military operations.
fields.tasks: Directing traffic and assuming authority in the event of accidents. Investigating crimes and incidents related to the military by finding the facts of the particular events. Identifying, pursuing and arresting suspects and perpetrators of criminal acts within the military environment.      Patrolling a specific area to maintain public order, responding to emergencies, protecting military personnel and property and enforce laws and regulations.      Providing emergency assistance to victims of crimes or accidents.

fields.name: Miller
fields.description: Monitors and controls mechanical and operational efficiency of production facilities, equipment, plant and related resources in the bulk handling and storage of cereals, milling of cereals and extraction of starch.
fields.tasks: Managing the process of grain manufacturing. Sampling grain, determining mass, grading wheat, grouping wheat, unloading consignment, managing intake and storage facility and implementing storage hygiene and combat contamination in grain.

fields.name: Milling Process Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines and performs routine tasks to mix, mill and treat grains and by-products to make flour, meal and stock feed.
fields.tasks: Setting up and operating stationary plant and machinery which grind, crush, cut, saw and slice rocks, minerals and stones according to the specifications for the job. Positioning blocks and slabs of stone onto machines for sawing, cutting and further working. Monitoring and maintaining the flow of unprocessed rocks, minerals and stones from conveyors into machines. Operating washing, separating, leaching, precipitating, filtering, extracting and combining equipment to remove waste material and recover minerals. Combining mineral ores with solvents to facilitate further processing. Separating metal and mineral concentrates from ore and alluvial deposits by thickening, flotation, gravity separation, filtration, and or magnetic and electrostatic separation. Observing meters, gauges and control panels, and adjusting valves and controls to ensure the safe and efficient operation of equipment, and detecting malfunctions, and assisting with plant and machinery maintenance and repair. Examining processed materials visually or with hands to ensure compliance with established standards and job specifications, and may collect samples for testing in laboratories. Recording information about processing completed during shifts, such as quantities, types and dimensions of materials produced. Sorting, stacking and moving processed minerals and stone for packaging, further processing or shipping.

fields.name: Millwright
fields.description: Installs, maintains, troubleshoots and repairs stationary industrial machinery and electromechanical equipment.. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Fitting, adjusting and repairing various kinds of electrical machinery and motors, generators, instruments, or electrical parts of elevators and related equipment. Fitting, adjusting and repairing electrical parts in domestic appliances, industrial machines and other appliances. Inspecting and testing manufactured electrical products. Installing, testing, connecting, commissioning, maintaining and modifying electrical equipment, wiring and control systems. Designing, installing, maintaining, servicing and repairing electric and hydraulic passenger and freight lifts, escalators, moving walkways and other lift equipment. Connecting electrical systems to power supply. Replacing and repairing defective parts.

fields.name: Mine Ventilation Observer
fields.description: Provides technical expertise with regard to ventilation and occupational hygiene issues.
fields.tasks: Observing, measuring, recording and reporting aspects of the occupational environmental conditions including air and water quality and flow using a wide variety of equipment and methods. Examining refuge bays and places of safety. Taking appropriate corrective action when hazardous environmental conditions are found. Taking safety measures when entering confined spaces or when being exposed to hazardous materials and spills. Providing information for ventilation engineering decision-making and legal compliance.

fields.name: Miner
fields.description: Supervises and performs blasting and excavation operations to extract ore.
fields.tasks: Extracting minerals and other natural deposits from the earth, operate underground conveyances or heavy equipment in surface mines and quarries.

fields.name: Mineral Beneficiation Plant Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in setting up and operating a mineral beneficiation plant.
fields.tasks: Assisting in assembling and dismantling equipment and fittings in ore-processing plants. Operating ore-crushing and ore-screening plants using manual and computer-based systems, conveyers, feeders, weight-meters, roll mills, pumps, jigs, spirals and flotation cells. Loading, unloading and storing materials such as treatment chemicals and tools. Mixing ore-treating chemicals, catalysts and reagents. Supplying and controlling molten metal in furnaces. Clearing blockages in materials-handling and transporting equipment. Cleaning, washing and maintaining equipment, and removing spillages and rubbish. Assisting with maintaining auxiliary systems, such as drainage, fluid-pouring and conveyor-belt systems.

fields.name: Mineral Beneficiation Process Controller
fields.description: Monitors and controls mechanical and operational efficiency of mineral beneficiation and process facilities, equipment, plant and related resources.
fields.tasks: Controlling metallurgical operations from a control room. Monitoring and controlling plant, equipment and processes in a minerals processing environment in terms of physical condition and operation. Conducting shift take-over and hand-over activities effectively in order to ensure typical continuous operations in a minerals processing plant. Applying operating instructions to control and respond to process plant conditions. Monitoring operational parameters in a minerals processing environment.

fields.name: Mineral Processing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines to cut and finish mineral for processing rocks, minerals and stone to recover refined products for immediate use or further processing for tiles, building blocks and facings.
fields.tasks: Setting up and operating stationary plant and machinery which grind, crush, cut, saw and slice rocks, minerals and stones according to the specifications for the job. Positioning blocks and slabs of stone onto machines for sawing, cutting and further working. Monitoring and maintaining the flow of unprocessed rocks, minerals and stones from conveyors into machines. Operating washing, separating, leaching, precipitating, filtering, extracting and combining equipment to remove waste material and recover minerals. Combining mineral ores with solvents to facilitate further processing. Separating metal and mineral concentrates from ore and alluvial deposits by thickening, flotation, gravity separation, filtration, and or magnetic and electrostatic separation. Observing meters, gauges and control panels, and adjusting valves and controls to ensure the safe and efficient operation of equipment, and detecting malfunctions, and assisting with plant and machinery maintenance and repair. Examining processed materials visually or with hands to ensure compliance with established standards and job specifications, and may collect samples for testing in laboratories. Recording information about processing completed during shifts, such as quantities, types and dimensions of materials produced. Sorting, stacking and moving processed minerals and stone for packaging, further processing or shipping. Alternate Occupation Names Coal Washer Conveyor Belt Operator (Mining) Crusher Operator Emery Press Operator Flotation Worker (Mineral Processing) Gold Precipitator Lime Miller Machine Operator (Stone Cutting or Processing) Marble Cutter / Polisher / Processor / Sawyer / Sp Metallurgical Plant Operator Milling Machine Operator (Minerals) Mineral Beneficiation Plant Operator Mineral Ore Treatment Plant Operator Stone Cutter / Polisher / Processor / Sawyer / Spl Stone Turner Lathe

fields.name: Mineral Resources Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates complex operational resources to establish optimal, economically viable and safe strategies and objectives to extract mineral resources from the earth, utilising appropriate engineering designs, mining and metallurgical processes, equipment and schedules that will accomplish these objectives and lead to the safe and productive recovery of mineral reserves and final product, in line with customer requirements.
fields.tasks: Conferring with other managers to set production quotas, plan extraction sites and develop policies for the removal of raw materials. Controlling the operation of plant and quality procedures through planning of maintenance, designation of operating hours and supply of equipment. Controlling the preparation of production records and reports. Establishing and managing budgets, monitoring production output and costs, and adjusting processes and resources to minimize costs. Evaluating efficiency of production sites to determine adequacy of personnel, equipment and technologies used, and make changes to work schedule or equipment. Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff. Planning details of production activities in terms of output quality and quantity, cost, time available and labour requirements.

fields.name: Mineralogist
fields.description: Studies the chemistry, crystal structure, and physical (including optical) properties of minerals.
fields.tasks: Conducting research and improving or developing concepts, theories and operational methods related to geology and geophysics. Studying composition and structure of the earth's crust, examining rocks, minerals, fossils and other materials, to determine processes affecting the development of the Earth, trace evolution of past life, establish nature and chronology of geological formations and assess their commercial applications. Interpreting research data and preparing geological reports, maps, charts and diagrams, reports and papers. Applying geological knowledge to problems encountered in civil engineering projects such as the construction of dams, bridges, tunnels, and large buildings; and land reclamation projects. Using various remote sensing programs to investigate and measure seismic, gravitational, electrical, thermal, and magnetic forces affecting the earth. Estimating weight, size and mass of the earth and composition and structure of its interior, and studying the nature, activity and predictability of volcanoes, glaciers and earthquakes. Charting the earth's magnetic field and applying this and other collected data for broadcasting, navigation and other purposes. Studying and measuring physical properties of seas and the atmosphere and their inter-relationship, such as the exchange of thermal energy. Locating and determining the nature and extent of oil, gas and mineral deposits using seismological, gravimetric, magnetic, electrical or radiometric methods. Identifying deposits of construction materials and determining their characteristics and suitability for use as concrete aggregates, road fill or for other applications. Researching the movement, distribution and physical properties of ground and surface waters. Advising in areas such as waste management, route and site selection and the restoration of contaminated sites.

fields.name: Mines Safety Inspector
fields.description: Regulates and monitors those environmental aspects at mines that affect, or may affect, the health or safety of employees or other persons.
fields.tasks: Advising on the implementation of rules and regulations concerned with occupational safety in the mining environment. Giving advice on environmental sanitary problems and techniques in the mining environment. Inspecting mines and surrounding areas to ensure conformity with regulations and standards in processes, transport, and material handling and storage. Inspecting mines to ensure conformance to rules and regulations concerning emission of pollutants and disposal of dangerous wastes. Obtaining information about mining practices and accidents to determine compliance with safety regulations and the availability of safety devices and emergency switches. Inspecting and testing mine shaft lifts and conveyor equipment. Inspecting safety measures that apply to entering confined spaces, exposure to hazardous materials, and spills. Inspecting mining machinery and equipment to determine conformance standards and regulations. Estimating quantities and costs of materials and labour required for a health, safety and sanitation remediation project. Initiating action to maintain or improve hygiene and prevent pollution of water, air, food or soil as a result of mining activities.

fields.name: Mining Engineer
fields.description: Plans and directs the engineering aspects of locating and extracting minerals (excluding Petroleum) from the earth. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Performing laboratory studies of steps in manufacture of new products and testing proposed process in small scale operation such as a pilot plant.
