Supervising children during lunch time, assisting children with eating and drinking as necessary. Engaging with children and supervising their play, both indoors and outdoors as required. Supervising homework where necessary. Planning and delivering new activities appropriate to children’s level of development. Ensuring positive management of children’s behaviour. Ensuring the safety of children, and keeping accident and incident records. Reporting any issues or concerns regarding any of the children to the supervising teacher on duty. Liaising with parents as necessary.

fields.name: Outbound Contact Centre Consultant
fields.description: Initiates specialised contact with targeted and/or selected customers according to agreed key performance indicators or outcomes.
fields.tasks: Contacting existing and prospective clients from a call centre environment in order to sell products and services.  Actively matching the needs of the client with the features and benefits of the sellable product.  Providing clients with relevant product information with the intention of selling products.  Processing client applications and concluding pre-agreements with client. Updating databases to reflect changes to the status and details of clients. Meeting sales, customer service, productivity, compliance and quality targets.  Dealing with highly confidential information in a secure environment.

fields.name: Outdoor Adventure Guide
fields.description: Instructs and guides an individual or groups in the use of equipment and explaining and enforcing safety procedures, rules and regulations for outdoor adventure activities.
fields.tasks: Demonstrating the concepts and skills used in outdoor adventure activities.      Explaining and enforcing safety procedures, rules and regulations.   Instructing clients in the use of relevant outdoor adventure equipment.   Evaluating and monitoring clients as they participate in outdoor adventure activities.

fields.name: Oversize Load Pilot / Escort
fields.description: Drives in front or at the back of a truck transporting an oversized load to warn other road users.
fields.tasks: Driving a vehicle equipped with warning lights and signs to escort oversize load trucks.   Maintaining the specified distance from the oversized vehicle to provide warning to other motorists.   Clearing traffic at specific locations to allow the oversized vehicle to pass or to turn.   Communicating by two-way radio with the driver of the oversized vehicle and with other pilot drivers to coordinate changes in speed and route, and to convey information about emergencies or traffic congestion.   Testing vehicle equipment such as lights, brakes, hooters and windscreen wipers to ensure proper operation.   Performing routine vehicle maintenance such as regulating tyre pressure and adding petrol, oil and water.

fields.name: Packaging Manufacturing Machine Minder
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and runs and monitors packaging manufacturing machinery and equipment.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines that weigh, wrap, seal and pack various products. Operating and monitoring machines that fill and seal tubes, bottles, cans, boxes, bags and other containers with products, such as food, beverages, paints, oils and lotions. Operating and monitoring machines that, by gluing or other methods, labels products, packages and various containers.

fields.name: Packer (Non Perishable Products)
fields.description: Weighs, wraps, seals and labels non perishable products.
fields.tasks: Assembling bags, package folders and boxes and inspecting containers for defects. Packing containers with products, counting, weighing or measuring amounts, and adjusting quantities. Manually wrapping products in protective material such as cling wrap. Sealing bags and containers and attaching labels. Sorting packaged products by weight or content. Counting and placing bags or packages onto trays or racks, or into boxes for distribution. Recording information such as numbers, weight, times and dates. Operating machines such as conveyors bundle tie machines, cling wrap machines and pallet strapping machines. Using laser barcode readers for identifying and verifying products

fields.name: Packing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates and monitors machines which weigh and pack and wrap various products.
fields.tasks: Operating machines that weigh, wrap, seal and pack various products. Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of raw materials and in-process products into the machines. Controlling process start-up and shut-down, troubleshooting and monitoring outside process equipment. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of machine and verify specified processing conditions. Adjusting equipment, valves, pumps, controls and process equipment. Analysing sample products, performing tests, recording data and writing production logs. Informing supervisors if machine requires adjustment, maintenance or repair.

fields.name: Paediatrician
fields.description: Investigates, diagnoses and treats diseases and disorders in children from birth up to and including adolescence.
fields.tasks: Caring for the physical, mental and emotional well being of children. Examining children at regular intervals to prevent problems. Advising parents on the health, development and nutrition of their children and about special services that are available for children. Acting as counsellors to parents and children on a range of matters tha spans infant care and emotional problems in teenagers.

fields.name: Paediatrics Nurse
fields.description: Provides nursing care to children with injuries and illness.
fields.tasks: Providing nursing care to children in peadiatric health care facilities and specialised peadiatric units. Coordinating the care of patients in consultation with other health professionals and members of health teams. Developing and implementing care plans for the biological, social, and psychological treatment of patients in collaboration with other health professionals. Planning and providing personal care, treatments and therapies including administering medications, and monitoring responses to treatment or care plan. Planning and participating in health education programmes, health promotion and nurse education activities in clinical and community settings Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about prevention of ill-health, treatment and care Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers

fields.name: Painter
fields.description: Applies paint, varnish, wallpaper and other finishes to protect, maintain and decorate the surfaces of buildings and structures.
fields.tasks: Cleaning and preparing walls and other surfaces of buildings for painting or wallpapering. Selecting and preparing paints to required colours by mixing pigments and additives. Applying or spraying paint, varnish, and similar materials to surfaces, fixtures and fittings of buildings. Measuring and hanging wallpaper or other fabrics on interior walls and ceilings. Applying paints, varnishes and stains to surfaces using brushes, rollers and sprays.

fields.name: Painter (Visual Arts)
fields.description: Conceives and creates visual art forms such as pictures, abstract designs and similar compositions to communicate impressions and ideas. This occupation requires high levels of creative talent or personal commitment and interest as well as, or in place of
fields.tasks: Conceiving and developing ideas, designs and styles for paintings, drawings and sculptures.   Selecting artistic media, method and materials.     Arranging objects, positioning models, and selecting landscapes and other visual forms according to the chosen subject matter.      Creating cartoons to depict persons and events, often in caricature.     . Creating drawings and engraving or etching them on metal, wood, or other materials.      Creating representational or abstract drawings and paintings using pencils, ink, chalk, oil paints, water colours or through the application of other techniques. Restoring damaged, soiled and faded paintings and other art objects.

fields.name: Panelbeater
fields.description: Repairs damage to metal, fibreglass and plastic body work on vehicles and forms replacement vehicle panels. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Straightening bent frames, removing dents and replacing damaged body parts. Using special machines to align damaged frames, body sections, and unit bodies. Bending back the bodywork of a damaged vehicle to its original position so that the doors and bonnet fit properly. Using various hammers to beat the metal from outside or inside until dents and bumps are even out. Removing badly damaged sections of body panels and welding new ones to replace the damaged ones. Repairing small dents by smoothing them out or by filling them with plastic or solder. Filling, sanding, and painting dents.

fields.name: Paper and Pulp Mill Operator
fields.description: Operates plant to produce pulp and/or paper from fibre
fields.tasks: Operating machinery and equipment in the pulp and paper-making process such as screening equipment, bleaching equipment, digesters, mixing tanks, washers and other pulp processing machinery and equipment. Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of processing agents or in-process products into the machines or equipment  to ensure a consistent quality of pulp and paper throughout the production process. Using computer-controlled systems and manual procedures to monitor the performance of machines and equipment. Analysing instrument readings and production test samples to see that product and process specifications are met. Recording data and writing production logs. Carrying out minor repairs and corrections to machinery and equipment and informing supervisors if machinery or equipment requires major adjustment, maintenance or repair.

fields.name: Paper Products Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines to manufacture paper packaging and other products from paper and fibreboard stock.
fields.tasks: Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of paper, cardboard, glue and other raw materials and in-process products into paper product making machines. Operating machines which cut, fold and glue paper to make envelopes and paper bags, or which form bags from other similar materials. Operating machines which glue paper to cardboard, cut it to the required length or cut and crease cardboard or paperboard to form box blanks. Operating pressing machines which form drinking cups or other containers from paper, paperboard or cardboard. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of machines and verify specified processing conditions. Analysing sample products, performing tests, recording data and writing production logs. Informing supervisors if machine requires adjustment, maintenance or repair.

fields.name: Paralegal
fields.description: Works within a legal environment, usually directly supporting one or more solicitors or legal executive by sharing caseload and providing legal advice and customer care within a law firm, a commercial company or in the public sector.
fields.tasks: Drafting legal documents and agreements such as official letters, court papers, contracts, etc. Reviewing contracts and clarifying contract terms. Conducting legal research. Preparing draft legal opinions. Supporting lawyers with meetings, committee processes and other organisational processes. Providing lawyers with technical support. Assisting with organising legal seminars. Managing communication with external legal service providers in consultation with Legal Advisors and Attorneys. Managing or assisting with legal documentation control.

fields.name: Paramedic
fields.description: A Paramedic is an emergency-health-care worker who responds to emergency calls, provides on-the-scene health-care treatment, and - if necessary -  administers emergency health care  while patients are being transported to a health facility.
fields.tasks: Resuscitating and stabilising the condition of critically ill or injured persons by applying emergency care prior to their transport to hospital. Surveying both the patient and the situation to decide upon suitable treatment, which is then applied. Providing basic life-support and the treatment of wounds and fractures. Making the site of the emergency safe and managing bystanders.

fields.name: Paramedical Practitioner
fields.description: Provides limited advisory, diagnostic, curative and preventive medical services to humans and applies advanced clinical procedures for treating and preventing diseases, injuries and other physical or mental impairments common to specific communities. In South Africa Paramedical Practitioners are known as “Clinical Associates” and their role is mid-way between that of a Resident Medical Doctor and a Primary Health Care Nurse. Clinical Associates are intended to strengthen healthcare teams that work in South African district hospitals and clinics where services are frequently known to be poor.
fields.tasks: Conducting physical examinations of patients and interviewing them and their families to determine their health status and recording patients' medical information. Performing basic or more routine medical and surgical procedures, including curative measures, especially for common diseases and disorders. Administering or ordering diagnostic tests, such as x-ray, electrocardiogram and other diagnostic tests; performing therapeutic procedures, such as injections, immunisations, suturing and wound care, and infection management. Assisting medical doctors with complex surgical procedures; monitoring patients' progress and response to treatment, and identifying signs and symptoms requiring referral to medical doctors. Advising patients and families on diet, exercise and other habits that aid prevention or treatment of disease and disorders. Advising patients and families on diet and other habits that aid prevention or treatment of disease or disorders.

fields.name: Park Ranger
fields.description: Controls state or national parks, scenic areas, historic sites, nature reserves, recreation areas and conservation reserves in accordance with authorised policies and priorities.
fields.tasks: Assessing an organization's compliance with government and internal environmental regulations and guidelines, identifying violations and determining appropriate remedial action. Developing conservation plans.

fields.name: Parking Inspector
fields.description: Patrols assigned areas and issues parking infringement notices to vehicles that are illegally parked.
fields.tasks: Patrolling an assigned area to enforce parking regulations.

fields.name: Parliamentary Council
fields.description: Drafts legislation for parliament.

fields.name: Parole Board Member
fields.description: Evaluates behaviour and formulates an opinion on whether an offender should be released from prison on parole after serving at least a minimum portion of their sentence as prescribed by the sentencing judge.
fields.tasks: Analysing criminal offenders' situations and presenting approaches to resolving problems.      Compiling case records or reports for courts and other legal proceedings.      Providing advice to prison governors and to probation and parole review boards that help determine whether, and under what conditions, an offender should be incarcerated, released from prison or undergo alternative correctional measures.      Working with offenders during and after sentence, to help them integrate into the community and to change attitudes and behaviour in order to reduce further offending.

fields.name: Parole or Probation Officer
fields.description: Supervises parolees who have been placed on probation by court order or released conditionally from corrective service institutions.
fields.tasks: Working with offenders during and after sentence, to help them to integrate into the community and to change attitudes and behaviour in order to reduce further offending. Providing advice to prison governors and to probation and parole review boards that help determine whether, and under what conditions, an offender should be incarcerated, released from prison or undergo alternative correctional measures. Compiling case records or reports for courts and other legal proceedings.

fields.name: Passenger Coach Driver
fields.description: Drives a coach to transport passengers long distances on scheduled intercity services over established routes.
fields.tasks: Driving a bus on specified routes or to specified destinations according to time schedules.   Assisting physically challenged passengers to board the bus.   Loading and unloading baggage into and out of baggage compartments.   Collecting tickets or cash fares from passengers.   Complying with traffic regulations to ensure that passengers have a smooth and safe ride.   Handling passenger emergencies and advising passengers to be seated and orderly while traveling on the bus.   Regulating the heating, lighting and ventilating systems for passenger comfort.   Performing routine vehicle maintenance such as regulating tyre pressure and adding petrol, oil and water.   Reporting delays or accidents and keeping a log book.   Maintaining the cleanliness of the bus.

fields.name: Passport Officer (Issuing)
fields.description: Examines applications for passports, determines eligibility of applications for issuing.
fields.tasks: Reviewing information on passport applications to define eligibility according to national law and governmental policy. Checking applicant fingerprints against police records. Examining supporting documents like affidavits and records to evaluate the relevance and authenticity of the documents. Querying applicants to obtain additional information or clarifying data. Approving applications for passports and related privileged services. Forwarding approved applications to designated officials.   Preparing summaries for cases not approved and indicating points of law. Answering questions by individuals concerning passport application related services.

fields.name: Pastry Cook
fields.description: Prepares and bakes buns, cakes, biscuits and pastry goods. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Weighing, mixing or kneading, moulding and shaping mixture before baking. Loading and unloading mixture into ovens using tins and trays. Operating and monitoring baking equipment. Glazing or decorating with icing or cream. Ordering baking supplies from wholesalers. Checking and maintaining the cleanliness of equipment and utensils to make sure health and safety regulations are met. Working with chocolate to create decorations.

fields.name: Patent Attorney
fields.description: Establishes the originality of an invention, idea or design, drafting detailed technical descriptions and definitions and legal documents to secure a patent. Protects 'intellectual property' rights through the protection of inventions, designs, ideas and
fields.tasks: Giving clients’ advice on all matters related to patents. Evaluating the technological aspects of new inventions for which clients seek to obtain patents. Preparing legal documents and patent specifications. Filing and processing patent applications with the Companies and Intellectual Property Registry Office (CIPRO) for clients both in South Africa and in overseas countries. Handling court procedures and negotiating settlements in matters that involve the infringement of patents.

fields.name: Pathologist
fields.description: Identifies the cause and processes of disease and illness by examining changes in bodily tissue and in blood and other body fluids, and conducts tests on samples of tissues, blood and body secretions.
fields.tasks: Studying the nature, cause, development and effects of disease. Providing and interpreting laboratory information essential to medical diagnosis and patient care.

fields.name: Patternmaker
fields.description: Constructs full size engineering models usually made out of timber, which are used in manufacturing to produce metal castings, copy models, vacuum form tooling and tooling for the automotive, aircraft or fibreglass industries. NOTE: This occupation is lis
fields.tasks: Constructing full size engineering models usually made out of timber. Reading and interpreting engineering drawings and specifications of tools, dies, prototypes or models. Preparing templates and sketches, and determining work processes. Visualizing and computing dimensions, sizes, shapes, and tolerances of assemblies, based on specifications. Setting up, operating and maintaining conventional and computer numerically controlled machine tools to cut, turn, mill, plane, drill, bore, grind or otherwise shape work piece to prescribed dimensions and finish. Making and repairing metal patterns for preparation of foundry moulds. Verifying dimensions, alignments, and clearances of finished parts for conformance to specifications, using precision measuring instruments and testing completed items for proper operation.

fields.name: Paving and Surfacing Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks associated in laying bituminous and other paving materials on roads, runways, parking areas and other surfaces to be paved.
fields.tasks: Sweeping paving bases prior to laying tar and other surfaces. Sprinkling and brushing hot and cold-mix tar over surfaces to be paved and repaired in order to bond tar toppings to bases. Operating tank-truck distributors and hoses to spray tar, road oils and emulsions onto graded surfaces prior to paving. Tripping tail-gate levers to discharge hot-mix tar into paving machines, and spreading stone chips, gravel and cold-mix tar onto road surfaces. Shovelling tar mix into areas inaccessible to paving machines, and compacting tar mix using rakes and hand tampers. Cutting and trimming damaged surfaces using jack-hammers, and softening the edges of areas to be repaired using blowtorches. Erecting and dismantling barricades around work areas. Loading and unloading equipment, and cleaning work sites. Directing traffic around road work sites if required.

fields.name: Paving Plant Operator
fields.description: Operates plant to spread and level hot bituminous paving materials and lay concrete on areas such as highways, streets and car parks.
fields.tasks: Setting up, inspecting, cleaning, maintaining, repairing and tearing down equipment using mechanics' hand tools. Reporting major equipment malfunctions to supervisors. Filling tanks, hoppers or machines with paving materials and coordinating truck dumping of material. Operate and guide machines and attachments that spread, smooth, level, or steel-reinforce stone, concrete or asphalt on road beds. Lighting burners or starting heating units of machines, and regulating screed temperatures and asphalt flow rates. Observing the distribution of paving material to adjust machine settings or material flow, and indicating low spots for workers to add material. Operating stamping machines or manually rolling surfaces to compact earth fills, foundation form, and finished road materials according to grade specifications. Controlling traffic where construction of roads is taking place.

fields.name: Pawnbrokers and Money-lenders
fields.description: Lends money against articles deposited as pledges, or against property or other security.
fields.tasks: Examining pawned (or pledged) articles such as jewellery, cameras, musical instruments, electronic equipment, furniture and other items to determine their condition and worth. Weighing gold or silver articles on coin scales or employing acid tests to determine carat content and purity. Using loupe for inspecting diamonds and other gems for flaws and colour. Assigning a pledge value to article based on knowledge of values or listing of wholesale prices. Rejecting articles in unsatisfactory condition or having no pledge value. Lending money to customer based on the worth of pledged articles. Issuing pledge tickets and keeping record of loans. Computing interest when pledges are redeemed or extended. Selling unredeemed pledged items.

fields.name: Payroll Clerk
fields.description: Prepares payroll and related records for employee salaries and statutory record keeping purposes.
fields.tasks: Calculating the earnings of employees by referring to their annual salary or timesheet to determine the hours worked. Verifying attendance, hours worked and pay adjustments, and post information on designated records. Inputting or calculating vacation or sick leave balances. Inputting or calculating and including deductions, such as pay-as-you-earn tax (PAYE) and unemployment insurance fund (UIF) payments. Managing the input of bonuses and commissions. Checking electronic data for errors. Initiating payroll at the appropriate times and balancing payroll runs. Handling complaints or questions regarding discrepancies.

fields.name: Payroll Manager
fields.description: Manages the payroll budget and directs the activities of payroll staff, monitors the payroll processing objectives including audits and legislative compliance.
fields.tasks: Assessing the financial situation of the enterprise or organization, preparing budgets and overseeing financial operations. Consulting with the chief executive and with managers of other departments or sections. Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures. Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources. Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff. Planning and directing daily operations. Planning, directing and coordinating the financial operations of an enterprise or organization. Representing the enterprise or organization in dealings with outside bodies.

fields.name: Pelt Grader
fields.description: Inspects and grades hides, pelts and leather, or garments and other manufactured fabric, fur and leather products.
fields.tasks: Inspecting pickled slats for cuts, tears, blemishes, and skin quality. Inspecting pelts, hides and skins to determine condition and grade. Sorting pelts into grades for pulling or drying. Stretching and smoothing dressed pelts. Stacking pelts in piles according to grade. Examining pelts to determine colour, texture, shading, density and size. Recording the quantity and grades pelts that were inspected. Dealing in leather, pelts and furs.

fields.name: Performing Arts Road Manager
fields.description: Administers a schedule of appearances of an artist, or group of artistists at a sequence of venues (a concert tour).
fields.tasks: Organising productions at different locations and coordinating communications between various personnel. Procuring equipment and keeping record of all stock. Devising schedules and ensuring that they are adhered to. Ensuring the welfare and productivity of personnel and maintaining a good working knowledge of all good working practice.

fields.name: Periodontist
fields.description: A Periodontist is a Dental Specialist who treats the supporting structures around the teeth - the gums, the roots and the bones around the oral area - and treats diseases of these structures.
fields.tasks: Assuring that the jaws, gums and other features of the oral cavity are suitable for implants. Checking whether other health factors are involved in periodontic disease, such as cardiovascular problems, respiratory disease and diabetes. Directly delivering antimicrobials to infected areas of the mouth. Surgically rebuilding gums and bones in the case of disease and for preparing the mouth for implants. Proving implants to replace missing teeth when conventional bridges or partial dentures are not appropriate.

fields.name: Personal Assistant
fields.description: Performs liaison, coordination and organisational tasks in support of managers and professionals.
fields.tasks: Acting as managers’ first point of contact with people from both inside and outside the organisation.    Devising and maintaining office systems, including data management and filing systems.   Making arrangements for travel, visas and accommodation.   Travelling with managers when necessary to take notes or dictation at meetings or to provide general assistance during presentations.   Screening phone calls, enquiries and requests, and liaising with clients, suppliers and other staff.   Meeting and greeting visitors at all levels of seniority.   Organising and maintaining diaries and making appointments.   Dealing with incoming e-mail, faxes and post, and often corresponding on behalf of managers.   Carrying out background research and producing documents, briefing papers, reports and presentations.

fields.name: Personal Care Assistant
fields.description: Provides routine personal care services to people in a range of health care facilities or in a person's home. Birth assistants who provide emotional support and general care and advice to women and families during pregnancy and labour
fields.tasks: Helping persons who are disabled or chronically ill with their activities of daily living. Assisting clients with personal, physical mobility and therapeutic care needs. Helping with daily activities, such as helping the individual bathe, eat, prepare meals and maintain their home. Providing clients with compassionate, considerate assistance with their hygiene, exercise, medication and communication. Providing rehabilitative assistance for individuals who have had surgery or been ill. Helping exercise the client by walking with him or her or helping with arm and leg stretches if the person is confined to bed or in a wheelchair. Accompanying clients to social events such as games or crafts sessions.

fields.name: Personnel / Human Resource Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates human resource and workplace relations activities within an organisation.
fields.tasks: Planning, directing and coordinating the personnel and industrial relations activities, policies and practices of an enterprise or organization. Planning and organizing negotiations and procedures for determination of wage structures and level and for consultation with workers on conditions of employment. Planning and organizing procedures for recruitment, training, promotion, transfer and dismissal of staff. Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff for the entire enterprise or organization. Ensuring compliance with standards and legislation relating to employees rights, health and safety, equal opportunity and related concerns. Overseeing the development and implementation of management information systems. Consulting with senior management and with managers of other departments.

fields.name: Pest Management Officer
fields.description: Identifies pests and monitors and controls threats and infestations by pests in industrial, commercial and domestic sites according to environmental protection, public health and food safety regulations and protocols.
fields.tasks: Inspecting for the presence of pests and vulnerabilities to infestation.    Identifying the core pests commonly found in domestic, industrial and commercial environments.   Applying pest or weed management techniques to kill and control pests or weeds in domestic, commercial and industrial areas, roadsides, private and public lands.   Calculating and providing numerical information to enhance operational efficiencies and cost effectiveness of pest control operations.    Selecting, recommending and motivating appropriate pest control procedures.    Implement pest control procedures.    Monitoring, measuring and recording the success of the control procedures.

fields.name: Pest or Weed Controller
fields.description: Applies pest or weed management techniques to kill and control pests or weeds in domestic, commercial and industrial areas, roadsides, private and public lands.
fields.tasks: Mixing chemicals according to instructions. Filling sprayer tanks with water and chemicals. Spraying or releasing chemical solutions or toxic gases over designated areas by operating and monitoring relevant equipment. Covering areas to specified depths with pesticides through applying knowledge of weather conditions, droplet sizes, elevation-to-distance ratios, and obstructions. Provide driving instructions to truck drivers to ensure complete coverage of designated areas, using hand and other signals. Cleaning and servicing machinery for spraying pests and weeds to ensure operating efficiency. Setting traps to kill pests and vermin, such as mice, termites, and cockroaches.

fields.name: Petroleum Engineer
fields.description: Plans and directs the engineering aspects of locating and extracting petroleum or natural gas from the earth.
fields.tasks: Performing laboratory studies of steps in manufacture of new products and testing proposed process in small scale operation such as a pilot plant. Determining the location and planning the extraction of coal, metallic ores, non-metallic minerals, and building materials, such as stone and gravel. Determining most suitable methods of efficient mining and extraction, types of machinery to be used, planning layout and directing construction of shafts and tunnels. Determining drilling site and devising methods of controlling the flow of water, oil or gas from wells. Planning and directing storage, initial treatment and transportation of water, oil or gas. Establishing safety standards and procedures and first-aid facilities, especially underground. Conducting research, developing methods of extracting metals from their ores and advising on their application. Investigating properties of metals and alloys, developing new alloys and advising on and supervising technical aspects of metal and alloy manufacture and processing. Maintaining technical liaison and consultancy with other relevant specialists such as geologists and geophysicists. Examining deposits or mines to evaluate profitability.

fields.name: Pharmaceutical Technician
fields.description: Fills and labels patients' prescriptions under the supervision of a pharmacist. May record details of, place orders for, take stock of, and store medications and medical supplies and deliver them to patients.
fields.tasks: Ordering, labelling, and counting stock of medications, chemicals, and supplies, and entering inventory data into records-keeping systems. Dispensing medicines and drugs to clients and giving written and oral instructions on their use, as prescribed by medical doctors, veterinarians or other health professionals. Receiving prescriptions or refill requests from health professionals and verifying that information is complete and accurate according to medical records keeping standards. Maintaining proper storage and security conditions for drugs. Filling and labelling containers with prescribed medications. Assisting clients by answering questions, locating items or referring them to a pharmacist for medication information. Cleaning and preparing equipment and containers used to prepare and dispense medicines and pharmaceutical compounds.

fields.name: Pharmacy Sales Assistant
fields.description: Sells pharmaceutical goods, toiletries and related goods in a retail pharmacy.
fields.tasks: Selling pharmaceutical goods, toiletries and related goods to customers of a retail pharmacy. Providing prospective customers with information about the characteristics and functions of the products and equipment for sale, and demonstrating its use or qualities. Obtaining and updating knowledge of market conditions and of employers, and competitors’ goods and services. Quoting prices, recording orders and arranging deliveries. Reporting customers’ reactions and requirements to employer, suppliers and manufacturers.

fields.name: Photographer
fields.description: Operates a still camera to take photographs.
fields.tasks: Studying the requirements of a particular assignment and deciding on the type of camera, film, lighting and background accessories to be used.   Taking photographs for advertising or other commercial, industrial or scientific purposes and to illustrate stories and articles in newspapers, magazines and other publications.   Taking portrait photographs of persons and groups of persons.      Determining picture composition, and making technical adjustments to equipment and photograph subject.      Operating scanners to transfer photographic images to computers.   Operating computers to manipulate photographic images.

fields.name: Photographer's Assistant
fields.description: Assists photographers in taking and developing photographs.
fields.tasks: Making a technical assessment of photographing sites in advance, checking for vehicle access, power and communications facilities. Organising transport, catering and accommodation and other resources needed for a photo shoot. Transporting equipment to sets, preparing sets, checking that all equipment is functioning properly, setting up lighting and accessories, taking meter readings. Loading film and handing freshly loaded backs to the photographer, logging the shot film, numbering the rolls, and keeping track of frames in a non-digital environment. Downloading compact flash cards, organising images as they’re shot, cataloguing and optimising digital files, scanning film and assisting with image manipulation and enhancement. Transmitting files and transporting film or prints to and from laboratories, printing photographs as required. Assisting with the general administration of a photography studio, keeping records of the film stock, exposures, lighting set-ups, as well as the names and details of art directors, models, stylists, animal handlers and other resources.

fields.name: Photographic Developer and Printer
fields.description: Edits and adjusts digital images, develops photographic film, and prints photographic images from digital media, negatives and positives using computer software, fully automatic equipment and by separate processes.
fields.tasks: Running automatic developing and print-making equipment and inspecting the images, films and prints. Adjusting settings to produce the required colour, brightness, contrast, number, size and type of prints.   Operating and monitoring equipment which makes photographic film and paper.   Operating automatic equipment (in retail establishments) to develop colour negatives, prints and slides.   Operating equipment to transfer film to video tape or other electronic media.   Operating, monitoring and testing photographic processing and printing equipment to maintain operational standards.   Performing photographic processing related tasks.   Preparing exposed film for different processing batches in dark rooms and dark chambers.

fields.name: Physical Asset Manager
fields.description: Manages physical assets throughout its lifecycle to ensure optimal return on investment.
fields.tasks: Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources. Keeping and maintaining a record of all the physical assets of the company. Alerting the company whenever the raw materials are running low; communicating with the suppliers and stock up on raw materials for the company. Implementing training on the effective use and maintenance of assets. Coordinating the processes of the various stages in the life cycle of physical assets. Managing the business' reserves - better known as assets. Providing information and support for the preparation of financial reports and budgets.

fields.name: Physical Asset Practitioner
fields.description: Administers asset management plans and operations to maintain and optimise assets throughout its lifecycle.
fields.tasks: Developing and maintaining an up-to-date record of all the physical assets of the company including equipment (computers and IT equipment, vehicles and machinery), production inventory, properties owned by the business, and cash. Conducting physical inventory, stock and asset counts and inspections, and conducting asset reconciliation and audit activities on a timely basis including licencing, warranties etc. Alerting the company whenever the raw materials inventory is running low; communicating with the suppliers and stocking up as required. Developing and managing maintenance schedules for all equipment in collaboration with maintenance personnel or service providers. Develop and update policies for asset tracking and identification. Performing all necessary administrative, legal, documentary and tax related tasks associated with asset transfer, sale, retirement, and disposal and recycling. Assisting in the preparation of financial, operational, maintenance or other technical reports that present calculations of net present asset value and life cycle costs. Assisting in the development and implementation of short- and long-term asset management and capital improvement programmes. Assisting the Physical Asset Manager in any other required tasks.

fields.name: Physical Science Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches physical science (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Physical Science Technician
fields.description: Performs tests and experiments, and provide technical support functions to assist with research, design, production and teaching in physical sciences.
fields.tasks: Preparing materials for experimentation such as freezing and slicing specimens and mixing chemicals. Collecting and testing earth and water samples, recording observations and analyzing data in support of geologists or geophysicists. Setting up, operating, and maintaining laboratory instruments and equipment, monitoring experiments, making observations, and calculating and recording results. Controlling the quality and quantity of laboratory supplies by testing samples and monitoring usage and preparing detailed estimates of quantities and costs of materials and labour required for projects, according to the specifications given. Carrying out routine laboratory tests and performing a variety of technical support functions to assist chemical and physical scientists in research, development, analysis and testing. Collecting samples and preparing materials and equipment for experiments, tests and analyses.

fields.name: Physicist
fields.description: Studies matter, space, time, energy, forces and fields and the interrelationship between these physical phenomena to further understanding of the laws governing the behaviour of the universe, and seeks to apply these laws to solve practical problems and d
fields.tasks: A physicist can perform a variety of tasks depending on the field of specialisation.  This may include the following: Working in space exploration. Developing theories as well as laws on the basis of observation plus experiments and applying these theories laws to problems in areas like nuclear energy, optics and aerospace technology. Developing  new medical treatments e.g. collaborate with other scientists in the design, development and testing of experimental, industrial, or medical equipment, instrumentation and procedures. Designing computer simulations to model physical data so that it can be better understood. Developing manufacturing, assembly, and fabrication processes of lasers, masers, infrared and other light-emitting light-sensitive devices. Conducting application evaluations to define commercial, industrial, scientific, medical, military or other uses for electro-optical devices. Investigating ways to generate power. Teaching and conducting research at institutions such as universities. Publishing news about new science developments e.g. report experimental results by writing papers for scientific journals or by presenting information at scientific conferences.

fields.name: Physiotherapist
fields.description: Assesses, treats and prevents disorders in human movement caused by injury or disease.
fields.tasks: Instructing patients and their families in procedures to be continued outside clinical settings. Recording information on patients' health status and responses to treatment in medical records-keeping systems, and sharing information with other health professionals as required to ensure continuing and comprehensive care. Developing and implementing programmes for screening and prevention of common physical ailments and disorders. Administering muscle, nerve, joint and functional ability tests to identify and assess physical problems of patients. Establishing treatment goals with patients and designing treatment programmes to reduce physical pain, strengthen muscles, improve cardiothoracic, cardiovascular and respiratory functions, restore joint mobility, and improve balance and coordination. Developing, implementing and monitoring programmes and treatments using the therapeutic properties of exercise, heat, cold, massage, manipulation, hydrotherapy, electrotherapy, ultraviolet and infra-red light and ultrasound in the treatment of patients.

fields.name: Picture Framer
fields.description: Cuts out and assembles mouldings to make picture frames, and frames paintings, photographs, needlework and other artwork.
fields.tasks: Conferring with customers to assess customer needs. Setting specifications for materials, dimensions, and finishes. Selecting materials based on strength, colour, texture, balance, weight, size and other characteristics. Setting-up and operating several types of woodworking machines. Cutting, fitting and joining materials, using hand tools, power tools, and/or machinery to make picture frames.

fields.name: Pipe Fitter
fields.description: Assembles, installs, repairs and maintains pipe systems, fittings and fixtures for water, gas, drainage, sewerage systems. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Cutting, threading, and hammering pipe to specifications, using tools such as saws, cutting torches, and pipe threaders and benders. Assembling and securing pipes, tubes, fittings, and related equipment, according to specifications, by welding, brazing, cementing, soldering, and threading joints. Attaching pipes to walls, structures and fixtures, such as radiators or tanks, using brackets, clamps, tools or welding equipment. Inspecting, examining, and testing installed systems and pipe lines, using pressure gauge, hydrostatic testing, observation, or other methods Measuring and marking pipes for cutting and threading. Laying out full scale drawings of pipe systems, support and related equipment, following blueprints.

fields.name: Plaster Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines to manufacture plaster.
fields.tasks: Reading work orders to determine production specifications or other relevant information. Weighing or measuring materials, ingredients or products, and inspecting these visually or with hands to ensure conformance to requirements. Dumping or pouring specified amounts of materials into machinery or equipment. Mixing or blending ingredients by starting machines and mixing for specified times. Compounding or processing ingredients according to formulas. Operating or minding machines that mix or blend a wide variety of plaster products to ensure safe and efficient operation. Collecting samples of materials or products for laboratory testing. Stopping mixing or blending machines when specified product qualities are obtained, and opening valves and starting pumps to transfer products for packaging. Checking and maintaining production records including information about quantities produced. Arranging and assisting with plant and machinery maintenance and repair.

fields.name: Plasterer
fields.description: Applies decorative and protective coverings of plaster, cement and similar materials to the interiors and exteriors of structures. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Applying one or more coats of plaster to interior walls and ceilings of buildings to produce finished surface. Measuring, marking and installing ornamental plaster panels, and casting and trimming ornamental plaster cornices. Applying protective and decorative covering of cement, plaster and similar materials to exterior building surfaces. Making and installing decorative plaster fixtures of fibrous plaster.

fields.name: Plastic Cablemaking Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates extruding machines to encase wire, cord, cable and optic fibre in rubber and plastic.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines which knead and blend compounds to obtain plastic materials. Operating and monitoring machines which shape plastic materials by moulding, extrusion, blowing, cutting and other means. Operating and monitoring machines which laminate plastics and plastic impregnated materials or produce fibreglass. Encasing uncoated wire, cord, cable and optic fibre in plastic. Recycling waste plastic materials.

fields.name: Plastic Compounding and Reclamation Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates mixing and grinding machines to prepare plastic powders, liquid blends and recycle waste plastic materials from factory operations.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines which knead and blend compounds to obtain plastic materials. Operating and monitoring machines which shape plastic materials by moulding, extrusion, blowing, cutting and other means. Recycling waste plastic materials.

fields.name: Plastics Fabricator or Welder
fields.description: Operates machines to measure, cut, shape, fit and assemble plastics materials to produce plastic products.
fields.tasks: Examining outputs for defects and conformity to specifications. Recycling waste plastic materials. Operating and monitoring machines which laminate plastics and plastic impregnated materials or produce fibreglass. Operating and monitoring machines which shape plastic materials by moulding, extrusion, blowing, cutting and other means. Operating and monitoring machines which knead and blend compounds to obtain plastic materials.

fields.name: Plastics Manufacturing Machine Minder
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and runs and monitors plastics manufacturing machinery and equipment to produce plastics products through moulding or extrusion processes.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines which knead and blend compounds to obtain plastic materials. Operating and monitoring machines which shape plastic materials by moulding, extrusion, blowing, cutting and other means. Operating and monitoring machines which laminate plastics and plastic impregnated materials or produce fibreglass.

fields.name: Plastics Production Machine Operator (General)
fields.description: Operates extruding, injection moulding and blow moulding machines to produce finished plastic products.
fields.tasks: Examining outputs for defects and conformity to specifications. Recycling waste plastic materials. Operating and monitoring machines which laminate plastics and plastic impregnated materials or produce fibreglass. Operating and monitoring machines which shape plastic materials by moulding, extrusion, blowing, cutting and other means. Operating and monitoring machines which knead and blend compounds to obtain plastic materials.

fields.name: Plastics, Composites and Rubber Factory Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in manufacturing plastic, fibreglass and rubber goods.
fields.tasks: Conveying goods, material, and equipment. Loading and unloading vehicles, trucks and trolleys. Clearing machine blockages, cleaning machinery, equipment and tools. Carrying out manual sorting of products or components.

fields.name: Plumber
fields.description: Installs and repairs water, drainage and sewerage pipes and systems.
fields.tasks: Measuring, cutting, threading, bending, jointing, assembling, installing, maintaining and repairing pipes, fittings and fixtures of drainage, heating, water supply and sewerage systems. Installing gas appliances, dishwashers and water heaters, sinks and toilets using hand and power tools. Laying clay, concrete or cast-iron pipes in ditches to form sewers, drains or water mains, or for other purposes. Inspecting, examining and testing installed systems and pipes, using pressure gauge, hydrostatic testing, observation or other methods.

fields.name: Plumber's Assistant
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in fabricating, laying, installing and maintaining pipes, fixtures, water meters and regulators.
fields.tasks: Locating, repairing or removing leaking or broken pipes. Immersing pipes in chemical solutions to remove dirt, oil and scale. Mounting brackets, hangers and fitters on walls and ceilings to hold pipes, and setting sleeves or inserts in place to provide support for pipes. Cutting or drilling holes in walls or floors to accommodate the passage of pipes.   Measuring, cutting, threading and assembling new pipes, and placing the assembled pipes in place. Filling pipes with sand or resin to prevent distortion, and holding pipes during bending and installation.   Assisting in fitting valves, couplings or assemblies to tanks, pumps or other systems, using hand tools. Cleaning and renewing steam traps.   Excavating and grading ditches, and laying and joining pipes for water and sewer services.

fields.name: Plumbing Inspector
fields.description: Inspects plumbing work to ensure compliance with relevant standards and regulations. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Monitoring of plumbing work during construction for general safety or conformance to specifications and codes. Inspecting plumbing work after construction to ensure that installation was performed properly. Using a pressure gauge, hydrostatic testing, observation or other methods to examine installed systems or pipe lines. Measuring dimensions and verifying level, alignment, or elevation of fixtures to ensure compliance to building plans and codes. Testing pipe lines as required by local plumbing regulations.

fields.name: Plywood and Veneer Maker and Repairer
fields.description: Controlling lathes and slicing machines to produce veneers, and laminating veneer using glue.
fields.tasks: Controlling lathes and slicing machines to produce veneers. Laminating veneers using glue. Assisting in maintaining processing equipment and machines as required. Cleaning, lubricating and adjusting machines and equipment. Monitoring equipment operation, gauges, and panel lights in order to detect deviations from standards and to ensure that processes are operating according to specifications. Transporting materials and products to and from work areas, manually or using carts, hand trucks, or hoists. Completing and maintaining production reports.

fields.name: Podiatrist
fields.description: Prevents, diagnoses and treats disorder of the feet.
fields.tasks: Assessing and diagnosing functional limitations, disorders and disabilities of the feet and lower limbs caused by illness, disease, injury or physical impairment.   Treating deformities, injuries and wounds to the feet and lower limbs through palliative means to enhance the patient’s comfort.   Performing minor surgical procedures on the feet and ankles such as the removal of corns, callosities and plantar warts.   Providing pain relief from foot deformities by prescribing corrective footwear to re-align foot or leg imbalances.   Using appliances and prescribing medicines to treat foot disorders and disabilities.   Advising patients on foot care to manage foot ailments.

fields.name: Police Officer (Non-commissioned)
fields.description: Maintains public order, and enforces laws by investigating crimes, patrolling public areas and arresting offenders.
fields.tasks: Directing traffic and assuming authority in the event of accidents.      Identifying, pursuing and arresting suspects and perpetrators of criminal acts.      Patrolling a specific area to maintain public order, respond to emergencies, protect people and property and enforce laws and regulations.      Providing emergency assistance to victims of accidents, crimes and natural disasters.

fields.name: Police Video Unit Manager and Producer
fields.description: Creates films, television programs or video productions by filming, adding sound and editing in digital or analogue format for police services.
fields.tasks: Developing public relations and other promotional material for the SAPS. Creating material for POL-TV, an internal SAPS TV channel broadcasting a few hours a week. Creating training videos for the police’s Training Division. Filming crime scenes for investigative purposes. Filming demonstrations, marches and other public events that may potentially lead to violence.

fields.name: Policy Analyst
fields.description: Collects and analyses information and data to produce intelligence for public or private sector organisations to support planning, operations and human resource functions.
fields.tasks: Developing advising and evaluating policies that guide the design, implementation and modification of government and commercial operations. Defining problems, gathering evidence, identifying the causes of problems and developing solutions and or recommendations, benefits and costs.

fields.name: Policy and Planning Manager
fields.description: Plans, develops, organises, directs, controls and coordinates policy advice and strategic planning within organisations.
fields.tasks: Coordinating the implementation of policies and practices.      Developing, directing, administering and participating in policy research and analysis.      Developing, implementing and monitoring strategic plans, programs, policies, processes, systems and procedures to achieve goals, objectives and work standards.      Establishing activity measures and measurements of accountability.      Leading and managing the activities of policy development and strategic planning staff.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Planning and directing daily operations.      Representing the enterprise or organization in negotiations, and at conventions, seminars, public hearings and forums.

fields.name: Political Scientist
fields.description: Studies the nature of states, the functions performed by governments, voter behaviour, political parties, political culture, political economy, and public opinion.
fields.tasks: Conducting research in past and present theory and practice of social systems, institution, behaviour or events.      Consulting and comparing primary sources, such as original or contemporary records of past events, and secondary sources such as archaeological or anthropological findings.      Developing theories, models and methods to interpret and describe the nature of human experience and historical and political events and behaviour.      Extracting relevant material, checking its authenticity, and researching into and describing the history of a particular period, country or region, or a particular facet for example economic, social or political of its history.      Observing contemporary political institutions and opinions, collecting data on them from various sources, including interviews with government and political party officials and other relevant persons.      Preparing scholarly papers and reports.      Presenting findings and conclusions for publication or use by government, political parties or other organisations and interested persons.      Researching, mostly by reasoning, into the general causes, principles and meanings of the world, human actions, experience and existence, and interpreting and developing philosophical concepts and theories.

fields.name: Post Office Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of a post office.
fields.tasks: Controlling selection, training and supervision of staff.      Determining product mix, stock levels and service standards.      Ensuring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations.      Formulating and implementing purchasing and marketing policies, and setting prices.      Maintaining records of stock levels and financial transactions.      Promoting and advertising the establishment’s goods and services.      Undertaking budgeting for the establishment.

fields.name: Postal Delivery Officer
fields.description: Delivers mail on foot, by bicycle or motorised transport over allocated delivery rounds.
fields.tasks: Sorting mail for delivery and arranging it in delivery sequence. Bundling mail in preparation for delivering or transporting it to relay boxes. Delivering mail to residences and business establishments along specified routes by walking and/or driving. Leaving notices telling clients where to collect registered mail or mail that could not be delivered. Returning incorrectly addressed mail to the mail depot. Reporting any unusual circumstances concerning mail delivery including the condition of street letter boxes. Meeting schedules for collecting and returning mail. Maintaining accurate records of deliveries. Travelling to post offices depots to collect mail for routes.

fields.name: Postal Frontline Service Worker
fields.description: Renders frontline services to clients / customers at a retail postal services outlet.
fields.tasks: Rendering frontline services to clients and customers at post offices and postal services outlets. Selling stamps and assisting customers with the correct value of stamps for letters and parcels. Paying out pensions and benefits. Assisting customers with the banking and savings services that are available through Postbank. Accepting account payments to registered third parties. Renewing vehicle registrations.

fields.name: Potter or Ceramic
fields.description: Conceives and creates functional or artistic articles by moulding clay, glass and other fusible materials using hand-building and wheel techniques. This occupation requires high levels of creative talent or personal commitment and interest as well as, or
fields.tasks: Conceiving designs for functional and artistic pottery and ceramic articles.   Selecting the appropriate method and materials for specific pottery and ceramic articles.      Using techniques that involve the pottery wheel or the hands only to create, mould and make pottery and ceramic articles.   Placing and packing articles into kilns to ‘fire’ and harden them.   Glazing and decorating pottery and ceramic articles.

fields.name: Potter or Ceramic Artist
fields.description: Conceives and creates functional or artistic articles by moulding clay, glass and other fusible materials using hand-building and wheel techniques. This occupation requires high levels of creative talent or personal commitment and interest as well as, or
fields.tasks: Making articles of pottery and porcelain using hand-, mould- and wheel techniques. Reading technical drawings to determine customer requirements. Forming abrasive wheels by moulding and pressing an abrasive mixture by hand or by machine. Adjusting wheel speeds according to the feel of the clay and the stage of the process. Operating jigger machines to form ceramic ware such as bowls, cups, plates and saucers. Making clay or plaster of paris moulds, and adjusting and setting the controls of pug mills that mix, extrude, cut and deposits clay in or over moulds as specified. Smoothing surfaces of finished pieces using rubber scrapers and wet sponges. Verifying the accuracy of shapes and sizes of objects, using callipers and templates, and examining finished articles for defects. Firing finished articles to harden them. Painting and glazing articles as necessary.

fields.name: Poultry Farmer
fields.description: Plans, organises and performs farming operations to breed and raise poultry.
fields.tasks: Monitoring and examining poultry to detect illness, injury, or disease, and to check physical condition, such as rate of weight gain, and removing weak, ill and dead poultry from flock.   Mixing feed and feed additives and filling feed and water containers.   Vaccinating poultry via drinking water, injection, or dusting of air.   Collecting and storing eggs and packaging them for sale delivery to market.   Determining sex of chicks and facilitating breeding, artificial insemination, and hatching of eggs.   Slaughtering and dressing poultry for sale or delivery to market.   Arranging the sale, purchase and transportation stock, produce and supplies.   Training and supervising workers in poultry production procedures, maintenance duties, and health and safety precautions, and hiring and discharging workers and contractors.

fields.name: Poultry Slaughterer
fields.description: Stuns and kills, dresses, trims, cuts into portions, bones, fillets, weighs, grades and packages poultry.
fields.tasks: Stunning and killing poultry. De-feathering poultry. Cutting and trimming poultry into portions. Grading and weighing poultry. Processing poultry. Packaging poultry.

fields.name: Poultry, Ratites or Avian Farm Worker / Assistant
fields.description: Performs routine tasks on a poultry farm such as collecting eggs and placing them in incubators, providing poultry with feed and water, and disinfecting hatcheries to prevent disease.
fields.tasks: Cleaning and filling feeders and water containers. Monitoring feed, water, illumination and ventilation systems. Maintaining chicken sheds and removing waste products. Collecting eggs from trap nests and recording the number of eggs laid by each hen. Grading and packing eggs in cases or cartons. Selecting, weighing and crating poultry for slaughter. Inspecting poultry for diseases, removing weak, ill and dead poultry from the flock. Rotating eggs in incubators, and checking eggs for progress in hatching. Removing day-old chicks from shipping cartons, sexing them, trimming their beaks and placing them in brooder houses. Fumigating, cleaning and sanitisation of poultry houses, hatchery incubators, hatchers and associated equipment.

fields.name: Power Generation Production/Operations Manager
fields.description: Plans, directs and coordinates the work activities and resources of power generation and biofuel plants.
fields.tasks: Consulting with and informing other managers about production matters. Controlling the operation of production plant and quality procedures through planning of maintenance, designation of operating hours and supply of parts and tools. Controlling the preparation of production records and reports. Determining, implementing and monitoring production strategies, policies and plans. Establishing and managing budgets, monitoring production output and costs, and adjusting processes and resources to minimize costs Identifying business opportunities and determining products to be manufactured. Overseeing the acquisition and installation of new plant and equipment.

fields.name: Practice Manager
fields.description: Organises and manages the functions and resources of professional practices such as administrative systems and office personnel.
fields.tasks: Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation, expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Coordinating cooperation with other service provision agencies in the same or related fields.      Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and standards for staff.      Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of professional, technical, clerical, service, maintenance, and other personnel.      Managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Monitoring and evaluating resources devoted to the provision of services.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Planning, directing and coordinating the provision of services.      Providing overall direction and management for a professional practice.

fields.name: Precision Instrument Maker and Repairer
fields.description: Assembles, calibrates, installs and overhauls mechanical precision instruments and equipment. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Testing, calibrating, and adjusting electronic, mercurial, aneroid, and other types of meteorological instruments for compliance with printed specifications and schematic diagrams, using voltmeters, oscilloscopes, tube testers, and other test instruments. Adjusting and repairing masts, supporting structures, clearance lights, control panels, control cabling and wiring, and other electrical and mechanical devices. Repairing and setting optical instruments such as microscopes, telescopes, theodolities, sextants. Checking whether assembled units conform to specifications and ensuring stipulated performance and sensitivity by standard tests. Calibrating precision instruments using standard weights and measures, jigs and fixtures, and hand tools to adjust and align parts and small balancing weights. Testing circuits in electronic timepieces. Programming of computers or electronic instruments, such as numerically controlled machine tools. Maintaining industrial machines, applying knowledge of mechanics, shop mathematics, metal properties, layout, and machining procedures.

fields.name: Prehistorian
fields.description: Studies the history of mankind prior to recorded history.
fields.tasks: Conducting research in past and present theory and practice of social systems, institution, behaviour or events.      Consulting and comparing primary sources, such as original or contemporary records of past events, and secondary sources such as archaeological or anthropological findings.      Developing theories, models and methods to interpret and describe the nature of human experience and historical events and behaviour.      Extracting relevant material, checking its authenticity, and researching into and describing the history of a particular period, country or region, or a particular facet of its history. Researching, mostly by reasoning, into the general causes, principles and meanings of the world, human actions, experience and existence, and interpreting and developing philosophical concepts and theories.         Observing contemporary political institutions and opinions, collecting data on them from various sources, including interviews with government and political party officials and other relevant persons.      Preparing scholarly papers and reports.      Presenting findings and conclusions for publication or use by and interested persons.

fields.name: Pre-press Technical Worker
fields.description: Interrogates and pre-fights pre-press media, creates print layouts, impositions and prepares contract proofs and sets up, operates and maintains machinery and equipment to image and process print ready forms.
fields.tasks: Transforming text and pictures into finished pages and producing printing plates of these pages. Creating the typesetting and page layout by making use of desktop publishing. Using computer applications to generate images, text, layouts and impositions for print and other visual media displays. Operating plate making equipment to reproduce images from film to printing plates, digital output devices and presses. Operating computer screen-based equipment for scanning, colour separation, colour correction, masking, creative design, combining, imposing, retouching, and other processes used to transfer copy to film and produce film for plate, and digital output. Carrying out digital and chemical proofing from digital systems, and negative and positive films. Evaluating printed proofs, checking and correcting them for quality. Preparing and exposing carbon tissue for laying on cylinders by transfer method, and developing images.

fields.name: Preschool Aide
fields.description: Provides care and supervision for children at preschool centres under the direction of preschool teachers.
fields.tasks: Planning and organizing individual and group activities designed to facilitate the development of children's motor skills, cooperative and social skills, confidence and understanding. Promoting language development through story-telling, role-play, songs, rhymes and informal conversations and discussions. Leading children in activities that, provide opportunities for creative expression through the media of art, dramatic play, music and physical fitness. Observing children in order to evaluate progress and to detect signs of developmental, emotional or health related problems with parents. Observing and assessing nutritional health, welfare and safety needs of students and identifying factors which may impede students' progress. Supervising children's activities to ensure safety and resolve conflicts. Guiding and assisting children in the development of proper eating, dressing and toilet habits. Discussing progress or problems of children with parents and other staff members and identifying appropriate actions and referrals to other services. Establishing and maintaining collaborative relationships with other service providers working with young children.

fields.name: Pressing Machine Operator (Laundry)
fields.description: Irons or presses garments and other fabrics such as delicate and formal wear in a commercial laundry or private residence.
fields.tasks: Straightening, smoothing or shaping materials to prepare them for pressing. Selecting appropriate pressing machines, based on garment properties such as heat tolerance. Activating and adjusting machine controls to regulate temperature and pressure of rollers, ironing shoes or plates according to specifications. Operating steam, hydraulic or other pressing machines to remove wrinkles from garments. Pushing and pulling irons over surfaces of articles to smooth or shape them. Finishing pleated garments by determining sizes of pleats from evidence of old pleats or from work orders, using machine presses or hand irons. Brushing materials made of suede, leather or felt. Blocking or shaping knitted garments after cleaning. Hanging, folding, packaging and tagging finished articles for delivery to customers.

fields.name: Pressure Equipment Inspector
fields.description: Conducts integrity assessments and tests of in-service pressure equipment and or certify new fabrication, modifications and repairs of pressure equipment in accordance with the applicable national legislation
fields.tasks: Conducting tests of mechanical systems, collecting and analysing data and writing reports. Developing and monitoring the implementation of safety standards and procedures. Ensuring that mechanical engineering designs and finished work are within specifications, regulations and contract provisions. Monitoring technical aspects of manufacture, utilisation, maintenance and repair of pressure vessel equipment, installations, facilities and components to ensure satisfactory performance and compliance with specifications and regulations.

fields.name: Pressure Welder
fields.description: Assembles, welds and repairs pressure vessels and pipes to pressure test standards.
fields.tasks: Studying blueprints, drawings and specifications to determine job requirements. Selecting, cleaning and preparing metal stock. Cutting marked-out metal sections and shapes using hand tools, flame cutting torches and metal cutting machines. Shaping and bending metal sections and pipes using hand and machine tools, and by heating and hammering. Aligning parts to be joined using hand tools and measuring instruments. Joining metal sections using various welding techniques, bolting and riveting. Examining welds for width of bead, penetration and precision. Finishing products by cleaning, polishing, filing and bathing in acidic solutions. Cleaning and smoothing welds by filing, chiselling and grinding.

fields.name: Price Inspector
fields.description: Conducts price inspections and verifies and monitors prices to ensure that displayed prices reflect the correct value of goods or commidities for sale.
fields.tasks: Employing pricing strategies that meet the business’s standards, policies and procedures.   Ensuring that salespeople and marketing employees comply with pricing changes while ensuring that markdowns and store signage changes are accurately applied efficiently and timely.   Monitoring store pricing systems, advertising media and registers for pricing accuracy and helping their stores drive sales, increase profits, meet productivity standards and remain competitive with similar retailers.   Moving merchandise during store promotions to drive sales, directing employees to apply markdowns or make signage changes, executing marketing changes, ensuring that the store is cleaned daily and preventing loss of merchandise.   Communicating frequently with store managers and other departmental leaders to acknowledge successes and solve problems.

fields.name: Primary Health Organisation Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates a primary health organisation which provides a broad range of out-of-hospital health services.
fields.tasks: Advising government bodies about measures to improve health and welfare services and facilities.      Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation and expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and performance standards for medical, nursing, technical and administrative staff.      Directing or conducting recruitment, hiring and training of personnel.      Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of medical, nursing, technical, clerical, service, maintenance, and other personnel.       Liaising with other health and welfare service providers, boards and funding bodies to coordinate the provision of services.      Monitoring the use of diagnostic services, in-patient beds, facilities, and staff to ensure effective use of resources and assessing the need for additional staff, equipment, and services.      Providing overall direction and management for the service, facility, organisation or centre.      Representing the organisation in negotiations, and at conventions, seminars, public hearings and forums.

fields.name: Print Journalist
fields.description: Collects and analyses facts about newsworthy events by interview, investigation and observation and writes stories for newspapers, magazines or journals.
