fields.tasks: Collecting local, national and international news through interviews, investigation and observation, attending public events, seeking out records, reviewing written work, attending film and stage performances.      Collecting, reporting and commenting on news and current affairs for publication in newspapers and periodicals, or for broadcasting by the media.      Interviewing politicians and other public figures at press conferences and on other occasions, including individual interviews recorded for the media.      Liaising with production staff.      Receiving, analysing and verifying news for accuracy.      Researching and reporting on developments in specialised fields such as medicine, science and technology.      Selecting material for publication, checking style, grammar, accuracy and legality of content and arranging for any necessary revisions.      Selecting, assembling and preparing publicity material about business or other organisations for issue through the media.      Writing critical reviews of literary, musical and other artistic works based on knowledge, judgement and experience for the media.

fields.name: Printing and Publishing Sales Representative
fields.description: Represents companies in selling printing and publishing equipment and supplies related products.
fields.tasks: Acquiring and updating knowledge of employers’ and competitors’ goods and services.      Arranging delivery of goods, installation of equipment and the provision of services.      Assessing clients' needs and resources and recommending appropriate goods or services.      Compiling lists of prospective client businesses using directories and other sources.      Consulting with clients after sale to ensure satisfaction resolve any problems and provide ongoing support.      Developing reports and proposals as part of sales presentation to demonstrate goods or services.      Monitoring customers’ changing needs and reporting these developments to sales management.      Quoting and negotiating prices and credit terms. Preparing and administering sales contracts.

fields.name: Printing Machinist
fields.description: Sets up and operates printing machines and presses to print artwork and text on a variety of substrates including paper, textiles, vinyl, metal, plastics and leather. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Applying ink to a raised surface and transferring directly to paper through pressure in the production of self-adhesive stickers. Printing from a plate with a flat surface (planographic) to produce newspapers, magazines, cardboard packaging and books. Using a raised surface on a flexible rubber or photopolymer plate in producing flexible packaging such as bread bags and confectionary wrappers. Using a recessed cylinder to remove excess ink from the paper's surface, producing an engraved design effect (intaglio) in gravure printing, mainly used for long-run packaging work designed for food and other consumables. Preparing plates, blankets and impression cylinders on small offset lithographic printing presses. Monitoring machine operations and quality of printing. Maintaining, adjusting, repairing and cleaning machines.

fields.name: Printing Plate Maker
fields.description: Transfers a prepared image either in digital or analogue format onto a printing plate. Alternate Occupation Names Computer to Plate Operator Flexographic Plate Maker Lithographic Plate Maker Screen Maker Screen Printing Plate Mounter Stereo Typer

fields.name: Prison Officer
fields.description: Supervises and controls the activities of inmates in a prison or other correctional institution.
fields.tasks: Assisting with the implementation of prisoner rehabilitation programs.      Escorting prisoners in transit and during temporary leaves.      Making periodic inspection tours of prison cells and inspecting and maintaining the security of locks, windows, doors and gates.      Observing the conduct and behaviour of prisoners to prevent disturbances and escapes.      Patrolling prison areas to prevent prisoner escapes.      Searching arriving prisoners, putting their valuables in safekeeping, escorting prisoners to cells and locking them in.     Supervising prisoners at work, and during meals or recreation periods.

fields.name: Private Investigator
fields.description: Conducts investigations for clients and prepares evidence for court proceedings.
fields.tasks: Conducting investigations on behalf of clients. Investigating possible cases of theft of goods, money or information from business establishments. Investigating possible cases of unlawful behaviour by an establishment’s customers or employees. Verifying people's backgrounds and assets for employment and other purposes. Finding missing persons and property. Investigating computer crimes, frauds, embezzlements, divorces, etc. Taking statements from clients, victims and witnesses, conducting interviews, and doing surveillance and undercover work as necessary. Determining if there is sufficient factual evidence to support or defeat each element of a cause of action or a case at trial (such as workmen's compensation, insurance fraud, medical malpractice, criminal or civil cases, etc.). Testifying at trials when necessary.

fields.name: Process Engraver
fields.description: Prepares and produces metal blocks for subsequent printing and finishing operations.
fields.tasks: Preparing all types of illustrations that cannot be typeset. Operating process cameras and producing negatives of photographs and other artwork. Developing negatives to make light impressions (exposures) on metal plates that are highly sensitive to light. Immersing plate in a nitric acid bath to etch away the unexposed sections of the plate. Ruling print according to size and mounting it onto wood. Mounting and composing blocks in a page form. Finishing off of product.

fields.name: Product Assembler
fields.description: Assembles, according to strictly laid down procedures various products that do not include electronic, electrical, or mechanical components.
fields.tasks: Reviewing work orders, specifications, diagrams and drawings to determine materials needed and assembly instructions. Assembling component parts and positioning, aligning and fastening units to assemblies, sub-assemblies, or frames using hand or power tools, soldering and micro-welding equipment. Inspecting and testing components and completed assemblies. Recording production and operational data on specified forms. Rejecting faulty products.

fields.name: Production / Operations Manager (Forestry)
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs and controls the production activities of a forestry operation including physical and human resources.
fields.tasks: Monitoring agricultural and forestry market activity and planning production to meet contract requirements and market demand. Overseeing the selection, training and performance of forestry workers and contractors. Analysing soil to determine types and quantities of fertilizer required for maximum production. Directing and coordinating activities such as planting, irrigation, chemical application, harvesting, and grading. Inspecting plantations and fields to determine maturity dates of crops, or to estimate potential crop damage from weather. Establishing and managing budgets, monitoring production output and costs, recording information and preparing financial and operational reports.

fields.name: Production / Operations Manager (Manufacturing)
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs and controls the manufacturing activities of an organisation including physical and human resources. Measures performance, quality and implements continuous improvement strategies.
fields.tasks: Consulting with and informing other managers about production matters.      Controlling the operation of production plant and quality procedures through planning of maintenance, designation of operating hours and supply of parts and tools.      Controlling the preparation of production records and reports.      Coordinating the implementation of occupational health and safety requirements.      Determining, implementing and monitoring production strategies, policies and plans.      Establishing and managing budgets, monitoring production output and costs, and adjusting processes and resources to minimize costs.      Identifying business opportunities and determining products to be manufactured.      Overseeing the acquisition and installation of new plant and equipment.      Overseeing the provision of quotes for the manufacture of specialised goods and establishing contracts with customers and suppliers.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.

fields.name: Production / Operations Manager (Mining)
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs and controls the production activities of a mining operation including physical and human resources.
fields.tasks: Conferring with other managers to set production quotas, plan extraction sites and develop policies for the removal of raw materials. Controlling the operation of plant and quality procedures through planning of maintenance, designation of operating hours and supply of equipment. Controlling the preparation of production records and reports. Establishing and managing budgets, monitoring production output and costs, and adjusting processes and resources to minimize costs. Evaluating efficiency of production sites to determine adequacy of personnel, equipment and technologies used, and make changes to work schedule or equipment when necessary. Overseeing the acquisition and installation of new plant and equipment. Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff. Planning details of production activities in terms of output quality and quantity, cost, time available and labour requirements.

fields.name: Production / Operations Supervisor (Forestry)
fields.description: Plans, organises, controls, leads, coordinates and reviews forestry activities of an organisation including physical and human resources.
fields.tasks: Monitoring agricultural and forestry market activity and planning production to meet contract requirements and market demand. Overseeing the selection, training and performance of forestry workers and contractors. Analysing soil to determine types and quantities of fertilizer required for maximum production. Directing and coordinating activities such as planting, irrigation, chemical application, harvesting, and grading. Inspecting plantations and fields to determine maturity dates of crops, or to estimate potential crop damage from weather. Establishing and managing budgets, monitoring production output and costs, recording information and preparing financial and operational reports.

fields.name: Production / Operations Supervisor (Manufacturing)
fields.description: Plans, organises, controls, leads, coordinates and reviews manufacturing activities of an organisation including physical and human resources.
fields.tasks: Planning production to meet contract requirements and market demand. Overseeing the selection, training and performance of forestry workers and contractors. Analysing soil to determine types and quantities of fertilizer required for maximum production. Directing and coordinating activities such as planting, irrigation, chemical application, harvesting, and grading. Inspecting plantations and fields to determine maturity dates of crops, or to estimate potential crop damage from weather. Monitoring production output and costs, recording information and preparing financial and operational reports.

fields.name: Production / Operations Supervisor (Mining)
fields.description: Plans, organises, controls, leads, coordinates and reviews mining operations including physical and human resources.
fields.tasks: Directly supervising and coordinating the activities of workers who extract minerals and other natural deposits from the earth, operate underground conveyances or heavy equipment in surface mines and quarries. Establishing methods to meet work schedules and recommending measures to mining managers to improve productivity. Working with managerial and technical personnel, other departments and contractors to resolve operational problems and coordinate activities. Providing reports and other information to mining managers about all aspects of mining or quarrying operations. Determining staffing and material needs for the mine or quarry.

fields.name: Production Assistant (Film, Television or Radio)
fields.description: Provides technical, administrative and organisational support to producers or directors for film, television, radio or stage productions.
fields.tasks: Undertaking a wide range of tasks before, during and after filming. Organising hiring of studio facilities and equipment necessary for production. Booking hotels and making travel arrangements for crew and actors. Attending production meetings. Copying and distributing scripts. Creating and distributing call sheets and daily reports. Obtaining permission to use copyrighted music or film clips.  Assisting with tracking accounts and expenses. Timing the show in the studio gallery for TV productions. Cueing pre-recorded material when necessary. Keeping records logging shots taken.

fields.name: Production Coordinator
fields.description: Records and coordinates the flow of work and materials between departments or sub-sections, examines orders for goods and prepares production schedules for production units.
fields.tasks: Preparing or assisting in the preparation of production operation schedules on the basis of customers' orders and the production capacity and performance. Computing the quantities, qualities and types of materials required by production programmes. Preparing production requirements schedules and ensuring that materials are available when needed. Recording and coordinating the flow of work and materials between departments. Verifying stocks, arranging deliveries and investigating delays. Keeping relevant records.

fields.name: Production Engineer
fields.description: Devises methods to improve extraction and production and determines the need for new or modified tool designs.
fields.tasks: Planning and coordinating production engineering processes to produce high quality products. Developing process improvements to effectively utilise equipment and materials to maximise production. Developing operational strategies to achieve production and financial objectives. Identifying unsafe operations and practices and establishing safety procedures and environmental regulations for employees. Providing engineering support for production and maintenance activities to ensure maximum production. Evaluating production activities by analysing problems and making recommendations for improvements. Implementing  cost reduction initiatives while maintaining high quality standards. Developing operating instructions and equipment specifications for production activities. Providing training and guidance to emplyees to accomplish production goals. Keeping up on product specifications, engineering technology and production processes. Developing best practices to improve production capacity, quality and reliability. Monitoring expenses and profitability.

fields.name: Production Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Analyses and modifies new and existing production technologies and applies them in the testing and implementation of production processes..
fields.tasks: Interpreting engineering drawings, sketches, or diagrams. Planning the flow of work or materials to maximise efficiency. Developing or implementing programmes to address problems related to production, materials, safety or quality. Modifying equipment or processes to improve resource or cost efficiency. Overseeing production processes. Analysing, estimating and reporting production costs. Compiling operational data to develop cost or time estimates, schedules or specifications. Monitoring and controlling inventory. Conducting time and motion studies to identify opportunities to improve worker efficiency. Analysing operational, production, economical and other data, using statistical procedures.

fields.name: Professional Principal Executive Officer
fields.description: Executes the decisions of the pensions fund board of trustees and liaise with services providers to the pension fund.
fields.tasks: Arranging to buy and sell stocks and bonds for clients.      Building and maintaining a client base.      Interviewing clients to determine financial status and objectives, risk tolerance and other information needed to develop financial plans and investment strategies.      Monitoring investment performance, and reviewing and revising investment plans based on modified needs and changes in markets.      Setting financial objectives, and developing and implementing strategies for achieving the financial objectives.

fields.name: Program Director (Television or Radio)
fields.description: Compiles and directs programs for television or radio.
fields.tasks: Selecting programs for broadcasting. Engaging and supervising technical personnel, and determining scope and scheduling of programs.      Maintaining administration and negotiating royalties.      Creating, planning and writing scripts and assigning roles to presenters.

fields.name: Program or Project Administrators
fields.description: Plans and undertakes administration of organisational programs, special projects and support services.
fields.tasks: Developing, reviewing and negotiating variations to contracts, programmes, projects and services. Responding to queries and resolving problems concerning programmes and projects. Managing the paperwork associated with programmes and projects, and with services provided. Working with project managers, architects, engineering professionals, business owners and others to ensure that project and programme goals are met. Overseeing the work by contractors and reporting on variations to work orders. Collecting and analysing data associated with projects and programmes undertaken, and reporting on outcomes.

fields.name: Programme or Project Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates special programmes or projects.
fields.tasks: Managing day-to-day operational aspects of a project. Creating and executing project work plans and revising as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements. Identifying resources needed and assigning individual responsibilities. Effectively applying methodology, enforcing project standards and minimising risk on project. Preparing for engagement reviews and quality assurance procedures. Reviewing deliverables prepared by team before passing to client. Ensuring project documents are complete, current, and stored appropriately.

fields.name: Programmer Analyst
fields.description: Designs, develops, modifies documents and tests, implements, installs and supports software applications and systems.
fields.tasks: Assessing, developing, upgrading and documenting maintenance procedures for operating systems, communications environments and applications software.      Consulting with customers concerning maintenance of software system.      Consulting with engineering staff to evaluate interface between hardware and software.      Developing and directing software testing and validation procedures.      Directing software programming and development of documentation.      Modifying existing software to correct errors, to adapt it to new hardware or to upgrade interfaces and improve performance.      Researching, analysing and evaluating requirements for software applications and operating systems.

fields.name: Project Builder
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the construction, alteration and renovation of dwellings and other buildings, and the physical and human resources involved in building process.
fields.tasks: Arranging building inspections by relevant authorities.      Arranging submission of plans to local authorities.      Building under contract, or subcontracting specialised building services.      Coordinating labour resources, and procurement and delivery of materials, plant and equipment.      Ensuring adherence to building legislation and standards of performance, quality, cost and safety.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Interpreting architectural drawings and specifications.

fields.name: Proof Reader
fields.description: Reads draft copies and proofs, detects errors and marks corrections to grammar, typing and composition.
fields.tasks: Checking typed documentation (called a proof) against the original documentation (called a copy). Detecting any grammatical, typographical or compositional errors. Marking the errors in the proof using standardized code. Returning the marked proof for correcting. Re-checking the corrected proof against the copy. Checking dimensions, spacing and positioning of page elements, and their verifying conformance to required specifications.

fields.name: Property Lease Administrator
fields.description: Conducts day-to-day duties associated with abstracting and billing a portfolio of properties.
fields.tasks: Marketing rental units to prospective clients, attending to walk-in and telephonic queries from prospective tenants, managing waiting lists, doing background checks on prospective tenants, placing tenants and compiling leases. Compiling and maintaining tenant schedules for all commercial and residential properties.  Ensuring that all lease rentals and associated charges for leased properties are charged out to, and recovered from, tenants. Maintaining the integrity and safe-keeping of copy lease agreements, reconciling tenant accounts and conducting tenant audits. Conducting irregular inspections of managed properties to determine deviations from lease terms and conditions, as well as to determine the condition of the buildings. Compiling reports reflecting cost of variances for both vacant premises and lettable areas of managed buildings, and managing floor plans of managed buildings. Submitting damage reports and claims, arranging for the cost of damages to be deducted from tenants’ deposits, and performing all tasks relative to debt collection.

fields.name: Property Manager
fields.description: Supervises the leasing of rental properties on behalf of owners.
fields.tasks: Overseeing the operational aspects of one or more commercial and/or residential properties by maintaining the property premises and ensuring that the buildings show a good return on investment. Conducting regular site monitoring, doing minor servicing and repair work on the building and any machines or equipment located on the premises, and contracting and managing specialist service providers to undertake major work. Working with estate agents to lease vacant properties, screening prospective tenants, and negotiating renewals of the lease agreements with existing tenants. Handling tenant queries and acting as a communication liaison between property owners, tenants and service providers. Collecting property rent payments and initiating or participating in litigation with tenants, contractors and insurance agencies.   Managing the accounts and finances of managed properties, including making certain property-related payments such as mortgage, tax, insurance and utilities, on behalf of the property owner, as well as doing basic book-keeping. Managing upgrade or refurbishment projects according to budgets and ensuring compliance with appropriate regulatory requirements. Ensuring the protection of vacant properties.

fields.name: Property Portfolio and Asset Manager
fields.description: Plans, directs, or coordinates the selling, buying, leasing, or governance activities of commercial, industrial, or residential real estate properties.
fields.tasks: Maximising the income and value of a portfolio of residential and/or commercial and/or retail properties through management of operations, acquisitions and dispositions. Overseeing all advertising, marketing, negotiations and contracts related to property leasing. Being responsible for all liaison and communication with tenants, clients, brokers, the public and local communities, and establishing mutually beneficial relationship with these groups. Ensuring the efficient and prompt collection of rentals. Managing and controlling the income and expenditure budgets of the property portfolio, benchmarking the portfolio's cost structure and implementing budget efficiency improvement measures. Maximising lease income through analysing tenant and retail income patterns, and conceptualising reconfigurations to optimise income growth and capital values. Supervising the facilities management of properties in the portfolio and undertaking property inspections. Managing all maintenance, revamp and upgrade-related issues including obtaining quotations, appointing and managing service providers. Attending to all legal matters related to management of the property portfolio, and ensuring legal and ethical compliance with industry standards and codes of conduct. Being responsible for all related administration and book-keeping, and writing and presenting management, budget and valuation reports.

fields.name: Prosthodontist
fields.description: Diagnoses, treats, rehabilites and maintains the oral comfort and health of patients with missing teeth and related mouth and jaw structures.
fields.tasks: Designing and constructing appliances to restore oral function. Bonding porcelain veneers to the teeth to improve their shape, colour and position. Inserting maxillary obturators that close and help heal holes in the roof of the mouth. Replacing teeth with artificial substitutes that are not readily removable.

fields.name: Pruner
fields.description: Prunes trees or shrubs.
fields.tasks: Cutting dead or unwanted branches from trees and shrubs to allow easy pedestrian or vehicle movement along roads and sidewalks, to maintain a safe distance from power and telephone lines, or to improve the appearance and health of plants.  Staking, cabling, bracing, tying and staking trees and shrubs that require support. Filling cavities in trees to promote healing and prevent deterioration through rotting. Using climbing hooks and belts, or climbing ladders to gain access to branches that need to be cut or trimmed.  Using tools and equipment such as handsaws, pruning hooks, shears, clippers and truck-mounted lifts. Clearing sites, streets and grounds of tree stumps, fallen trees and branches, or shrubby overgrowth. Collecting and piling debris from tree trimming and removal operations for removal. Maintaining tools and equipment by cleaning, sharpening and lubricating.

fields.name: Psychiatrist
fields.description: Diagnoses, assesses, treats and prevents human mental, emotional and behavioural disorders.
fields.tasks: Taking complete histories of their patients including medical, emotional and developmental information. Determining the nature and degree of the disorder and deciding on a programme of treatment. Directing or administering the kind of care and treatment necessary, which usually involves medication. Serving as consultants to courts, special schools and community agencies.

fields.name: Psychometrician
fields.description: Conducts, evaluates and interprets psychometric tests.
fields.tasks: Planning and carrying out tests to measure mental, physical and other characteristics such as intelligence abilities, aptitudes, potentialities, etc. Interpreting and evaluating test results, Preparing papers and reports,

fields.name: Psychotherapist
fields.description: Provides diagnosis and treatment of mental and emotional disorders using psychotherapeutic methods such as behavioural therapy, biofeedback, relaxation therapy and other techniques.
fields.tasks: Conducting a series of individual sessions with a patient to assess need, explore issues and build trust. Encouraging the patient to talk about and explore their feelings and behaviour. Providing therapy to assist patients s to develop skills and insights needed to deal with and resolve their social and personal problems. Facilitating group sessions and mediation services. Keeping abreast of developments in theory and research

fields.name: Public Health Physician
fields.description: Provides nursing care to children from birth to school age and their families, with an emphasis on preventing and early detection of, and intervention in, physical, emotional and social problems affecting children and their families.
fields.tasks: Conducting physical examinations of patients and interviewing them and their families to determine their health status. Ordering laboratory tests, X-rays and other diagnostic procedures and analysing findings to determine the nature of disorders or illnesses. Providing continuing medical care for patients including prescribing, administering, counselling on and monitoring curative treatments and preventive measures. Performing surgery and other clinical procedures Advising individuals, families and communities on health, nutrition and lifestyle which aid prevention or treatment of disease and disorders. Providing referrals to patients and families for specialised care in hospitals, rehabilitation centres or other types of health care centres. Identifying, managing and providing referrals for complications before, during and after childbirth.

fields.name: Public Speaker
fields.description: Makes speeches in public settings.
fields.tasks: Performing formal speeches at various events. Making notes on discussion topics and forming interesting presentations in order to engage audiences. Communicating and co-operating with event personnel.

fields.name: Publication Gravure Machine Technician
fields.description: Sets up, operates and maintains webfed gravure printing presses to print specified printing jobs on a variety of papersubstrates.
fields.tasks: Producing a variety of printed products using gravure printing presses and in-line finishing systems. Maintaining, adjusting, repairing and cleaning gravure printing machines. Producing digital print images, and transferring and outputting images. Mixing ink and solvents to standard, and regulating paper and ink supply during print runs. Loading paper into feeding mechanisms. Monitoring machine operations and quality of printing. Monitoring, evaluating and determining press to check print quality standards against proofs and detect malfunctions. Setting, adjusting and monitoring substrate-feed mechanisms, delivery mechanisms, inking systems and other printing machine functions.

fields.name: Publisher
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates budgets, research and development activities within a publishing organisation and commissions Authors and Editors.
fields.tasks: Editing, reviewing and approving written content. Obtaining permission to use images if necessary. Making a notes on important topics to be placed in the back matter of publications. Registering published materials for copyright.

fields.name: Purchasing Officer
fields.description: Prepares purchase orders, monitors supply sources and negotiates contracts with suppliers.
fields.tasks: Forecasting levels of demand for services and products to meet the business needs and keeping a constant check on stock levels.   Conducting research to ascertain the best products and suppliers in terms of best value, delivery schedules and quality.   Liaising between suppliers, manufacturers, relevant internal departments and customers, ensuring suppliers are aware of business objectives.   Identifying potential suppliers, visiting existing suppliers and building and maintaining good relationships with them.   Evaluating bids and making recommendations based on commercial and technical factors.   Negotiating and agreeing contracts and monitoring their progress, checking the quality of service provided.   Processing payments and invoices, keeping contract files and using them as reference in the future.   Forecasting price trends and their impact on future activities. Giving presentations about market analysis and possible growth.   Developing an organisation's purchasing strategy and producing reports and statistics using computer resources.   Attending meetings and trade conferences.

fields.name: Quality Assurance Analyst (Computers)
fields.description: Installs software and hardware and configures operating system software in preparation for testing and conduct testing.
fields.tasks: Developing and documenting software testing plans.     Developing and implementing software and information system testing policies, procedures and scripts.          Executing, analysing and documenting results of software application tests and information and telecommunication systems tests.          Installing software and hardware and configuring operating system software in preparation for testing.          Verifying that programmes function according to user requirements and established guidelines.

fields.name: Quality Systems Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the deployment of quality systems and certification processes within an organisation.
fields.tasks: Developing or specifying standards, methods, or procedures to determine product quality or release readiness. Participating in product design reviews to provide input on functional requirements, product designs, schedules or potential problems. Planning test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope or delivery dates. Collaborating with field staff or customers to evaluate or diagnose problems and recommend possible solutions. Analysing quality control test results and providing feedback and interpretation to production management or staff. Producing reports regarding non-conformance of products or processes, daily production quality, root cause analyses or quality trends. Reviewing statistical studies, technological advances or regulatory standards and trends to stay abreast of issues in the field of quality control.

fields.name: Quantity Surveyor
fields.description: Estimates and monitors construction costs from the feasibility stage, through tender preparation, to the construction period and beyond.
fields.tasks: Acting as a member of a professional team which may include architects and engineers to advise a client on aspects of a building project. Acting mainly in the area of cost to the client. Assisting with valuation of property for insurance purposes. Evaluating progress on building projects. Preparing estimates, feasibility studies and budgets for building projects. Preparing tender documentation for competitive tendering. Settling final costs of a project with the contractor and subcontractors.

fields.name: Quarantine Officer
fields.description: Inspects incoming animals, plants, and animal and plant products to ensure compliance with laws and regulations to prevent the spread of exotic pests and diseases.
fields.tasks: Dealing with requests from importers and exporters about cargo they wish to bring into or take out of the country.   Following import health standard procedures of the Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries (DAFF) when dealing with import requests.   Advising importers on where they have to take imported goods to be inspected.   Ensuring entry requirements are met by inspecting import documentation and/or the cargo itself.   Banning or imposing quarantine restrictions on goods or animals suspected of disease.   Sending cargo that needs to be decontaminated or treated to DAFF-approved decontamination areas.   Maintaining an in-depth knowledge of the laws surrounding the industry.

fields.name: Racing Driver
fields.description: Drives racing cars professionally on roads, tracks, or closed circuits. This occupation requires high levels of physical fitness, sporting ability and personal commitment as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications or experience.
fields.tasks: Adhering to the rules and regulations associated with racing. Participating in regular practice and training sessions and undertaking training to maintain the required standard of fitness and skill. Maintaining a high degree of expertise in racing. Assessing other competitors and conditions at venues. Deciding on strategies in consultation with coaches. Competing in racing events. Undertaking racing promotional activities and media interviews.

fields.name: Radar Mechanic
fields.description: Inspects, tests, aligns, repairs and installs aircraft electrical and avionic system components.
fields.tasks: Examining and testing machines, instruments, components, other equipment, instruments and control systems to identify faults. Adjusting, repairing, and replacing worn and defective parts and wiring, and maintaining machines, equipment and instruments. Reassembling, test operating and adjusting equipment. Installing electronic instruments and control systems. Coordinating work with that of engineers, technicians, and other maintenance personnel. Interpreting test data to diagnose malfunctions and systemic performance problems.

fields.name: Radiation Laboratory Technician
fields.description: Assists with patient diagnosis and treatment by performing a variety of standard radiological examinations on patients using stationary and portable x-ray and ancillary equipment.
fields.tasks: Measuring patients for immobilisation and positioning devices necessary for radiation oncology treatment. Measuring patients for protective devices needed during radiation oncology treatment. Manufacturing personal immobilisation, positioning and protective devices. Fitting and modifying immobilisation, positioning and protective devices to ensure safety and comfort during treatment. Explaining procedures and positioning patients for treatment.

fields.name: Radio Journalist
fields.description: Collects and analyses facts about newsworthy events by interview, investigation and observation and writes stories for radio news or current affairs programs.
fields.tasks: Collecting local, national and international news through interviews, investigation and observation, attending public events, seeking out records, reviewing written work, attending film and stage performances.      Collecting, reporting and commenting on news and current affairs for publication in newspapers and periodicals, or for broadcasting by the media.      Interviewing politicians and other public figures at press conferences and on other occasions, including individual interviews recorded for the media.      Liaising with production staff.      Receiving, analysing and verifying news for accuracy.      Researching and reporting on developments in specialised fields such as medicine, science and technology.      Selecting material for publication, checking style, grammar, accuracy and legality of content and arranging for any necessary revisions.      Selecting, assembling and preparing publicity material about business or other organisations for issue through the media.      Writing critical reviews of literary, musical and other artistic works based on knowledge, judgement and experience for the media.

fields.name: Radio or Television Programme Organiser
fields.description: Organises and sequences programs for television or radio.
fields.tasks: Selecting programs for broadcasting. Engaging technical personnel, and determining scope and scheduling of programs.      Maintaining administration.      Creating sequences of pragrams and advertisements to fulfill a schedule. Planning and following timetables.

fields.name: Radio Presenter
fields.description: Prepares and presents news, sports or other information, conducts interviews, and introduces music, performances and special events on radio. This occupation requires high levels of creative talent or personal commitment and interest as well as, or in pla
fields.tasks: Commenting on music and other matters , such as weather or traffic conditions.      Interviewing persons on radio.      Introducing performing artists or persons being interviewed, and making related announcements on radio.      Reading news bulletins on radio.      Studying background information in order to prepare for programs or interviews.

fields.name: Radio Station Operator
fields.description: Sets up, operates, and maintains equipment that regulates the signal strength, the clarity, and the ranges of sounds of radio broadcasts.
fields.tasks: Working with equipment used for the transmission and reception of radio broadcasts, and other related communication systems. Setting  up, operating, and maintaining equipment that regulates signal strength, clarity, and the ranges of sounds for radio broadcasts.  Making sure that radio programmes are broadcast at the right times.  Ensuring radio broadcast is of  the highest quality. Recording productions and various live broadcasts, including sporting and musical events, news programmes and  forums for broadcast at a later time.

fields.name: Radiologist
fields.description: Provides diagnostic medical services, and medical care and management of of patients utilising radiant-energy techniques such as general radiography, angiography, fluoroscopy, mammography, ultra-sound, computed tomography, and magnetic resonance.
fields.tasks: Diagnosing and treating diseases of the breasts in women. Diagnosing and treating diseases of the heart and vascular system. Using radiologic equipment that shows both bone and soft tissue, including organs, muscles and tumours. Diagnostic imaging of emergency trauma or non-traumatic emergency conditions.

fields.name: Radiotrician
fields.description: Installs, tests, repairs and maintains radar and radio equipment. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Installing electronic instruments and control systems. Testing the electrical system in an effort to find any faulty wires that need to be replaced. Repairing and maintaining parts that are utilised for aircraft navigation and radio communications, weather radar systems, and other instruments and computers that control flight, and engines. Interpreting test data to diagnose malfunctions and systemic performance problems. Installing, adjusting, repairing or replacing electrical and electronic components, assemblies, and systems using hand tools, power tools, or soldering irons. Connecting components to assemblies such as radio systems, instruments, magnetos, inverters, and in-flight refuelling systems. Reassembling, test operating and adjusting equipment.

fields.name: Railway Signal Operator
fields.description: Controls the movement of trains, and assembles and disassembles trains within a marshalling yard.
fields.tasks: Controlling the flow of railway traffic over sections of railway lines by operating signals and switches from control panels or signal boxes.   Switching and coupling rolling stock in railway yards and sidings in accordance with orders about loading, unloading and make-up. Making up trains for hauling by locomotives or cables, and directing their movement along haulage ways.   Taking charge of and safeguarding freight trains during their runs.

fields.name: Railway Station Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of a railway station.
fields.tasks: Determining, implementing and monitoring purchasing, storage and distribution strategies, policies and plans.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Liaising with other departments and customers concerning requirements for outward goods and associated forwarding transportation.      Monitoring and reviewing storage and inventory systems to meet supply requirements and control stock levels.      Negotiating contracts with suppliers to meet quality, cost and delivery requirements.      Operating recording systems to track all movements of goods, and ensuring re-ordering and re-stocking at optimal times.      Overseeing the recording of purchase, storage and distribution transactions.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.

fields.name: Railway Steward
fields.description: Provides services for the safety and comfort of passengers travelling by train.
fields.tasks: Checking passenger tickets and directing them to their seats and cabins.   Distributing reading material, pillows, blankets and other amenities for the comfort of passengers.    Operating galleys, preparing and heating food for passengers, and serving refreshments and meals.   Tidying railway cabins, and receiving and stowing food, equipment and cabin baggage.   Conducting safety checks and demonstrations of safety equipment and procedures.   Making public announcements. Carrying out safety procedures, and assisting and directing passengers in emergencies.

fields.name: Railway Track Master
fields.description: Operates plant to lay, align, repair and maintain railway tracks. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring excavating machinery equipped with moveable shovel, grab-bucket or dragline bucket, to excavate and move earth, rock, sand, gravel or similar materials. Operating and monitoring machinery for digging trenches. Operating and monitoring machinery equipped with concave steel blade to move, distribute and level earth, sand, snow and other materials. Operating and monitoring equipment to remove sand, gravel and mud from bottom of body of water. Operating and monitoring machines for hammering wooden, concrete or steel piles into ground. Operating and monitoring power roller to compact and smooth layers of materials in making railway tracks. Operating and monitoring machines which spread and smooth concrete or bituminous or tar preparations to construct railway tracks.

fields.name: Railway Track Worker
fields.description: Lays and repairs tracks for railways, tramways, quarries and mines, and installs and repairs signals and other equipment.
fields.tasks: Spreading and tamping ballast to provide firm foundations for railway sleepers. Cutting rails to length and grinding worn and rough rail ends. Placing sleepers across roadbeds, and positioning and fastening rails onto sleepers. Drilling bolt holes, and bolting rail sections. Repairing, adjusting, lubricating or removing and replacing rails, sleepers and track switches, using wrenches and replacement parts. Lubricating wheel bearings on rolling stock and maintaining switch signal lamps. Repairing signal lamps and other equipment. Assisting with the righting of derailed rolling stock where necessary. Performing general site maintenance of the rail corridor.

fields.name: Railways Assistant
fields.description: Assists with operating and maintaining facilities at a railway station by updating platform indicators showing train times and destinations, collecting and checking passenger tickets, giving signals for train departures, and cleaning station facilities.
fields.tasks: Ensuring that accurate, up-to-date and appropriate customer information is provided by using PA-systems, notices and face-to-face communication. Altering indicator boards to reflect new information and making passenger announcements. Checking tickets and giving information on services, routes, train times and delays. Maintaining a presence on strategic areas of the station e.g. booking halls, platforms, circulating areas. Some of the work may be based in the ticket office and in the information office, passenger queries are dealt with in person and by phone. Attending automatic gate lines and barriers to help customers, deal with ticketing problems and maximising revenue by preventing fraudulent travel. Watching and listening for dangerous situations and safety hazards and alerting senior staff as necessary.

fields.name: Ratites Farmer
fields.description: Plans, organises and performs farming operations to breed and raise ratites (ostrich, emu ("E-mew") and rhea).
fields.tasks: Monitoring and examining animals to detect illness, injury, or disease, and to check physical condition such as rate of weight gain.   Monitoring market activity and conditions, determining kinds and amounts of products to produce, planning and coordinating production accordingly.   Performing duties related to animal reproduction, such as breeding or egg incubation.   Promoting and marketing products, arranging the sale, purchase and transportation of stock, produce and supplies and maintaining and evaluating records of activities and transactions.   Raising, feeding and tending animals.   Slaughtering and skinning animals and preparing them for market.   Storing and carrying out some processing of produce.   Training and supervising workers in animal care procedures, maintenance duties, and health and safety precautions.

fields.name: Real Estate Agency Principal / Real Estate Agency Licensee
fields.description: Manages the overall activities of a real estate agency.
fields.tasks: Running an Estate Agency business and employing other Estate Agents and Intern Estate Agents. Gathering a thorough knowledge of the property market, particularly in the assigned working area. Appraising properties, setting prices for rental or sale, advertising the ‘for sale’ and ‘for rent’ properties that are on the estate agency books, and sitting at ‘show houses’ which are viewed by prospective buyers over weekends. Liaising with new clients and discussing in detail what they want in a property. Taking prospective buyers or tenants to a number of suitable properties and explaining the terms of sale or conditions of rent or lease. Negotiating contracts with buyers and sellers, and arranging signing of lease agreements and transfer of property rights. Meeting with other estate agencies. Learning and keeping up to date with municipal and tax laws. Being available to both parties (buyers and sellers) at all times.

fields.name: Real Estate Agent
fields.description: Coordinates the activities of real estate representatives in selling and leasing real estate, ensuring compliance with legislative requirements.
fields.tasks: Gathering a thorough knowledge of the property market, particularly in the assigned working area. Appraising properties, setting prices for rental or sale, advertising the ‘for sale’ and ‘for rent’ properties that are on the estate agency books, and sitting at ‘show houses’ which are viewed by prospective buyers over weekends. Liaising with new clients and discussing in detail what they want in a property. Taking prospective buyers or tenants to a number of suitable properties and explaining the terms of sale or conditions of rent or lease. Negotiating contracts with buyers and sellers, and arranging signing of lease agreements and transfer of property rights. Meeting with other estate agencies. Learning and keeping up to date with municipal and tax laws. Being available to both parties (buyers and sellers) at all times.

fields.name: Real Estate Representative
fields.description: Arranges the conduct of real estate transactions such as sales and leasing, and assists buyers to find suitable properties, on behalf of an agency. Alternate Occupation Names Commercial Industrial or Agricultural Property Broker Leasing and Letting Agent Property Portfolio Officer Real Estate Salesperson Real Estate Sub-agent Residential Salesperson

fields.name: Real Estate Sales Settlement Administrator
fields.description: Administers the client, estate agent, documentation, after sales processes and expedites the transfer of the property to the buyer.
fields.tasks: Assisting Conveyancing Attorneys with all the administrative tasks related to property transfers. Communicating with and assisting in answering queries from clients and financial institutions. Screening phone calls and taking messages. Typing memos, preparing figures and making relevant payments. Managing the documentation related to new and existing property transfer files including filing, faxing and photocopying. Invoicing and issuing disbursement accounts to clients, and following up on outstanding fees and disbursements. Assisting with cheque requisitions and receipts after payment.

fields.name: Reception Manager
fields.description: Manages reception functions related to hospitality establishment.
fields.tasks: Directing and overseeing reservation, reception, room service and housekeeping activities. Providing guests with local tourism information, and arranging tours and transportation. Assessing and reviewing customer satisfaction. Controlling selection, training and supervision of reception staff.

fields.name: Receptionist (General)
fields.description: Greets clients and visitors, and responds to personal, telephone, email and written inquiries and requests.
fields.tasks: Greeting visitors and directing them to the appropriate person. Answering, connecting and transferring incoming telephone calls to the relevant staff member. Arranging and recording details of appointments. Answering enquiries and providing information on the goods, services and activities of the organisation. Taking messages for staff who are not available at the time of the call. Receiving and distributing correspondence, faxes and deliveries. Maintaining the reception area in a neat and tidy state. Performing other clerical tasks such as word processing, data entry, filing, mail dispatch and photocopying. Issuing visitor's pass cards when required.

fields.name: Recreation Officer
fields.description: Plans, organises and coordinates recreation facilities and programs through organisations such as local governments, schools, church bodies and youth organisations.
fields.tasks: Organising and coordinating recreation programmes for people to improve their quality of life, and encouraging participation.   Developing recreation programmes for specific audiences such as children, disabled or elderly people, or tourists.   Advising sport and recreation administrators and counsellors on obtaining sponsors for recreational events.   Keeping audiences and communities informed about the different recreational programmes, excursions and exhibitions available.   Keeping records of all activities and events organised and presented.

fields.name: Recruitment Consultant / Officer
fields.description: Interviews applicants to determine their job requirements and suitability for particular jobs, and assists employers to find suitable staff.
fields.tasks: Liaising with Management and relevant Department Heads on what positions need to be filled and setting up the job specifications for these positions. Conducting salary surveys for new positions. Liaising with recruitment agencies and/or placing internal and external employment advertisements. Screening prospective employees by using their CV's and then shortlisting candidates. Setting up and conducting interviews with prospective employees. Setting up offers of employment for successful candidates. Ensuring all the relevant checks have been conducted. Ensuring that the employment contracts meet legal requirements and signing them. Maintaining a database of prospective candidates for easy reference by the company or organisation.

fields.name: Recruitment Manager
fields.description: Manage, plan and evaluate recruitment services of the organisation.
fields.tasks: Setting the social media communication strategy for different job profiles and functions in the organization. Monitoring the labour legislation and implementing required changes to keep the process compliant. Managing and developing the team of recruiters and acting as a single point of contact for managers regarding recruitment topics. Designing, developing and maintaining the recruitment process in the organisation. Designing the selection matrix for choosing the optimum recruitment channel and recruitment source and conducting job interviews. Exploring the market best practices in the recruitment and staffing and implementing appropriate practices in the organisation. Building a quality relationship with the internal customers and external recruitment agencies.

fields.name: Rector (Educational)
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the educational and administrative aspects of a university or other tertiary education institution.
fields.tasks: Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation, expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Controlling selection, training and supervision of staff.      Determining educational programs based on frameworks established by education authorities and governing bodies.      Developing and enforcing a disciplinary code to create a safe and conducive environment for students and teachers.      Directing administrative and clerical activities concerning student admissions and educational services.      Evaluating the work of teachers and lecturers by visiting classrooms, observing teaching methods, reviewing instructional objectives and examining learning materials.      Implementing systems and procedures to monitor school performance and student enrolments.      Organising and implementing methods of raising additional funds in conjunction with parent and community groups and sponsors.      Promoting the educational program, and representing the service or institution in the wider community.      Providing leadership and guidance to teaching, academic and administrative staff as well as to students.      Supervising the maintenance of educational facilities.

fields.name: Recycling or Rubbish Collector
fields.description: Collects household, commercial and industrial waste for recycling and disposal. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Collecting household, commercial and industrial solid waste for disposal or recycling following established routes through residential streets or through business and industrial areas Riding in or on collection trucks between collection stops, and hopping on and off trucks to collect or load rubbish and recycling. Emptying waste bins or throwing plastic refuse bags into the back of the collection truck. Returning empty domestic bins to pavements for residents to collect. Collecting rubbish or recycling from public places by hand and dropping it off at formal collection sites.

fields.name: Red Meat De-boner
fields.description: Prepares slaughtered livestock for further processing in abattoirs.
fields.tasks: Cleaning, slicing and sectioning carcasses for transport and future processing. Removing skin and bones from carcasses. Using knives, meat saws or other equipment to perform meat cutting and trimming. Inspecting meat products for defects or bruises and removing them along with any excess fat. Separating meats and by-products into specified containers. Cutting and trimming meat to prepare for packing. Processing primal parts into cuts that are ready for retail use. Weighing meat and tagging containers for weight and contents.

fields.name: Refractory Mason
fields.description: Restores or replaces linings of furnaces, kilns and basins by installing refractory bricks, blankets, modules, castables, plastics or ceramic coatings to protect structures from high heat.
fields.tasks: Adapting the job site environment. Using and maintaining refractory tools and equipment. Tearing out refractory masonry. Laying refractory bricks. Installing poured castables. Installing gunnable castables,shotcrete, and lining with ceramic welding. Installing refractory material by plastic ramming.

fields.name: Refrigeration Mechanic
fields.description: Assembles, installs, maintains and repairs industrial, commercial and domestic air-conditioning and refrigeration systems and equipment. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Following plans and specifications to install units part by part and bolt them down. Installing parts such as compressors, motors, condensers, evaporators, air filters, switches and gauges, as well as copper lines for steam, gas, refrigerant, compressed air, fuel, oil and chilled water. Drilling holes, installing mounting brackets and cutting, bending and threading piping. Attaching piping to refrigeration systems.ing Working with electricians, pipe fitters and carpenters to install ducting for air-conditioning. Filling systems with gas or fluid and testing for leaks. Removing test gas or fluid using vacuum pumps and filling these with refrigerant in accordance with regulations and governing procedures.

fields.name: Refuge Worker
fields.description: Provides services and support to people seeking assistance in refuges.
fields.tasks: Providing services to people in need at homeless shelters and places of safety for victims of domestic abuse. Organising accommodation for refuge-seekers. Providing emotional support to the residents of refuges and shelters. Referring residents of refuges for health and welfare assistance. Maintaining discipline, enforcing regulations and behaviour standards, compiling disciplinary reports and assisting in implementing remedial measures. Ensuring the personal security of those staying at refuges and shelters.

fields.name: Refugee Status Determination Officer
fields.description: Adjudicate asylum seeking applications to confer refugee status in accordance with the refugee act, 1998 (act no 130 of 1998) and its regulations of 2000.
fields.tasks: Interviewing asylum seekers to determine whether they are entitled to refugee status.   Adjudication of applications for refugee status.   Providing reasons for the decision to grant asylum; or to reject the application as manifestly unfounded, abusive or fraudulent.   Referring any question of law regarding any application to the Standing Committee for Refugee Affairs (SCRA).

fields.name: Refuse Sorter
fields.description: Refuse sorters identify, collect and sort discarded items suitable for recycling at dump sites in buildings, streets and other public places. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Working at recycling depots or dump sites, sorting bulk loads of waste paper, glass materials or other recyclable waste. Assisting the general public in unloading recyclable material at designated places. Verifying that waste material is of a specified type and grade. Loading waste materials onto conveyor belts or into bulk loaders. Operating and regulating the flow of paper into shredding or baling machines. Assisting forklift drivers to move bales of shredded or compressed materials into storage areas or  loading waste materials onto trucks or trailers. Operating hydraulic lift jacks to move bales or loads of bulk paper.

fields.name: Registered Nurse (Aged Care)
fields.description: Provides nursing care to the elderly in community settings, residential aged care facilities, retirement villages and health care facilities.
fields.tasks: Providing nursing care to the elderly in community settings, residential aged care facilities, retirement villages and health care facilities. Coordinating the care of patients in consultation with other health professionals and members of health teams. Developing and implementing care plans for the biological, social, and psychological treatment of patients in collaboration with other health professionals. Planning and providing personal care, treatments and therapies including administering medications, and monitoring responses to treatment or care plan. Planning and participating in health education programmes, health promotion and nurse education activities in clinical and community settings. Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about prevention of ill-health, treatment and care. Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers.

fields.name: Registered Nurse (Child and Family Health)
fields.description: Provides nursing care to children from birth to school age and their families with an emphasis on preventing, and early detection of, and intervening in physical, emotional and social problems affecting children and their families such as assistance with
fields.tasks: Providing nursing care and preventative health care services to the families in community settings and in community based health care facilities. Coordinating the care of patients in consultation with other health professionals and members of health teams. Developing and implementing care plans for the biological, social, and psychological treatment of patients in collaboration with other health .professionals Planning and providing personal care, treatments and therapies including administering medications, and monitoring responses to treatment or care plan. Planning and participating in health education programmes, health promotion and nurse education activities in clinical and community settings. Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about prevention of ill-health, treatment and care. Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers.

fields.name: Registered Nurse (Community Health)
fields.description: Provides nursing care, health counselling, screening and education to individuals, families and groups in the wider community with a focus on patient independence and health promotion.
fields.tasks: Providing nursing care and preventative health services in community settings and community-based health care facilities. Identifying health care needs, priorities and problems of individuals, families and communities. Coordinating health care interventions at community level. Coordinating the care of patients in community settings in consultation with other health professionals and members of health teams. Developing and implementing care plans for the biological, social, and psychological treatment of patients in collaboration with other health professionals. Planning and providing personal care, treatments and therapies including administering medications, and monitoring responses to treatment or care plan. Planning and participating in health education programmes, health promotion and nurse education activities in clinical and community settings. Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about prevention of ill-health, treatment and care. Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers.

fields.name: Registered Nurse (Critical Care and Emergency)
fields.description: Provides nursing care to critically ill patients and patients with unstable health following injury, surgery or during the acute phase of diseases, integrating new technological equipment into care in settings such as high dependency units, intensive care
fields.tasks: Providing nursing care to the patients in emergency, trauma and critical care facilities. Coordinating the care of patients in consultation with other health professionals and members of health teams. Developing and implementing care plans for the biological, social, and psychological treatment of patients in collaboration with other health professionals. Planning and providing personal care, treatments and therapies including administering medications, and monitoring responses to treatment or care plan. Planning and participating in health education programmes, health promotion and nurse education activities in clinical and community settings Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about prevention of ill-health, treatment and care Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers

fields.name: Registered Nurse (Developmental Disability)
fields.description: Provides nursing care to people with intellectual and development disabilities in a range of health, welfare and community settings.
fields.tasks: Providing nursing care to disabled individuals in community settings, residential care and health care facilities. Coordinating the care of patients in consultation with other health professionals and members of health teams. Developing and implementing care plans for the biological, social, and psychological treatment of patients in collaboration with other health professionals. Planning and providing personal care, treatments and therapies including administering medications, and monitoring responses to treatment or care plan. Planning and participating in health education programmes, health promotion and nurse education activities in clinical and community settings. Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about prevention of ill-health, treatment and care. Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers. Alternate Occupation Names Registered Mental Retardation Nurse

fields.name: Registered Nurse (Disability and Rehabilitation)
fields.description: Provides nursing care to patients recovering from injury and illness, and assists and facilitates patients with disabilities to live more independently.
fields.tasks: Providing nursing care to disabled and seriously injured individuals in community settings, residential care and health care facilities. Coordinating the care of patients in consultation with other health professionals and members of health teams. Developing and implementing care plans for the biological, social, and psychological treatment of patients in collaboration with other health professionals. Planning and providing personal care, treatments and therapies including administering medications, and monitoring responses to treatment or care plan. Planning and participating in health education programmes, health promotion and nurse education activities in clinical and community settings. Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about prevention of ill-health, treatment and care. Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers. Alternate Occupation Names Orthopaedic Nurse Palliative Care Nurse Rehabilitation Nurse

fields.name: Registered Nurse (Medical Practice)
fields.description: Provides clinical care to patients, undertakes clinical organisation and practice administration, and facilitates communication within a general practice environment and between the practice and outside organisations and individuals.
fields.tasks: Coordinating the care of patients in consultation with other health professionals and members of health teams.   Managing and overseeing the clinical organisation and administration of the medical practice.   Liaising with other healthcare professionals and health facilities outside the medical practice as instructed by the General Medical Practitioner, Dentist or Medical Specialist.   Practising in accordance with accepted scientific principles, legal requirements and ethical standards.   Planning and providing treatment and therapies including administering medications, and monitoring responses to treatment or care plans.   Planning and participating in health education programmes, health promotion and nurse education activities in clinical and community settings.   Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about health promotion, treatment and care, and the prevention of ill-health.   Supervising and teaching learners and students in the relevant clinical practice area.   Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers.

fields.name: Registered Nurse (Medical)
fields.description: Provides nursing care to patients with conditions such as infections, metabolic disorders and degenerative conditions which require medical intervention in a range of health, aged care and community settings.
fields.tasks: Coordinating the care of patients with a range of conditions in consultation with other health professionals and members of the health team.   Developing and implementing care plans to address a range of different illnesses, disorders and diseases in patients in different settings and in collaboration with other health professionals.   Providing therapeutic care to meet the biological, social, and psychological treatment needs of patients in collaboration with other health professionals.   Practising in accordance with accepted scientific principles, legal requirements and ethical standards.   Planning and providing personal care, treatment and therapies including administering medications, and monitoring responses to treatment or care plans.   Planning and participating in health education programmes, health promotion and nurse education activities in clinical and community settings.   Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about health promotion, treatment and care, and the prevention of ill-health.   Supervising and teaching learners and students in the relevant clinical practice area.   Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers.

fields.name: Registered Nurse (Mental Health)
fields.description: Provides nursing care to patients with mental health illness, disorder and dysfunction, and experiencing emotional difficulties, distress and crisis in health, welfare and aged care facilities, correctional services and the community.
fields.tasks: Providing nursing care to psychiatric patients in community settings,  and in residential  mental health facilities. Coordinating the care of patients in consultation with other health professionals and members of health teams. Developing and implementing care plans for the biological, social, and psychological treatment of patients in collaboration with other health professionals. Planning and providing personal care, treatments and therapies including administering medications, and monitoring responses to treatment or care plan. Planning and participating in health education programmes, health promotion and nurse education activities in clinical and community settings. Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about prevention of ill-health, treatment and care. Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers.

fields.name: Registered Nurse (Operating theatre)
fields.description: Provides nursing care to patients before, during and immediately after surgery, assesses patients' condition, plans nursing care for surgical intervention, maintains a safe and comfortable environment, assists surgeons and anaesthetists during surgery, an
fields.tasks: Preparing the operating room for patients and setting up the tools and equipment for the specific type of surgery.   Creating and maintaining a sterile and safe surgical environment and assisting the surgical team by passing sterilised instruments and supplies during the surgery.   Assisting the Anaesthesiologist with patients during surgery, conferring with the Surgeon about patient care, and managing the overall nursing care in the operating room.   Practising in accordance with accepted scientific principles, legal requirements and ethical standards.   Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about health promotion, and treatment and care prior to and after surgery.   Supervising and teaching learners and students in the relevant clinical practice area.   Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers.

fields.name: Registered Nurse (Surgical)
fields.description: Provides nursing care to patients with injuries and illness that require surgical intervention.
fields.tasks: Preparing patients for surgery and providing nursing care to patients before and after surgery according to instructions from Medical Specialists.   Monitoring patients’ overall condition after surgery and reporting complications to Medical Specialists.   Coordinating the care of patients in consultation with other health professionals and members of health teams.   Developing and implementing care plans for the biological, social, and psychological treatment of patients in collaboration with other health professionals.   Practising in accordance with accepted scientific principles, legal requirements and ethical standards.   Planning and providing personal care, treatment and therapies including administering pain-relief medications, and providing wound care.   Answering questions from patients and families and providing information about health promotion, treatment and care following surgery, and the prevention of ill-health.   Supervising and teaching learners and students in the relevant clinical practice area.   Supervising and coordinating the work of other nursing, health and personal care workers.

fields.name: Registrar / Councillor (Educational)
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the administrative aspects of a university or other tertiary education institution.
fields.tasks: Controlling the administrative operations of a tertiary education institution including budgeting, report preparation and expenditure.      Overseeing the selection, training and supervision of staff.      Determining educational programs based on frameworks established by education authorities and governing bodies.      Developing and enforcing a disciplinary code to create a safe and conducive environment for students and lecturers.      Directing administrative and clerical activities concerning student admissions and educational services.      Evaluating the work of lecturers by visiting classrooms, observing teaching methods, reviewing instructional objectives and examining learning materials.      Implementing systems and procedures to monitor institutional performance and student enrolments.      Organising and implementing methods of raising additional funds in conjunction with students, community groups and sponsors.      Promoting educational programs, and representing the institution in the wider community.      Providing leadership and guidance to teaching, academic and administrative staff as well as to students.

fields.name: Rehabilitation Counsellor
fields.description: Assists physically, mentally and socially disadvantaged people to re-integrate into work and the community.
fields.tasks: Assisting people with disabilities, health conditions and disadvantage to achieve their personal, educational and vocational goals in life, Interviewing clients individually, in families, or in groups, to assess their situation and problems and determine the types of services required, Analysing the client's situation and presenting alternative approaches to resolving problems,

fields.name: Reinforced Plastic and Composite Production Worker
fields.description: Operates machines to apply gel coat, colouring and fibre reinforced plastic to moulds to produce fibreglass and laminated products.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines which shape plastic materials by moulding, extrusion, blowing, cutting and other means. Encasing uncoated wire, cord, cable and optic fibre in plastic. Examining outputs for defects and conformity to specifications. Recycling waste plastic materials. Making artificial eyes and contact lens discs, making and repairing spectacle frames and plastic parts of orthopaedic appliances.

fields.name: Reinforced Plastics and Composite Trades Worker
fields.description: Builds products using composites and reinforced plastics.
