fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines which shape plastic materials by moulding, extrusion, blowing, cutting and other means. Encasing uncoated wire, cord, cable and optic fibre in plastic. Examining outputs for defects and conformity to specifications. Recycling waste plastic materials. Making artificial eyes and contact lens discs, making and repairing spectacle frames and plastic parts of orthopaedic appliances.

fields.name: Religion Studies Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches religion within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Religious Associate Professional
fields.description: Undertakes religious works, preach and propagate the teachings of a particular religion and endeavour to improve well-being through the power of faith and spiritual advice.
fields.tasks: Administering and participating in programs to provide food, clothing and shelter to those in need.      Advising communities and individuals on proper behaviour and faith to preserve or improve well-being.      Assisting at services of public worship and religious rites.      Preaching and propagating the teachings of a particular religious faith.      Providing religious education, spiritual guidance and moral support to individuals and communities.      Undertaking religious works.

fields.name: Remotely Operated Vehicle (ROV) Pilot
fields.description: Drives a remotely operated vehicle to perform specialised functions.
fields.tasks: Setting-up, operating, maintaining and fault finding on Remote Operated Vehicles (ROVs) which can be used a variety of functions including: supporting the construction, maintenance and inspection of wind farms as well as tidal and wave installations; inspecting and surveying sub-sea structures; exploring remote under-sea locations in the offshore oil and gas industry; installing high-voltage power cables; doing repairs in places with high hydraulic pressure. Lifting heavy components of ROV's into place. Performing preventative and corrective ROV maintenance tasks in the field. Working outside under sometimes challenging weather conditions and physical circumstances. Working with people in a team, sometimes in small spaces for long periods of time.

fields.name: Renal Technician
fields.description: Prepares and maintains equipment for renal tests and treatments.
fields.tasks: Explaining procedures, observing and positioning patients, and using protection devices to ensure safety and comfort during examination or treatment.   Positioning treatment equipment and adjusting settings and controls according to technical specifications.   Monitoring patients' conditions and reactions, reporting abnormal signs to a medical practitioner.   Following prescription issued by a medical practitioner.   Operating or overseeing operation equipment. Reviewing and evaluating information and recording results of procedures.

fields.name: Rental Salesperson
fields.description: Rents goods and equipment to individuals and businesses.
fields.tasks: Greeting customers and discussing the type, quality and quantity of merchandise sought for rental. Providing information about rental items and services, such as availability, operation or description, and explaining rental fees, policies and procedures. Answering telephones to provide information and receive orders. Preparing rental forms, obtaining customer signature and verifying information such as required licences. Calculating charges for merchandise or services and receiving payments. Inspecting, adjusting and handing over rental items, arranging for the provision of rental services, and accepting returns. Reserving items for requested times. Preparing merchandise for display, or for purchase or rental. Keeping records of transactions, and of the number of customers entering an establishment.

fields.name: Research and Development Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinate research and development activities within organisations.
fields.tasks: Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures.   Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.   Leading and managing the activities of research and development staff.               .   Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.   Planning and directing daily operations.                .   Planning the overall research and development programme of an enterprise or organisation, specifying goals and budgetary requirements.   Planning, directing and coordinating research and development activities, in-house or commissioned from external research organisations, to develop new or improved technical processes, products, knowledge, or utilisation of materials.   Representing the enterprise or organisation at conventions, seminars and conferences.              .

fields.name: Research Psychologist
fields.description: Conducts research into various areas of psychology.
fields.tasks: Conducting scientific experiments and observational studies in an effort to better understand behaviors and the factors behind those behaviors, Developing theories, models and methods to interpret and describe human behaviour, Preparing papers and reports

fields.name: Reservations Manager
fields.description: Monitor, manage and increase occupancy levels in a accommodation establishment.
fields.tasks: Overseeing reservation administration and coordinating the responsibilities of the sales and reservation team. Liaising with travel agents as well as central reservations to communicate new rate plans and promotions. Liaising with travel agents as well as central reservations to communicate new rate plans and promotions. Forecasting all project requirements on everyday basis and ensuring achievement of all hotel reservation objectives. Collaborating with maintenance and operations department to resolve all guest issues. Being involved with selection and training of staff.

fields.name: Resident Medical Officer
fields.description: Diagnoses, treats and prevents human physical and mental disorders and injuries under the supervision of specialists or senior general practitioners. A resident medical practitioner also provided continuous on-site medical support service to meet the needs of patients, consultants and nursing staff. This includes emergency procedures and providing a general service to all clinical areas.
fields.tasks: Completing a brief admission examination on each patient when appropriate and documenting clinical findings. Ordering laboratory tests, X-rays and other diagnostic procedures and analysing findings to determine the nature of disorders or illnesses. Providing continuing medical care for patients including prescribing, administering, counselling on and monitoring curative treatments and preventive measures. Performing surgery and other clinical procedures. Advising individuals, families and communities on health, nutrition and lifestyle which aid prevention or treatment of disease and disorders. Providing referrals to patients and families for specialised care in hospitals, rehabilitation centres or other types of health care centres. Identifying, managing and providing referrals for complications before, during and after childbirth.

fields.name: Residential Care Officer
fields.description: Provides care and supervision for children or disabled persons in group housing or government institutions.
fields.tasks: Checking each resident's needs and progress. Providing physical care, which could include bathing, toileting, dressing and feeding. Creating a safe and positive living environment. Setting rules for the behaviour of residents. Assisting with daily living skills. Providing relaxation and creative activities in a safe and supportive setting. Helping residents to deal with problems and become independent. Working under the supervision of other health and care professionals. Acting as a learning support assistant.

fields.name: Retail Buyer
fields.description: Selects and buys goods for resale in a retail establishment.
fields.tasks: Interviewing suppliers and negotiating prices, discounts, credit terms and transportation arrangements.   Maintaining relationships with existing suppliers and sourcing new suppliers for future products.   Analysing consumer buying patterns and predicting future trends.   Conducting staff meetings with sales personnel to introduce new merchandise.   Studying market reports, trade periodicals and sales promotion materials.   Managing plans for stock levels and liaising with shop personnel to ensure supply meets demand.   Visiting trade shows, showrooms, factories and product design events to select and assemble a new collection of products.   Presenting new ranges to senior retail managers.

fields.name: Retail Loss Prevention Officer
fields.description: Detects and investigates shoplifting, fraud and other unlawful acts of employees or customers of a retail establishment.
fields.tasks: Patrolling shops and retail premises to watch customers and prevent shoplifting, property damage or other unlawful acts from taking place on the premises.   Checking doors, windows and gates to prevent and detect signs of unauthorised entry.   Controlling access to shops and retail establishments, and monitoring and authorising the entrance or departure of employees and customers.      Responding to alarms, investigating disturbances and contacting superiors, police or fire-fighters as appropriate.

fields.name: Retail Manager (General)
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of a retail trading establishment.
fields.tasks: Controlling selection, training and supervision of staff.      Determining product mix, stock levels and service standards.      Ensuring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations.      Formulating and implementing purchasing and marketing policies, and setting prices.      Maintaining records of stock levels and financial transactions.      Promoting and advertising the establishment’s goods and services.      Undertaking budgeting for the establishment.

fields.name: Retail Pharmacist
fields.description: Dispenses prescribed pharmaceuticals to the public, educates customers on health promotion, disease prevention and the proper use of medicines, and sells non-prescription medicines and related goods in a community pharmacy.
fields.tasks: Being an indispensable and acceptable link in the health system and providing cost-effective and efficient services for the community. Receiving prescriptions for medicinal products from medical doctors and other health professionals, checking patients' medicine histories, and ensuring proper dosage and methods of administration and drug compatibility before dispensing. Preparing or supervising the preparation and labelling of liquid medicines, ointments, powders, tablets and other medications to fill prescriptions. Advising patients about their health and supply over-the-counter medicines for less serious conditions. Storing and preserving vaccines, serums and other drugs subject to deterioration.

fields.name: Retail Supervisor
fields.description: Supervises and coordinates the activities of retail sales workers.
fields.tasks: Managing retail sales staff, including cashiers and  merchandisers working on the floor. Supervising and coordinating staff activities including organising and distributing staff schedules. Recruiting, training, coaching, counselling, and disciplining employees. Helping  retail sales staff to achieve sales targets. Evaluating on-the-job performance of sales staff  against Key Performance Areas (KPAs). Selling merchandise to customers. Authorising certain types of  payments and the return of merchandise. Handling customer questions, complaints and issues. Preparing reports regarding sales volumes, merchandising and personnel matters for management. Ensuring promotions are accurate and merchandised correctly. Ensuring standards for quality, customer service and health and safety are followed. Maintaining store's cleanliness and health and safety measures.

fields.name: Rheumatologist
fields.description: Investigates, diagnoses and treats diseases, injuries and deficiencies of human joints, muscles and soft tissue.
fields.tasks: Examining patients to determine the nature and extent of problems after referral from General Practitioners. Undertaking laboratory tests and diagnostic procedures. Prescribing therapeutic treatment and procedures. Treating by medication rather than surgery.

fields.name: Rigger
fields.description: Assembles and installs rigging gear such as cables, ropes, pulleys and winches to lift, lower, move and position equipment, structural steel and other heavy objects. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Estimating the size, shape and weight of objects to be moved. Deciding on the type of equipment to move objects. Installing and repairing cables, ropes, wires, pulleys and other tackle. Joining, repairing and fitting attachments to wires, ropes and cables. Working as member of crew erecting and repairing derricks for drilling water, gas- and oil-wells. Lifting and mounting scenery, lighting and other equipment in theatres and on film sets. Installing and maintaining communication towers, aerial cableways, funicular railways, ski lifts and similar infrastructure.

fields.name: Road Roller Operator
fields.description: Operates a power-driven roller to prepare surfaces for roads, runways and car parks.
fields.tasks: Performing safety checks before operating the road roller and ensuring all equipment function properly.   Driving a heavy rolling vehicle to compact earth fills, subgrades, flexible base and bituminous surface to grade specifications preparatory to construction of highways, streets and runways.   Moving levers, depressing pedals, turning hand wheels and pushing a throttle to control and guide the road roller.   Determining speed and direction of machine based on knowledge of compressibility of material under changing temperatures preventing ridges to be formed by excessive pressure.   Driving the road roller in successive overlapping passes over surface to be compacted.   Performing routine maintenance tasks on the road roller such as lubricating, fuelling and cleaning.

fields.name: Road Transport Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of an enterprise which operates a fleet of vehicles to transport goods and passengers.
fields.tasks: Determining, implementing and monitoring purchasing, storage and distribution strategies, policies and plans.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Liaising with other departments and customers concerning requirements for outward goods and associated forwarding transportation.      Monitoring and reviewing storage and inventory systems to meet supply requirements and control stock levels.      Negotiating contracts with suppliers to meet quality, cost and delivery requirements.      Operating recording systems to track all movements of goods, and ensuring re-ordering and re-stocking at optimal times.      Overseeing the recording of purchase, storage and distribution transactions.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.

fields.name: Rock Drill Operator
fields.description: Drives and operates rock drilling machine or handheld rockdrill to drill explosive-charge holes through hard materials to facilitate blasting operations.
fields.tasks: Selecting the appropriate drill for the job using knowledge of rock or soil conditions. Assembling and dismantling pipes, casings and drill heads and replacing dysfunctional equipment. Preparing drilling fluid and checking the operation of pumps to ensure adequate circulation of fluid in drill pipe. Starting, stopping and controlling drilling speed of machines and insertion of casings into holes. Drilling or boring holes in rock for blasting, grouting or anchoring. Operating controls to stabilize machines and to position and align drills. Regulating air pressure, rotary speed and downward pressure, according to the type of rock being drilled. Monitoring drilling operations, checking gauges and listening to equipment to assess drilling conditions and to determine the need to adjust drilling or alter equipment. Maintaining records of drilling and servicing operations. Maintaining and cleaning drilling rigs, hoisting and other machinery.

fields.name: Rock Engineering Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the rock engineering and related functions, including support, extraction sequences and infrastructure to ensure safe and optimal extraction of ore reserves on a mine.
fields.tasks: Conferring with other managers to set production quotas, plan extraction sites and develop policies for the removal of raw materials.      Controlling the operation of plant and quality procedures through planning of maintenance, designation of operating hours and supply of equipment.      Controlling the preparation of production records and reports.      Coordinating the implementation of health and safety requirements.      Establishing and managing budgets, monitoring production output and costs, and adjusting processes and resources to minimize costs.      Evaluating efficiency of production sites to determine adequacy of personnel, equipment and technologies used, and make changes to work schedule or equipment when necessary.      Overseeing the acquisition and installation of new plant and equipment.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Planning details of production activities in terms of output quality and quantity, cost, time available and labour requirements.      Researching and implementing regulatory and statutory requirements affecting mineral extraction operations and the environment.

fields.name: Rock Engineering Technician
fields.description: Designs regional mine support, infrastructure placement, extraction sequences, configurations and local mine support to ensure safe and optimal extraction of ore reserves.
fields.tasks: Providing technical assistance in geological and topographical surveys, and in the design and layout of oil, natural gas and mineral ore extraction and transportation systems, and processing and refining plants for minerals and metals. Monitoring technical, regulatory and safety aspects of the construction, installation, operation, maintenance and repair of mineral ore, oil and natural gas exploration, extraction, transport and storage installations and of mineral processing plants. Helping plan and design mines, mine shafts, tunnels and underground first-aid facilities. Assisting scientists in the use of electrical, sonic, or nuclear measuring instruments in both laboratory and production activities to obtain data indicating potential sources of metallic ore, gas, or petroleum.

fields.name: Roll Label Machine Technician
fields.description: Sets up, operates and maintains roll label printing presses to print specified printing jobs on a variety of paper, plastic and self adhesive substrates by using inline printing and finishing processes.
fields.tasks: Setting, adjusting and monitoring substrate-feed mechanisms, delivery mechanisms, inking systems and other printing machine functions. Mixing ink and solvents to standard, and regulating paper and ink supply during print runs. Monitoring, evaluating and determining press to check print quality standards against proofs and detect malfunctions. Producing a variety of printed products using relief, lithographic, flexographic and gravure printing presses, and in-line finishing systems. Preparing plates, blankets and impression cylinders on small offset lithographic printing presses. Loading paper into feeding mechanisms. Monitoring machine operations and quality of printing. Maintaining, adjusting, repairing and cleaning machines. Producing digital print images, and transferring and outputting images.

fields.name: Roll Label Rewind Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, operates and maintains roll label rewinding machines to rewind roll labels.
fields.tasks: Setting up machines to product specifications. Examining job orders to determine quantities, stock specifications and special instructions. Operating machines. Conducting regular inspections and maintenance of machines.

fields.name: Roof Plumber
fields.description: Installs, maintains and repairs flashings, metallic roof and wall claddings and rainwater products such as gutters and down pipes.
fields.tasks: Setting ladders, scaffolds, and hoists in place for taking supplies to roofs and upper floors of buildings. Assisting pipe fitters in the installation of piping for air, ammonia, gas, and water systems. Installing flashings, metallic roof and wall claddings. Repairing roof gutters and pipes. Anchoring steel supports from ceiling joists to hold pipes in place. Setting sleeves or inserts to provide support for pipes. Attaching pipes to walls, structures, or fixtures such as radiators or tanks using brackets, clamps, tools or welding equipment.

fields.name: Roof Thatcher
fields.description: Covers roof using natural thatch.
fields.tasks: Putting in place fire felt or fire boarding before thatching a roof. Covering roofs of buildings with layers of thatching grass or thin reeds, laid vertically over thatching battens or saplings, to make them weatherproof. Pegging new thatching material on the roof in overlapping layers, fixing it securely with treated twine using special hooks to maintain the weatherproofness of a thatched roof. Trimming the edges of the thatch at the eaves and sometimes cutting decorative patterns into the roof surface. Beating and brushing the thatch until it is smooth. Covering thatch with protective wire netting to keep out birds and pests. Repairing thatched roofs by straightening the edges, removing old or damaged thatch from a roof and re-ridging as required.

fields.name: Roof Tiler
fields.description: Cover roofs with tiles, sheets and shingles to form a waterproof surface.
fields.tasks: Setting up scaffolding to provide safe access to roofs. Laying a waterproof shield and fixing metallic or synthetic materials to a building’s frame. Sizing and cutting roofing materials to fit around edges, corners and protuberances such as chimneys. Covering roofs with tiles to form a waterproof surface. Fixing edge and ridge tiles in cement mortar. Caulking and flashing exposed nail heads to prevent leaks. Removing tiles when required. Working closely with carpenters, bricklayers, plasterers and other tradesmen in the building industry.

fields.name: Rotary Printing and Re-reeling Flexographic Machine Technician
fields.description: Sets up, operates and maintains webfed flexographic printing presses to print specified printing jobs on a variety of paper and plastic substrates.
fields.tasks: Setting, adjusting and monitoring substrate-feed mechanisms, delivery mechanisms, inking systems and other printing machine functions. Mixing ink and solvents to standard, and regulating paper and ink supply during print runs. Monitoring, evaluating and determining press to check print quality standards against proofs and detect malfunctions. Producing a variety of printed products using relief, lithographic, flexographic and gravure printing presses, and in-line finishing systems. Preparing plates, blankets and impression cylinders on small offset lithographic printing presses. Loading paper into feeding mechanisms. Monitoring machine operations and quality of printing. Maintaining, adjusting, repairing and cleaning machines. Producing digital print images, and transferring and outputting images.

fields.name: Rotary Printing and Re-reeling Gravure Machine Technician
fields.description: Sets up, operates and maintains webfed gravure printing presses to print specified printing jobs on a variety of paper and plastic substrates.
fields.tasks: Setting, adjusting and monitoring substrate-feed mechanisms, delivery mechanisms, inking systems and other printing machine functions. Mixing ink and solvents to standard, and regulating paper and ink supply during print runs. Monitoring, evaluating and determining press to check print quality standards against proofs and detect malfunctions. Producing a variety of printed products using relief, lithographic, flexographic and gravure printing presses, and in-line finishing systems. Preparing plates, blankets and impression cylinders on small offset lithographic printing presses. Loading paper into feeding mechanisms. Monitoring machine operations and quality of printing. Maintaining, adjusting, repairing and cleaning machines. Producing digital print images, and transferring and outputting images.

fields.name: Rotational Moulding Operator (Plastics)
fields.description: Operates rotational moulding machines to produce plastic products.
fields.tasks: Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of raw materials and processing agents into rotational moulding machines. Controlling process start-up and shut-down, troubleshooting and monitoring outside process equipment. Setting up, preparing and adjusting machinery. Operating and monitoring rotational moulding machines to produce plastic products. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of machine and verify specified processing conditions. Adjusting equipment, valves, pumps, controls and process equipment. Analysing sample products and performing tests to ensure conformity to standards. Verifying equipment for malfunctions, carrying out routine operating tests and arranging for maintenance. Recording data and writing production logs.

fields.name: Rubber Manufacturing Machine Setter and Minder
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and runs and monitors rubber manufacturing machinery and equipment to produce rubber products.
fields.tasks: Monitoring and minding machines which: build up tyres on a form, vulcanise tyres and mould or rebuild used tyres; extrude compounded rubber or shape vulcanised rubber by moulding; knead, mix and blend rubber and rubber compounds for further processing; or produce sheets of rubber or rubberised fabric by a rolling process. Locating defects and repairing worn and faulty tyres by vulcanising or other processes. Setting up, preparing and adjusting rubber manufacturing machinery. Controlling process start-up and shut-down, troubleshooting and monitoring outside process equipment. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of machine and verify specified processing conditions. Adjusting equipment, valves, pumps, controls and process equipment. Analysing sample products and performing tests to ensure conformity to standards, and recording data and writing production logs. Verifying equipment for malfunctions, carrying out routine operating tests and arranging for maintenance.

fields.name: Rubber Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines to manufacture rubber products such as tyres.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines which knead, mix and blend rubber and rubber compounds for further processing. Operating and monitoring machines which produce sheets of rubber or rubberised fabric by a rolling process. Operating and monitoring machines which extrude compounded rubber or shape vulcanised rubber by moulding. Operating and monitoring machines which build up tires on a form, vulcanise tires and mould or rebuild used tires. Examining outputs for defects and conformity to specifications. Locating defects and repairing worn and faulty tyres by vulcanising or other processes.

fields.name: Saddle Stitch Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, maintains and operates a saddle stitch binding line to produce saddle stitched publications.
fields.tasks: Examining job orders to determine the quantities, stock specifications and any special instructions. Setting up and operating machines to achieve product specifications. Conducting regular inspections and maintenance of machines. Checking the quality and conformance to specifications of products. Keeping records of products produced.

fields.name: Safety Inspector
fields.description: Inspects machines, equipment, working conditions and public places to ensure compliance with government and industry standards and regulations, in relation to occupational health and safety.
fields.tasks: Inspecting places of work to ensure that the working environment, machinery and equipment, processes and products conform to relevant government rules, regulations and standards relating to: sanitation; occupational and environmental health and safety; emission of pollutants; disposal of dangerous wastes; escalator and passenger conveyor equipment and lifts. Obtaining information about work practices and accidents to determine compliance with safety rules and regulations. Conducting relevant destructive and non-destructive tests on equipment and machinery to ensure their conformance regulations. Advising employers’ and workers’ representatives on the implementation of government and other rules and regulations concerning occupational health, safety and the working environment in a particular sector or industry. Removing unsafe items from, or blocking off unsafe areas in, workplaces that have been inspected. Coordinating, monitoring, organising and planning inspectorate activities of both proactive and reactive inspections that may include other government departments such as the police. Compiling monthly statistics on inspections.

fields.name: Safety, Health, Environment and Quality (SHE&Q) Practitioner
fields.description: Develops, implements and evaluates risk management policies and programs, trains employees in occupational health and safety procedures, monitors and audits the workplace, and records and investigates incidents to ensure safe and healthy working condition
fields.tasks: Preparing strategies, developing internal policies and operational procedures, and leading in-house training with managers and employees for health and safety issues and environmental risks. Conducting regular site inspections to check that policies and procedures are being properly implemented, documenting findings and making recommendations and/or changes to working practices to increase safety and compliance with legislation.   Carrying out risk assessments and considering how risks could be reduced. Keeping records of incidents and accidents and producing statistics for management. Keeping up to date with new legislation and any other developments that may affect the industry. Managing and organising the safe disposal of hazardous substances, e.g. asbestos. Assisting in ensuring the safe installation of equipment. Advising on a range of specialist areas, e.g. fire regulations, hazardous substances, noise, safeguarding machinery and occupational diseases.

fields.name: Sail Maker
fields.description: Fabricates and repairs sails and other articles from sail-cloth.
fields.tasks: Making or repairing a variety of articles made from sail-cloth including tool bags, blinds, camping beds, tents, army webbing, sails, tarpaulins and garden chairs. Examining articles for holes, tears, worn areas and other defects. Selecting thread according to specifications or colour of parts or dying thread to match colour and shade of cloth to be darned. Renovating sails and other articles by re-stitching defective seams, sewing up holes, or replacing components of fabric articles by hand sewing or by using sewing machines. Adding accessories like PVC windows, eyelets, ropes, or zips for fastening. Stamping grommets into canvas, using mallets and punches or eyelet machines. Sewing labels and emblems onto articles for identification. Cleaning stains from fabric or garments using spray guns and cleaning fluid. Checking repaired articles. Packing or repacking survival equipment to ensure that it meets specifications.

fields.name: Sales and Marketing Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the sales and marketing activities of an organisation.
fields.tasks: Determining price lists, discount and delivery terms, sales promotion budgets, sales methods, special incentives and campaigns.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures related to sales and marketing activities.      Establishing and managing budgets and controlling expenditure to ensure the efficient use of resources.      Leading and managing the activities of sales and marketing staff.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Planning and directing daily operations.      Planning and organizing special sales and marketing programmes based on sales records and market assessments.      Representing the enterprise or organization at sales and marketing conventions, trade exhibitions and other forums.

fields.name: Sales Assistant (General)
fields.description: Sells goods and services such as food, clothing, hardware, household appliances, office supplies and cosmetics in a retail or wholesale establishment.
fields.tasks: Greeting customers and ascertaining customer requirements.  Recommending, selecting and helping to locate or obtain items requested by customers. Showing and explaining to customers the relevant goods or services. Demonstrating the use or operation of product if appropriate. Preparing sales invoices and accepting payment for goods and services by a variety of payment methods. Assisting with the ongoing management of stock, and participating in stocktakes. Stacking and displaying goods for sale according to company directives. Maintaining knowledge of current sales and promotions. Placing special orders or contacting other branches to find required items. Carrying out of cashier duties if required to do so.

fields.name: Sales Clerk / Officer
fields.description: Receives and processes purchase and hire orders for goods and services, and provides information and advice about goods and services.
fields.tasks: Processing the orders and handling the sales queries of telephone or walk-in customers. Preparing, printing and mailing sales quotations, invoices and statements. Planning, managing and undertaking all administration related to the processing of sales orders. Issuing credit notes and handling account queries. Liaising with managers and warehouse staff regarding the items required. Liaising with service provides for the delivery of products to clients Dealing with client queries regarding orders placed or accounts received. Dealing with internal sales-related queries.

fields.name: Sales Demonstrator
fields.description: Displays and demonstrates goods at commercial premises, exhibitions and private homes.
fields.tasks: Setting up displays of sample merchandise in shops, at exhibitions or at private home for ‘product parties’. Inviting consumers to trial and view a product demonstration. Pro-actively interacting with customers and educating them on the key features of the product(s). Handing out catalogues or brochures that detailing the product or product range. Handing out small sample items to prospective customers when appropriate. Visually merchandising the product within company standards in order to create an eye-catching display. Educating merchandising staff from the store so that they’re able to promote or answer questions about the product. Writing orders for merchandise and arranging for payment. Delivering orders to party sponsor or individuals and collecting payment when appropriate.  Reporting on sales and competitor activities.

fields.name: Sales Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls, analyses and coordinates the sales strategy activities and the organisational integration thereof.
fields.tasks: Determining price lists, discount and delivery terms, sales promotion budgets, sales methods, special incentives and campaigns.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures related to sales and marketing activities.      Establishing and managing budgets and controlling expenditure to ensure the efficient use of resources.      Leading and managing the activities of sales and marketing staff.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Planning and directing daily operations.      Planning and organizing special sales and marketing programmes based on sales records and market assessments.      Representing the enterprise or organization at sales and marketing conventions, trade exhibitions and other forums.

fields.name: Sales Representative (Building and Plumbing Supplies)
fields.description: Represents their company in selling builders' timber, and building and plumbing hardware and supplies to wholesale and retail establishments. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Providing prospective customers with information about the characteristics and functions of the products and equipment for sale and demonstrating its uses or qualities. Quoting prices and credit terms, recording orders and arranging deliveries. Soliciting orders and selling goods to retail, industrial, wholesale and other establishments. Following up on clients to ensure satisfaction with products purchased. Reporting customers’ reactions and requirements to suppliers and manufacturers. Obtaining and updating knowledge of market conditions and competitors’ goods and services.

fields.name: Sales Representative (Business Services)
fields.description: Represents their company in selling financial, advertising and other business services.
fields.tasks: Selling advertising space in print publications, on websites, on outdoor media, or on radio or television to companies or individuals who want to advertise their products. Setting up meetings with prospective advertisers, assessing their needs and presenting proposals to them. Convincing advertisers of the best way to reach target consumers and closing sales deals. Answering questions, resolving any problems that arise and proposing new or additional advertising plans for clients. Analysing clients’ sales data and preparing reports. Traveling to meet with potential and current clients. Meeting monthly sales targets for the employing company.

fields.name: Sales Representative (Educational Products and Services)
fields.description: Represents companies in selling educational products and services.
fields.tasks: Acquiring and updating knowledge of employers’ and competitors’ goods and services.      Arranging delivery of goods, installation of equipment and the provision of services.      Assessing clients' needs and resources and recommending appropriate goods or services.      Compiling lists of prospective client businesses using directories and other sources.      Consulting with clients after sale to ensure satisfaction resolve any problems and provide ongoing support.      Developing reports and proposals as part of sales presentation to demonstrate goods or services.      Monitoring customers’ changing needs and reporting these developments to sales management.      Quoting and negotiating prices and credit terms. Preparing and administering sales contracts.

fields.name: Sales Representative (Medical and Pharmaceutical Products)
fields.description: Represents companies in selling medical, dental and veterinary equipment and supplies, and pharmaceutical products.
fields.tasks: Acquiring and updating knowledge of employers’ and competitors’ goods and services.      Arranging delivery of goods, installation of equipment and the provision of services.      Assessing clients' needs and resources and recommending appropriate goods or services.      Compiling lists of prospective client businesses using directories and other sources.      Consulting with clients after sale to ensure satisfaction resolve any problems and provide ongoing support.      Developing reports and proposals as part of sales presentation to demonstrate goods or services.      Monitoring customers’ changing needs and reporting these developments to sales management.      Quoting and negotiating prices and credit terms. Preparing and administering sales contracts.

fields.name: Sales Representative (Personal and Household Goods)
fields.description: Represents their company in selling consumer goods such as toys, sporting goods, books, stationery, hardware, floor coverings, furniture, textiles, clothing, footwear, toiletries and groceries to wholesale and retail establishments.
fields.tasks: Providing prospective customers with information about the characteristics and functions of the products and equipment for sale and demonstrating its uses or qualities.   Quoting prices and credit terms, recording orders and arranging deliveries.   Soliciting orders and selling goods to retail, industrial, wholesale and other establishments.   Following up on clients to ensure satisfaction with products purchased.   Reporting customers’ reactions and requirements to suppliers and manufacturers.   Obtaining and updating knowledge of market conditions and competitors’ goods and services.

fields.name: Sales Representative (Photographic Equipment and Supplies)
fields.description: Promotes and sells photographic products and equipment to retail stores and professional and commercial photography laboratories.
fields.tasks: Providing prospective customers with information about the characteristics and functions of the products and equipment for sale and demonstrating its uses or qualities.   Quoting prices and credit terms, recording orders and arranging deliveries.   Soliciting orders and selling goods to retail, industrial, wholesale and other establishments.   Following up on clients to ensure satisfaction with products purchased.   Reporting customers’ reactions and requirements to suppliers and manufacturers.   Obtaining and updating knowledge of market conditions and competitors’ goods and services.

fields.name: Sales Representative / Salesman (Industrial Products)
fields.description: Represents companies in selling a range of specialised chemicals, machines, manufacturing materials and other industrial supplies (excluding medical, pharmaceutical and ICT) for which a high level of technical knowledge is required.
fields.tasks: Compiling lists of prospective client businesses using directories and other sources. Acquiring and updating knowledge of employers’ and competitors’ goods and services, and market conditions. Visiting regular and prospective client businesses to establish and act on selling opportunities. Assessing clients' needs and resources and recommending appropriate goods or services. Providing input to product design where goods or services must be tailored to suit clients’ needs. Developing reports and proposals as part of sales presentation to demonstrate benefits from use of good or service. Estimating costs of installing and maintaining equipment or service. Monitoring customers’ changing needs and competitor activity, and reporting these developments to sales management. Quoting and negotiating prices and credit terms, and preparing and administering sales contracts. Arranging delivery of goods, installation of equipment and the provision of services. Reporting to sales management on sales made and the marketability of goods and services. Consulting with clients after sale to ensure satisfaction resolve any problems and provide ongoing support.

fields.name: Salon Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of a hairdressing or beauty salon.
fields.tasks: Managing client appointments. Welcoming and greeting customers who come to the salon. Carrying out treatments within qualification range. Selling beauty products and treatments. Resolving client complaints or issues. Ensuring high standards of hygiene, cleanliness within the salon. Managing salon staff. Setting targets for the beauty therapists. Identifying staff training requirements. Analysing weekly and monthly sales figures. Managing and forecasting retail stock levels. Controlling salon expenses. Organising promotion and marketing campaigns.

fields.name: Sand Blaster
fields.description: Operates sandblasting machines to clean and grind metal products and other hard surfaces.
fields.tasks: Operating a sandblast machine to remove paint, scale, grease, tar, rust, corrosion and foreign objects from various surfaces.   Turning valves on equipment to regulate the pressure and composition of the abrasive mixture flowing through the nozzle or into the tumbling barrel.   Masking specified areas of the object to protect them from abrading action.   Examining finished parts to ensure conformance to specifications.   Decorating glass using standblasting equipment by adjusting the speed and the angle from which the abrasive is being launched to create different shades.

fields.name: Saw Maker and Repairer
fields.description: Makes, repairs, sets and sharpens blades for circular, band and other saws. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Operating fixed or portable buffing and polishing machines. Sharpening cutting tools and instruments using grinding wheels or mechanically operated grinding machines. Repairing, adjusting and sharpening saw blades and metal teeth of cylinders in textile carding machines. Dressing grinding wheels, according to specifications. Monitoring machine operations to determine whether adjustments are necessary; stop machines when problems occur. Inspecting, feeling, and measuring work pieces to ensure that surfaces and dimensions meet specifications. Selecting and mounting grinding wheels on machines, according to specifications, using hand tools and applying knowledge of abrasives and grinding procedures.

fields.name: Scaffolder
fields.description: Erects and dismantles scaffolding to provide work platforms in building and industrial sites, and for temporary structures such as staging and seating.
fields.tasks: Erecting temporary metal or wooden scaffolding on building sites. Erecting framework, hoists, or roof supports, using hand tools, plumb rule and level. Anchoring and bracing forms and other structures in place, using nails, bolts, anchor rods, steel cables, planks, wedges, and timbers. Climbing tall structures such as towers, chimneys and spires. Loading or unloading building materials to be used in construction. Assisting other construction workers such as carpenters, bricklayers, plasterers, and tilers. Dismantling scaffolding in building and industrial sites.

fields.name: Scale Fitter
fields.description: Installs, repairs and calibrates a variety of scales. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Assembling, installing, repairing and maintaining a wide variety of scales and weighing instruments. Applying knowledge of mechanical, electronic, hydraulic, pneumatic and software components. Setting up, adjusting, and operating all of the basic machine tools and many specialized or advanced variation tools to perform precision machining operations. Measuring, examining, or testing completed units to check for defects and ensuring conformance to specifications, using precision instruments, such as micrometers. Installing repaired parts into equipment or installing new equipment. Installing experimental parts or assemblies, such as hydraulic systems, electrical wiring, lubricants, or batteries into machines or mechanisms. Testing experimental models under simulated operating conditions for purposes such as development, standardisation, or feasibility of design.

fields.name: School Laboratory Technician
fields.description: Prepares experiments and demonstrations, makes up solutions, prepares slides, orders books and equipment, and tidies up laboratories in support of teaching chemistry, earth sciences, life sciences and physical sciences.
fields.tasks: Assessing students and offering advice, criticism and encouragement.      Obtaining specimens, cultivating, isolating and identifying microorganisms for analysis. Operating, calibrating and maintaining equipment used in experiments. Setting up, cleaning, and maintaining laboratory equipment.

fields.name: School Principal
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the educational and administrative aspects of primary and secondary schools.
fields.tasks: Controlling the administrative operations of a school including budgeting, report preparation, and expenditure. Controlling the selection, training and supervision of staff. Determining educational programs based on frameworks established by education authorities and governing bodies. Developing and enforcing a disciplinary code to create a safe and conducive environment for students and teachers. Directing administrative and clerical activities concerning student admissions and educational services. Evaluating the work of teachers by visiting classrooms, observing teaching methods, reviewing instructional objectives and examining learning materials. Implementing systems and procedures to monitor school performance and student enrolments. Organising and implementing methods of raising additional funds in conjunction with parent and community groups and sponsors. Promoting the educational program, and representing the service or institution in the wider community. Providing leadership and guidance to teaching, academic and administrative staff as well as to students.

fields.name: Scout
fields.description: Identifies, monitors and reports on weeds, pests and diseases in orchards, fields and nurseries.
fields.tasks: Knowing about all the different weeds, pests and diseases that affect particular plants and being able to identify them.   Monitoring plants in orchards, fields and nurseries and reporting any weeds, pests or diseases identified. Assisting in mixing chemical solutions, such as pesticides, herbicides and fertilisers.   Assisting with spraying fungicides and pesticides onto plants to destroy diseases and insects using hand- or engine-powered pump sprayers. Weeding or thinning out crops by hand or by using hoes.

fields.name: Scraper Operator
fields.description: Operates mobile scrapers to remove soil and overburden.
fields.tasks: Performing safety checks before operating the scraper and ensuring all equipment function properly. Scooping up large amounts of earth and loading it in the scraper’s bowls, hauling it to where it must go, dumping and spreading it. Stripping the surface material (overburden) and preparing site for further development. Operating the scraper on road building and surface mining sites, rock quarries a well as sand and gravel pits. Keeping safety in mind as the scraper is one of the fastest earthmoving equipment. Performing routine maintenance tasks on the scraper such as lubricating, fuelling and cleaning.

fields.name: Screen Printer
fields.description: Prepares screens, sets up and operates power-driven or hand-operated screen printing equipment on variety of substrates. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Preparing screens from which images are printed onto all types of materials, such as fabric, glass, plastic – in fact, almost any surface. Familiarity with colour matching, ink mixing, knowing what inks to use on a particular surface, as well as knowledgeable about different textiles when printing on caps, T-shirts, conference bags, posters, or corri-boards. Assessing artwork and colour proofs of the project before starting with the print job by taking into account factors such as the right colour, the right position, and the right product. Using screen-printing on items such as decals, clock and watch faces, balloons, and many other products. Monitoring machine operations and quality of printing.

fields.name: Scribe
fields.description: Writes letters and complete forms on behalf of illiterate persons.
fields.tasks: Reading letters and other written material to persons who are unable to read or write and providing necessary interpretation and information. Offering assistance to individuals in reading and interpreting government and other official forms. Helping individuals with the completion of government and other official forms. Writing letters on behalf of others.

fields.name: Sculptor
fields.description: Conceives and creates three-dimensional forms to communicate impressions and ideas by carving or modelling materials such as wood, stone, clay and metal or assembling found and manufactured materials. This occupation requires high levels of creative talen
fields.tasks: Conceiving and developing ideas, designs and styles for sculptures.   Selecting, arranging and positioning objects and models according to the chosen subject matter. Selecting the method and materials to be used.      Using techniques such as carving, clay-moulding, gluing, welding and bolting to create or assemble three-dimensional sculptures with materials such as wood, stone, clay and metal.   Painting and/or decorating sculptures.   Restoring damaged sculptures.

fields.name: Seafood Processing Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets, operates and attends machinery used to process fish.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machinery that trims seafood into standard cuts. Using freezing and cooling equipment and machines to freeze or cool seafood. Operating seafood smoking equipment. Minding machines that process or can seafood. Tending machines that mix or blend spices for seafood. Pouring specified amounts of materials and ingredients into machinery or equipment. Observing or monitoring machines to ensure safe and efficient operation.

fields.name: Secondary Health Services Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates secondary health services.
fields.tasks: Advising government bodies about measures to improve health and welfare services and facilities.      Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation and expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and performance standards for medical, nursing, technical and administrative staff.      Directing or conducting recruitment, hiring and training of personnel.      Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of medical, nursing, technical, clerical, service, maintenance, and other personnel.     Liaising with other health and welfare service providers, boards and funding bodies to coordinate the provision of services.      Monitoring the use of diagnostic services, inpatient beds, facilities, and staff to ensure effective use of resources and assessing the need for additional staff, equipment, and services.      Providing overall direction and management for the service, facility, organisation or centre.      Representing the organisation in negotiations, and at conventions, seminars, public hearings and forums.

fields.name: Secretary (General)
fields.description: Performs secretarial, clerical and other administrative tasks in support of managers and professionals.
fields.tasks: Checking, formatting and transcribing correspondence, minutes and reports from dictation, electronic documents or written drafts to conform to office standards using personal computers or other word-processing equipment. Dealing with incoming and outgoing mail. Dealing with routine correspondence using own initiative. Organising and supervising filing systems. Scanning, recording and distributing mail, correspondence and documents. Screening and recording leave and other staff-members' entitlements. Screening requests for meetings or appointments and helping to organise meetings. Using various computer software packages including spreadsheets to provide administrative support.

fields.name: Secretary Bargaining Council
fields.description: Facilitates coordination of industry collective bargaining processes and procedures.
fields.tasks: Drafting administrative correspondence and minutes. Writing and answering business or technical letters and other similar correspondence. Preparing verbatim reports of proceedings in legislative assemblies, courts of law or other places using shorthand or specialised office equipment. Screening requests for meetings, scheduling and organizing meetings and travel arrangements. Obtaining, proposing and monitoring deadlines and follow-up dates. Assisting in the preparation of budgets, monitoring of expenditures, drafting of contracts and purchasing or acquisition orders. Liaising with other staff about a range of matters relating to the organization’s operations. Supervising the work of clerical support workers.

fields.name: Securities Dealer
fields.description: Buys and sells securities within financial markets and trades and distributes financial securities on behalf of financial institutions.
fields.tasks: Trading stocks or bonds in the financial market to raise capital for customers. Analysing market trends for securities, bonds, stocks and other financial instruments, including foreign exchange. Informing prospective customers about market conditions and prospects. Obtaining information about the financial circumstances of customers and companies in which investments may be made. Recording and transmitting buy and sell orders for securities, stocks, bonds or other financial instruments and for foreign exchange for future or immediate delivery.

fields.name: Securities Services Administrative Officer
fields.description: Handles the administrative work associated with the execution and finalisation of financial markets transactions.
fields.tasks: Recording, filing and looking after stocks, bonds and other investment documents. Maintaining records of bonds, shares and other securities bought or sold on behalf of clients or the employer. Obtaining all required source documents and forms (including identity documents, trust documents and company documents) to prepare agreements, National Credit Act (NCA) quotes and all related security documents for all loans and overdrafts. Opening accounts on the system and updating the Electronic Securities Register (ESR) with securities required as pending. Maintaining proper records of correspondence from attorneys and financial institutions. Managing security safekeeping and recording in accordance with the banking regulations. Following up receipt of the original bond and title deeds from attorneys. Drawing up loan agreements, facility letters or NCA quotes for re-advances or increased facilities where applicable.

fields.name: Security Consultant
fields.description: Advises clients on security requirements, and recommends and designs security specifications.
fields.tasks: Managing the security process. Keeping informed about security research, products and threats. Conducting security risk assessments. Providing ongoing risk management advice to decision makers and clients. Requesting quotations from security service providers on the client's behalf. Attending meetings with security companies. Communicating with the South African Police Service (SAPS). Attending and providing security workshops. Providing security management reports. Creating and implementing security standards, policies and procedures.

fields.name: Security Officer
fields.description: Patrols and guards industrial and commercial property, railway yards, stations or other facilities.
fields.tasks: Controlling access to establishments, monitoring and authorising the entrance or departure of employees and visitors, checking identification and issuing security passes.   Patrolling premises and checking doors, windows and gates to prevent and detect signs of unauthorised entry.   Circulating among visitors, patrons, or employees to preserve order, protect property from theft or vandalism and enforce the regulations of the establishment. Responding to alarms, investigating disturbances and contacting superiors, police or fire-fighters as appropriate.        Picking up and ensuring the safe delivery of cash and valuables to banks, automated teller machines and retail establishments. Performing security checks of passengers and luggage at airports.

fields.name: Security Services Manager
fields.description: Directs an organisation's security functions, including physical security and safety of employees, facilities, and assets.
fields.tasks: Leading and managing security services. Recruiting, maintaining and managing a workforce of sufficient, appropriately skilled and motivated security employees. Driving a culture of high performance, commitment and professionalism. Devising and overseeing security protocols.  Creating and maintaining structures and processes to ensure that all clients' requirements are met. Working closely with the police and other security service providers in order to prevent crime and catch criminals.

fields.name: Seed Processing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines and performs routine tasks to process and package seed.
fields.tasks: Operating seed processing equipment including threshing machines, extraction machines, dryers, priming units, laboratory germination cabinets, cleaning machines, pelleting machines and film coaters. Operating and minding machines that count, weigh and package seeds. Preparing dispatch containers for delivery of packaged seeds to customers. Performing routine maintenance of machinery and equipment.

fields.name: Senior Government Manager
fields.description: Manages a department, providing direct support to the minister, through strategic leadership and within a designed strategic planning framework, whilst ensuring an integration of governance throughout the department.
fields.tasks: Advising national, state, regional or local governments and legislators on policy matters. Advising on the preparation of government budgets, laws and regulations, including amendments. Coordinating activities with other senior government managers and officials. Ensuring appropriate systems and procedures are developed and implemented to provide budgetary control. Establishing objectives for government departments or agencies in accordance with government legislation and policy. Formulating or approving and evaluating programs and procedures for the implementation of government polices in conjunction or consultation with government. Making presentations to legislative and other government committees regarding policies programs or budgets. .Overseeing the interpretation and implementation of government policies and legislation by government departments and agencies. Recommending, reviewing, evaluating and approving documents, briefs and reports submitted by middle managers and senior staff members.

fields.name: Senior Government Official
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls, reviews and oversees the interpretation and implementation of government policies and legislation.
fields.tasks: Advising national, state, regional or local governments and legislators on policy matters.      Advising on the preparation of government budgets, laws and regulations, including amendments.      Coordinating activities with other senior government managers and officials.      Ensuring appropriate systems and procedures are developed and implemented to provide budgetary control.      Establishing objectives for government departments or agencies in accordance with government legislation and policy.      Formulating or approving and evaluating programs and procedures for the implementation of government polices in conjunction or consultation with government.      Making presentations to legislative and other government committees regarding policies programs or budgets.      Overseeing the interpretation and implementation of government policies and legislation by government departments and agencies.      Recommending, reviewing, evaluating and approving documents, briefs and reports submitted by middle managers and senior staff members.

fields.name: Senior Police Officer
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and reviews the day-to-day operations and major functions of organisational units of the south African police and metro police services through subordinate officers.
fields.tasks: Advising national, state, regional or local governments and legislators on policy matters.      Advising on the preparation of government budgets, laws and regulations, including amendments.      Coordinating activities with other senior government managers and officials.      Ensuring appropriate systems and procedures are developed and implemented to provide budgetary control.      Establishing objectives for government departments or agencies in accordance with government legislation and policy.      Formulating or approving and evaluating programs and procedures for the implementation of government polices in conjunction or consultation with government.      Making presentations to legislative and other government committees regarding policies programs or budgets.      Overseeing the interpretation and implementation of government policies and legislation by government departments and agencies.      Recommending, reviewing, evaluating and approving documents, briefs and reports submitted by middle managers and senior staff members.

fields.name: Septic Tank Cleaner
fields.description: Cleans any type of septic tank.
fields.tasks: Flushing out tanks to break up the scum layer at the top of the tank. Pumping the effluent inside the septic tank into a septic tanker truck and then back to the tank to mix the sludge that settles at the bottom of the tank with the liquid layer above it. Checking the septic tank structure for wear and tear. Checking the baffles located at the top of the tank. Removing old, worn-out baffles and replacing them with new ones as required. Checking ventilation shafts during a tank inspection, replacing any missing ventilation grates, and repairing or replacing any damaged seals.

fields.name: Service Station Attendant
fields.description: Sells fuel, lubricants and other automotive accessories, and performs minor maintenance on motor vehicles at a service station.
fields.tasks: Filling fuel tanks and containers with fuel to the level or quantity specified by customers. Washing vehicle windscreens and windows. Checking and replenishing air pressure in vehicle tyres, and oil and other vehicle fluid levels. Performing minor repair work to vehicles such as replacing tyres, light bulbs and windscreen wiper blades. Collecting payments from customers for purchases. Cleaning petrol pumps and the surrounding driveway, shop and facilities. Maintaining and operating automatic car wash facilities. Undertaking stock control and preparing reports on fuel, oil, accessories and other items sold.

fields.name: Set Designer
fields.description: Designing and painting stage scenery.
fields.tasks: Designing sets for theatrical, television and film productions.   Conferring with director regarding interpretation and set requirements.   Conducting research to determine appropriate architectural and furnishing styles.   Integrating requirements, interpretation, research, design concepts and practical considerations regarding factors such as mobility, interchangeability as well as budget to plan sets.   Rendering drawing or illustration of design concept, estimating costs and presenting drawing for approval.   Preparing working drawings of floor plan, front elevation, scenery and properties to be constructed.   Preparing charts to indicate where items, such as curtains and borders are to be hung.   Overseeing building of sets, furniture and properties.   Building scale models from cardboard, plaster or sponge.   Designing stage lighting to achieve dramatic or decorative effects.

fields.name: Sewing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates and monitors sewing machines to make, repair, darn and renovate textile, fur, synthetic or leather garments or embroider ornamental designs on garments or other materials. They operate button hole making and eyelet holing machines to cut holes, s
fields.tasks: Operating or tending sewing machines to perform garment sewing operations, such as joining, reinforcing, seaming or decorating garments or garment parts. Attaching buttons, hooks, zippers, fasteners, or other accessories to fabric, using feeding hoppers or clamp holders. Tending semi-automatic sewing machines with multiple-sewing heads controlled by pattern chain that embroiders various designs on garment. Operating machines, such as single or double needle serging and flat-bed felling machines, to automatically join, reinforce, or decorate material or articles. Operating fur sewing machines to join fur pelt strips to required size and shape and join pelts into garment sections or shells. Operating stitching machines to sew leather parts together for leather garments, handbags, gloves. Monitoring machine operation to detect problems such as defective stitching, breaks in thread, or machine malfunctions. Performing equipment maintenance tasks such as replacing needles.

fields.name: Sheet Metal Worker
fields.description: Makes, installs and repairs articles and parts of articles made out of sheet metal such as sheet steel, copper, tin, brass, aluminium, zinc, galvanised iron or other substitutes. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Manufacturing various types of articles and components out of sheet metal less than three millimetres thick. Making and installing sheet metal ducts for air-conditioning, heating and ventilation systems. Making and installing metal for kitchen walls and counters and stamped metal for roofing and siding. Installing roof gutters and downpipes for rainwater drainage and making skylights and vents for industrial buildings. Manufacturing most metal components in workshops where the metal pieces to be used are measured, cut, bent, shaped and joined. Cementing, bolting, riveting, soldering or welding together metal pieces to form ducts, pipes, tubes and other items. Treating some products against rust by galvanising, tin-plating or treating with certain chemicals.

fields.name: Shelf Filler
fields.description: Fills up shelves and display areas in a store or supermarket.
fields.tasks: Replenishing merchandise on shelves and display areas in a store or supermarket. Ensuring that shelves and merchandise displays remain stocked. Rotating merchandise on the shelves, ensuring that those with earlier use-by dates are at the front and removing stock that has passed this date. Sorting and repacking merchandise that has been placed in the incorrect place by customers. Working after hour to tidy the store and ensure that it is neat and tidy, with fully stocked shelves for the next day’s trade. Assisting customers to locate specific goods in the store. Acting as a cashier in small establishments.

fields.name: Sheltered Workshop Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in sheltered workshops.
fields.tasks: Producing craft items for sale through speciality stores or craft markets, or as corporate gifts. Using hand craft and basis machine operation skills in the areas of woodwork, spinning and weaving, embroidery, pottery, cooking and baking. Using basic farming skills to grow vegetables for sale using traditional or hydroponic methods. Counting items and packing them into boxes or other containers for transport and sale. Following the instructions provided by trainers and volunteers in order to learn new craft skills.

fields.name: Ship's Engineer
fields.description: Controls and manages the operation and maintenance of the plant and equipment of ships.
fields.tasks: Controlling and participating in the operation, maintenance and repair of mechanical, electrical and electronic equipment and machinery on board ship. Ordering fuel and other engine-room department stores and maintaining record of operations. Performing technical supervision of the installation, maintenance and repair of ship’s machinery and equipment to ensure compliance with specifications and regulations. Inspecting and conducting maintenance and emergency repairs to engines, machinery and auxiliary equipment. Standing engine room watch, monitoring and noting performance of engines, machinery and auxiliary equipment.

fields.name: Ship's Master
fields.description: Controls and manages the operations of a ship or boat.
fields.tasks: Commanding and navigating ship or similar vessel at sea or on inland waterways. Controlling and participating in deck and bridge-watch activities. Ensuring safe loading and unloading of cargo and observance of safety regulations and procedures by crew and passengers. Applying knowledge of principles and practices relating to ship’s operation and navigation in order to identify and solve problems arising in the course of their work. Ordering ship’s stores and recruiting crew as required and maintaining record of operations. Transmitting and receiving routine and emergency information with shore stations and other ships. Navigating vessels into and out of ports and through channels, straits and other waters where special knowledge is required.

fields.name: Ship's Officer
fields.description: Navigates and controls the safe operation of a ship and supervises and coordinates the activities of deck crew.
fields.tasks: Navigating vessels into and out of ports and through channels, straits and other waters where special knowledge is required. Controlling and participating in deck and bridge-watch activities. Ensuring safe loading and unloading of cargo and observance of safety regulations and procedures by crew and passengers. Performing technical supervision of maintenance and repair of ship to ensure compliance with specifications and regulations. Applying knowledge of principles and practices relating to ship’s operation and navigation in order to identify and solve problems arising in the course of their work. Ordering ship’s stores and recruiting crew as required and maintaining record of operations. Transmitting and receiving routine and emergency information with shore stations and other ships.

fields.name: Ship's Purser
fields.description: Coordinates administrative and logistic processes on board a ship on behalf of ship's crew and passengers.
fields.tasks: Carrying out business-related tasks and other functions on cruise and cargo ships. Preparing and maintaining payrolls for crew members. Preparing clearance papers and relevant documentation for foreign customers or shipments. Preparing the legal documentation for ship and customs declarations. Preparing activity plans for guest entertainment on cruise ships such as games, parties or on-shore visits during docking. Maintaining the flow of daily activities on cruise liners. Assisting guests with documentation such as passports and travel documents. Publicising the rules and orders from crew managers among other crew members.

fields.name: Ship's Surveyor
fields.description: Surveys machines and hulls of ships to ensure they are constructed, equipped and maintained according to safety standards, rules and regulations laid down by marine authorities.
fields.tasks: Performing inspections required by domestic statutes and international conventions by the International Maritime Organisation (IMO). Inspecting ships to make sure that ships, components and machinery are built according to the standards required for their class. Conducting a variety of operating tests and inspecting interior conditions. Monitoring and reporting the conditions of the equipment, machinery, and products of vessels. Measuring ships for tonnage and surveying them for load line assignment. Preparing reports and providing recommendations for maintenance and repairs. Acting as investigator and expert witnesses in marine accidents.

fields.name: Shipwright
fields.description: Constructs, fits out and repairs ships. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Constructing, fitting out, commissioning and repairing all kinds of vessels ranging from small pleasure craft through to a range of competitive, commercial and naval vessels. Using metal, wood, aluminium, plastic, fibreglass and composites or Ferro cement (reinforced cement or concrete) materials to build vessels. Scaling plans for fabrication or cutting of hull sections. Studying plans and specifications and producing templates and patterns from full size drawings. Preparing slipways and constructing cradles to support ships during construction, transportation launching and slipping. Positioning sections accurately prior to permanent fastening by boilermakers or welders. Constructing cradles, bilging and keeling block supports to support ships during construction. Determining repair requirements/procedures.

fields.name: Shoemaker
fields.description: Makes and repairs footwear.
fields.tasks: Studying work orders and/or shoe part tags to obtain information about workloads, specifications, and the types of materials to be used. Studying drawings and other specifications to make footwear according to customer’s needs. Checking the texture, colour and strength of leather to ensure that it is adequate for a particular purpose. Cutting out, shaping and padding parts of the leather for making shoes. Attaching insoles to shoe lasts and affixing shoe uppers. Cementing, nailing, or sewing soles and heels to shoes. Shaping shoe heels with a knife, and sanding them on a buffing wheel for smoothness. Making, modifying or repairing standard footwear to meet individual requirements. Making, modifying and repairing orthopaedic or therapeutic footwear according to doctors' prescriptions. Taking plaster casts of legs or foot requiring orthopaedic footwear in order to prepare the drawings.

fields.name: Shotcreter
fields.description: Performs shotcreting operations to provide support for unsafe or unstable excavations on surface or underground.
fields.tasks: Preparing wet and dry shotcrete mixes for application to mine and tunnel walls in order to stablise and support them. Placing and securing fibres or frames made of steel and other materials onto which the shotcrete will be sprayed. Setting up and operating shotcrete machines and equipment. Performing minor maintenance and repairs and lubricating and cleaning machines, equipment and tools. Working as part of a mining production team.
