Completing records detailing operations completed during shifts.

fields.name: Shotfirer
fields.description: Assembles, positions and detonates explosives for surface blasting.
fields.tasks: Ensuring that procedures and regulations for workplace safety and for explosives handling, storage and transport are followed. Determining the quantity and type of explosives to be used. Planning and giving instructions for the layout of surface explosives. Assembling primer charges using detonators and explosive cartridges, and attaching electrical wires, fuses and detonating cords to primers. Connecting wires, fuses and detonator cords into series, testing electrical circuits, and connecting series to blasting machines. Ensuring that all explosives are detonated, and reporting and attending to misfires. Declaring blast areas safe before and after detonation of explosives. Compiling and maintaining records about the usage of explosives in compliance with laws and regulations.

fields.name: Sign Erector
fields.description: Erects and installs signs, and cleans signs and their sites after installation.
fields.tasks: Assembling, erecting and maintaining roadside signs and billboards at designated locations using hand and power tools. Digging holes with posthole diggers or shovels, and placing wood or metal posts into holes. Filling the holes with concrete and tamping it to hold posts in vertical position. Driving channel-metal posts into the ground using an air hammer. Fixing sign panels to sign posts or frames using hand tools or power tools. Replacing worn and damaged signs.

fields.name: Signal Soldier
fields.description: Practise, exercise and employ military signal tactics, techniques and procedures during military war and peace operations.
fields.tasks: Coordinating armour, artillery, and air support units.      Directing deployment of land defence weapons, vehicles, and equipment. Directing location, construction, and camouflage of landward defence positions and equipment.      Managing field communications.      Driving and operating specialised military vehicles designed for combat operations.      Performing strategic and tactical planning, including battle plan development and reconnaissance operations.

fields.name: Signwriter
fields.description: Designs, fabricates and paints signs for displays, buildings, hoardings, boats and structures. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Painting decorative free-hand designs on objects, such as pottery, glass, cigarette cases, and lampshades. Transferring from paper transfers decorative or ornamental designs on articles. Integrating and developing visual elements, such as line, space, mass, colour, and perspective, in order to produce desired effects such as the illustration of ideas, emotions, or moods. Laying out and painting in one or more languages letters, figures, monograms and designs to make signs. Using software and routing equipment to produce 3D carved images for application onto larger signage as well as engraved and inlaid signs. Writing, painting, or printing signs or show cards used for display or other purposes. Placing signs on shop windows. Using different techniques to paint on glass.

fields.name: Silicon Chip Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines which make silicon chips.
fields.tasks: Controlling the preparation, measuring and feeding of raw materials and in-process products into the machine. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of the machine and to verify specified processing conditions. Analysing sample products, performing tests, recording data and writing production logs. Informing supervisors if machine requires adjustment, maintenance or repair.

fields.name: Singer
fields.description: Entertains by singing songs. This occupation requires high levels of creative talent or personal commitment and interest as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications or experience.
fields.tasks: Practising and rehearsing to maintain a high standard of performance. Adapting or arranging music for particular voice or vocal groups or occasions. Selecting music for performances and working with conductors, producers and other musicians in the planning of performances.    Performing as a soloist or as a member of a choir or a musical group.  Recording performances.

fields.name: Skills Development Administrator
fields.description: Maintains and updates organisational skills development plans, reports, programmes and projects.
fields.tasks: Assisting the Skills Development Facilitator (SDF) to implement knowledge management processes to undertake skills gap analysis, define training needs and development skills plans. Assisting with administration of training programmes and delivering on current and future plans. Managing mandatory and regulatory training such as health and safety training. Managing the administration of internal and external training. Assisting with the development of competency profiles. Assisting with the implementation of appropriate Learnerships and skills programmes. Maintaining an accurate database on training undertaken and service providers used.

fields.name: Skills Development Facilitator / Practitioner
fields.description: Analyses the skills requirements within an organisation and coordinates the execution of the personal development plans of employees and monitors the implementation of the workplace skills plan and reports accordingly.
fields.tasks: Evaluating and promoting a learning culture in a company. Strategically aligning the training and development of skills in a company. Conducting analyses to determine the outcomes of all training. Serving as a resource with regard to all aspects of skills development. Identifying scarce skills and developing training and skills development plans. Co-ordinating skills development interventions in the company. Acting as a liaison between your employer and your company’s Sector Education Training Authority (SETA). Communicating Seta initiatives, grants and benefits to the employer. Communicating with all employees in the main office and branch offices concerning events and grants being offered at the SETA.

fields.name: Skin Care Therapist
fields.description: Provides skin analyses, facial therapies and skin-care treatments to clients.
fields.tasks: Treating clients’ facial skin to maintain and improve its appearance. Doing facials, skin care treatments and facial cleansing for clients using specialised techniques and products. Giving advice and evaluating the clients’ skin. Demonstrating how to clean and care for skin properly and recommending skin-care routines. Selecting and applying suitable cosmetic products. Selling appropriate salon products to clients for home use.

fields.name: Skipper (Fishing Boat)
fields.description: Controls fishing operations to catch fish, crustacea and molluscs ior gather other forms of aquatic life in inland or coastal waters, for sale or delivery on a regular basis to wholesale buyers, marketing organizations or at markets.
fields.tasks: Selecting area for fishing, plotting courses and computing navigational positions using compass, charts and other aids. Operating fishing vessels to, from and at fishing grounds. Direct fishing operations, and supervising fishing crew members. Preparing and repairing nets and other fishing gear and equipment. Baiting, setting, operating and hauling in fishing gear by hand or using hoisting equipment. Removing catches from fishing equipment, measuring them to ensure compliance with legal size and returning undesirable or illegal catches to the water. Sorting, and storing catch in holds with salt and ice. Gathering various forms of aquatic life from shores and shallow waters. Keeping records of transactions, fishing activities, weather and sea conditions and estimating costs and budgets. Maintaining engine fishing gear and other on-board equipment.

fields.name: Slaughterer
fields.description: Slaughters livestock in abattoirs.
fields.tasks: Slaughtering animals in accordance with regulations and/or religious laws. Shackling hind legs of animals to raise them for slaughtering or skinning. Skinning sections of animals or whole animals. Severing jugular veins to drain blood from carcasses. Shaving or singeing carcasses. Washing carcasses in preparation for further processing or packaging. Slitting open, eviscerating and trimming carcasses of slaughtered animals. Cutting and sorting viscera of slaughtered animals to separate edible portions from offal. Trimming, cleaning, or curing animal hides.

fields.name: Small Business Manager
fields.description: Manages, organises, and controls the operations and resources of a small or own business.
fields.tasks: Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation, expenditure on supplies, equipment and services. Coordinating cooperation with other service provision agencies in the same or related fields. Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and standards for staff. Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of professional technical, clerical, service, maintenance, and other personnel. Managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources. Monitoring and evaluating resources devoted to the provision of services. Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff. Planning, directing and coordinating the provision of services. Providing overall direction and management for a service, facility, organization or centre.

fields.name: Small Engine Mechanic
fields.description: Maintains, tests and repairs engines of chainsaws, lawn mowers, garden tractors and other equipment with small engines. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Repairing and servicing power equipment ranging from racing motorcycles to chain saws. Following a checklist including the inspection and cleaning of brakes, electrical systems, fuel injection systems, plugs, carburetors, and other parts. Repairing or adjusting parts that do not work properly, or replacing unfixable parts. Doing routine maintenance as a major part of the work. Diagnosing mechanical, fuel, and electrical problems, and making repairs in a minimal amount of time. Using special computerised diagnostic testing equipment as a preliminary tool in analysing equipment when employed at larger companies. Using common handtools such as wrenches, pliers, and screwdrivers for certain jobs. Using power tools, such as drills and grinders when required.

fields.name: Small Offset Printing Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, operates and maintains small offset printing presses to print specified printing jobs on a variety of substrates, such as paper, paperboard, vinyl and plastic.
fields.tasks: Producing digital print images, and transferring and outputting the images. Producing a variety of printed products using small lithographic printing presses and in-line finishing systems. Loading paper and other substrates into feeding mechanisms. Mixing ink and solvents to standard, and regulating substrate and ink supply during print runs. Setting, adjusting and monitoring substrate-feed mechanisms, delivery mechanisms, inking systems and other printing machine functions. Monitoring machine operations and the quality of printing. Monitoring and evaluating the press process to check print quality standards against proofs and to detect malfunctions. Maintaining, adjusting, repairing and cleaning machines.

fields.name: Snow Groomer
fields.description: Manipulates snow for recreational uses.
fields.tasks: Creating high quality sliding conditions by building and shaping trails with interesting features.   Performing pre-start up inspections of snow grooming machines as per established checklists. Grooming the trail by removing moguls, and processing and compressing the snow.   Constructing competition courses and challenging race courses.   Maintaining snow depth in high traffic areas and pushing out snow from snow fences and snow drifts.   Removing excess snow around lift stations and covering creeks, rocks and other obstacles.   Performing shut down and post-operational procedures including documentation regarding machine maintenance.   Observing and adhering to all company safety, operating and maintenance procedures.

fields.name: Snow Maker
fields.description: Operates machinery to make snow.
fields.tasks: Tending artificial snow making equipment to produce artificial snow for sport, recreation, film and fun.    Attaching hoses from snow equipment to nozzles of above-ground outlets for underground compressed air and water pipelines, using wrenches.   Turning outlet valves to adjust compressed air and water mixture to obtain desired snow spray.   Repositioning equipment periodically to direct snowfall to other sections of trail or closing valves to shut off equipment when snow coverage is completed.   Cleaning dirt and frozen snow from equipment using hand tools.

fields.name: Social Auxiliary Worker
fields.description: Assists the work of social services professionals by providing services and counselling support to individuals, families and communities.
fields.tasks: Collecting information relevant to clients’ needs and assessing their relevant skills, strengths and deficits. Assisting clients to identify options and develop plans of action while providing necessary support and assistance. Assisting clients to identify and access community resources including legal, medical and financial assistance housing, employment, transportation, assistance with moves, day care and other referral services. Providing crisis intervention and emergency shelter services Implementing life skills workshops, substance abuse treatment programs, behaviour management programs, youth services programs and other community and social service programs under the supervision of social work or health care professionals. Assisting in evaluating the effectiveness of interventions and programs by monitoring and reporting on clients' progress. Maintaining contact with other social service agencies, schools and health care providers involved with clients to provide information and obtain feedback on clients' overall situation and progress.

fields.name: Social Counselling Worker
fields.description: Provides socially related counselling services of a specific nature. May work in a call centre.
fields.tasks: Analysing the client's situation and presenting alternative approaches to resolving problems, Interviewing clients individually, in families, or in groups, to assess their situation and problems and determine the types of services required, Maintaining contact with other social service agencies, educational institutions and health care providers involved with clients to provide information and obtain feedback on clients' overall situation and progress, Providing counselling, therapy and mediation services and facilitating group sessions to assist clients to develop skills and insights needed to deal with and resolve their social and personal problems,

fields.name: Social Sciences Teacher (Grades 4 - 9)
fields.description: Teaches social sciences within a prescribed curriculum from grades 4 - 9 school students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Social Security Assessor
fields.description: Assesses social welfare claims and entitlements under government legislation and investigates fraud and suspected breaches of legislation.
fields.tasks: Advising individuals and organisations on government laws, rules and regulations concerning government benefit programs and the determination and disbursement of payments or referral to services, as well as on the public’s rights and obligations. Assessing documentation and interviewing benefit recipients to ensure eligibility for continuing benefits or services. Examining applications and other relevant documents to determine type and amount of benefit which individuals are eligible to receive. Performing related administrative tasks to maintain client records and prepare reports on determinations regarding eligibility, referral decisions, termination of benefits and abuse or fraud.

fields.name: Social Services Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates a centre, program or project concerned with social services.
fields.tasks: Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation, expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and standards for staff.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Liaising with other welfare and health services providers, boards and funding bodies to discuss areas of health and welfare service cooperation and coordination.      Monitoring and evaluating resources devoted to the provision of welfare, housing, and other social services.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Providing overall direction and management for a service, facility, organisation or centre.      Representing the organisation at conventions, seminars and conferences.      Representing the organszation in negotiations, and at conventions, seminars, public hearings and forums

fields.name: Social Worker
fields.description: Assesses the social needs of individuals, families and groups, assists and empowers people to develop and use the skills and resources needed to resolve social and other problems, and furthers human well-being and human rights, social justice and social development.
fields.tasks: Interviewing clients individually, in families, or in groups, to assess their situation and problems and determine the types of services required. Analyzing the client's situation and presenting alternative approaches to resolving problems. Compiling case records or reports for courts and other legal proceedings. Providing counselling, therapy and mediation services and facilitating group sessions to assist clients to develop skills and insights needed to deal with and resolve their social and personal problems. Planning and implementing programs of assistance for clients including crisis intervention and referral to agencies that provide financial assistance, legal aid, housing, medical treatment and other services. Investigating cases of abuse or neglect and taking action to protect children and other at risk persons. Maintaining contact with other social service agencies, educational institutions and health care providers involved with clients to provide information and obtain feedback on clients' overall situation and progress.

fields.name: Sociologist
fields.description: Researches the science of society, social institutions and social relationships, and specifically the systematic study of development, structure, interaction and collective behaviour of organised human groups.
fields.tasks: Conducting research on different aspects of human society, including group forming and group behaviour, societal institutions, cultures and the relationship between individual behaviour and societal beliefs. Developing theories, models and methods to interpret and describe social phenomena. Advising on the practical application of research findings in the formulation of economic and social policies for population groups and regions. Evaluating the outcome of political decisions concerning social policy. Preparing scholarly papers and reports.

fields.name: Software Developer
fields.description: Researches, analyzes and evaluates requirements for existing or new software applications and designs, develops, tests and maintains software solutions.
fields.tasks: Assessing, developing, upgrading and documenting maintenance procedures for operating systems, communications environments and applications software.      Consulting with customers concerning maintenance of software system.      Consulting with engineering staff to evaluate interface between hardware and software.      Developing and directing software testing and validation procedures.      Directing software programming and development of documentation.      Modifying existing software to correct errors, to adapt it to new hardware or to upgrade interfaces and improve performance.      Researching, analysing and evaluating requirements for software applications and operating systems.

fields.name: Solar Installer
fields.description: Installs, tests and repairs solar water heating systems and equipment. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Determining locations for installing solar subsystem components including piping, water heaters, valves and ancillary equipment. Assessing collector sites to ensure structural integrity of potential mounting surfaces.  Identifying methods for laying out and mounting modules or arrays to ensure efficient energy collection, system installation, electrical configuration and system maintenance. Assembling solar modules, panels or support structures as specified. Installing solar water heating systems and equipment and circulating pumps using piping, fittings, soldering equipment, electrical supplies and hand tools. Identifying plumbing, electrical, environmental or safety hazards associated with solar thermal installations. Testing operating voltages to ensure operation within acceptable limits. Checking electrical installation for proper wiring, polarity, grounding or integrity of terminations. Performing routine maintenance to restore solar thermal systems to baseline operating conditions.

fields.name: Somatologist
fields.description: Assesses and treats a variety of skin and body problems in a holistic and health related manner.
fields.tasks: Carrying out skin analysis and giving advice about skin and body care. Using a range of treatments and electrical equipment to treat individual skin and body conditions. Performing specialised facial or body massage. Removing facial and body hair by electrolysis, waxing or other methods. Analysing body types and advising on exercise programmes and nutrition, especially for weight loss. Working in a spa or as part of a medical support team, under the instruction of a General Medical Practitioner. Providing advice and support to clients following cosmetic surgery and undertaking treatments prescribed by a Dermatologist, Surgeon or General Medical Practitioner. Creating and updating client records. Performing reception duties when required.

fields.name: Sonographer
fields.description: Operates ultrasound equipment to acquire, interpret and selectively record anatomical images, physical data and real time physiological information for medical diagnostic purposes in conjunction with other medical practitioners.
fields.tasks: Operating or overseeing operation of radiologic, ultrasound and magnetic imaging equipment to produce images of the body for diagnostic purposes. Explaining procedures, observing and positioning patients, and using protection devices to ensure safety and comfort during examination, scan, or treatment. Position imaging or treatment equipment, monitoring video displays, and adjusting settings and controls according to technical specifications. Reviewing and evaluating developed x-rays, video tape, or computer generated information to determine if images are satisfactory for diagnostic purposes and recording results of procedures. Monitoring patients' conditions and reactions, reporting abnormal signs to a medical practitioner. Measuring and recording radiation dosage or radiopharmaceuticals received and used for patients, following prescription issued by a medical practitioner. Administering, detecting and mapping radiopharmaceuticals or radiation in patients' bodies, using radioisotope, camera or other equipment for diagnosing and treating diseases.

fields.name: Sound Technician
fields.description: Operates audio equipment to record, enhance, mix and amplify sound in support of television, radio, film or video productions, or stage performances.
fields.tasks: Setting up, preparing, operating and adjusting audio recording, editing and sound reproducing equipment. Undertaking post-production audio mixing and editing for film or video work. Discussing sound requirements with the relevant people involved with production. Working  at  the audio console  or with computers, mixing  sound, adjusting the volume and technical quality during the production of pre-recorded and live broadcasts. Developing the sound plot . Selecting  music and sound effects  from a sound library or recording them. Developing and programming playback of created sound effects using a variety of audio equipment. Selecting  and positioning microphones and loudspeakers for recordings and productions.

fields.name: Special Care Accommodation Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operation of accommodation establishments for people that need special care .
fields.tasks: Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation, expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Coordinating and administering welfare programs and care services for the elderly.      Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and performance standards for nursing, personal care, technical, and administrative staff.      Directing or conducting recruitment, hiring and training of personnel.      Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of medical, nursing, technical, clerical, service, maintenance, and other personnel.        Liaising with other health and welfare providers, boards and funding bodies to coordinate the provision of services.      Providing overall direction and management for a service, facility, organisation or centre.      Representing the organisation in negotiations, and at conventions, seminars, public hearings and forums.

fields.name: Special Class Electrician
fields.description: Services and repairs intricate and complex electrical and electronic circuitry. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Diagnosing and repairing faults in electrical circuitry which is of a complex nature. Analysing drawings and specifications to determine sequences and methods of operation. Using electrical and electronic test instruments to trace faults. Dismantling units, repairing or replacing defective components and re-assembling them. Test-operating  and monitoring the performance of systems, and adjusting  settings. Recording causes of malfunctioning and deciding on action to be taken. Servicing and repairing circuitry in prototype and other non-standard units if required. Servicing and repairing components of electrical equipment powered by hydraulic, pneumatic or other non-electrical energy sources if required.

fields.name: Special Effects Person
fields.description: Fabricates, installs, and activates equipment to produce special effects, such as rain, snow, explosions, and other mechanical and electrical effects as required by script for television, motion picture, and theatrical productions.
fields.tasks: Choosing, installing and operating special effects equipment needed on set or on stage.   Generating special effects using 3D animation and effects software.   Applying computer generated special effects to film footage using compositing techniques.   Completing compositing operations using compositing software. Rendering drawings in a variety of media.

fields.name: Special Forces Manager
fields.description: Collects and analyses intelligence, plan, coordinate, monitor and manage all aspects of special forces operations in the training, preparation and operational environments. They support and assist with joint and integrated spec forces operational and tact
fields.tasks: Acting as the warrior diplomat during Peace Keeping Operations.      Appling administrative, financial, logistical and military procedures, taking in account the Spec Forces' operating environment and national legislative, security and/or emergency policies and procedures.      Assessing, developing and maintaining individual and small unit proficiency in specialised combat related skills.      Collecting, analysing and interpreting information and data to develop possible Special Forces solutions to given military problems and challenges.      Conducting Special Forces operations during high and low conflict military operations.      Controlling the use of, and accounting for, the assets and facilities of the organisation.      Validating combat readiness standards.

fields.name: Special Forces Officer
fields.description: Liaises, exercises, practises, designs, coordinates, commands and guides the military use of special forces personnel and capabilities (fighting power) that are difficult or impossible to accomplish with conventional forces alone, during war and peace.
fields.tasks: Acting as the warrior diplomat during Peace Keeping Operations.      Appling administrative, financial, logistical and military procedures, taking in account the Special Forces' operating environment and national legislative, security and emergency policies and procedures.      Assessing, developing and maintaining individual and small unit proficiency in specialised combat related skills.      Collecting, analysing and interpreting information and data to develop possible Special Forces solutions to given military problems and challenges.      Conducting Special Forces operations during military operations.      Controlling the use of, and accounting for the assets and facilities of the organisation.      Validating combat readiness standards.

fields.name: Special Forces Operator
fields.description: Practises, exercises and employs special forces tactics, techniques and procedure during war and peace operations.
fields.tasks: Acting as the warrior diplomat during peace keeping operations.          Assessing, developing and maintaining individual and small unit proficiency in specialised combat related skills.      Collecting, analysing and interpreting information to develop possible Special Forces solutions to given military problems and challenges.      Conducting Special Forces operations during high and low conflict military operations.

fields.name: Special Needs Teacher
fields.description: Teaches academic and living skills to primary and further education and training students with particular learning difficulties using various techniques and promotes students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Assessing students' abilities and limitations with regard to intellectual, physical, social and emotional impairments, exceptional intellectual gifts, or other specific problems. Designing or modifying curricula and preparing and delivering programmes, lessons and activities adapted to students’ abilities and needs. Giving instruction on an individual or group basis using special techniques or aids appropriate to students’ needs. Employing special educational strategies and techniques during instruction to improve the development of sensory- and perceptual-motor skills, language, cognition, and memory. Teaching academic subjects, and practical and self-help skills to students with hearing, sight and other impairments. Stimulating and developing students’ confidence interests, abilities, manual skills and coordination. Conferring with other staff members to plan and schedule lessons for special needs students. Preparing and maintaining student data and other records and submitting reports. Administering various forms of assessment and evaluating progress of each student. Conferring with students, parents, head teacher and other relevant professionals involved in the students’ care to develop individual educational plans designed to promote students' development.

fields.name: Special Services Contracting Agent
fields.description: Arranges contracts for performances of athletes, entertainers, models and artists.
fields.tasks: Finding marketable talent (sportspersons, models, actors, singers, musicians, songwriters, writers etc.) to represent by means such as: scouting, holding live auditions, and reviewing electronic submissions of audio, visual, or literary material. Maintaining an extensive current knowledge of the specific industry trends and deals, being constantly aware of what clients are looking for and submitting portfolios and material for consideration. Marketing and promoting signed talent so that they get bookings, and keeping tabs on them by being in constant communication regarding work opportunities. Taking care of all the administrative tasks of talent performances such as general communications, bookings and schedule management, and fan mail, so that the talent can focus on preparation, performance and client delivery. Making sure that booked talent understands the details of the client’s project or gig, including location, time, wardrobe requirements etc. Negotiating for and/or writing up contracts between talent and clients that outline performance requirements, deliverables and rates of pay, and providing talent with legal and financial advice. Providing feedback on performance or writing to assist in performance improvement, and working with talent to develop short- and long-term career strategies.

fields.name: Specialist Physician (General Medicine)
fields.description: Investigates and diagnoses human disorders and diseases, and administers treatment. It must be noted that in some countries the term “Physician” has the same meaning “General Practitioner” or “Family Doctor” have in South Africa. When South Africans refer to a “Physician” they are referring to a Medical Doctor who is a specialist in internal medicine; i.e. a specialist who does not use surgery to cure disease. So, a South African Physician is already a specialist and the term "specialist" does not have to be used in front of his or her name. The Health Professions Council of South Africa (HPCSA) uses the name “General Physician” for such a specialist and it is the occupation of a General Physician that is described here.
fields.tasks: Examining patients to determine the nature and extent of problems after referral from General Practitioners. Undertaking laboratory tests and diagnostic procedures. Prescribing therapeutic treatment and procedures. Treating by medication rather than surgery.

fields.name: Speech Pathologist
fields.description: Assesses and treats people with communication disorders such as speech, language, voice, fluency and literacy difficulties and people who have physical problems with eating or swallowing.
fields.tasks: Evaluating hearing, speech and language performance in patients to determine the nature of hearing and communication disorders. Administering hearing or speech/language tests or other examinations using specialised diagnostic instruments and equipment, and interpreting test results alongside other medical, social and behavioural diagnostic data to determine appropriate courses of treatment. Planning, directing and participating in counselling, screening, speech rehabilitation and other programs related to hearing and communication. Prescribing hearing aids and other assistive devices according to patients’ needs and instructing them in their use. Planning and conducting treatment programs to manage physical disorders affecting speech and swallowing in patients such as stuttering and feeding disorders. Counselling and guiding hearing and/or language-impaired individuals, their families, teachers and employers. Referring patients and families to additional medical or educational services if needed.

fields.name: Sport Psychologist
fields.description: Applies psychological principles and techniques to motivate sportspersons to enhance performance.
fields.tasks: Preparing athletes psychologically for competition Helping athletes to deal with the psychological effects of competition, Educating coaches on the best ways to enhance the team's psychological state and become a successful, cohesive unit, Researching the effects of sport participation on athletes, Evaluating developmental disabilities,

fields.name: Sport Science Manager
fields.description: Maximize human physical performance to ensure elite sporting performance on a continuous basis to all sporting clients.
fields.tasks: Controlling administrative operations such as budget planning, report preparation and expenditure on supplies, equipment and services.      Developing, implementing and monitoring procedures, policies and performance standards for staff.      Directing or conducting recruitment, hiring and training of personnel.      Directing, supervising and evaluating the work activities of personnel. Liaising with service providers, boards and funding bodies to coordinate the provision of services.      Providing overall direction and management for the service, facility, organisation or centre.      Representing the organisation in negotiations, and at conventions, seminars, public hearings and forums.

fields.name: Sports Administrator
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls, coordinates and promotes sport and recreational activities, and develops related policies.
fields.tasks: Advising on the facilities available and promoting publicity in relation to events, shows and activities.      Checking and keeping custody of all cash receipts and making regular stock checks.      Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of staff.      Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.      Ensuring that facilities are kept clean and in good condition.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.       Planning and directing daily operations.      Planning and organising the range and mix of activities, and sports and fitness programmes to be offered by the centre.

fields.name: Sports Centre / Facility Manager
fields.description: Organises, controls and promotes the activities, facilities and resources of a sports centre.
fields.tasks: Planning and organising the range and mix of sports programmes and events to be offered by the centre.     Planning and directing daily operations.   Advising on the facilities available and promoting publicity in relation to sports events and activities.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.   Controlling the selection, supervision and performance of staff.   Ensuring compliance with health and safety regulations.      Ensuring that facilities are kept clean and in good condition.   Checking and keeping custody of all cash receipts and making regular stock checks.

fields.name: Sports Coach or Instructor
fields.description: Coaches, trains and instructs sportspersons by analysing their performances and developing their abilities.
fields.tasks: Analysing and evaluating athletes' or teams' performances and modifying training programs. Compiling scores and other athletic records.      Developing, planning and coordinating competitive schedules and programs.      Formulating competitive strategy, developing game plans and directing athletes and players during games or athletic events.      Identifying strengths and weaknesses of athletes or teams.

fields.name: Sports Development Officer
fields.description: Promotes sports and skills development, and oversees the participation of young people in sport.
fields.tasks: Analysing and evaluating athletes' or teams' performances and modifying training programs. Compiling scores and other athletic records.      Developing, planning and coordinating competitive schedules and programs.      Formulating competitive strategy, developing game plans and directing athletes and players during games or athletic events.      Identifying strengths and weaknesses of athletes or teams.

fields.name: Sports Official
fields.description: Coordinates and directs sporting activities, and liaises with other officials to interpret and enforce sporting rules and regulations.
fields.tasks: Compiling scores and other athletic records.      Developing, planning and coordinating competitive schedules and programs.      Formulating competitive strategy, developing game plans and directing athletes and players during games or athletic events.      Identifying strengths and weaknesses of athletes or teams.     Judging the performance of competitors, awarding points, imposing penalties for infractions and determining results.      Monitoring and analysing technique and performance, and determining how future improvements can be made.      Officiating at sporting events or athletic competitions to maintain standards of play and to ensure that game rules and safety regulations are observed.      Planning, developing and implementing training and practice sessions.      Recording lapsed time and keeping scores during events or competitions.

fields.name: Sports Scientist
fields.description: Sports scientists assist sportspeople to achieve the best possible sporting performance by applying knowledge and techniques from the areas of medicine, physiology, biomechanics (the study of human movement), nutrition, psychology and physiotherapy / mass
fields.tasks: Enabling people to improve their health through exercise and assisting them to recover from injury or illness through physical activity and exercise.   Working alongside sports coaches and sports therapists to assess the performance of individuals and sports teams and helping them to improve. Acting as consultants to sports coaches and professional sports teams on fitness, training and exercise.   Designing training programmes for sports teams and individuals to strengthen particular areas of the body and to achieve the required fitness levels to perform.   Working with hospitals and research institutions in areas such as cardiac rehabilitation and health promotion.   Attending training sessions and sporting fixtures to monitor sporting performances of athletes and to provide feedback.   Taking part in research on matters of interest in sports such as coaching, training, performance and recovery practices.   Giving advice on the design and production of sports equipment.

fields.name: Sports Umpire
fields.description: Officiates at sporting events such as netball, hockey, football, basketball, cricket, boxing and wrestling matches.
fields.tasks: Judging the performance of competitors, awarding points, imposing penalties for infractions and determining results.      Monitoring and analysing technique and performance, and determining how future improvements can be made.      Officiating at sporting events or athletic competitions to maintain standards of play and to ensure that game rules and safety regulations are observed.      Planning, developing and implementing training and practice sessions.      Recording lapsed time and keeping scores during events or competitions.

fields.name: Stage Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, supervises and coordinates the activities of workers responsible for placing sets and properties, and operating lighting and sound equipment as part of dramatic productions.
fields.tasks: Ensuring that lighting and sound cues are acted upon at the right time by issuing verbal standby and prompt calls. Controlling all aspects of the performance by calling the cues for all transitions. Organising the production and coordinating communications between various personnel. Procuring props, furniture and set dressings. Making changes to the set between scene changes, prompting actors and cueing technicians. Ensuring the welfare of people on and around the stage and maintaining a good working knowledge of all relevant health and safety legislation and good working practice.

fields.name: Stage or Studio Hand
fields.description: Provides assistance in the assembly and disassembly of show productions.
fields.tasks: Loading and unloading stage sets and other production equipment into and from trucks.   Assisting in the assembly and disassembly of set for show productions. Assisting in assembling production equipment on stage. Constructing of set pieces and risers, and putting musical equipment in place. Assisting the crew with relevant tasks related to video, sound and light production before, during and after shows. Moving furniture, road cases and miscellaneous equipment.

fields.name: Stationery Machine Technician
fields.description: Sets up, operates and maintains stationery and envelope manufacturing and printing machines to produce stationery or envelopes on a variety of paper substrates.
fields.tasks: Setting, adjusting and monitoring substrate-feed mechanisms, delivery mechanisms, inking systems and other printing machine functions. Mixing ink and solvents to standard, and regulating paper and ink supply during print runs. Monitoring, evaluating and determining press to check print quality standards against proofs and detect malfunctions. Producing a variety of printed products using relief, lithographic, flexographic and gravure printing presses, and in-line finishing systems. Preparing plates, blankets and impression cylinders on small offset lithographic printing presses. Loading paper into feeding mechanisms. Monitoring machine operations and quality of printing. Maintaining, adjusting, repairing and cleaning machines. Producing digital print images, and transferring and outputting images.

fields.name: Statistical and Mathematical Assistant
fields.description: Assists in planning the collection, processing and presentation of statistical, mathematical or actuarial data.
fields.tasks: Performing technical tasks connected with data collection and quality control operations in censuses and surveys. Performing technical tasks connected with establishing, maintaining and using registers and sampling frames for census and survey operations. Preparing detailed estimates of quantities and costs of materials and labour required for statistical census and survey operations. Preparing statistical, mathematical, actuarial, accounting and other results for presentation in graphical or tabular form. Applying knowledge of statistical, mathematical, actuarial, accounting and related principles and practices in order to identify and solve problems arising in the course of their work. Assisting in planning and performing statistical, mathematical, actuarial, and related calculations. Supervising the work of statistical clerks. Using standard computer software packages to perform mathematical, actuarial statistical accounting and related calculations.

fields.name: Statistical Clerk
fields.description: Compiles data and undertakes statistical and actuarial computations.
fields.tasks: Assisting with computing and analysing data using statistical formulas and computer software.   Checking source data and verifying its completeness and accuracy. Assisting with compiling reports, charts or graphs, and in describing and interpreting findings of analyses. Compiling statistical reports from source materials such as production or sales records, quality-control or test records, time sheets or survey sheets. Filing data and related information and maintaining and updating databases.

fields.name: Statistician
fields.description: Designs and applies statistical principles and techniques for collecting, organising and interpreting quantifiable data, and uses statistical methodologies to produce statistical reports and analyses for government, commercial and other purposes.
fields.tasks: Collecting, analysing, interpreting and presenting of quantitative information in a range of sectors including health, education, government, finance, the environment, transportation and market research. Designing and managing experiments and surveys. Conducting the initial collection of quantitative data. Processing and analysing quantitative data in context, looking for patterns to help make decisions. Advising on findings and recommending strategies. Teaching statistical methods and the theory of statistics.

fields.name: Steel Fixer
fields.description: Positions and secures steel bars and steel mesh in concrete forms to reinforce concrete structures.
fields.tasks: Reading and interpreting working plans and steel lists for the job, and setting out the work from these instructions. Shaping, bending and cutting metal sections, mesh or pipes to the required length by using hand and machine tools or by heating and hammering. Aligning metal parts to be joined using hand tools and measuring instruments. Fabricating, assembling and erecting reinforcing bars or mesh by welding, wiring or clipping them into predetermined locations within the concrete of buildings, bridges and other constructions. Joining prefabricated units together for large sections of high rise or civil projects and positioning the reinforcements ready for concrete pours.

fields.name: Sterilisation Technician
fields.description: Cleans, sterilises and packages surgical instruments and other hospital equipment, soft goods and linen in a sterilisation service department.
fields.tasks: Cleaning and sterilising medical instruments. Packing and dispatching instruments, containers and other sterile supplies. Validating sterile equipment as per prescribed procedure. Sorting post-operative instruments and decontaminating them according to prescribed procedure. Packing instrument sets according to set lists. Inspecting instruments and reporting blunt, broken or missing instruments. Inspecting linen, and folding and packing it according to checklists. Sterilising and sorting instrument sets and linen packs according to policy. Undertaking ad hoc tasks as required. Maintaining a clean and neat working environment.

fields.name: Stock and Station Agent
fields.description: Provides advice to clients and acts on their behalf in relation to the sale and purchase of rural property, livestock, crops and agricultural products and services.
fields.tasks: Bringing together sellers of local agricultural produce including fresh produce and livestock with both local and international buyers. Obtaining information on the agricultural products to be sold and the needs of prospective buyers. Examining or testing crops or products to estimate their value, determine their grade, or locate any evidence of disease or insect damage. Negotiating contracts on behalf of sellers or buyers and explaining the terms of sale and payment to clients. Signing agreements on behalf of sellers or buyers and ensuring that contracts are honoured. Arranging transportation or storage for purchased products. Maintaining records of business transactions and product inventories, and reporting data to companies or government agencies as necessary.

fields.name: Stock Clerk / Officer
fields.description: Monitors stock levels and maintains stock, order and inventory records.
fields.tasks: Working in stores, warehouses, stockrooms and other storage facilities to monitor and maintain stock levels as well as order and inventory records.   Taking inventory of merchandise to identify items that need to be reordered or replenished. Ordering merchandise from supplier as required and keeping inventories of such merchandise.   Receiving and unpacking containers of merchandise, and checking invoices against items received.   Attaching price tags to merchandise as per price lists.   Stocking storage areas with new merchandise ready to be placed on the shop floor.

fields.name: Stonemason
fields.description: Cuts and shapes hard and soft stone blocks and masonry slabs to construct and renovate stone structures and monumental masonry. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Adapting the job site environment. Using and maintaining refractory tools and equipment. Tearing out refractory masonry. Laying refractory bricks. Installing poured castables. Installing gunnable castables, shotcrete, and lining with ceramic welding. Installing refractory material by plastic ramming.

fields.name: Store Person
fields.description: Receives, handles and dispatches goods in stores and warehouses.
fields.tasks: Unloading merchandise and checking items against order forms. Scanning items into stock databases using item and storage details. Obtaining details of the location and quantity of items in stock using visual display units or computers. Entering details of deliveries received, requisitions and invoices into computers. Completing orders by selecting goods from shelves and checking them off appropriate lists. Packaging and dispatching completed orders to customers. Counting and recording items during stocktake. Advising supervisor on stock and re-ordering levels if not working on a computerised system. Helping to keep the work area orderly. Moving heavy packages using a forklift.

fields.name: Straddle Carrier Operator
fields.description: Lowers a spreader at the required location on the wharf and draws a chalk line to provide a visual reference mark to be used by straddle carrier drivers.
fields.tasks: Operating the four-wheeled straddle carrier to safely move containers around port terminals and intermodal yards to ensure timely loading and unloading. Carefully manoeuvring the carrier over the container needed to be picked up. Pushing and pulling levers to raise and lower the lifting mechanism equipped with electric and hydraulic systems with clamps to grasp, lift and hold container.   Driving the machine to specified delivery point and moves levers to lower load to ground.   Inspecting equipment to identify wear and damage.   Keeping records of work undertaken and breakdowns of straddle carrier.   Performing routine maintenance on straddle carrier and equipment.

fields.name: Strata Control Officer
fields.description: Assists with the management and monitoring of mining support designs.
fields.tasks: Providing technical assistance to aid in research on and development of processes to determine the properties of metals and new alloys. Providing technical assistance in geological and topographical surveys, and in the design and layout of oil, natural gas and mineral ore extraction and transportation systems, and processing and refining plants for minerals and metals. Monitoring technical, regulatory and safety aspects of the construction, installation, operation, maintenance and repair of mineral ore, oil and natural gas exploration, extraction, transport and storage installations and of mineral processing plants.

fields.name: Street Food Sales Person
fields.description: Prepares and sell, or sell previously prepared, hot or cold foods and beverages ready for immediate consumption in streets and public places such as stations, cinemas, or theatres.
fields.tasks: Obtaining the mandatory trading documentation from the local municipality to set up a stand at a particular place in streets, markets or other open spaces. Erecting and dismantling stalls and stands, transporting, storing, loading and unloading goods for sale. Cooking and selling food from stalls in open-air or covered markets or from stalls in streets or other open spaces. Ensuring food meets health and safety standards and is kept at optimal temperatures and conditions. Taking orders from customers and cooking foods according to customers' requirements. Accepting payments and making change, or writing charge slips. Keeping accounts and maintaining records of stock levels.

fields.name: Street Market Vendor
fields.description: Sells goods and services to customers at a street market location.
fields.tasks: Obtaining the mandatory trading documentation to set up a stand at a particular place in streets, markets or other open spaces. Erecting and dismantling stalls and stands, transporting, storing, loading and unloading goods for sale. Ordering and purchasing goods for sale, and monitoring and maintaining stock levels. Marking or ticketing merchandise. Displaying and demonstrating goods, and explaining the qualities of goods to customers. Answering questions from and providing information to customer about merchandise for sale. Informing customers of new goods and services. Receiving payments from customers and giving change. Recording transactions on customer receipts and sales records. Wrapping and packaging goods sold. Keeping merchandise in order on tables or racks.

fields.name: Street Sweeper Operator
fields.description: Operates plant to clean streets and gutters of litter and debris.
fields.tasks: Driving sweeping machines along the street near the curb to clear streets of rubbish and other debris.    Moving controls to activate rotary brushes and water sprayers so that the machine automatically picks up dust and rubbish from the street and deposits it into the dirt trap.   Pulling levers to dump rubbish in piles at curbs for removal.   Driving sweeping machines that remove sand and litter from newly constructed highways.

fields.name: Street Vendor
fields.description: Sells goods and services to customers in public locations.
fields.tasks: Selling packaged foodstuffs and basic convenience goods that do not need specific storage. Buying or receiving items for sale, or making simple items for sale. Displaying and demonstrating goods and explaining the qualities of goods to customers. Answering questions about the various products for sale. Informing customers of new goods and services. Loading and unloading baskets, trays, push-carts, bicycles or hand trucks to transport goods to the streets or public area where they may be sold.

fields.name: Structural Plater
fields.description: Sets up, operates, or tends plating or coating machines to coat metal or plastic products with chromium, zinc, copper, cadmium, nickel, or other metal to protect or decorate surfaces. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Marking metal framework as a guide when drilling, cutting, and shaping them for use in buildings, ships and other structures. Drilling, cutting and shaping structural steel in a workshop. Erecting steel framework for buildings, bridges and other constructions. Assembling and erecting the framework and other metal parts of ships' structures. Shaping and fitting structural-steel plates of ships under construction or repair. Riveting structural-metal members by hand, machine or pneumatic riveter. Shaping and bending metal sections and pipes using hand and machine tools or by heating and hammering. Aligning parts to be joined using hand tools and measuring instruments.

fields.name: Structural Steel Erector
fields.description: Erects and dismantles structural steel frames of buildings and other structures.
fields.tasks: Analysing engineering drawings, blueprints, specifications, sketches or work orders and determining the required equipment. Preparing, positioning and securing workpieces, using hoists, cranes, wire, and banding machines or hand tools. Aligning parts to be joined using hand tools and measuring instruments. Assembling and erecting steel frameworks and other metal parts for buildings, bridges and other structures. Riveting structural-metal members by hand, machine or pneumatic riveter. Operating safety equipment, using safe work habits, and working safely at heights without fear.

fields.name: Student Counsellor
fields.description: Provides information and assistance to students, parents and teachers about a wide range of matters such as students' personal problems, learning difficulties and special requirements.
fields.tasks: Planning and implementing programs of assistance for students including crisis intervention and referral, Analysing the student's situation and presenting alternative approaches to resolving problems, Compiling records or reports, Providing counselling, therapy and mediation services to assist students to develop skills and insights needed to deal with and resolve their social and personal problems, Facilitating group sessions,

fields.name: Student Support Service Officer
fields.description: Working with students on career, study and employment options.
fields.tasks: Providing a point of contact for students in order to give information and advice in response to routine queries on academic and social support services such as administrative issues, accommodation, financial aid and examination deferments. Maintaining appropriate records e.g. student information, and make these available to personnel who need updates. Referring students to central services and other specialist sources of information and guidance e.g. counsellors, mentoring, campus health services as and when appropriate.

fields.name: Stunt Person
fields.description: Conducts dangerous stunts on behalf of actors.
fields.tasks: Communicating effectively in order to explain actions and any possible repercussions to members of the production team. Being adaptable and able to react quickly and safely under changing circumstances. Liaising with and taking orders from others, including the director and the stunt action co–ordinator, and work as part of the production team. Remembering the actors’ exact positions and movements at any given time during the performance in order to assist with continuity.

fields.name: Subsistence Crop Farmer
fields.description: Grows and harvests field or tree and shrub crops, vegetables and fruit, in order to provide food, shelter and a minimum of cash income for themselves and their households.
fields.tasks: Preparing the soil and growing vegetables, fruit and other tree and shrub crops. Sowing, planting, tending and harvesting field crops. Storing crop produce for later use and carrying out some processing of produce. Selling or bartering some crop products at local markets. Building and maintaining houses and other shelters. Fetching water and gathering firewood. Making tools, clothes and utensils for use by the household. Breeding, tending and feeding animals and poultry mainly to obtain meat, eggs, milk, hair, skin or other products for household use. Supplementing household resources by hunting animals and gathering wild fruits, medicinal and other plants.

fields.name: Subsistence Livestock Farmer
fields.description: Breeds, raises and tends livestock in order to provide food, shelter and a minimum of cash income for themselves and their households.
fields.tasks: Raising, tending, feeding, milking and breeding animals, and helping with animal births. Cultivating pastures, or managing grazing lands, and monitoring feed and water supplies needed to maintain condition of livestock. Monitoring and examining animals to detect illness, injury, or disease, and to check physical condition. Grooming and marking animals and shearing coats to collect hair or wool; herding or leading livestock to pastures, grazing land and water supplies. Slaughtering and skinning animals and preparing them and their products for consumption or sale. Carrying out some processing of animal products. Buying, bartering and selling animals and some animal products. Building and maintaining houses and other shelters. Fetching water and gathering firewood. Making tools, clothes and utensils for use by the household.

fields.name: Subsistence Mixed Crop and Livestock Farmers
fields.description: Grows and harvests field or tree and shrub crops, vegetables and fruit, gather wild fruits, medicinal and other plants, tend or hunt animals, and/or catch fish and gather various forms of aquatic life in order to provide food, shelter and a minimum of cas
fields.tasks: Breeding, tending and feeding animals and poultry to obtain meat, eggs, milk, hair, skin or other products. Preparing the soil, sowing, planting, tending and harvesting field crops. Growing vegetables, fruit and other tree and shrub crops. Storing animal and crop produce for later use and carrying out some processing of produce. Selling some animal and crop products at local markets. Supplementing household resources by gathering wild fruits, medicinal and other plants. Building and maintaining houses and other shelters. Fetching water and gathering firewood. Making tools, clothes and utensils for use by the household.

fields.name: Sugar Process Controller
fields.description: Monitors and controls mechanical and operational efficiency of production facilities, equipment, plant and related resources in the extraction and processing of juice from sugar cane.
fields.tasks: Controlling sugar processing unit operations to achieve planned operational outputs that meet product specifications. Ensuring the consistent availability and utilisation of resources required to meet operational demands of a sugar processing unit. Monitoring and enforcing compliance with safety, health, environmental protection and quality (SHEQ) policies, practices and procedures in a sugar processing plant. Monitoring and ensuring the integrity of operational equipment and facilities for a sugar processing unit. Initiating, performimng  and responding to in-line quality tests of samples from various sugar processing operational stages. Prepare and communicate sugar processing unit operational information in a variety of applicable formats.

fields.name: Sugar Processing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines and performs routine tasks to extract juice from sugar cane to make granular sugar and molasses.
fields.tasks: Operating equipment to cool, heat, dry, roast, blanch, pasteurize, smoke, sterilize, freeze, evaporate and concentrate foodstuffs and liquids used in food processing. Mixing, pulping, grinding, blending and separating foodstuffs and liquids with churning, pressing, sieving, grinding and filtering equipment.

fields.name: Supply and Distribution Manager
fields.description: Plans, administers and reviews the supply, storage and distribution of equipment, materials and goods used and produced by an organisation, enterprise or business.
fields.tasks: Determining, implementing and monitoring purchasing, storage and distribution strategies, policies and plans.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures. Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Liaising with other departments and customers concerning requirements for outward goods and associated forwarding transportation.      Monitoring and reviewing storage and inventory systems to meet supply requirements and control stock levels.      Negotiating contracts with suppliers to meet quality, cost and delivery requirements.      Operating recording systems to track all movements of goods, and ensuring re-ordering and re-stocking at optimal times.      Overseeing the recording of purchase, storage and distribution transactions.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.      Planning and directing daily operations.

fields.name: Supply Chain Practitioner
fields.description: Organises, manages, controls and coordinates the supply chain management function including demand, acquisition ,logistics, disposal, performance and risk management.
fields.tasks: Planning procurement and overseeing procurement processes and the internal control environment of supplies and products in a company or organisation. Setting up and managing a database of potential suppliers. Advising on procurement options and mechanisms to ensure that the appropriate method is utilized to approach the market for goods and services. Making sure that company procurement, logistics, quality, and waste disposal policies are in place and implemented in full compliance with Supply Chain Management principles and regulations. Requesting quotations from suppliers. Administering the bidding and tendering process through: participating in writing specifications, compiling relevant documents for competitive processes, managing the receiving and opening of submissions, and participating in the evaluation and adjudication processes. Setting up contract agreements for the supply of various goods and services. Managing all contracts and maintaining a contract audit trail. Providing advice and guidance to internal customers on procurement of goods and services. Handling all administrative functions related to the management of the company or organisation’s supply chain.

fields.name: Surfer
fields.description: Surfs professionally in surfing competitions. This occupation requires high levels of physical fitness, sporting ability and personal commitment as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications or experience.
fields.tasks: Adhering to the rules and regulations associated with surfing. Participating in regular practice and training sessions and undertaking training to maintain the required standard of fitness and skill. Maintaining a high degree of expertise in surfing. Assessing other competitors and conditions at venues. Deciding on strategies in consultation with coaches. Competing in surfing events. Undertaking surfing promotional activities and media interviews.

fields.name: Surgeon
fields.description: Performs surgery to correct diseases and disorders covering a broad range of medical conditions.
fields.tasks: Examining each patient thoroughly, reviewing the medical history and consulting with other Doctors to be sure an operation is necessary. Explaining to the patient and his or her family about what a surgical operation entails. Treating injury, deformity, and disease by manual and instrumental means. Removing or replacing a diseased organ or tissue. Checking the equipment, instruments and surgical setup to be sure everything needed for an operation is present and sterile.

fields.name: Survey Interviewer
fields.description: Interviews people and records their responses to survey and market research questions on a range of topics. May work in a call centre.
fields.tasks: Contacting people to conduct surveys. Interviewing people randomly on the street or in shopping malls. Working in a call centre if surveys are conducted telephonically. Recording answers to survey questions manually or electronically. Providing survey respondents with self-completion questionnaires if required. Recording the distribution of survey questionnaires. Collecting questionnaires and scanning them to ensure that important questions have been answered. Returning completed questionnaires to supervisors Assisting in encoding survey responses and in checking their consistency.

fields.name: Surveying or Cartographic Technician
fields.description: Collects, records and evaluates survey data and prepares maps, charts and plans in support of surveyors and cartographers. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Surveying, measuring and describing land surfaces, mines, underground surfaces, sea, river and lake beds. Noting exact position of various features and recording survey data in digital form. Making charts and maps to be used in determining navigable waters and channels and in planning construction of marine structures. Planning and conducting aerial photographic surveys. Designing, compiling and revising maps and charts using aerial and other photographs, satellite imagery, survey documents and data, existing maps and records, reports and statistics. Undertaking research and development of surveying and photogrammetric measurement systems, cadastral systems and land information systems.

fields.name: Surveyor
fields.description: Plans, directs and conducts survey work to determine, delineate, plan and precisely position tracts of land, natural and constructed features, coastlines, marine floors and underground works, and manages related information systems.
fields.tasks: Surveying, measuring and describing land surfaces, mines, underground surfaces, sea, river and lake beds. Noting exact position of various features and recording survey data in digital form. Planning and conducting aerial photographic surveys. Designing, compiling and revising maps and charts using aerial and other photographs, satellite imagery, survey documents and data, existing maps and records, reports and statistics. Undertaking research and development of surveying and photogrammetric measurement systems, cadastral systems and land information systems. Maintaining technical liaison and consultancy with other relevant specialists.

fields.name: Surveyor's Assistant
fields.description: Performs routine tasks to assist surveyors and geologists by transporting, assembling, maintaining and laying out prospecting and surveying equipment, and collecting and labelling samples. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Assisting surveyors to collect information about the position, shape and elevation of land to map property boundaries.  Loading survey equipment into vehicles for transport to sites. Ensuring that all necessary equipment is included and is in proper working order.  Clearing vegetation and debris from a site to be surveyed. Assembling and dismantling equipment. Holding levels or stadia rods at designated points to assist in determining elevations. Laying out stakes or pegs for map-making, construction, mining, land and other surveys. Recording the measurements taken by the surveyor.

fields.name: Survival Equipment Fitter
fields.description: Maintains safety and survival equipment. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Maintaining equipment associated with the Survival Equipment trade. Maintaining an operational performance standard. Using technical and basic engineering skills. Keeping a basic fitness level. Repairing machines. Assembling aircrew equipment. Charging gas. Familiarity with and making use of inter alia trade principles, basic engineering, parachutes, life rafts, life preservers, pyrotechnics, adhesive repairs, and key skills.

fields.name: Sustainability Manager
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates sustainability or environment-related risk assessments, develops methodologies to assess the viability or success of sustainability initiatives and the monitoring and evaluation thereof.

fields.name: Swimmer
fields.description: Participates professionally in swimming events. This occupation requires high levels of physical fitness, sporting ability and personal commitment as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications or experience.
fields.tasks: Adhering to the rules and regulations associated with swimming. Participating in regular practice and training sessions and undertaking training to maintain the required standard of fitness and skill. Maintaining a high degree of expertise in swimming. Assessing other competitors and conditions at venues. Deciding on strategies in consultation with coaches. Competing in swimming events. Undertaking swimming promotional activities and media interviews.

fields.name: Swimming Pool Cleaner
fields.description: Cleans and keeps swimming pools in good condition.
fields.tasks: Removing debris and leaves from swimming pools using a strainer basket or leaf rake. Cleaning the wall and floor tiles of the pool using a nylon brush. Cleaning the algae on the concrete walls using a stainless steel brush. Checking and testing level of chemicals such as chlorine and adding them as required. Checking the circulation and filter systems and cleaning them out when necessary. Checking the pH of the water and adjusting as required. Checking the walls and the vinyl liner on the pool for any tears or cracks and notifying the owner. Cleaning the deck of the swimming pool using a high pressure hose. Checking and maintaining the automatic pool vacuum cleaner and related pipes. Using a pool cover to cover the pool so that the process of evaporation is kept in check, debris is kept out and the heat is trapped.

fields.name: Switchboard Operator
fields.description: Operates telecommunication switchboards and consoles to assist callers establish telephone connections, receive caller inquiries and fault reports.
fields.tasks: Operating switchboards and consoles to connect, hold and transfer telephone calls. Answering incoming calls, greeting callers, providing information, or taking messages as necessary. Operating other communication systems, such as intercoms, two-way radios or public address systems to page individuals. Relaying or routing written or verbal messages. Placing telephone calls or arranging conference calls as required. Undertaking other reception duties especially in small companies or firms.

fields.name: Systems Administrator
fields.description: Develops, controls ,maintains and supports the optimal performance and security of information technology systems.
fields.tasks: Diagnosing hardware and software problems.   Maintaining and administering computer networks and related computing environments including computer hardware, systems software, applications software and all configurations.   Operating master consoles to monitor the performance of computer systems and networks, and to coordinate computer network access and use.   Performing data backups and disaster recovery operations.   Recommending changes to improve systems and network configurations, and determining hardware or software requirements related to such changes.

fields.name: Tailor
fields.description: Makes, alters and repairs women's and men's tailored garments, formal wear, couturier clothing, and special occasion wear, such as suits, dresses, coats, evening wear and bridal wear. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Selecting textile fabrics, leather or fur pelts matching the desired size, colour, texture, and quality of the garment; cutting to shape them to garment pattern and arranging them on pattern according to the design of the garment. Making garment style changes, such as tapering trouser legs, narrowing lapels, and adding or removing padding. Selecting and modifying commercial patterns to customers' and clothing manufacturers' specifications and fit. Fitting, altering and repairing tailored clothing, dresses, coats and other made-to-measure garments according to customers' requests making and caring for costumes used in theatrical, television and motion picture productions. Folding, twisting, and draping material, such as satin or silk, or sewing ribbon or cloth in the form of artificial flowers or bows around crown and brim to shape and decorate hats sewing, and fastening together materials and hair strands to make wigs. Blending shades of hair to give natural appearance to wigs and arranging woven hair in specified position and sewing hair together to form hairpiece.
