Making, altering, restyling and repairing fur garments and other fur articles. Reclaiming furs or skins from old coats, gluing fabric to interior of fur coats and trimming fur garments.

fields.name: Tanker Driver
fields.description: Drives a tanker truck, requiring a specially endorsed class of licence, to transport bulk liquids.
fields.tasks: Driving trucks that transport liquid loads in tanks (tankers) on required routes to specific destinations while observing all traffic laws and safety regulations. Loading and unloading tankers using hoses and pipes according to all company and governmental regulations.   Chocking rear wheels of truck and trailer before any unloading takes place and removing chocks before driving away from the delivery site.   Completing and transmitting all paperwork in compliance with established company procedures.   Performing safety inspections on trucks, equipment and/or facilities as required by company policy and reporting any equipment malfunctions.   Maintaining vehicle cleanliness and replacing gaskets, nozzles and other related articles as necessary.   Maintaining the tanker by adding petrol, and checking oil, water, fuel and tyre pressure.

fields.name: Tanner
fields.description: Converts or cures animal hides into leather.
fields.tasks: Splitting the underlying layer off the hide and shaving it to uniform thickness. Preserving and strengthening the hide by saturating it in a tanning solution. Tanning the hide according to the brain-tanning process, the salt-and-alum tanning process or the alcohol-and-turpentine tanning process. Stretching the hide, removing excess moisture and trimming the hide. Doing the final finishing that provides colour, softness and durability to the hide using a variety of hand tools, materials and techniques. Spraying the final colours on the hide. Embossing the hide to add texture. Dealing in hides and tanned leather.

fields.name: Tattoo Artist
fields.description: Pricks skin of patrons, using a needled electric tool that inserts indelible non-toxic pigment into skin to form decorative or ornamental designs.
fields.tasks: Advising clients on suitable tattoos and confirming that the chosen design is exactly what the client wants.   Making sure that the client understands that tattooing is permanent.   Placing the chosen design onto the customer’s skin, either by drawing freehand or using a transfer.   Following the line with an electrically-operated needle injecting ink under the skin.   Using different shapes and numbers of needles depending on the type of tattoo.   Following strict hygiene as well as health and safety procedures.   Keeping up to date with the latest fashions in tattoos.

fields.name: Tax Practitioner
fields.description: Analyses, reports and provides advice on taxation issues to tax entities, prepares and reviews tax returns and reports and handles disputes.
fields.tasks: Registering tax payers, calculating tax liabilities and preparing and submitting clients’ tax returns for various kinds of taxes. Reviewing or auditing tax returns. Mediating tax disputes. Preparing and presenting tax opinions related to tax disputes, business models and investment and estate planning.

fields.name: Tax Technician
fields.description: Reviews completed tax records, prepares and submits taxation returns and documents and verifies accuracy.
fields.tasks: Preparing or assisting in preparing simple to complex tax returns for individuals or small businesses. Interviewing clients to obtain information on taxable income and deductible expenses and allowances. Furnishing taxpayers with sufficient information and advice to ensure correct tax form completion. Reviewing financial records such as income statements and documentation of expenditures to determine forms needed to prepare tax returns. Checking data input or verifying totals on forms prepared by others to detect errors in arithmetic, data entry or procedures. Computing taxes owed or overpaid, using adding machines or personal computers, and completing entries on forms following tax form instructions and tax tables. Consulting tax law handbooks or bulletins to determine procedures for preparation of atypical returns. Calculating form preparation fees according to return complexity and processing time required. Answering questions and providing future tax planning to clients.

fields.name: Taxation Clerk
fields.description: Prepares standard tax returns and provides administrative support to professional tax practitioners.
fields.tasks: Assisting accountants with basic administration duties related to tax and tax calculations. Keeping records of value added tax (VAT) on sales transactions, production processes or articles produced, and assisting with VAT returns. Assisting with calculations of pay-as-you-earn (PAYE) and unemployment insurance fund (UIF) payments due on wages and salaries. Keeping record of taxes due and rebates paid. Working on the South African Revenue Services (SARS) e-filing system to submit tax returns. Undertaking other accounting related clerical tasks as required.

fields.name: Taxation Inspector
fields.description: Inspects and assesses taxation returns to ensure compliance with government legislation, and investigates suspected breaches of taxation legislation.
fields.tasks: Advising organisations, enterprises and the public on government laws, rules and regulations concerning the determination and payment of taxes, duties and other government fees, and on the public’s rights and obligations. Examining tax returns, bills of sale and other relevant documents to determine type and amount of taxes, duties and other types of fees to be paid. Investigating filed tax returns and accounting records, systems and internal controls of organisations to ensure compliance with taxation laws and regulations. Performing related administrative tasks to document findings of investigations and inspections, and maintaining records and report on actions taken for cases.

fields.name: Taxi Driver
fields.description: Drives a taxi to transport passengers to destinations on a fee-for-service basis, usually on a short-term, metered fare hiring arrangement.
fields.tasks: Picking up passengers and driving them to their destinations.   Loading and unloading baggage into and out of baggage compartments.   Assisting physically challenged passengers to board the taxi.   Calculating the right fare and returning the correct change.   Operating telecommunications equipment to report location and availability, and to follow the directions of the control centre.   Following relevant safety regulations and laws governing vehicle operation and ensuring that passengers follow safety regulations.   Testing vehicle equipment such as lights, brakes, hooters and windscreen wipers to ensure proper operation.   Performing routine vehicle maintenance such as regulating tyre pressure and adding petrol, oil and water.

fields.name: Tea Attendant
fields.description: Serves tea to guests.
fields.tasks: Preparing snacks and beverages, and organising tea trollies for staff refreshment.   Deliveries tea trollies and refreshments to staff in different departments.   Collecting tea cups from staff after tea rounds.   Setting refreshment trays for visitors. Cleaning and washing crockery and cutlery and keeping the kitchenette area clean. Preparation shopping lists and purchasing items such as milk, tea, coffee and sugar as required.   Supporting event catering as required.  Adhering to hygienic food-handling practices.

fields.name: Tea Taster / Grader
fields.description: Inspects, tests, sorts, samples, or weighs raw or processed tea.
fields.tasks: Sorting and weighing raw tea. Sniffing and smelling the tea leaves to determine flavour. Brewing tea using different brewing times, temperatures and water types. Looking at the colour and opacity of brewed tea and the tea leaves as an indication of the flavour. Savouring the aroma of the tea before it is sipped and notes the aftertaste for flavour and scent that develops. Tasting the tea to identify the specific sensation on the tongue. Observing the mental and or physical effects (such as soothing stress or improving focus) of the various types of tea. Recording the grade and/or identification on tags, receiving, or sales sheets.

fields.name: Teacher of English To Speakers of Other Languages
fields.description: Teaches classes in English to students who speak languages other than English.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organisational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Teacher of The Hearing Impaired
fields.description: Teaches academic and living skills to hearing impaired students and promotes students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Assessing students' abilities and limitations with regard to intellectual, physical, social and emotional impairments, exceptional intellectual gifts, or other specific problems. Designing or modifying curricula and preparing and delivering programmes, lessons and activities adapted to students’ abilities and needs. Giving instruction on an individual or group basis using special techniques or aids appropriate to students’ needs. Employing special educational strategies and techniques during instruction to improve the development of sensory- and perceptual-motor skills, language, cognition, and memory. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and policies and procedures to maintain order among students. Teaching academic subjects, and practical and self-help skills to students with hearing, sight and other impairments. Stimulating and developing students’ confidence interests, abilities, manual skills and coordination. Conferring with other staff members to plan and schedule lessons for special needs students. Preparing and maintaining student data and other records and submitting reports. Administering various forms of assessment and evaluating progress of each student. Conferring with students, parents, head teacher and other relevant professionals involved in the students’ care to develop individual educational plans designed to promote students' development.

fields.name: Teacher of The Sight Impaired
fields.description: Teaches academic and living skills to sight impaired students and promotes students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Assessing students' abilities and limitations with regard to intellectual, physical, social and emotional impairments, exceptional intellectual gifts, or other specific problems. Designing or modifying curricula and preparing and delivering programmes, lessons and activities adapted to students’ abilities and needs. Giving instruction on an individual or group basis using special techniques or aids appropriate to students’ needs. Employing special educational strategies and techniques during instruction to improve the development of sensory- and perceptual-motor skills, language, cognition, and memory. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and policies and procedures to maintain order among students. Teaching academic subjects, and practical and self-help skills to students with hearing, sight and other impairments. Stimulating and developing students’ confidence interests, abilities, manual skills and coordination. Conferring with other staff members to plan and schedule lessons for special needs students. Preparing and maintaining student data and other records and submitting reports. Administering various forms of assessment and evaluating progress of each student. Conferring with students, parents, head teacher and other relevant professionals involved in the students’ care to develop individual educational plans designed to promote students' development.

fields.name: Teachers' Aide
fields.description: Assists teaching staff in the preparation of teaching materials and with general classroom tasks.
fields.tasks: Tutoring and assisting children individually or in small groups to help them master assignments and to reinforce learning concepts presented by teachers Maintaining computers in classrooms and laboratories and assisting learners with hardware and software use. Operating and maintaining audio-visual equipment. Distributing teaching materials such as textbooks, workbooks, papers and pencils to learners. Providing extra assistance to learners with special needs. Conducting demonstrations to teach skills such as sports and handicrafts. Supervising learners in classrooms, on school playgrounds, or on field trips. Taking class attendance and maintaining attendance records. Discussing assigned duties with classroom teachers to coordinate instructional efforts.

fields.name: Technical (ICT) Support Services Manager
fields.description: Manages and controls systems and network engineering support service functions, including strategy, support for business development, quality of service and operations.  Ensures specialist technical expertise and support in installing, testing, tuning, op
fields.tasks: Conferring with users to discuss issues such as computer data access needs, security violations, and programming changes.      Developing plans to safeguard computer files against accidental or unauthorised modification, destruction, or disclosure and to meet emergency data processing needs.      Encrypting data transmissions and erecting firewalls to conceal confidential information as it is being transmitted and to keep out tainted digital transfers.      Modifying computer security files to incorporate new software, correct errors, or change individual access status.      Monitoring current reports of computer viruses to determine when to update virus protection systems.      Monitoring use of data files and regulate access to safeguard information in computer files.      Training users and promoting security awareness to ensure system security and to improve server and network efficiency. Performing risk assessments and executing tests of data processing system to ensure functioning of data processing activities and security measures.

fields.name: Technical Director
fields.description: Controls the quality of pictures and sound for television or radio programs by directing technical teams and planning and organising technical facilities.
fields.tasks: Choosing writers, studying scripts to determine artistic interpretation, and instructing actors on acting methods.      Creating, planning, videotaping and editing video.     Engaging and supervising all technical personnel and determining the treatment, scope and scheduling of production.      Maintaining production archives and negotiating royalties.      Planning, organising and controlling the various stages and scheduling involved in the production of presentations, motion pictures, and television shows.      Supervising the positioning of scenery, props and lighting and sound equipment.

fields.name: Technical Writer
fields.description: Researches and writes technical information-based material and documentation for articles, manuals, text books, handbooks, or multimedia products, usually for education or corporate purposes.
fields.tasks: Analysing material, such as specifications, notes and drawings, and writing manuals, user guides and other documents to explain clearly and concisely the installation, operation and maintenance of software, electronic, mechanical and other equipment.      Conducting research to establish factual content and to obtain other necessary information.     Selecting material for publication, checking style, grammar and accuracy of content, arranging for any necessary revisions and checks proof copies before printing.     Writing brochures, handbooks and similar technical publications.

fields.name: Telecommunications Cable Jointer
fields.description: Joints, terminates and repairs copper and fibre optic telecommunications cables installed in underground pipes, trenches and overhead systems.
fields.tasks: Accessing specific areas to repair cables by climbing poles or ladders, or entering tunnels, trenches or crawl spaces. Splicing cables using hand tools, epoxy or mechanical equipment. Joining optical fibres together mechanically by positioning them inside a mechanical splice unit and using a connector or an adhesive cover to join the splice together. Joining together two or more optical fibers through fusion splicing as an alternative to mechanical splicing by welding with an electronic arc. Protecting fibre optic telecommunication cables with heat shrink tubing to keep the cable safe from the outside elements or breakage. Laying underground cable directly in trenches or feeding it through conduits running through trenches. Terminating copper and fibre optic telecommunication cables when required.

fields.name: Telecommunications Engineer
fields.description: Designs and develops telecommunications systems, devices and products.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing telecommunications devices or components, systems, equipment and distribution centres. Specifying production or installation methods, materials, quality and safety standards and directing production or installation work of telecommunications products and systems. Organizing and directing maintenance and repair of existing telecommunication systems, motors and equipment. Researching and advising on telecommunications equipment. Planning and designing communications networks based on wired, fibre optical and wireless communication media. Designing and developing signal processing algorithms and implementing these through appropriate choice of hardware and software. Designing telecommunications networks and radio and television distribution systems, including both cable and over the air.

fields.name: Telecommunications Engineering Technologist
fields.description: Analyses, modifies, maintains and repairs new and existing telecommunication systems and applies them in the testing and implementation of telecommunication engineering projects.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing telecommunications devices or components, systems, equipment and distribution centres. Specifying production or installation methods, materials, quality and safety standards and directing production or installation work of telecommunications products and systems. Organising and directing maintenance and repair of existing telecommunication systems, motors and equipment. Researching and advising on telecommunications equipment. Planning and designing communications networks based on wired, fibre optical and wireless communication media. Designing and developing signal processing algorithms and implementing these through appropriate choice of hardware and software. Designing telecommunications networks and radio and television distribution systems, including both cable and over the air.

fields.name: Telecommunications Field Engineer
fields.description: Plans, designs commissions and monitors complex telecommunications networks and associated equipment. Provides technical advice and information, and identifies complex problems and initiates action to resolve.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing telecommunications devices or components, systems, equipment and distribution centres Specifying production or installation methods, materials, quality and safety standards and directing production or installation work of telecommunications products and systems Organizing and directing maintenance and repair of existing telecommunication systems, motors and equipment Researching and advising on telecommunications equipment Planning and designing communications networks based on wired, fibre optical and wireless communication media Designing and developing signal processing algorithms and implementing these through appropriate choice of hardware and software Designing telecommunications networks and radio and television distribution systems, including both cable and over the air

fields.name: Telecommunications Line Mechanic
fields.description: Installs, maintains and repairs external telecommunication equipment, including aerial lines, conduits and underground cables, radio and mobile phone antennae, and limited items of terminal equipment. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Installing and repairing cabling for computer, radio, telephone and television transmission. Joining telecommunications and data cables and sealing sheathes. Installing, maintaining and repairing antennae used in communications. Testing lines and circuits. Locating and repairing faults. Install electricity transformers. Connect equipment to an electric network.

fields.name: Telecommunications Network Engineer
fields.description: Plans, designs, and monitors complex telecommunications networks and associated broadcasting equipment.
fields.tasks: Advising on and designing telecommunications devices or components, systems, equipment and distribution centres. Specifying production or installation methods, materials, quality and safety standards and directing production or installation work of telecommunications products and systems. Organising and directing maintenance and repair of existing telecommunication systems, motors and equipment. Researching and advising on telecommunications equipment. Planning and designing communications networks based on wired, fibre optical and wireless communication media. Designing and developing signal processing algorithms and implementing these through appropriate choice of hardware and software. Designing telecommunications networks and radio and television distribution systems, including both cable and over the air.

fields.name: Telecommunications Technical Officer or Technologist
fields.description: Carries out specialised design and support functions in telecommunications engineering including optimization and performance monitoring of telecommunications networks, diagnosis and repair of faults, and the selection and installation of equipment.
fields.tasks: Installing fixed and wireless network equipment, ensuring that equipment and circuit installations are of good quality. Carrying out proof tests such as line testing, circuit commissioning and power tests. Installing and maintaining telecommunication and other data systems at customers' premises. Installing, testing and maintaining all types of telecommunications, switching and transmission equipment. Modifying equipment as required. Analysing system faults with a high degree of diagnostic skill (to circuit board level). Maintaining and adhering to operational procedures and completing appropriate documentation. Developing and maintaining relations with all stakeholders. Operating call tracing facilities when necessary.

fields.name: Telecommunications Technician
fields.description: Installs, maintains and repairs telecommunications equipment and appliances such as telephones, mobile telephones, switchboards and data transmission equipment, in homes, businesses, telephone exchanges and other network sites. NOTE: This occupation is li
fields.tasks: Maintaining, troubleshooting, testing and repairing computers, data transmission equipment and computer peripherals. Fitting and adjusting computer hardware. Examining equipment and systems to find and repair faults. Updating and maintaining existing equipment. Installing telecommunications equipment, and connecting it to networks. Testing repaired, updated, or newly installed items. Assisting with selecting sites for equipment.

fields.name: Telephone Betting Clerk
fields.description: Records and processes customer bets and account details over the telephone for horse and dog racing, and other sports events. May work in a call centre.
fields.tasks: Taking bets for horse racing and other competitive sporting or recreational events over the phone from a betting agency or call centre. Verifying the identity and account balances of betting agency customers. Recording bets electronically. Issuing tickets and preparing summaries of transactions. Checking the amounts of money placed on race entrants and updating bookmakers accordingly. Checking the details of winning betting tickets against the betting records, and paying out on winning tickets.

fields.name: Television Equipment Operator
fields.description: Operates television equipment to record, edit, mix and prepare material for broadcast.
fields.tasks: Setting up, positioning and operating equipment in studios or on location. Recording subject matter. Discussing filming techniques as well as focus and distance settings and camera angles with Director. Selecting and setting  up equipment and accessories. Checking  that the lighting has been  set up  as required. Checking scenes through viewfinders, making final adjustments and filming scenes. Monitoring equipment during operation. Moving cameras, adjusting controls, following the action of scenes being filmed. Consulting with other technicians and workers to obtain required results. Supervising assistants during the production phase.

fields.name: Television Journalist
fields.description: Collects and analyses facts about newsworthy events by interview, investigation and observation and writes stories for television news or public affairs programs.
fields.tasks: Collecting local, national and international news through interviews, investigation and observation, attending public events, seeking out records, reviewing written work, attending film and stage performances.      Collecting, reporting and commenting on news and current affairs for publication in newspapers and periodicals, or for broadcasting by the media.      Interviewing politicians and other public figures at press conferences and on other occasions, including individual interviews recorded for the media.      Liaising with production staff.      Receiving, analysing and verifying news for accuracy.      Researching and reporting on developments in specialised fields such as medicine, science and technology.      Selecting material for publication, checking style, grammar, accuracy and legality of content and arranging for any necessary revisions.      Selecting, assembling and preparing publicity material about business or other organisations for issue through the media.      Writing critical reviews of literary, musical and other artistic works based on knowledge, judgement and experience for the media.

fields.name: Television Presenter
fields.description: Prepares and presents news, sports and other information, conducts interviews and introduces music performances and special events on television. This occupation requires high levels of creative talent or personal commitment and interest as well as, or in
fields.tasks: Commenting on music and other matters , such as weather or traffic conditions.      Interviewing persons on television.      Introducing programs, performing artists or persons being interviewed, and making related announcements on television.      Reading news bulletins and making other announcements on television.      Studying background information in order to prepare for programs or interviews.

fields.name: Tennis Player
fields.description: Plays tennis professionally. This occupation requires high levels of physical fitness, sporting ability and personal commitment as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications or experience.
fields.tasks: Adhering to the rules and regulations associated with tennis. Participating in regular practice and training sessions and undertaking training to maintain the required standard of fitness and skill. Maintaining a high degree of expertise in tennis. Assessing other competitors and conditions at venues. Deciding on strategies in consultation with coaches. Competing in tennis tournaments and other events. Undertaking tennis promotional activities and media interviews.

fields.name: Textile and Footwear Manufacturing Machine Minder
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and runs and monitors textile and footwear manufacturing machinery and equipment.
fields.tasks: Threading yarn or fabric through guides, needles and rollers of machines. Starting machines and making adjustments as needed. Operating and monitoring machines that fold cloth into measured lengths. Minding machines to measure leather pieces. Operating and monitoring machines which make miscellaneous articles such as braids or other trimmings. Observing operations to detect defects, malfunctions or supply shortages. Minding machines that wind thread, twine or yarn into balls preparatory to shipping or further processing.

fields.name: Textile Machine Mechanic
fields.description: Sets up, adjusts, maintains and repairs industrial machines used in the production of yarn, knitted, woven and non-woven textiles.
fields.tasks: Installing or commissioning machines. Starting machines for trial runs to make sure they are running properly. Inspecting yarns and fabrics produced. Adjusting machine settings to meet design specifications. Performing operational maintenance of machines. Overhauling and repairing mechanical parts or fluid power equipment. Programming, diagnosing and repairing computer controlled machines. Diagnosing and fixing processing faults on textile equipment.

fields.name: Textile Produce Mender and Embroiderer
fields.description: Repairs tears, holes, and other defects in fabrics and embroiders designs over stamped or stenciled designs on fabric material.
fields.tasks: Selecting thread according to specifications of parts or dying thread to match colour and shade of cloth to be darned. Repairing tears, holes and other defects in fabrics. Sewing or gluing decorative trimmings to articles. Embroidering ornamental designs on cloth by hand or machine using needle and coloured threads. Sewing designs by hand over stamped, printed or stencilled patterns on fabric. Sewing fringe, tassels and ruffles onto drapes and curtains, and buttons and trimming onto garments. Sewing labels and emblems onto articles for identification.

fields.name: Textile Wet Process Production Operator
fields.description: Sets up, loads, operates and monitors wet process production machines to bleach, dye, print and finish fibre, yarn, knitted, woven and non-woven products.
fields.tasks: Starting and controlling machines and equipment to bleach, dye, or otherwise process and finish fabric, yarn, thread, and/or other textile goods. Tending machines that shrink woven or knitted cloth to predetermined size or strengthen the weave by interlocking the fibres. Tending a variety of automatic machines that comb and polish furs. Operating and monitoring machines that treat silk to give it body and weight. Operating and monitoring machines that impregnate textiles with chemicals to render them waterproof. Dyeing articles to change or restore their colours. Operating and monitoring machines that stretch, or impart lustre, or other type of finish to textiles. ending and regulating equipment that fumigates and removes foreign matter from furs. Operating machines that comb, dry and polish furs, clean, sterilize and fluff feathers and blankets. Keying in processing instructions to program electronic equipment. Observing display screens, control panels, equipment, and cloth entering or exiting processes to determine if equipment is operating correctly.

fields.name: Textile, Clothing, Footwear and Leather Processing Machine Mechanic
fields.description: Sets up, adjusts, maintains and repairs industrial or domestic sewing machines, or machines used in the production of yarn, textiles, footwear and in leather processing. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Studying drawings and specifications to determine suitable material, method and sequence of operations, and machine settings. Fitting fabricated metal parts into products and assembling metal parts and sub-assemblies to produce machines and equipment. Checking fabricated and assembled metal parts for accuracy, clearance and fit using precision measuring instruments. Setting guides, stops and other controls on machining tools, setting up prescribed cutting and shaping tools and dies in machines and presses, and setting controls for textile machines. Forming metal stock and castings to fine tolerances using machining tools to press, cut, grind, plane, bore and drill metal. Cutting, threading, bending and installing hydraulic and pneumatic pipes and lines. Preparing pattern mechanisms to control the operation of textile machines used to spin, weave, knit, sew and tuft fabric. Diagnosing faults and performing operational maintenance of machines, and overhauling and repairing mechanical parts and fluid power equipment.

fields.name: Textile, Leather and Related Materials Handicraft Workers
fields.description: Applies traditional techniques and patterns to produce woven fabrics, knitted, embroidered, woven and other garments and articles for household use, as well as traditional footwear, handbags, belts and other accessories.
fields.tasks: Spinning and dyeing with natural dyestuffs, wool, cotton and other fibres. Lace-making and weaving, knitting, or embroidering various garments and articles for household use. Preparing and dyeing hides with natural dyestuffs and making traditional footwear or handbags, belts and other accessories. Spinning and winding yarn by hand. Drawing warp threads into loom by hand. Weaving plain or figured cloth, tapestry, lace, carpet or other fabrics on hand looms. Making carpets by using a knotting technique. Knitting garments and other articles on hand-operated machine or by hand. Crocheting or making braid by hand. Making nets by hand. Grading and classifying natural textile fibres. Washing wool fibres. Cleaning and fluffing textile fibres. Forming fibres into sliver, combing them, combining sliver into sliver laps or forming sliver into rove.

fields.name: Theatrical Dresser
fields.description: Selects, fits, and takes care of costumes for cast members, and aid entertainers. May assist with multiple costume changes during performances.
fields.tasks: Maintaining all costumes, shoes, undergarments, hats and costume related personal props such as gloves, jewelry, parasols, fans and pocket books. Assisting performers with costume changes during performances. Assisting performers with costume-related issues. Ensuring the proper labeling, hanging, storage and preset of all costume pieces. Creating and executing a proper cleaning schedule for all items, ensuring that laundry and dry cleaning are done on a regular basis between performances.

fields.name: Therapy Aide
fields.description: Assists therapists in providing therapy programs and in the direct care of their patients in a variety of health, welfare and community settings.
fields.tasks: Working under the supervision of a Physiotherapist or Occupational Therapist and providing support and assistance to them when they treat patients. Providing general care and comfort to patients and continuing with basic therapy as directed. Assisting patients with recreational and leisure activities and assisting with rehabilitation exercises. Instructing and assisting people with a disability with self-care and daily living activities. Assisting patients to perform routine physiotherapy or occupational therapy tasks on an individual or group basis under the supervision of a registered Physiotherapist or Occupational Therapist. Reporting to supervising priofessional on action taken, client progress and any unusual circumstances.

fields.name: Thermoforming Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates thermoforming machines to produce thermo plastic products.
fields.tasks: Controlling process start-up and shut-down, troubleshooting and monitoring outside process equipment. Setting up, preparing and adjusting machinery. Operating and monitoring thermoforming machines to produce thermoplastic products. Observing gauges, meters, computer printouts, video monitors and products to ensure correct operation of machine and verify specified processing conditions. Adjusting equipment, valves, pumps, controls and process equipment. Analysing sample products and performing tests to ensure conformity to standards. Verifying equipment for malfunctions, carrying out routine operating tests and arranging for maintenance. Recording data and writing production logs.

fields.name: Ticket Collector
fields.description: Collects tickets or admission passes and ushers patrons to their seats at an entertainment, sporting or recreational venue, prepares the venue before an event and locks up premises afterwards.
fields.tasks: Greeting patrons attending entertainment events while collecting their admission tickets and giving and collecting passes. Examining tickets or passes to verify authenticity and denying admittance to undesirable persons or persons without tickets or passes. Providing assistance with patrons' special needs, such as helping those with wheelchairs. Counting and recording the number of tickets collected. Selling programmes to patrons. Operating refreshment stands during intermission. Managing inventory or sale of artist merchandise. Working with other employees to change advertising displays. Maintaining order, ensuring adherence to safety rules, and providing instructions to or guiding patrons to exits points in cases of emergency.

fields.name: Ticket Seller
fields.description: Sells tickets and makes reservations for services such as travel and admission to sporting and entertainment venues. May work in a call centre.
fields.tasks: Answering questions concerning fares, routes, schedules and reservations, and giving information concerning upcoming shows or events. Receiving customers' requests regarding ticket availability, and checking ticket availability as per required dates and times. Making reservations for customers. Accepting payment from customers and issuing tickets, receipts and change. Keeping balance sheets of cash received and tickets sold. Making reservations for customers by telephone or email.

fields.name: Timber and Wood Process Worker
fields.description: Performs routine tasks in paper and pulp mills, sawmills, timber yards, and wood processing and timber products factories.
fields.tasks: Rolling logs from trucks and conveyors to log decks, saw carriages and stacking bays. Moving logs and wood billets onto conveyors and lathes for processing into chips, veneers and pulp. Selecting types and grades of timber, and measuring and cutting it to specifications. Placing timber for processing by machines and unloading cut timber from machines. Supporting and guiding timber during sawing, and sorting and stacking timber during milling. Assisting with setting up and operating bandsaws, gangsaws and circular saws. Transporting, packing and loading wood products around the plant. Cleaning work areas, tools and equipment.

fields.name: Tobacco Grader
fields.description: Grades cured tobacco leaves by type, quality and locality where grown.
fields.tasks: Recording the locality where tobacco was grown. Grading the leaf after the harvesting and curing and describing the stalk position, quality, and colour of the cured tobacco. Weighing products or estimating the weight, visually or by feel. Determining further detail such as smell and appearance to ensure correct processing. Grading of aromatic tobaccos in the factory before the fermentation process. Placing of products in containers according to grade and marking grades on containers. Recording inspection or test data, such as weights, temperatures, grades, or moisture content, and quantities inspected or graded. Recording grade and/or identification numbers on shipping, receiving, or sales sheets.

fields.name: Tobacco Processing Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets operates and attends machinery used to blend and otherwise process tobacco.
fields.tasks: Tending vacuum container which moistens tobacco for further processing. Setting up tobacco processing and cigarette production machines. Starting machines or valves to engage feeding, cooling, and lubricating mechanisms. Operating tobacco blending and cigarette production machines. Observing machine operation to detect defects or machine malfunctions. Performing minor machine maintenance, such as oiling or cleaning machines, or adding coolant to machine reservoirs.

fields.name: Tobacco Product Processing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates machines and performs routine tasks to process and package tobacco products.
fields.tasks: Producing cutrag (semi-processed tobacco or tobacco that has been cut into fine strips for use in cigarettes). Pre-conditioning of unmanufactured tobacco. Cutting lamina and threshed stems. Supplying raw materials to production machines. Processing tobacco leaves by machine to make cigarettes, cigars, pipe and other tobacco products. Applying quality control on filter rods. Shutting down machines and applying quality control on the final product. Cleaning cutting machines. Cleaning conditioning machines.

fields.name: Tool Grinder and Sharpener
fields.description: Sharpens cutting tools and instruments using grinding wheels or mechanically operated grinding machines.
fields.tasks: Applying knowledge of abrasives and tool grinding and sharpening procedures. Selecting, mounting and positioning grinding tools in machine chucks, spindles, or other tool-holding devices, using hand tools. Switching on and operating grinding and related tools that remove excess material or burrs from surfaces, sharpen edges or corners, or buff, hone, or polish metal or plastic workpieces. Moving machine controls to index workpieces and to adjust machines for pre-selected operational settings. Sharpening cutting tools and instruments using grinding wheels or mechanically operated grinding machines. Observing machine operations to detect any problems and making necessary adjustments to correct problems. Brushing or spraying lubricating compounds on workpieces, or turning valve handles and directing the flow of coolants against tools and workpieces.

fields.name: Toolmaker
fields.description: Makes and repairs tools, dies, jigs, fixtures and other precision parts and equipment to fine tolerances for machine tools and other production machinery. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Reading and interpreting engineering drawings and specifications of tools, dies, prototypes or models. Preparing templates and sketches, and determining work processes. Visualising and computing dimensions, sizes, shapes, and tolerances of assemblies, based on specifications. Positioning, securing and measuring metal stock or castings to lay out for machining. Setting up, operating and maintaining conventional and computer numerically controlled machine tools to cut, turn, mill, plane, drill, bore, grind or otherwise shape work piece to prescribed dimensions and finish. Fitting and assembling parts to make and repair jigs, fixtures and gauges. Repairing and modifying sports guns and other small arms. Making, fitting, assembling, repairing and installing lock parts and locks.

fields.name: Tour Guide
fields.description: Escorts visitors on sightseeing, educational or other tours, and describes and explains points of interest.
fields.tasks: Escorting and guiding tourists on cruises and sightseeing tours. Escorting visitors through places of interest such as museums, exhibitions, theme parks, factories and other industrial establishments. Describing and providing information on points of interest and exhibits and responding to questions. Conducting educational activities for school children. Monitoring visitors' activities to ensure compliance with establishment or tour regulations and safety practices. Greeting and registering visitors and tour participants, and issuing any required identification badges or safety devices. Providing for physical safety of groups, and performing activities such as providing first aid and directing emergency evacuations.

fields.name: Tourism Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches tourism principles (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organizing and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Tourist Information Officer
fields.description: Provides travel and accommodation information to tourists. May work in a call centre.
fields.tasks: Obtaining information about the availability, cost and convenience of different types of transport and accommodation, ascertaining customer’s requirements and advising them on travel arrangements. Preparing itineraries. Making and confirming reservations. Issuing tickets and vouchers. Helping customers in obtaining necessary travel documents such as visas. Organizing group tours for business or vacation travel and selling them to groups or individuals.

fields.name: Tow Truck Driver
fields.description: Drives a tow truck, requiring a specially endorsed class of licence, to transport broken down motor vehicles.
fields.tasks: Driving a tow truck to move motor vehicles that have been damaged in accidents, have stalled or have been ticketed by police for traffic violations.   Responding to calls from police, repair garages, insurance companies or automobile associations to provide assistance at specific locations.   Removing, bending or cutting parts of damaged vehicles to prepare them for towing.   Attaching an anti-sway bar to vehicles by means of cables, chains or other grappling devices, and hoisting up one end of vehicles using a hand winches or powered winchs. Towing vehicles to repair garages or to police vehicle impounding areas.   Performing minor repairs to vehicles along roads such as replacing spark plugs, batteries and light bulbs, or connecting loose wires in an effort to get the vehicle driving again.   Dismantling vehicles to salvage parts using hand tools such as wrenches, pry bars and hack saws.

fields.name: Town Planning Technician
fields.description: Provides technical support to town planners by preparing and maintaining plans, documents, charts, photographs, tables, reports, and exhibition material for projects, public meetings and committees related to the controlled use of urban and rural land. NO
fields.tasks: Providing technical assistance connected with the construction of buildings and other structures, and with surveys or the preparation of survey reports. Planning layout and coordinating development of urban areas. Compiling and analyzing data on economic, legal, political, cultural, demographic, sociological, physical and environmental factors affecting land use. Devising and recommending use and development of land, and presenting narrative and graphic plans programs and designs to groups and individuals. Advising governments, companies and communities on urban and regional planning issues and proposals. Planning layout and coordinating development of urban areas. Planning and the development of land areas for parks, schools, institutions, airports, roadways and related projects, and for commercial, industrial and residential sites.

fields.name: Tractor Mechanic
fields.description: Maintains, tests and repairs tractors. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Diagnosing mechanical failures and repairing tractors and tractor components according to factory specifications. Attaching compression, ignition, and time test instruments to certain parts of tractor, using clamps and handtools. Starting engine dials and reading meters and gauges of testing equipment to diagnose engine malfunction. Removing and disassembling engine, transmission, and clutches, using hoists, jacks, and mechanic's handtools. Inspecting parts for damage, and verifying dimensions and clearances of parts for conformance to factory specifications, using gauges, such as calipers, and micrometers. Replacing or repairing worn or damaged parts. Grinding valves, relining and adjusting brakes, tightening body bolts, aligning wheels, and tuning engine. Welding defective body or frame parts.

fields.name: Trade Mark Attorney
fields.description: Registers and protects trademarks such as names, slogans, symbols, logos, packaging, letters and numbers. Advises clients on industrial designs and copyright.
fields.tasks: Researching new trade marks and advising clients on trade mark availability for use or registration. Advising on trade mark design and copyright issues. Assisting clients with identifying the nature of their intellectual property. Overseeing and assisting with all procedural details of trade mark registration and contractual papers. Taking action on trade mark infringement and negotiating in disputes regarding trade marks. Providing back-up to the attorneys and advocates conducting patent-related cases in Court. Handling all matters related to trade mark renewals.

fields.name: Trade Mark Examiner
fields.description: Determines whether an applicant should be permitted to receive a trademark registration.
fields.tasks: Searching for trademarks that have been applied for previously to ensure there are no earlier trademarks that conflict with new applications. Using research tools to conduct examinations, including in-house and external databases, procedural manuals, legislation, court decisions and other legal resources, as well as using own intellectual capabilities and technical knowledge. Determining the capacity of the trademark to distinguish the goods or services specified in the application. Determining whether legislative requirements have been met in the making of the trademark application. Communicating with applicants or their attorneys on the outcome of the examination, and considering responses and submissions. Recommending or approving the acceptance of trademarks for registration.

fields.name: Trade Union Representative
fields.description: Determines, formulates and direct the implementation of policies of trade unions, and represent their organization and act on its behalf.
fields.tasks: Monitoring and evaluating performance of the organization or enterprise against established objectives and policies. Negotiating on behalf of the organization, its members and relevant special-interest groups. Planning, directing and coordinating the general functioning of the organization. Promoting the interests of the organization, its members and relevant special-interest groups before the legislature, government or general public. Representing the organization at official occasions and board meetings, in negotiations, at conventions, public hearings and forums. Reviewing the operations and results of the organization and reporting to boards of directors and governing bodies, the organization’s membership and funding agencies.

fields.name: Traditional African Medicine Practitioner
fields.description: Treats imbalances of energy flows through the body by assessing the whole person and using techniques and methods such as acupuncture, Chinese herbal medicine, massage, diet, exercise and breathing therapy.
fields.tasks: Conducting physical examinations of patients and interviewing them and their families to determine their health status.   Developing and implementing treatment plans for physical, mental and psychosocial ailments using traditional methods.   Preparing and administering traditional medicines with herbal, plant, mineral and animal products to bring about physiological and psychological healing effects.   Conducting research into traditional and complementary medicines and treatments and disseminating findings.   Evaluating patients' progress through treatment plans.   Providing health, nutrition and lifestyle advice to individuals, families and communities.

fields.name: Traditional Chinese Medicine Practitioner
fields.description: Treats imbalances of energy flows through the body by assessing the whole person and using techniques and methods such as acupuncture, Chinese herbal medicine, massage, diet, exercise and breathing therapy.
fields.tasks: Using techniques in the traditional Chinese medicine system to treat a range of conditions in the human body that contribute to ill health.   Conducting physical examinations of patients and interviewing them and their families to determine their health status.   Using techniques unique to the discipline of Chinese medicine to diagnose imbalances in the body. Developing and implementing treatment plans for physical, mental and psychosocial ailments using traditional methods.   Applying a range of therapies and treatments such as acupuncture, massage, dietary and herbal therapies as well as traditional breathing and movement exercises.   Conducting research into traditional and complementary medicines and treatments and disseminating findings.   Evaluating and documenting patients' progress through treatment plans.   Providing health, nutrition and lifestyle advice to individuals, families and communities.   Prescribing and preparing traditional medicines that incorporate herbal, plant, mineral and animal extracts.

fields.name: Traditional Leader
fields.description: Performs a variety of legislative, administrative and ceremonial tasks and duties, as determined by the community or village.
fields.tasks: Allocating the use of communal land and other resources among households in the community or village. Collecting and distributing surplus production of the community or village. Disciplining members of the community or village for violation of rules and customs. Informing the community or village about government rules and regulations. Performing ceremonial duties in connection with births, marriages, deaths, harvests and other important occasions. Representing the community or village on local or regional councils. Settling disputes between members of the community or village.

fields.name: Traffic Officer
fields.description: Preserves safety on the roads through the enforcement of traffic rules.
fields.tasks: Patrolling roads in motorcars, on motorcycles or on foot.   Monitoring traffic to ensure motorists observe traffic regulations and exhibit safe driving procedures.   Applying the legal requirements in respect of vehicles and drivers and issuing citations or warnings to violators.   Keeping a daily log on citations issued and writing reports about problems experienced.   Directing traffic and assuming authority in the event of accidents.   Acting as official escorts where needed.   Investigating traffic accidents to determine causes.   Testifying in court to present evidence or acting as witness in traffic cases.   Controlling crowds during emergencies to make sure fire and rescue workers can get to the scene safely.

fields.name: Train Controller
fields.description: Oversees the safe movement of trains using a computerised train control signalling system.
fields.tasks: Signalling to trains to begin runs, stop or change speed using a computerised train control system.   Conferring with engineers regarding train routes, timetables and cargo.   Receiving information regarding train or rail problems from dispatchers or from electronic monitoring devices.   Discussing alternative routes when there are rail defects or obstructions.   Directing and instructing workers engaged in yard activities such as switching tracks, coupling and uncoupling cars as well as routing inbound and outbound traffic.   Operating controls to activate track switches and traffic signals.   Keeping records of the contents and destination of each train car, and making sure that cars are added or removed at proper points on routes.   Arranging for the removal of defective cars from trains at stations or stops.

fields.name: Train Driver
fields.description: Drives a train to transport passengers and freight on railways.
fields.tasks: Checking train systems and equipment such as air conditioning and heating systems, brakes and brake hoses prior to train runs.   Driving or assisting in driving an electric or diesel-electric locomotive engine to transport passengers or freight by rail.   Operating communications systems to communicate with train crew and traffic controllers to ensure the safe operation and proper scheduling of trains.   Watching for track hazards, and using and obeying train track signals.   Using computers for navigation and to operate and regulate the trains under strict safety regulations.   Inspecting the train regularly, repairing minor problems and reporting major defects.

fields.name: Train Examiner
fields.description: Inspects rolling stock in railway yards, terminals and stations to ensure adherence to safety standards and operational rules and regulations.
fields.tasks: Conducting checks of the mechanical, structural, electrical, pneumatic and hydraulic systems of railway wagons, carriages and locomotives.   Inspecting railroad locomotives using hand tools and measuring instruments to determine extent of wear.   Tapping parts such as rods, wheels and bolts with hammer or rawhide mallet and listening to sound to detect ruptures or cracks.   Measuring wheel flanges with calipers and depth gauge to detect excessive wear or flat spots.   Performing minor fault diagnosis and component exchange.   Preparing inspection form and reporting defects.

fields.name: Training and Development Professional
fields.description: Plans, develops, implements and evaluates training and development programs to ensure management and staff acquire the skills and develop the competencies required by an organisation to meet organisational objectives.
fields.tasks: Assisting with the upgrading of the skills of employees, to contribute to improving the production levels and efficiency of workers and companies. Gathering, investigating and researching background materials to gain an understanding of various subject matters and systems. Placing employees in positions which suit their talents, character and qualifications. Assisting line managers to identify and solve performance problems of employees through training and development interventions. Liaising with external training providers to arrange delivery of specific training and development programmes. Conducting specialised training sessions, on-the-job learning opportunities and managing learnership programmes. Structuring the content of training courses and learning opportunities which are used to develop the competencies of employees. Setting human resource development objectives and evaluating outcomes by measuring the progress of learners as well as the improvement of performance and productivity in the company.

fields.name: Tram Driver
fields.description: Drives a tram to transport passengers on urban light rail networks.

fields.name: Translator
fields.description: Transfers a source text from one language into another, usually within an extended time frame to allow for corrections and modifications and without the presence of the participants who require the translation.
fields.tasks: Advising on or preparing language classification systems, dictionaries and similar materials.      Developing methods for the use of computers and other instruments to improve productivity and quality of translation.      Revising and correcting translated material.      Translating from one language into another and ensuring that the correct meaning of the original is retained, that legal, technical or scientific works are correctly rendered, and that the phraseology and terminology of the spirit and style of literary works are maintained.

fields.name: Transport Analyst
fields.description: Conducts studies in the use and operation of transportation systems and develops transportation models or simulations.
fields.tasks: Advising governments, companies and communities on urban and regional planning issues and proposals. Compiling and analysing data on economic, legal, political, cultural, demographic, sociological, physical and environmental factors.      Conferring with government authorities, communities and specialists.      Devising and recommending use and development of land, and presenting narrative and graphic plans programs and designs. Planning and advising on routing and control of road traffic and public transportation systems for efficiency and safety.          Reviewing and evaluating environmental impact reports.

fields.name: Transport Clerk
fields.description: Keeps records of operational aspects and coordinate the timing of train, road and air passenger and freight transport, and prepare reports for management.
fields.tasks: Coordinating and keeping records of operational activities concerning air transport of passengers and freight, such as passenger lists and freight manifests. Coordinating and keeping records of operational activities concerning road transport, such as the allocation and scheduling of vehicles and drivers, loading and unloading of vehicles, and storage of goods in transit. Directing train routings within a division or zone of a railway system and keeping related records. Directing, controlling and keeping records of freight handling at a railway yard. Maintaining records of receipts and dispatches. Undertaking clerical work such as filing, accounting, updating customs records, preparing correspondence, and inputting and retrieving information from computers

fields.name: Transport Conductor
fields.description: Collects fares and issues tickets on a transport vehicle.
fields.tasks: Checking the carriages are clean before the start of a journey. Making sure equipment, doors and controls are working properly. Walking through carriages during the journey, checking tickets and travel documents. Answering passengers' questions about routes, arrival times and connections. Making announcements over the public address system. Making sure passengers get on and off the train safely. Dealing with unexpected delays or emergencies.

fields.name: Transport Operations Inspector
fields.description: Monitors scheduled train, tram and bus services and investigates accidents, complaints and service disruptions.
fields.tasks: Monitoring and investigating train or bus schedule effectivity, delays, accidents, and complaints.   Observing and recording time required to load and unload passengers or freight volume on trains or busses.   Determining the need for changes in service such as additional vehicles or route changes and revising schedules to improve service and efficiency.   Driving along route to detect conditions hazardous to equipment and passengers and negotiating with local governments to eliminate hazards.   Carrying out detailed examinations of train or bus accidents collecting evidence in the form of photos, videos, witness statements and expert reports.   Submitting written reports with recommendations to authorities.

fields.name: Transportation Electrician
fields.description: Installs, maintains and repairs electrical wiring and electronic components in motorised vehicles. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Installing, testing, connecting, maintaining and modifying electrical wiring and control systems in motorised vehicles. Inspecting and testing manufactured electrical parts of motorised vehicles. Locating and removing or repairing circuit defects in motorised vehicles. Inspecting and testing electrical systems and equipment to locate and diagnose malfunctions in motorised vehicles, using visual inspections, testing devices, and computer software. Referring to schematics and manufacturers' specifications that show connections and provide instructions on how to locate problems in motorised vehicles. Installing electrical equipment such as air-conditioning, heating, or ignition systems and components in motorised vehicles. Repairing or rebuilding equipment such as starters, generators, distributors, or door controls, using electrician's tools in motorised vehicles.

fields.name: Travel Accommodation Inspector
fields.description: Evaluates and grades places of accommodation for listing purposes.
fields.tasks: Travelling to hotels and lodges inspecting the facilities. Performing standardised onsite inspections/assessments of hotels and lodgings for ratings as set by Tourism Grading Council of South Africa (TGCSA). Providing an individual perspective based on independent evaluation for tour books and websites. Meeting with the property general manager/owner to review findings and explain the rationale for the decision rendered. Generating a report once evaluation has been completed; publishing report in travel and accommodation guides.

fields.name: Travel Agency Manager
fields.description: Organises and controls the operations of a travel agency.
fields.tasks: Promoting and marketing the business, sometimes to new or niche markets. Managing budgets and maintaining statistical/financial records. Selling travel products and tour packages and overseeing the smooth, efficient running of the business. Sourcing products and destinations to meet consumer demands for bespoke travel and sustainable tourism. Taking part in familiarisation visits to new destinations in order to gain information on issues and amenities of interest to consumers. Liaising with travel partners, including airlines and hotels, to manage bookings and schedules, often one year in advance. Dealing with customer enquiries and aiming to meet their expectations.

fields.name: Travel Consultant
fields.description: Plans travel, accommodation and associated arrangements for clients, and makes travel bookings. May work in a call centre.
fields.tasks: Obtaining information about the availability, cost and convenience of different types of transport and accommodation, ascertaining customer’s requirements and advising them on travel arrangements. Preparing itineraries. Making and confirming reservations. Issuing tickets and vouchers. Helping customers in obtaining necessary travel documents such as visas. Organising group tours for business or vacation travel and selling them to groups or individuals.

fields.name: Tree Feller
fields.description: Fells trees in forests, and trims and saws them into logs.
fields.tasks: Locating trees to be felled and estimating volume of timber.   Operating and maintaining a skidder, bulldozer or other prime mover to pull a variety of scarification or site preparation equipment over areas to be regenerated.   Operating chainsaw and other power saws to thin young forest stands, trim, top and fell trees and saw them into logs.   Shaping rough wooden products from logs at felling site.   Stacking logs and loading them in chutes or floating them down rivers.   Controlling weeds and undergrowth in regenerating forest stands using manual tools and chemicals.

fields.name: Tribunal Member
fields.description: Hears industrial, administrative or other disputes to assist in resolving differences and to arbitrate on issues.
fields.tasks: Listening to the evidence in a tribunal. Questioning parties and witnesses where appropriate. Providing a practical, specialised view of the facts and evidence before the tribunal. Taking part in the decisions made by the tribunal.

fields.name: Trolley Collector
fields.description: Collects supermarket trolleys from car parks and other areas, and returns them to the supermarket by hand or trailer. May drive a small tractor to tow the trolleys.
fields.tasks: Observing car parks and other areas in the vicinity of supermarkets or retail stores to locate trolleys left by shoppers.   Collecting trolleys, stacking them together and pushing trolleys back to trolley bay. Stacking trolleys in the trolley main bays from where shoppers can access them.   Performing minor repairs on trolleys or removing badly damaged trolleys from circulation for more difficult repairs.   Removing rubbish from trolleys and cleaning the trolley stock.

fields.name: Truck Driver (General)
fields.description: Drives a heavy truck, requiring a specially endorsed class of licence, to transport bulky goods.
fields.tasks: Driving a truck with or without a trailer or a dump-truck to transport goods over short or long distances.   Assisting with or carrying out loading or unloading operations, using various lifting or tipping devices. Ensuring goods are stowed and securely covered to prevent loss and damage during transport.   Estimating weights to comply with load limitations, and ensuring the safe distribution of weights.   Determining the most appropriate routes for travel.   Maintaining accurate logs and records about the truck and the transported products.   Following relevant safety regulations and laws governing vehicle operation.   Testing vehicle equipment such as lights, brakes, hooters and windscreen wipers to ensure proper operation.   Performing routine vehicle maintenance such as regulating tyre pressure and adding petrol, oil and water, and arranging for major maintenance and repairs.

fields.name: Truck Driver's Offsider
fields.description: Loads and unloads trucks and containers.
fields.tasks: Working across a range of industries including furniture removal, wholesale and retail. Inspecting the items at the pick-up address to see what has to be moved, and packing and labelling items if required. Checking items against inventory lists and noting any wear and tear or damage. Loading items onto the truck either by hand or by using a forklift, trolleys, lifting straps or lifting hooks. Ensuring correct placement and securing of items to avoid any damage to the truck or to the goods. Attaching or fastening protective devices, such as bracing, padding, or strapping to items to prevent shifting or damage to items while being transported. Unloading items at the drop-off address and unpacking them if required. Conducting a general maintenance check of the truck and cleaning the vehicle if required. Assisting with navigation and truck maintenance on long-distance trips. Directing truck driver when manoeuvring the truck in tight spots.

fields.name: Trust Officer
fields.description: Administers trusts, estates and settlements on behalf of beneficiaries.
fields.tasks: Keeping abreast of all the legal developments related to trusts. Preparing relevant documentation for the South African Revenue Services. Preparing relevant documentation for registration of trusts with the High Court. Arranging all insurance required by trusts. Ensuring the proper transfer of assets into the names of trusts. Evaluating client request for the establishment of trusts and preparing recommendations. Ensuring the liquidity of trust funds. Checking trust reports and financial statements. Submitting bi-annual Provisional Tax returns for all trusts under administration.

fields.name: Tunnelling Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates mobile equipment to produce, shape or dig tunnels.
fields.tasks: Operating tunnel boring machine ensuring that all safety standards are followed.   Operating hydraulic pumping systems and computer controlled equipment.   Securing special attachments to tunnelling machine and conducting pre-operational checks.   Cleaning, lubricating and preforming minor repairs on apparatus used.   Using two-way radios and other communication systems.   Reading blueprints, maps, drawings and project specifications and calculating weight, distance, volume and length measurements.   Utilizing material safety data sheets and completing on board and other logs.

fields.name: University Lecturer
fields.description: Lectures students and conducts tutorials in one or more subjects within a prescribed course of study at a university and conducts research in a particular field of knowledge.
fields.tasks: Preparing and presenting lectures, in a particular field of study, to students at the tertiary level of education. Preparing and marking examination papers and marking or evaluating student assignments and projects. Guiding and supervising senior and post-graduate students with their research projects, study problems etc. Keeping up-to-date with the field in which they lecture through further studies, reading publications, papers and articles relating to their field of study, interaction with professional bodies and by having one-on-one discussions with colleagues in their field of specialisation. Conducting and publishing research on their own or as part of a team in their area of expertise. Acting as research counsellors or mentors to their students. Undertaking study tours or attending symposia and conferences for contact with other experts in their field of specialisation.

fields.name: University Tutor
fields.description: Conducts tutorials in one or more subjects within a prescribed course of study at a university.
fields.tasks: Conducting undergraduate training, small-group teaching and assessments. Grading of assignments submitted during lectures and assisting with the marking of tests. Partaking in moderation sessions and final marks moderation. Offering mentorship to at-risk students through, for instance, specially allocated classes. Monitoring student behaviour, attendance and progress and enforcing controlled discipline. Updating course content and revising study guides. Assisting with developing and updating electronic instructional learning programmes. Providing technological support to students and lecturers. Arranging training schedules and allocating training resources.

fields.name: Upholsterer
fields.description: Makes, rebuilds and repairs upholstered furniture such as chairs, sofas, beds and mattresses. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Discussing upholstery fabric, colour, and style with customers and providing cost estimate for upholstering furniture or other items. Making upholstery patterns from sketches, customer descriptions or blueprints. Laying out, measuring and cutting upholstery materials following patterns, templates, sketches, or design specifications. Installing, arranging and securing springs, padding and covering material to furniture frames. Sewing upholstery materials by hand to seam cushions and joining sections of covering materials. Sewing rips or tears in material, or creating tufting, using needle and thread. Tacking, gluing or sewing ornamental trims, buckles, braids, buttons and other accessories to covers or frames on upholstered items. Laying out, cutting, fabricating and installing upholstery in aircrafts, motor vehicles, railway cars, boats and ships. Collaborating with interior designers to decorate rooms and coordinate furnishing fabrics. Making quilts, cushions and mattresses.

fields.name: Urban and Regional Planner
fields.description: Develops and implements plans and policies for the controlled use of urban and rural land, and advises on economic, environmental and social needs of land areas. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Planning layout and coordinating development of urban areas. Planning and advising on routing and control of road traffic and public transportation systems for efficiency and safety. Conferring with government authorities, communities and specialists in fields such as architecture, planning, social science the environment and the law. Devising and recommending use and development of land, and presenting narrative and graphic plans programs and designs to groups and individuals. Advising governments, companies and communities on urban and regional planning issues and proposals. Planning layout and coordinating development of urban areas. Planning and the development of land areas for parks, schools, institutions, airports, roadways and related projects, and for commercial, industrial and residential sites.

fields.name: Valuer
fields.description: Assesses the value of land, property, commercial equipment, merchandise, personal effects, household goods and objects of art.
fields.tasks: Determining the quality or value of raw materials, real estate, industrial equipment, personal and household effects, works of art, gems and other objects. Inspecting items or property to evaluate condition, size, and construction. Selecting methods of evaluation. Obtaining records of sales and value of similar items or property. Calculating values by considering market demand, condition of items, future trends and other factors (e.g. location, size, zoning legislation and the availability of services, such as transport and parking, in the case of real estate). Submitting written assessments of value outlining the estimation factors and methods used. Providing consultancy advice on valuation matters. Providing rental valuations for arbitration purposes. Giving evidence in legal proceedings and mediating on valuation matters.

fields.name: Varnish Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, maintains and operates a mailing line to insert/onsert products into envelopes and/or bags for mailing purposes.
fields.tasks: Setting up machines to product specifications. Examining job orders to determine quantities, stock specifications and special instructions. Operating machines. Conducting regular inspections and maintenance of machines.

fields.name: Vehicle Body Builder
fields.description: Manufactures and repairs prototype production units and purpose-built vehicle bodies such as buses, trucks, fire engines and caravans. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Manufacturing framework sections in metal, wood, fibreglass and other materials by working from engineering drawings, and by using shaping machinery and all types of welding and cutting equipment. Forming complete frameworks by welding or bolting sections to the vehicle's frame. Making the panels used to cover the framework by cutting, shaping and attaching panels of sheet metal, aluminium, stainless steel or reinforced plastic. Fitting axles, suspensions and brakes.
