Designing and fitting mechanised equipment, such as winches and hoists, to various types of vehicle chassis. Installing door handles, locks and hinges. Designing and carrying out chassis alterations in consultation with engineers, or altering assembly line vehicles to special requirements.

fields.name: Vehicle Detailer (Valet Servicer)
fields.description: Washes and cleans exteriors and interiors of cars and other means of transport and touches up paint work, glass and upholstery to prepare them for sale, rent or re-use.
fields.tasks: Cleaning and washing cars and other vehicles by hand or using high-pressure hoses. Cleaning windows, wheels, door handles and mirrors.  Applying cleaning agents to remove stains from vehicle exteriors and interiors. Vacuuming vehicle interiors and shampooing or dry-cleaning carpets and upholstery. Waxing and polishing exterior paint work of cars and vehicles by hand or using hand-held power tools. Using different products for different areas of the car including gels and other finishes to bumpers and trims. Steam cleaning the engine, frame and wheel arches. Emptying and cleaning compartments in vehicles.

fields.name: Vehicle Painter
fields.description: Prepares surfaces of vehicles, matches and mixes colours and applies paint. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Preparing surfaces to be coated using a variety of methods to remove grease, dirt and rust. Painting cars, buses, trucks and other vehicles, and applying varnish and other protective coatings. Applying paint as well as protective coatings of enamel or varnish on metal, wooden and other manufactured products, usually with a hand-spraying device.

fields.name: Vehicle Trimmer
fields.description: Installs, repairs and replaces the interior trim of vehicles, such as seats, linings, floor coverings and door trims. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Installing and replacing the interior trim of vehicles according to drawings and sketches. Selecting, measuring and cutting out pieces of fabric, vinyl or leather using shears or electric cutting tools. Sewing pieces together using industrial sewing machines. Removing the door handles and detaching the upholstery and trimmings from the door panels, floor, roof and seats. Matching, measuring and cutting new material to the required shape, size, and pattern. Repairing and manufacturing seat covers. Refitting, aligning and checking window winding mechanisms, door locks and other interior parts. Waterproofing and dustproofing vehicles using weather strips and draught sealers.

fields.name: Vending Machine Attendant
fields.description: Stocks and maintains vending and amusement machines and collects money from coin boxes.
fields.tasks: Loading, unloading and transporting stock and equipment to various vending machine sites.   Replenishing vending machines with stock.   Clearing money from machines and checking monitoring systems.   Keeping stock records and records of vending machine service and repair.   Checking vending machines' dispensing, money-handling and refrigeration systems.   Studying product manuals or specifications, keeping up-to-date with new technologies and learning about individual vending machines.   Performing routine maintenance to keep vending machines in good working condition.   Undertaking minor repairs to  vending machines.   Arranging for removal and replacement of vending machines that cannot be repaired on site.

fields.name: Venetian Blind Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, operates, or maintains machines to assemble venetian blinds.
fields.tasks: Preparing machines prior to the production process.   Loading machines with aluminium coil of the chosen colour.   Programming the machine for sizes and number of blinds required.   Monitoring equipment to ensure proper functioning throughout the production process.   Testing or measuring products or parts to ensure that they meet specifications.   Cleaning and recalibrating machines.   Creating production reports for the machines operated.

fields.name: Veterinarian
fields.description: Diagnoses, treats and prevents animal diseases, ailments and injuries.
fields.tasks: Determining the presence and nature of abnormal conditions in animals by physical examination, laboratory testing and through diagnostic imaging techniques including radiography and ultrasound. Treating animals medically and surgically, and administering and prescribing drugs, analgesics, and general and local anaesthetics; performing surgery, dressing wounds and setting broken bones. Rendering obstetric services to animals; participating in programs designed to prevent the occurrence and spread of animal diseases. Inoculating animals against, and testing for infectious diseases and notifying authorities of outbreaks of infectious animal diseases. Performing autopsies to determine cause of death; advising clients on health, nutrition and feeding, hygiene, breeding and care of animals.

fields.name: Veterinary Nurse
fields.description: Cares for animals under treatment or in temporary residence at veterinary facilities and assists veterinarians to perform procedures and operations.
fields.tasks: Advising communities and individuals on the treatment of animals and their diseases and injuries. Conducting examinations of animals to make diagnoses or refer more difficult cases to veterinarians when needed. Treating ill or injured animals, especially for common diseases and disorders. Getting animals ready for examination or treatment and restraining or holding them during treatment. Assisting veterinarians to administer anaesthetics and oxygen during treatment. Placing animals in cages for recovery from operations and monitoring their condition. Performing routine animal dental procedures and assisting veterinarians with animal dentistry.

fields.name: Veterinary Public Health Professional / Practitioner
fields.description: Conducts and oversees the provision of advanced Veterinary Services in any of the following fields: diseases control, import and export policy & control, epidemiology, quarantine, veterinary public health, animal welfare, animal health, laboratory diagnos
fields.tasks: Conducting regular testing, monitoring and surveillance of livestock and domestic animals for diseases that may impact on food production and food security.   Assessing animals and animal products destined for the export market and issuing guarantees for the safe exportation thereof.   Inspecting livestock and animal products and enforcing food safety measures.   Implementing vaccination programmes and parasite control programmes in livestock.   Working as part of an inter-disciplinary team to prevent and control the transmission of diseases between animals and humans, and animals and the environment.   Developing and implementing policies aimed at strengthening veterinary public health services and control measures for food production and food distribution.   Training veterinary science students in veterinary public health practices.

fields.name: Veterinary Technician
fields.description: Prepares vaccines, serums or tissue samples, takes blood samples and performs medical tests in a laboratory environment for use in the treatment and diagnosis of diseases in animals.
fields.tasks: Conducting laboratory tests on plant matter, feeds, blood or organs for the isolation and identification of micro-organisms for veterinary purposes. Conducting serological tests, biochemical analyses, and chemical and biochemical tests to determine the presence of toxins. Identifying internal and external parasites. Preparing histological preparations for veterinary experiments. Conducting laboratory procedures required for specific veterinary examinations or research projects and maintaining records of observations and results arising from such research projects. Preparing veterinary biological products for diagnostic tests. Preparing vaccines for the prevention of disease.

fields.name: Video Producer
fields.description: Creates films, television programs, video productions or commercials by filming, adding sound and editing in digital or analogue format. This occupation requires high levels of creative talent or personal commitment and interest as well as, or in place of
fields.tasks: Choosing writers and studying scripts to determine the artistic interpretation.   Creating, planning, videotaping and editing films and videos.   Planning, organising and controlling the various stages and schedules involved in the production of presentations, motion pictures, and television shows.   Supervising the positioning of scenery, props and lighting and sound equipment.     Instructing actors on relevant acting methods.     Engaging and supervising all technical personnel, and determining the treatment, scope and scheduling of production.      Maintaining production archives and negotiating royalties.

fields.name: Visual Arts Teacher (Grades 10 - 12)
fields.description: Teaches visual art (theoretical and or practical component) within a prescribed curriculum to grade 10-12 or further education and training college students and promote students' social, emotional, intellectual and physical development.
fields.tasks: Designing and modifying curricula and preparing educational courses of study in accordance with curriculum guidelines. Establishing and enforcing rules for behaviour and procedures for maintaining order among learners. Preparing and giving lessons, discussions, and demonstrations in one or more subjects. Establishing clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects and communicating those objectives to learners. Preparing materials and classrooms for class activities. Adapting teaching methods and instructional materials to meet learners' varying needs and interests. Observing and evaluating learners' performance and behaviour. Preparing, administering and marking tests, assignments and examinations to evaluate learners' progress. Preparing reports about learners' work and conferring with other teachers and parents. Participating in meetings concerning the school's educational or organizational policies. Planning, organising and participating in school activities such as excursions, sporting events and concerts.

fields.name: Visual Merchandiser
fields.description: Plans and installs internal, window and fixed displays to show goods to their best advantage.
fields.tasks: Developing ideas or plans for merchandise displays or window decorations to entice and appeal to customers.   Obtaining plans from display designers or display managers and discussing their implementation with clients or supervisors.   Consulting with advertising or sales staff to determine type of merchandise to be featured and time and place for each display.   Arranging properties, furniture, merchandise, backdrops or other accessories as shown in prepared sketches.   Using hand or power tools to construct or assemble displays with fabric, glass, paper or plastic.   Placing prices or descriptive signs on backdrops, fixtures, merchandise or floor.   Dressing dummies and arranging screens, fabric and posters.   Collaborating with others to obtain products or other display items.   Changing or rotating window displays, interior display areas or signage to reflect changes in inventory or promotion.   Taking photographs of displays or signage.

fields.name: Wage Inspector
fields.description: Monitors price regulations to assess appropriateness of costs for goods and services to protect consumer interests.

fields.name: Waiter
fields.description: Serves food and drinks in a hotel, restaurant, club or dining establishment.
fields.tasks: Setting and arranging dining tables. Greeting customers and presenting them with menus and beverage lists. Taking orders and relaying them to kitchen and bar staff. Recommending food from the menu, or wines to complement food, when requested to do so. Opening bottles and pouring beverages for customers. Collecting ordered food from the kitchen and serving it to customers. Removing empty bottles and used glasses from tables, and refilling and replacing glasses. Clearing tables and returning dishes and cutlery to the kitchen. Collecting payments for sales and operating point of sales machines and cash registers.

fields.name: Wall and Floor Tiler
fields.description: Lays ceramic, clay, slate, marble and glass tiles on external and internal walls and floors to provide protective and decorative finishes. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Preparing floor areas for covering with a variety of materials. Assembling carpet, tiles or other materials and laying them on floors according to design and other specifications. Preparing wall areas for covering with tiles or other materials for decorative or other purposes such as acoustic insulation. Setting tiles and constructing and laying mosaic panels to walls, floors and other surfaces.

fields.name: Warehouse Administrator / Clerk
fields.description: Administers and coordinates storage and distribution operations within an organisation.
fields.tasks: Requisitioning supplies from stock and sending orders to production departments and other firms. Confirming completion of orders and compliance with the details specified, signing tally sheets and attaching these to checked items. Receiving and checking purchase requests against inventory records and stock on hand. Examining orders and compiling data for production schedules. Checking inventories and preparing delivery schedules. Examining containers to record quantities and ensure that they are filled. Investigating and identifying supply sources and preparing and processing purchase orders. Providing prices and other information about goods to prospective customers. Counting incoming stock, reconciling it with requisitions, and updating inventory and stock location records. Establishing and coordinating the operating procedures for receiving, handling, storing and shipping goods.

fields.name: Warehouse Manager
fields.description: Plans, directs, and coordinates the storage and distribution operations within an organization or the activities of organizations that are engaged in storing and distributing materials and products.
fields.tasks: Determining, implementing and monitoring purchasing, storage and distribution strategies, policies and plans.      Establishing and directing operational and administrative procedures.      Establishing and managing budgets, controlling expenditure and ensuring the efficient use of resources.      Liaising with other departments and customers concerning requirements for outward goods and associated forwarding transportation.      Monitoring and reviewing storage and inventory systems to meet supply requirements and control stock levels.      Negotiating contracts with suppliers to meet quality, cost and delivery requirements.      Operating recording systems to track all movements of goods, and ensuring re-ordering and re-stocking at optimal times.      Overseeing the recording of purchase, storage and distribution transactions.      Overseeing the selection, training and performance of staff.

fields.name: Warping Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, operates and monitors warping machinery and equipment to wind yarn on to beams, suitable for subsequent processes, such as weaving and knitting.
fields.tasks: Selecting standard types of yarns and warp in most instances (as variations in yarn thickness, tension, twist and other factors might result in a defective fabric). Laying out warp on a loom or frame to form the base yarn and weaving weft under and over the warp yarns that are stretched onto the loom. Using either indirect warping or direct warping to prepare the warps for knitting machines. Wounding yarns from yarn packages onto an intermediate cylinder (mill) in parallel groups followed by back wounding onto the warp beam when indirect warping is applied. Wrapping the ends of the yarn in one operation, from the yarn packages onto the warp beam when direct warping is applied. Constructing fabrics through weaving and knitting, using warp and weft yarns that are interlaced with each other. Tending automatic looms that simultaneously weave pile yarn, filling yarn, and warp yarn material to produce carpets and rugs with various coloured designs. Examining looms to determine causes of loom stoppage such as warp filling, harness breaks or mechanical defects. Cleaning, oiling and lubricating machines using air hoses, cleaning solutions, rags, oil cans and/or grease guns.

fields.name: Wash Plant Operator
fields.description: Operates equipment used to wash oversized loads.
fields.tasks: Operating or tending machines to wash or remove impurities from oversized loads.   Measuring, weighing or mixing cleaning solutions using measuring tanks, calibrated rods or suction tubes.   Observing machine operations, gauges or thermometers and adjusting controls to maintain specified conditions.   Examining and inspecting machines to detect malfunctions.   Adjusting, cleaning and lubricating mechanical parts of machines, using hand tools and grease guns.

fields.name: Washroom Attendant
fields.description: Maintains and cleans public facilities, ensuring that toilet paper, soap, paper towels, and other necessary items are kept stocked.
fields.tasks: Cleaning and disinfecting bathroom fixtures, floors and walls with appropriate cleaning materials as needed and according to cleaning schedules.  Emptying all litter and waste bins as necessary, and replacing receptacles with clean liners. Transporting waste to appropriate holding area for collection. Replenishing toilet roll  and paper towel supplies. Completing daily schedule report sheets. Reporting breakages, faults and defective plumbing fixtures to manager.

fields.name: Waste Material Sorter and Classifier
fields.description: Waste material sorters and classifiers identify, sort and classify waste, including electronic waste in salvage and recycling enterprises. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Sorting materials such as metals, glass, wood, paper, plastics or electronics according to grades and types into correct containers for recycling. Moving collection bins around using pneumatic forklifts. Washing recyclable materials when necessary. Operating saws to remove bindings from materials. Cleaning the recycling work area by sweeping, raking, picking up broken glass and loose paper debris, or moving barrels and bins. Cleaning, inspecting, and performing routine maintenance and minor repairs on recycling collection equipment.

fields.name: Waste Materials Plant Operator
fields.description: Operates machinery which disposes of waste. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Completing and maintaining station records, logs and reports, and communicating with other plant personnel to assess equipment operating status. Controlling the operation of multiple-hearth incinerator furnaces and related equipment to burn sludge and solid waste in waste treatment plants. Inspecting equipment and monitoring operating conditions, meters, filters, chlorinators, and gauges in central control room to determine load requirements, to verify that flows, pressures, and temperatures are within specification, and to detect malfunctioning. Monitoring and adjusting controls of auxiliary equipment, such as exhaust emissions, scrubbers, and incinerator heat recovery units. Performing security and safety checks in plant and on grounds. Completing and maintaining plant logs and reports.

fields.name: Watch and Clock Maker and Repairer
fields.description: Makes, repairs, cleans and adjusts watches and clocks. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Replacing watch power sources such as batteries and capacitors. Removing watch and clock mechanisms from cases and examining them for signs of wear or damage. Repairing or replacing faulty parts such as cracked crystals, broken hands and bent teeth or wheels. Cleaning, testing and lubricating watch and clock components. Testing and analysing electronic circuits in quartz watches and clocks. Reassembling, fitting and adjusting timepieces to make sure they work correctly. Testing watches for water resistance to agreed depths and standards. Performing minor repairs to watch parts including bands, glass, crown and winder.

fields.name: Water Inspector
fields.description: Monitors the allocation and use of water from water resources such as streams, rivers and underground sources. NOTE: This occupation is regarded as a green occupation.
fields.tasks: Investigating complaints and emergency calls concerning poor water pressure, noises in water pipes and fixtures, dirty water, water seepage, and bad water taste and odour.   Determining causes of water and water infrastructure related faults and issues.   Making arrangements for dispatching repair crews and recommending repairs to be made by commercial plumbers.   Inspecting buildings and/or blueprints to determine the size of the water service piping and meter necessary to insure adequate water supply.   Conducting water flow and pressure tests.   Determining the causes of unusual consumption, checking premises, and testing and inspecting the operational status of water meters.   Inspecting plumbing, piping and fixtures, taking necessary action, and reporting official findings.

fields.name: Water Plant Operator
fields.description: Operates plant to store, distribute and treat water including purifying water for human consumption and removing wastes from sewerage.
fields.tasks: Completing and maintaining station records, logs and reports, and communicating with other plant personnel to assess equipment operating status. Controlling the operation of multiple-hearth incinerator furnaces and related equipment to burn sludge and solid waste in waste treatment plants. Inspecting equipment and monitoring operating conditions, meters, filters, chlorinators, and gauges in central control room to determine load requirements, to verify that flows, pressures, and temperatures are within specification, and to detect malfunctioning. Monitoring and adjusting controls of auxiliary equipment, such as exhaust emissions, scrubbers, and incinerator heat recovery units. Collecting and testing water and sewage samples for chemical and bacterial content, using test equipment and colour analysis standards. Analyzing test results to make adjustments to plant equipment and systems to disinfect and deodorize water and other liquids. Performing security and safety checks in plant and on grounds. Completing and maintaining plant logs and reports.

fields.name: Water Quality Analyst
fields.description: Analyses and develops policies and plans for the control of factors which may produce water pollution.
fields.tasks: Conducting research, performing tests, collecting samples, performing field and laboratory analysis to identify sources of environmental problems and recommending ways to prevent, control and remediate. Assessing the likely impact that potential or proposed activities, projects and developments may have on the environment, and recommending whether such developments should proceed. Developing and coordinating the implementation of environmental management systems to enable organizations to identify, monitor and control the impact of their activities, products and services on the environment. Conducting audits to evaluate environmental impact of existing activities, processes, wastes, noises and substances. Assessing an organization's compliance with government and internal environmental regulations and guidelines, identifying violations and determining appropriate remedial action. Providing technical advice and support services to organizations on how best to deal with environmental problems in order to reduce environmental damage and minimize financial loss.

fields.name: Waterside Worker
fields.description: Transfers cargo between ships and other forms of transport or storage facilities.
fields.tasks: Sorting, loading and unloading ships' cargoes. Carrying or moving cargo by hand-truck to wharfs. Stacking cargo on pallets or cargo boards ready for transferring to and from ships. Stacking cargo in transit sheds or in the holds of ships as directed. Positioning and fastening hose lines to ships' cargo tanks when loading or unloading liquid cargo such as animal fats, vegetable oils, molasses or chemicals. Attaching identifying tags to containers or marking them with identifying information. Attaching and moving the slings used to lift cargo. Guiding the load being lifted to prevent swinging. Shoring the cargo in the ship's hold to prevent shifting during the voyage.

fields.name: Weapon Systems Mechanic
fields.description: Designs, installs, maintains, services and repairs military weapon systems and related equipment. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Testing faulty equipment to diagnose malfunctions, using test equipment or software. Fitting, adjusting and repairing various kinds of electrical weapon machinery and equipment. Fitting, adjusting and repairing electrical parts in military weapon systems and equipment. Inspecting and testing manufactured electrical military weapon systems and related equipment. Installing, testing, connecting, commissioning, maintaining and modifying electrical military weapon systems and related equipment. Replacing and repairing defective parts military weapon systems and related equipment. Using various kinds of testing instruments to locate damaged coils.

fields.name: Weatherisation Installers and Technicians
fields.description: Performs a variety of activities to weatherise homes, performs energy audits and advise clients on energy conservation measures.
fields.tasks: Inspecting buildings to identify required repair work, modification, or replacement.   Recommending  techniques to clients in accordance with needs and applicable energy regulations, codes, policies, or statutes.   Explaining energy conservation measures, such as the use of low flow showerheads and energy efficient lighting.   Preparing and applying weather-stripping, glazing, caulking, or door sweeps to reduce energy losses.   Wrapping air ducts and water lines with insulating materials, such as duct wrap and pipe insulation.   Applying spackle, compounding, or other materials to repair holes in walls.   Applying insulation materials such as loose blanket, board, and foam insulation to attics, crawl spaces, basements, or walls.   Preparing cost estimates or specifications for rehabilitation or weather station services.   Explaining recommendations, policies, procedures, requirements, or other related information to residents or building owners.

fields.name: Weaving and Knitting Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up,loads,operates and monitor sbraiding machinery and equipment to produce braided products
fields.tasks: Setting up and operating batteries of automatic, link-type knitting machines to knit garments of specified pattern and design. Threading yarn, thread, and fabric through guides, needles, and rollers of machines for weaving, knitting, or other processing. Tending automatic looms that simultaneously weave pile yarn, filling yarn, and warp yarn material to produce carpets and rugs with various coloured designs. Operating and monitoring loom on which yarn or twist is intersected and knotted at regular intervals to form mesh. Operating and monitoring large automatic multi-needle machines to embroider material or to sew lengths of several layers of material to make yard goods, quilts or mattress coverings. Tending circular knitting machines with automatic pattern controls that knit seamless hose. Operating and monitoring knitting machines to knit hosiery to shape of foot and leg. Operating and monitoring machine for knitting heel and toes of socks into ribs or tops cut from circular fabric. Examining looms to determine causes of loom stoppage, such as warp filling, harness breaks, or mechanical defects. Repairing or replacing worn or defective needles and other components. Cleaning, oiling, and lubricating machines, using air hoses, cleaning solutions, rags, oil cans, and/or grease guns.

fields.name: Web Designer
fields.description: Designs online forms to seamlessly integrate with workflow processes in organisations.
fields.tasks: Meeting clients to identify their needs and liaising regularly with them. Creating web site designs using, among other things, designing graphics, animations and manipulating digital photographs. Producing sample sites. Demonstrating and receiving feedback about draft sites. Keeping up-to-date with recent technological and software developments. Developing skills and expertise in appropriate software/programming languages including html (Hypertext Markup Language), Java script and others. Producing websites that are user-friendly, effective and appealing. Working as part of a multi-disciplinary team.

fields.name: Web Developer
fields.description: Plans, produces and maintains web sites using web programming languages, software applications, technologies and databases together with specifications of user needs, often in conjunction with other ICT professionals such as business analysts, web designe
fields.tasks: Developing World Wide Web applications or distributed network applications that are run over HTTP from a webserver to a web browser. Maintaining databases on the back-end to serve pages, store content and manage the site i.e. technical and functional aspects of database driven web sites. Solving problems to make a web page function perectly. Working as part of a team with people like web designers and producers websites.

fields.name: Web Technician
fields.description: Maintains, monitors and supports the optimal functioning of internet and intranet websites and web server hardware and software.
fields.tasks: Assisting webmasters, web designers and computer programmers to set up and maintain websites and web servers.  Assisting with maintaining hardware and software on web servers, supporting websites on the internet and intranet.  Responding to operational issues and providing routine maintenance and monitoring to ensure websites are operating at optimal levels. Responding to requests for help and information from website visitors and website designers. Ensuring  websites operate correctly by monitoring and testing website performance on an ongoing basis.

fields.name: Weighbridge Operator
fields.description: Operates weighing plant and issues measurement tickets which provide readings of vehicle and livestock weight.
fields.tasks: Weighing and making accurate recordings of all inbound and outbound loads on trucks, trailers and other vehicles. Checking for weight variances, making sure that loads are correct and reporting differences in weight.  Reporting on which loads have or have not been delivered or collected. Maintaining all related invoicing and administration systems. Maintaining professional customer relations.

fields.name: Weight Loss Consultant
fields.description: Advises clients to improve health, fitness and body mass.
fields.tasks: Speaking to and motivating clients about personal fitness goals. Working one-on-one or with groups, offering advice on nutrition and lifestyle changes. Devising exercise strategies for optimum, healthy weight loss. Consulting with clients on cultivating healthy eating habits. Monitoring clients’ weight loss on a regular basis. Promoting and selling merchandise linked to weight loss programmes or brands.

fields.name: Weights and Measures Inspector
fields.description: Examines places of business to ensure the use of correct weights and measures in trade and certifies equipment and devices.
fields.tasks: Inspecting any measuring instrument or container for sale or for use in measuring products for commerce or trade. Entering any premises, or stopping any person, for inspection and verification of measuring instruments and measured goods. Seizing and retaining any measuring instrument, container, article or goods that are inaccurately calibrated, or ordering persons found in possession of such instruments to stop using or selling them. Certifying measuring instruments as compliant with legal requirements at regular intervals, as well as after any repairs. Issuing verification documents stating that measuring instruments are certified as accurate, and applying certifying marks to these instruments. Acting as a referee in disputes concerning the accuracy of measuring instruments.

fields.name: Welder
fields.description: Fabricates and repairs metal products using various welding techniques.
fields.tasks: Welding metal parts using gas flame, or an electric arc, thermite compound or other methods. Operating resistance-welding machines. Using blowtorch to make and repair lead linings, pipes, floors and other lead fixtures. Brazing metal parts together. Cutting metal pieces using gas flame or an electric arc. Joining metal parts by hand soldering. Monitoring the fitting, burning, and welding processes to avoid overheating of parts or warping, shrinking, distortion, or expansion of material. Examining work pieces for defects and measuring work pieces with straight edges or templates to ensure conformance with specifications.

fields.name: Wholesaler
fields.description: Plans, organises, directs, controls and coordinates the operations of a wholesale trading establishment.
fields.tasks: Formulating and implementing purchasing and marketing policies, and setting prices for products.   Promoting and advertising the establishment’s goods and services.   Maintaining records of stock levels and financial transactions.   Determining product mix, stock levels and service standards.   Undertaking budgeting for the establishment.      Controlling selection, training and supervision of staff.    Ensuring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations.

fields.name: Wig Maker
fields.description: Lays out, sews, and fastens together materials and hair strands to make wigs and transformations.
fields.tasks: Drawing or pinning wig pattern on a model of the customer’s head. Placing sections of gauze, lace, net, ribbon and springs over pattern and sewing sections together to form the wig foundation. Blending shades of hair to give a natural appearance to wigs. Laying out, sewing, and fastening together materials and hair strands to make wigs and transformations. Weaving hair to form speciality hairpieces such as braids, switches and chignons. Arranging woven hair in specified positions and sewing hair into place to form a hairpiece. Repairing wigs if required.

fields.name: Wind Turbine Power Plant Process Controller
fields.description: Plans, prepares and conducts installation, maintenance and component assembly for wind turbine systems and facilities and equipment. Assembles, installs and maintains wind turbines and associated equipment and compounds
fields.tasks: Operating, monitoring and inspecting various types of energy generating power plants. Operating and controlling power generating systems and equipment including boilers, turbines, generators, condensers, and reactors in hydro, thermal, coal, oil, natural gas, and nuclear power plants to generate and distribute electrical power. Controlling start-up and shut-down of power plant equipment, controlling switching operations, regulating water levels and communicating with systems operators to regulate and coordinate transmission loads, frequency and line voltages. Taking readings from charts, meters and gauges at established intervals, troubleshooting and performing corrective action as necessary. Completing and maintaining station records, logs and reports, and communicating with other plant personnel to assess equipment operating status. Cleaning and maintaining equipment such as generators, boilers, turbines, pumps, and compressors in order to prevent equipment failure or deterioration.

fields.name: Window Cleaner
fields.description: Cleans interior and exterior window surfaces using heavy duty cleaning equipment.
fields.tasks: Washing and drying interior and exterior glass surfaces of buildings such as private homes, offices and retail outlets. Using ladders, swinging scaffolds, bosun's chairs, hydraulic bucket trucks and other equipment to reach and clean the windows of multi-storey buildings. Cleaning interior windows and glass partitions using soapy water or other cleaning solutions with sponges and squeegees. Cleaning stone walls, metal surfaces, fascias and window frames using high pressure water cleaners and solvents.

fields.name: Wine Maker
fields.description: Plans, supervises and coordinates the production of wine or spirits from selected varieties of grapes.
fields.tasks: Discussing fruit quality and quantity with grape growers (viticulturists) throughout the growing season and deciding whether the grapes are ready for processing into wine. Performing quality control analyses to determine the sugar content and acid level of the grapes before it can be crushed, processed and fermented into wine. Regularly monitoring the fermentation of the wines and performing further treatments such as maturation and clarification to ensure that the wine develops as required. Using and maintaining a variety of cellar machinery as well as laboratory equipment to perform the necessary tasks and quality control analyses. Blending wines according to formulas or own knowledge and experience in wine making and developing new wine styles and trying to improve the wine quality Finishing (cool, filter and bottle) and promoting wines. Recording procedures, blends and inventories and managing winery workers.

fields.name: Wine Taster / Grader
fields.description: Conducts sensory examination and evaluation of wine to describe the range of perceived flavours, aromas and general characteristics of a wine.
fields.tasks: Checking the colour of wine by looking beyond red, white or blush and determine the variation of red (maroon, ruby, or brownish) and whether white wine is clear, pale yellow, straw-like, golden, or amber in appearance. Determining the opacity of wine, whether watery or dark, translucent or opaque, dull or brilliant, cloudy, clear or whether sediment can be seen. Smelling wine in identifying the aroma (oak, berry, flowers or citrus) as an indicator of its quality and uniqueness. Tasting wine in order to identify its flavour whether fruity (tropical, citrus, pear, etc.), spicy, floral in nature or consisting of honey, butter, herbs or a bit of earthiness. Determining the aftertaste of wine and if the taste persists or is short-lived, light-bodied, medium-bodied, or full-bodied. Identifying the overall character (sweet, sour or bitter) of a specific wine. Matching food with wine by experimenting with combinations of food and wine and noting which specific wine complements what kind of food. Recording the name, producer, and vintage year of a specific wine.

fields.name: Wood and Paper Manufacturing Machine Minder
fields.description: Prepares, sets up and runs and monitors wood and paper manufacturing machinery and equipment.
fields.tasks: Operating and minding screening equipment, bleaching equipment, digesters, mixing tanks, washers and other pulp processing machinery and equipment to carry out one or more cellulose processing steps. Analysing instrument readings and production test samples to see that product or process specifications are met. Making minor adjustments to pulp production process and equipment as required. Completing and maintaining production reports. Informing supervisors if machinery or equipment requires major adjustment, maintenance or repair.

fields.name: Wood and Paper Manufacturing Process Control Technician
fields.description: Provides technical support and services in the development of manufacturing methods, facilities and systems, and in the planning, estimating, measuring and scheduling of wood and paper manufacturing processes.
fields.tasks: Interpreting operating principles applicable to pulp and paper processes by using scientific and technological principles. Monitoring and controlling a selected pulp and paper process in accordance with workplace procedures. Monitoring product quality by using a range of analyses methods and correct deviations by applying prescribed workplace procedures.

fields.name: Wood Machinist
fields.description: Cuts, planes, turns, shapes and sands wood stock to specifications. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Setting-up, programming, operating and monitoring several types of woodworking machines for sawing, shaping, boring, drilling, planning, pressing, turning, sanding or carving to fabricate or repair wooden parts for furniture, fixtures and other wooden products. Setting and adjusting various kinds of woodworking machines for operation by others. Programming and controlling Computer-Aided Design (CAD) and Computer Numerical Control (CNC) machines. Preparing and applying decorative finishes to furniture. Understanding and using various timber and timber products to produce furniture. Preparing surfaces for finishing. Cleaning and maintaining work areas including machinery and tools to ensure safe working environments.

fields.name: Wood Model Maker
fields.description: Constructs full-sized and scale wooden precision models of products.
fields.tasks: Selecting the required wood stock. Reading blueprints, drawings and sketches to determine material dimensions, required equipment and sequence of operations. Laying out and marking reference points and dimensions on material using measuring instruments and drawing tools. Setting up and operating machines such as lathes, drill presses, punch presses or handsaws to fabricate models. Constructing wooden models, patterns and moulds for parts of products and production tools. Fitting and fastening wooden parts together to form patterns and models using glue, nails, dowels, bolts, screws, and other fasteners. Trimming and shaping surfaces by using hand tools. Verify dimensions and contours of models during hand-forming processes, using templates and measuring devices. Reworking or altering the model or parts of the model to ensure that products meet the required standards. Constructing and completing full-sized wooden precision models or scale models.

fields.name: Wood Preparer and Treater
fields.description: Operates and tends wood treatment processing equipment and machines to remove bark from logs, produce wood chips, season, preserve and treat wood.
fields.tasks: Operating and tending wood treatment processing equipment and machines to remove bark from logs, produce wood chips, season, preserve and treat wood. Assisting in maintaining processing equipment and machines as required. Cleaning, lubricating and adjusting machines and equipment. Monitoring equipment operation, gauges, and panel lights in order to detect deviations from standards and to ensure that processes are operating according to specifications. Operating and tending kilns, treating tanks and other equipment to dry lumber, prepare and season wood and other wood products, and to treat chemically and impregnate wood products with preservatives. Transporting materials and products to and from work areas, manually or using carts, hand trucks, or hoists. Completing and maintaining production reports.

fields.name: Wood Processing Machine Operator
fields.description: Operates sawing, rolling, pressing and other machines to manufacture logs, timber poles and pieces, plywood, particleboard, solid laminate and similar products.
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines that strip, saw, process, sort and grade wood. Operating and monitoring log in-feed and conveyor systems. Operating and monitoring plywood core-laying machines and hot-plate plywood presses and machines which cut veneer. Observing gauges, dials and products to ensure correct operation of machinery and equipment and to verify specified processing conditions. Analysing sample products, performing basic tests, recording data and writing production logs. Cleaning and lubricating sawmill equipment. Informing supervisors if machines require adjustment, maintenance or repair.

fields.name: Wood Turner
fields.description: Operates wood turning lathes to turn and shape wood stock. NOTE: This occupation is listed as a trade.
fields.tasks: Installing and adjusting blades, cutterheads, boring-bits and sanding-belts, and using hand tools and rules. Setting and adjusting various kinds of woodworking machines for operation by others. Cutting, shaping, fitting, joining, molding, or otherwise processing materials, using hand tools, power tools, and/or machinery. Starting machine, placing gouge or caliper chisel over tool rest and against stock, and moves chisel to reduce stock to rough cylinder. Selecting chisel according to type of cut specified and holding chisel against rotating stock to cut shapes according to drawing. Verifying dimensions of shapes and cutting by using calipers and rule. Smoothing wood surface by holding sandpaper against rotating piece.

fields.name: Wool Classer / Grader
fields.description: Classifies wool to industry standards or market requirements.
fields.tasks: Discussing requirements with the farmers before sheep-shearing starts. Sorting wool into groups to produce lines that have uniform colour, length, fault and fibre diameter, and keeping wool breeds separate. Ensure that wool is free from contamination (such as black fibres, twine, and other foreign objects). Ensure that wool is sorted into the correct categories and placed in the correct bin. Operating and maintaining wool-weighing, sampling and wool-blending machinery. Supervising the pressing and branding of wool bales. Keeping records of the wool bales pressed. Being responsible for the management of the woolshed.

fields.name: Wool Handler
fields.description: Regulates the flow of sheep to be shorn, keeps the shearing shed clean and tidy, and assists with wool preparation, packing and storage.
fields.tasks: Preparing and maintaining the shearing shed by cleaning and carrying out minor repairs and maintenance in preparation for shearing. Moving and penning sheep while keeping groups separate and maintaining the supply of sheep for the shearers. Picking up and gathering shorn fleece and removing non-fleece wools. Skirting the fleece to remove inferior wool and rolling the fleece ready for wool classing. Preparing wool presses and loading the presses with lines of wool to press and fasten wool bales. Weighing, branding and storing wool bales. Cleaning the shed and storing equipment at the end of shearing. Doing other tasks expected of a livestock farm worker when shearing is not occurring.

fields.name: Word Processing Operator
fields.description: Operates a computer to type, edit and generate a variety of documents and reports.
fields.tasks: Compiling, typing, revising, editing and printing documents including reports, records, forms, meeting minutes, scientific or technical material, data sheets and other correspondence.   Working from dictaphone recordings, drafts and corrected copies. Following the instructions accompanying the material to be typed, or following verbal instructions regarding the format and content required. Checking completed documents for spelling errors using relevant software. Inputting data for revision or editing using an optical scanner and relevant software.   Proofreading documents for grammar, spelling, punctuation and formatting errors, and correcting these as necessary. Backing up data on a regular basis for safe storage.

fields.name: Workplace / Industrial Relations Advisor
fields.description: Assists in resolving disputes by advising on workplace relations policies and problems, and representing industrial, commercial, union, employer or other parties in negotiations on rates of pay and conditions of employment.
fields.tasks: Formulating and implementing industrial labour relations programmes in the company. Assisting in resolving disputes by advising on labour relations policies and problems and representing industry, organised labour, employer or other parties in negotiations on salary or working conditions. Acting as mediator by advising and counselling labour and management to prevent disputes over labour agreements or other labour relations’ issues or resolve these disputes. Advising and collaborating with the Human Resources manager and other managers in the company as well as employees on all aspects of personnel policy such as wages, benefits, pensions and work practices.

fields.name: Wrestler
fields.description: Wrestles professionally in wrestling matches. This occupation requires high levels of physical fitness, sporting ability and personal commitment as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications or experience.
fields.tasks: Adhering to the rules and regulations associated with wrestling. Participating in regular practice and training sessions and undertaking training to maintain the required standard of fitness and skill. . Maintaining a high degree of expertise in wrestling. Assessing other competitors and conditions at venues. Deciding on strategies in consultation with coaches. Competing in wrestling events. Undertaking wrestling promotional activities and media interviews.

fields.name: Yachtsman
fields.description: Sails a yacht professionally in yachting events. This occupation requires high levels of physical fitness, sporting ability and personal commitment as well as, or in place of, formal qualifications or experience.
fields.tasks: Adhering to the rules and regulations associated with yachting. Participating in regular practice and training sessions and undertaking training to maintain the required standard of fitness and skill. Maintaining a high degree of expertise in yachting. Assessing other competitors and conditions at venues. Deciding on strategies in consultation with coaches. Competing in yachting events. Undertaking yachting promotional activities and media interviews.

fields.name: Yarn Production Machine Operator
fields.description: Sets up, loads, operates and monitors machinery and equipment to produce yarn
fields.tasks: Operating and monitoring machines for tearing woollen rags into fibre. Operating and monitoring machines for cleaning and turning woollen yarn waste into fluffed wool. Operating and monitoring machines which combine textile fibres into uniform blends. Operating and monitoring machines which clean and fluff textile fibres, transform them into sliver, comb them into sliver for first drawing, combine slivers into sliver lap or sliver laps into ribbon lap. Operating and monitoring machines which spin thread and yarn from roving, wind two or more threads onto bobbin, twist two or more strands of yarn or thread into single strands of yarn to increase strength, smoothness and/or uniformity of yarn, or wind yar. Operating and monitoring spinning frame that draws out and twists roving or sliver into yarn. Operating draw frame (machine) having number of drawing sets, each set combining several slivers into one of nearly same weight and thickness as any of original sliver. Operating and monitoring machines for drawing slivers received from drawing machine into loosely twisted strands. Preparing sizing for use in stiffening and finishing cloth and yarn by mixing ingredients such as starch, tallow, resins, soaps and water and boiling mixture for specified time in steam. Treating textiles with chemicals to make them water resistant. Cleaning rollers and cylinders of carding machines to remove wool waste. Operating and resurfacing metal drawing rolls of various spinning, combing and lapping machines with new rubber or leather covers.

fields.name: Zookeeper
fields.description: Feeds, provides water for and monitors the health of animals in zoos, aquaria and wildlife parks; cleans, fixes and maintains animal cages; and informs visitors about animals.
fields.tasks: Supervising and coordinating activities of workers engaged in the care and exhibition of birds and animals at establishments, such as zoos or circuses. Observing animals to detect signs of illness and consulting  with a Veterinarian to determine the type of medication or treatment required. Assisting a Veterinarian to treat injured or sick animals. Inspecting cages, grottos, and pens for cleanliness and structural defects. Setting temperature and humidity controls of animal quarters as specified. Assigning workers to various tasks, and overseeing treatment, food preparation, feeding of animals, and maintaining and repairing of animal quarters. Specifiying type of animal to exhibit in the zoo and location of exhibit, according to weather, animal behaviour characteristics and physical condition. Assisting Animal Trainer or instructor in presentation of programmes, shows or lectures. Giving  lectures to the public to stimulate interest in animals. Answering  visitors' questions concerning animals' habits or zoo operations.

fields.name: Zoologist
fields.description: Studies the anatomy, physiology, characteristics, ecology, behaviour and environments of animals.
fields.tasks: Investigating the origin, interrelationships, classification, life histories, habits, life processes, diseases, relation to environment, growth development, genetics and distribution of animals. Studying animals in their natural habitat and collecting specimens for laboratory study. Dissecting and examining specimens under microscope and using various types of scientific equipment to carry out experimental studies. Preparing collections of preserved specimens or microscopic slides for purposes such as the identification of species, the study of species development, and the study of animal diseases. Designing and conducting research projects, analysing data and writing and publishing scientific reports, Ensuring animal welfare, educating the public, promoting conservation efforts and assisting with captive breeding programmes.
